Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Worst Prof to exist!!!! Has no practical knowledge and everything he teaches is abstract also doesnt care about his students. Avoid if possible this guy is terrible

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: he doesn't teach. his lectures are useless, he confuses you every time.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Taking Bailey is no joke. It's a lot of hard work and sitting in the eco help room. His i-clicker sessions will screw you. Everything on the exam is from class lectures and the worksheets given. Don't worry if you have low grades in micro as he makes macro much easier and he curves you up like mad in the finals. Prepares you for upper years well.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Thought you hated your life before a class with Bailey? You've got another thing coming. Very sad to see so many first years changing their career paths because of one prof. It's a shame UTM can't get rid of him.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Absolutely avoid this professor, don't torment yourself! First years who are in his lecture in ECO100: SWITCH TO A DIFFERENT PROF! Don't let him ruin your chance at POSt! The fact that he thinks that his teaching style works is mind-boggling... He throws everything at you and expects you to understand them and he doesn't know to explain anything.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: No matter how much you study, there is no way you can cover all the material he presents. Every lecture, he throws concept after concept at you without proper explanation, and expects you to regurgitate them all perfectly on test day. Also this course caused me not to get into commerce, despite straight As in all other courses. Would not rec

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Absolutely the most horrible professor in UTM. I've heard horror stories about him for ECO100 but I didn't want my opinion to be biased. So I went in with a positive attitude for ECO200. No support from him or the TA's, I actually feel bad for people who didn't get into commerce b/c of him. Imagine their whole life being different b/c of one prof

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: had him for eco200. write down everything he SAYS and write down as much as you can on the board but what he says is more important. make study groups! because he posts no solutions at all for the past questions he gives u. dont waste so much time on the workbook, it takes so much of your time. focus more on lecture & tut questions.40% dropped

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Best Econ Prof at UTM. He's very smart, very respected and a genuinely inspiring great guy !!!

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Charismatic, Caring, Kind, Compassionate and Intelligent.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Have little respect to students in his class, kicks out people in the middle of the lecture. The lecture itself is super fast-paced and he skips a lot of stuff that is going to be on his test. L for UTM.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Attend all classes and tutorials and take clear notes, be sure to review and rewrite them afterwards. Tests are similar to problems done in-class and practice questions posted. Kinda warms up in upper years but still very much an arrogant elitist. 40% of the class dropped, but stick around till the end and you'll be rewarded with a sweet curve.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: After hearing a bulk of negativity, Prof Bailey isn't that bad after all. STUDY BEFORE THE CLASS! DO THE GIVEN WORKSHEETS. His tests are mostly math, just practice continuously and you'll be fine!

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Let me cut straight to it. Im not a genius, but once I found the algorithm I had success. Heres a detailed guide: Get seats near the front of the class. Take notes on every thing he says, no matter how messy. Find a group of max 5 smart like-minded peers. GO TO TUTORIAL. Quizzes -> TEXTBOOK Tests-> ONLY LECTURE NOTES. DO ALL WORKSHTS

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Lee bailey is a prof who will make you work like a dog for good grades. Study your lecture notes and do the practice worksheets religiously. Don't waste your time reading the textbook, just skim it. Have a good understanding of algebra and with a good work ethic you'll be the 1 out of every 3rd person to finish his course.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Did horrible semester one, everything was fine after the exam. If youre getting 30s or 40s in the first few months, dont quit, start studying more. Micro is hard af, macro is better. Youll pass if you dont drop out of the course trust me, just study harder.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Never studied economics before coming to university. Thanks to Professor Bailey, it is was my favourite course of the year. His lectures are extremely interesting! The recipe for success is simple: read chapter summary before lectures, do Econlab quizzes after lectures; when you finished the topic read the chapter and do all practice tests.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: If you're in first year, you might not find him to be a very pleasant guy, but if you are able to do his practice worksheets without help, you will do fine for his tests as they are basically just past tests. He's a nicer marker than some people give him credit for because he gives a handful of bonus marks; however, his course is quite difficult.

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Horrible prof. I went to him for help with something I was struggling with and he refused to help, telling me that I had to "use my notes to figure it out". He makes you feel bad for not understanding, even though he's the reason ECO is so hard for students!

Name: Lee Bailey
Review: Dont bother buying the textbook completely useless, does not provide any feedback on test or show solutions to similar questions. The TA's are the only thing that will keep you from failing. This year alone kids enrolled in econ went from 1500-> 500 by exams. Not worth wasting a year take it in the summer.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Attending is not mandatory because he didn't teach much through the lectures but it was entertaining being there. Just memorize the textbook

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Prof. Joordens is a solid professor. Sure, his lectures material isn't really tested on the final, but I still enjoyed watching them because he was very interesting and engaging. To do well, the key is to read the textbook and take good notes. A 50% final may sound scary, but it's super doable if you just study a week or two before.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: He is a good lecturer, but his lectures are P O I N T L E S S. There was 1 question from the lecture out of the 100 m/c exam, so honestly don't bother going to lecture unless you're interested in stories and rambling. MAKE SURE to read the textbook and MAKE NOTES cus the final exam is all based on that.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: I liked him. He's nice and funny. He has a really chill vibe BUT don't let that fool you. A 50% final is NOT chill. Printing out and memorizing 83 pages of notes 8 hours before the exam is NOT chill. So even though it may seem like the class is all fun and games take it seriously, write down deadlines and meet them. You'll do gr8

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: He's pretty funny and gives really engaging lectures. However, he sometimes runs over his time and has to post a YouTube video to explain the rest of the lecture. Also, he promotes his band A LOT. He can be kind of annoying after a while. Also, the class is available to watch online.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Professor Joordens is a great lecturer. He makes classes really fun and interesting. Like its a 9 AM class and I never feel like I want to sleep during the lectures. There will be a lot of assignments though so get ready for that. Also, if you like Biology, you'll love this class.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Excellent coursera course but you have to do a "real world peer graded assignment" which may take several days or a week to wait for others to give feedback. I had to make a post in teh optional discussion forums for people to "review" my "real world peer graded assignment"

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: The lectures don't cover anything in the textbook which is way more difficult to understand. The tests don't cover anything from the lectures. Joke of a class. You're expected to do all these assignments worth only 2-5% that take forever, and then the final is a whopping 50%. To think a psychology prof doesn't know how students learn.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Great prof, interesting content, and the exams are quite easy as long as you study well.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: He was definitely entertaining in lecture but didn't actually get through a lot of content and it took him forever to get started. It was also unprofessional for him to accidentally display an inappropriate video in front of the entire class  he is a professor and should be paying attention to that!

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Great guy but his lectures were actually a joke. There was absolutely no content. On the 100 question exam, only 2 questions were from lecture. Don't expect to get through this course without having a thorough knowledge of the textbook. The only positive aspect of this course was that the grading was fairly easy.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: not an effective lecturer.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Very passionate about his studies and the learning. Do not take the course cause its "bird course" take it with passion. Got to pass the exam to pass the course, no midterms. Full on textbook materials, even know it seems like its based on lectures.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Steve Joordens was a great prof. He made the lectures interesting and easy to follow. I will say though, that in order to do well in this course, you definitely have to read the textbook and take notes on the highlighted terms for the assigned chapters.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: The worst psychology professor ever at UTSC!!!

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: He is super good at teaching, makes me love psychology and changes me a lot of point of view. But what sucks is that he doesn't provide us testbank to study while many students somehow get access to it and easily ace the course.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Not a good profe

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: really a nice guide for you to start learning psy

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: Prof joordens is inspirational and charismatic. However, the problem lies within the way psya01 and psya02 are graded. The mtuners and exam are heavily based on textbook material, and lectures were somewhat unhelpful. One 50% final is a nightmare.

Name: Steve Joordens
Review: the coolest prof

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: Do not take his class unless you're okay with him misinterpreting every single religious book out there with as little context possible. He says his opinions as if they are facts and it's annoying.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: Had him my freshman year. Interesting class. Some of the lectures wound up to be total snoozefests (not to take anything away from the man's teaching ability). However I love the fact that he incorporated individual wireless remotes for all students when conducting the occasional class survey.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: boring

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: His lectures are well-prepared and though the subject matter is a bit dull, he usually offers some really interesting insights on it that make you think a little harder than Caron's lectures do. I actually really enjoyed reading his mini-textbook , which you definitely need to read thoroughly for his questions on the tests.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: He makes a ridiculous sum of money for shelling his own books and keeps making new editions to get more money. You are cattle to Brym.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: I love this Professor's class! He is the best ever. Really easy and he explains everything until you understand. He understands when you have emergencies and he gives extra credit. His class will be the only class you will really learn while having an easy A. I Strongly recommend him for everyone!!!!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: His questions on tests are harder than caron's.  He's pretty interesting though, and I like his statistics and real life examples; in comparison with caron, who is much more definitionalby the book.  I think the two complement each other well.  Caron makes things cleareasier as a course coordinator; Brym's lectures are very goodinteresting.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: Brym is an awesome speaker. His lectures are very in depth and his arguments are always strong. His lectures are very emotional (which made me feel angry and unjustified about social issues). He uses the most recent eventsnews to explain sociology concepts. Brym does not  read off the slides. He teaches students  to interpret data and graphs.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: He tends to go very in depth on every topic and sometimes loses the interest of people in lectures. However, I found all of his lectures interesting, and very easy to understand. The math components are simple multiplication or division. Overall I do not understand the negativity most students have towards him.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: Brym covers the research aspects of sociology, mainly math, and as a social science student it isn't exactly my strong suit, and its confusing to follow. Tells funny jokes occasionally. But make sure you really pay attention to his information, because reading the textbook for his sections does not help, and his section of the test is rough.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: Overall just kind of... boring. Most lectures are summarizing the readings (from his own books that are expensive) and brings up quantitative stuff constantly. If you go to a lecture he teaches, everyone around you will be playing solitaire or on Facebook, you can stay home if he's teaching. Also you only really need the Commit Sociology books.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: Went off on his own tangents and would always use charts and graphs in class. It was kind of hard to follow along.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: always brings graphs and charts in every possible topic! this isn't a math course!!!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: Textbooks are very difficult to understand. Uses his own textbook of course and replaces them very frequently. Perhaps, consideration to students' finance as opposed to his own would make him more popular among students. Tests are VERY difficult. More problematic, don't think he's the one that actually write them.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: AMAZING PROF!!!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: His classes were pretty boring and repetitive. He taught every other lecture and another professor would teach the other lectures. The other professor was better. Pretty tough tests, as all Sociology tests are. They are always worded confusingly. Read the textbook weekly and you'll get a B or B+

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: He's knowledgable about the topic but can be very rude when answering questions. The data he uses are all outdated and the tests are brutal since it asks about the tiny statistical details. Not approachable at all

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: Professor Brym made me want to specialize in Sociology. I loved his lectures. I loved talking to him in person. He is great. The people in my class who didn't like him were slackers looking for an easy mark. If you want to actually learn, you should take his class.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: very organized and an overall good professor

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Robert Brym
Review: Don't recommend. Tests are tough. Brym is boring. First lecture was on suicide! Adam Green was fine though. Very weird class.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: really makes the lecture entertaining and enjoyable. has a wide range of knowledge and ability to add on besides course material and makes the lectures very engaging. makes me want to change program in order to take his class.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Don't take this course if you aren't majoring in psych (or related). Lectures are interesting, but the course is not worth it. Lots of textbook readings. Sure, the success package will make it easier, but the course is time-consuming and a waste of time.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Dax is the reason I continued with psychology. Hes great at keeping the class engaged and tells great stories that really help you understand/remember the content of the lectures. My favourite prof at UTM!

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Looking back, Dr. Dax inspired me through his genuineness and passion for the field of Psychology.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: amazing prof. his slides are short and to the point and he tells interesting stories. he gives additional information during lecture so you should show up to the lectures.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Dax is very intimidating and will make you feel bad about your life choices in lecture. Although, his lectures are engaging, with many stories and jokes. Tests are a breeze if you have the success package, as he reuses questions from previous years over and over, you don't even have to attend lectures of read if you have it. Good prof overall

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: a true legend, his texts are based on lecs and the textbook and are fair, and his analogies and stories really help you understand and remember concepts. hope to have him again soon!

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Dax is definitely one of the best profs out there, anyone would be lucky to have him. His lectures are awesome cause they're rarely boring and he shares really interesting stories. For the most part, the content's pretty intriguing, but get ready to do the (lengthy) chapter readings as the class is test heavy. Overall, super awesome class.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: He is an amazing professor !! I'm so glad that I took this course with him

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: easiest class ever

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Dax is a great prof who genuinely cares about students' success. Don't be intimidated to talk to him after class/during breaks, because he is very open to questions. Even with the success package, I'd still advise doing readings and studying lectures to get the most out of the course and enjoy lectures. As Dax says, you are only cheating yourself!

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: His lectures are pretty long and tend to get boring sometimes but he tries to make them as interesting as possible. If you study you will do well in the class. Reading heavy though.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Honestly, I didn't go to class at all and just memorized the success package and read the textbook, and I 4.0'd the course. Dax is alright, albeit a bit condescending and conceited. The short answers on the tests are taken directly from the success package. MC is a bit harder - you actually have to read the textbook for that.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: get your hands on the success pkg with past questions and you're SET. Lectures are a good way to understand the general concepts within the textbook but there will be questions on the weird bits of the book that nobody ever reads (super textbook heavy). Funny guy in class and i would take another class, but he's intimidating for me to approach

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Really awesome and engaging lectures. Use the free success package for the short answers and you'll do good. Multiple choice portion is all textbook which means you have to know every detail from the chapter so make sure to read.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: This was easily my favourite course and prof in my first year at UTM. Very knowledgeable and passionate about course material and makes 2 hour lectures go by so fast. Pay attention in lectures, read the textbook VERY thoroughly, and download the success package (free online) and tests will be pretty easy! This is a course I recommend EVERYONE takes

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Not bad. He does give great lectures, however, the tests recall the most specific information from the textbook. He's all about the importance of teaching methods that correlate with actually learning the information, but the multiple choice tests really are just memorization, so that's that. Lecture tests are easy if you get the success package.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: He's remarkable guy. He clearly cares about his craft, and he doesn't sugar coat anything. Take this course if you're looking to push yourself with the best kind of encouragement. Also the course material is really interesting.

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: rambles on but has interesting lectures. Read the textbook and you're pretty much set

Name: Dax Urbszat
Review: Very funny professor so 2 hours lectures were actually engaging and fun. If you look up the PSY100 Mega Success Package on FB you will get a bunch of past MC and SA  easy 4.0. I recommend still attending lectures and reading (+taking notes from textbook) for a meaningful understanding of the course. Like always, put in effort  great results!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: His tests are hard and very application based, but he tends to follow the same format every year. Tip: do the multiple choice last when writing tests. Prepare for quizzes, on which you generally get either 100% or 0%. He likes to talk though and will gladly meet with you to work through problems- it may not seem like it but he wants you to do well.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: If you expect the final exam to be the material he taught in class, think again. Most questions were application, so if you don't get it, there is absolutely no way you can memorize your way out. Unless you think, breathe, and eat chemistry, I'm not sure there's a way to get a good grade with Browning.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: His questions on tests tend to be really word-heavy, especially on the first midterm. Be prepared to read, because some of them can be very tricky to understand the first time you see it.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: I look forward to his lectures and I can't wait to have him again next semester for CHM135. Makes chemistry interesting and does an amazing job of explaining concepts. Really caring and funny too and you can tell he wants the class to succeed. His tests are harder but it's definitely possible to do well.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: Professor Browning is hands down one of my favourite lecturers. Although his tests might not be the easiest, but if you are a high achiever, you will definitely do fine and (even well) if you study hard. He makes chemistry fun and a lot less depressing than it seems. I enjoy lectures with him a lot and tend not to fall asleep.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: I love this man. Browning is one of the sweetest and nicest profs and i loved going to chem lectures. If you study well enough and attend his lectures, his tests aren't that hard. I would start a browning fanclub if i could. Main thing is to just study well

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: Man were his tests hard. Also, his slides were not informative and you definitely need to attend class if you're going to decipher them. That being said, he is super clear about what is going to be on the test and tested everything fairly evenly. He usually answers questions but on occasion would go "I'd like you to think on that" X(

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: For his multiple choice, he literally takes the biggest molecule on a random research paper and you answer a bunch of questions about that molecule. His reaction questions: He thinks of a compound, does a reaction on it. Then throws it in a blender. Then you find the original compound. What a great man. 10/10 effort. UNMATCHED EXCELLENCE!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: Best Prof I've ever had. He absolutely does not make your life miserable, he also does not crush your dreams Would absolutely recommend, if I had the chance I would take each and every class with him. His test are not hard at all and absolutely representative of his lectures his questions absolutely wont make you cry at night. God bless this man.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: Its day 4 of class and honestly hes pretty chill, i havent really done any homework, but apparently we had some. Hope this helps all the other people out there, I will go back to not doing my chm136 homework. Peace out world!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: I heard he's a really kind and funny prof, but in terms of his lecturing, it's horrible. I hated every second of it. The way he talked about certain things were so.... bland. His lecture slides are made to attend class. He doesn't put instructions on how to do certain mechanisms but just use the textbook and you'll do great.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: A great lecturer, probably one of my favourites from my first year, but he does not hold back on his tests. Master everything in lecture, and know how to do it FAST. The time constraint on his test is probably what makes it so difficult.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: such a hard course but his lectures were teaching simple and basic stuff. I reviewed all of material before the final exam and did all of the past exams and go to 95% of the lectures. Ends up getting 78 on the finals, so if everyone thinks this final exam is fair, then all I could say is that I am such a dumb kid :(((( destroy my specialist dream

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: While he may be a good lecturer, I found that his tests were way harder then what was covered in lecture. My CHM136 tests done by browning were by far the hardest.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: Prob Browning is hands-down one of the best lecturers I have ever met. He made chem seem fun and his style of teaching was awesome. The level of difficulty for his exams was very challenging tho so do all the practice questions. I; however, never want to see a hexagon again after org chem...

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: really fun guy, explains concepts extremely clearly and even tells us what kind of mistakes students usually make. he's very nice and approachable so definitely chat with him. a strict instructor though; when I goto office hours I see he expects a lot from students. tests are hard but very reasonable, so once you adapt, you ace them.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: Great professor, he explains things exceptionally well, and is very passionate about his lectures which makes you feel that vibe as well. As for his tests you must do the homework,and ask someone for help for anything you are unsure of. Also if you are someone who is lazy and procrastinates, you will not do well! So work for it! Good luck

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: If he curved up his ridiculously low average tests, he'd be the greatest prof ever.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: He is a great, knowledgeable professor. His tests are harder, but as long as you do all the problems in the textbook you will be fine. Trust me, I just finished my first chem midterm and he made the test. You don't have to go to lectures, just make sure you go through the textbook and understand every single thing covered.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Scott Browning
Review: He is a great professor and his lectures are very informative. However, his tests are unreasonably difficult. The term test was one of the hardest tests I wrote out of all my courses in Life Sci.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Prof. D. is a true legend at UofT. This isn't your normal lecture, when he teaches and you pay attention, his content will change the way you think about the world. I would recommend everybody to merely audit any one of his courses, you will be fascinated!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: One of those rare, inspirational professors. Makes an effort to get to know you and uses stories to make material more engaging. Although he asks test questions in an unconventional manner, they're easy if you follow his study advice. No slides, so coming to class is important (and fun!) Group project was mediocre, but what group project isn't?

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Dolderman will make you leave every lecture feeling like your life has changed. However, his organizational skills don't exist. It is almost March and we haven't got feedback from our December paper. Doesn't attend his own office hours. Doesn;'t provide a rubric for papers, but then marks using one. 0 Lecture slides/notes - just talking < 3

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Professor Dolderman is the greatest professor I've had in my 4 years at UofT. His environmental psychology class is beyond inspirational and incorporates many of the psychological concepts we've covered in the pursuit of our (psych) degrees. The workload is standard for a 4th year course. This class will change the your life.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Definitely the best professor I've ever had. Also definitely the most unorganized professor I've ever had. We've had a couple assignments that had close to zero instructions. But I still stand behind my words; he is a great lecturer and he keeps you engaged. And he is funny. Really funny.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: He's an incredibly interesting lecturer, however, his overall style is disorganized. He gives very limited explanations for assignments and often fails to properly organize test review sessions and tutorials. His tests were also unnecessarily difficult

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Dolderman was inspirational; he's easily the best prof I've ever had

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: totally unorganized

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Too many readings assignment and the material was very difficult. Rarely goes over readings in class

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Has gotten really disorganized and very unclear about grading. Also very confusing lectures

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: One of my favourite profs in first year. Hilarious, witty, and above all, extremely clear in his elaboration of the material. In terms of exams, READ the textbook and REVIEW the lectures as there will be questions from both on the exam. Less memorisation, more critical thinking and how to apply your knowledge to a real problem. Amazing prof.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Took psy100 and psy230 with him. Such an inspirational prof, sad when the semester was over. One of the best classes I've ever taken, lectures were intriguing and kept your attention, relatable. Sometimes the mc questions can be tricky but he's very helpful in going over material and helping prepare. Defs take more classes with him. Phenomenal.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Great prof, funny & entertaining but kinda disorganized (not sure if it's him or just the psych department in general). Both lectures and readings are VITAL, don't get stuck with 13 chapters to read 2 days before the final. For midterms/exams: go beyond memorizing & make sure you know how to APPLY the knowledge. His questions are hilarious btw.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Dr. Dolerman is one of my favourite professors so far.  He makes his class really fun and interesting and tries to make it engaging.  His midterms are 50/50 from lecture and the readings.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Not a bird course! don't take it to boost your gpa and don't take this course With Dolderman if you don't like psychology! Class average was a C+ too much readings. However, lectures were entertaining.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Prof. Dolderman is great. He's nice, hilarious, popular and fun to talk to after class. His lectures are so interesting. Make sure not just understand concepts but know how to apply them because tests are not really easy. Read textbook before class and take notes during lectures. Overall, psy100 is the best course I've ever taken! Enjoy!!!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Fantastic prof,  he is unlike any other prof, however, I am afraid I will be unable to pursue a psychology degree because one of his tests was extremely hard. He added 24% (12 questions worth)to the test. The average for the class was a C+. He was such an awesome prof, def recommend his class, but do not take it as an average booster.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Ah, Dolderman. What an adventure. First and foremost: he *is* a good prof. His lectures are great, and they/the book adequately prepare you for midterms I'd say. Honestly no complains about this. But, certain parts- mostly administrative- weren't fun. He obviously needed help. Assignment feedback was sparse, and marks nowhere to be seen *still*.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: Amazing prof, makes lectures very interesting and engaging. He clearly loves psychology and that is evident in his lectures. Disappointed in the the assessments for this course, tests were challenging and I felt like I couldn't share my understanding of the course

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Dan Dolderman
Review: His lectures built on the textbook material more than explain it. Most of the test is from the textbook, but he directly questions some his stories from the lectures. A lot of readings and tests were pretty hard. The lectures were nice and entertaining though.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Professor Wall is Wonderful!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Marty Wall is really knowledgeable and explains difficult concepts well. Tests could seem intimidating at first, but all the questions are actually fair and are based on material from the textbook. The prof/TAs are approachable after class, but not so much during the online tutorial sessions. You should do really well if you have a good memory.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Amazing Professor.  Very engaging.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Martin (Marty) Wall is an amazing professor.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: hottie

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Terrible course. Even if you were a good student in High School, U of T Arts and Science will crush you. It's VERY Competitive here. Avoid U of T Arts and Science under all circumstances. This prof's Psych exams were soooo hard!!!! Especially the writing part.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: My favourite Prof of my entire degree.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: He's a great teacher, very clear, and able to keep a class in con hall interesting, which isn't easy. The tests are fair, not hard. Some people simply confuse psychology and sociology coming out of high school and think you have to know nothing about the brain! He sends you a nice letter if you're doing well.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: nice guy but hard

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Pretty good prof.  He was hard, but if you knew the material you'd get a good mark.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: He made you hate psychology.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Dont take that course. Just don't. It's only Psych. Its not worth going through the trouble. Reallly tough and you need to know how to write big answers. His multiple choice were tricky but still doable.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Very interesting material and he is so funny and entertaining to watch some days. But he was very very tough on the exams.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Incredible lecturer. Makes the hours fly by, and then he's available to chat and answer questions  afterwards. My favorite prof at U of T so far.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Amazing Prof.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: No Comments

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: The best Prof ever!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: He's so vague! Really bad prof, wastes a lot of time.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: PSY100 was my favorite course in first year. Professor Wall did an amazing job expanding on the textbook material and making the concepts interesting and applicable to everyday life. He and this course inspired me to go on further in psychology. Best prof I've had so far!!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Martin Wall
Review: Wall is great. He is very interested and enthusiastic about the material. Lectures were always enjoyable, however, almost the entire test covered material from the textbook. You are expected to memorize the text quite a bit.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Dr. Zakzanis is the epitome of what a UofT professor should be: inspiring, persuasive, entertaining, passionate, always couches opinion in terms of evidence based research literature, dedicated to ensuring student understanding of complex course topics. I hung on to every word even though the lectures were 3 hours in duration.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Zakzanis is one of my absolute favorite profsl! Even if a course's content is more challenging to learn and internalize, I always look forward to attending his classes because of how engaging and entertaining he is. The anecdotes he uses with his dog are memorable too. As a prof he is approachable, clearly understandable, and supportive. A for him.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Gives us an idea of how things work in the real world and gives us confidence

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Amazing teacher :) Loved his course!! Would def take more courses with him.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Honestly he is one of my favourite professors as he is inspirational and an amazing lecturer. His exams are mostly based on lectures but skimming the textbook is also helpful as both are fair game. I would say go to lectures in person (if the option is available). All in all, amazing prof and fair exams. PS- the TAs can be a little tough on grading

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Loved this course! Dr. Zakzanis is an amazing lecturer, he explains the material really well, he's also a really nice guy. Exams were mainly lecture based.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Prof. Zakzanis is a very knowledgable guy, and makes his evening classes very enjoyable. The midterms were both very fair (make sure to write down lecture notes AND read the textbook) and the assignments were pretty straight forward (follow the rubric). Love Zakzanis but the way he pronounces "allele" is a no from me omg LOL

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: This course really helps you understand psychological disorders and their real world context. The concepts are incredibly interesting and Prof. Z makes them come to life. If you have the option of in person or online lectures, definitely go in person. Will definitely be taking courses with him in the future if possible. Highly recommend this class!

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Amazing prof with super engaging, personable lectures. He doesn't just read off the slides and seems genuinely interested in what he's teaching. The assessments are quite easy and there isn't much work throughout the term. Had a great semester with him and would love for him to be my professor again!

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Amazing professor, who not only teaches what's required in the syllabus but also things that will help you improve as a person. Would highly recommend even if you're not in mental health/psych.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: He is an amazing lecturer who is able to relate real life situations to the course concept. Take this class irrespective of the fact its a requirement for your programme or not. Plus his exams are fair to lecture content and textbook too. Additionally, the tas are pretty brutual in marking the assignement. You have to work hard to earn that A+.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: I sacrificed my summer evenings for this class and did not regret it at all! Prof Zakzanis was an amazing lecturer, and hilarious! The course material was extremely interesting. Just like any course, if you study, youll do well. The exams were fair and the assignment was simple! I highly recommend this course even if you dont need it!

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: He is an amazing lecturer. Loves to give real life examples concerning to concepts taught in class. hard to get 85 and above. You have to put work in it for that A. This is as the TAs are hard marker. Pretty helpful and makes class really engaging as he brings in lot of guest speakers. His exams are a bit confusing but fair to his lectures.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: literally one of the most interesting and well taught courses. the prof makes the content sound very very interesting and he is humorous&very nice and easy to approach and interact with. would definitely recommend taking PSYB32 if u are majoring in psych. The prof really takes his time to make sure the content is understandable& the exams are fair

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Konstantine is a good professor. His TAs for PSYC32 could be better. For the lab component of this course ( for those in MH Spec. program) there was little guidance in how to properly administer hard tests. The lab component makes this course double the amount of work. 2 midterms, a lab exam, a lab oral exam & final; this course is 2x the work.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: It's harder to fail this course than it is to pass with an A. To do well, you have to read the material. If you got a low mark it is because you didn't read the textbook, which is a mistake. The lectures are great but you'll do poorly if you rely on just that. Why should the prof read the material when it's supposed to be us doing the learning?

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: I'm weboptioning this course this winter semester but I wish I could have taken it in person. I love his lectures, they're always so engaging and interesting to watch. This is the only class that I genuinely enjoyed the semester. I'm glad we didn't have to do the essay, we had 2 midterms and a final that were fairly straightforward.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: Amazing professor, gives such great lectures and makes anything interesting.

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: he is the best prof I had so far!! his teaching style is incredible and he wants the students to actually pass his class and do good!! as long as you pay attention in lecture and highlight slides/concepts he considers important for exams you will do great!! best class ever!

Name: Konstantine Zakzanis
Review: He's hands down my favourite professor at UTSC. Even if you aren't in psychology, his courses are 100% worth taking. He could lecture literally any topic and make it sound interesting. Clearly knows what he's talking about. Make sure you use the textbook to compliment his lectures and you'll get an easy A in the course.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: Wonderful class

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: The course is easy but he is proud, mean and very bad at emotion management. Hes sensitive to questions you ask, hell think that youre criticizing him not for doing his job well, he also gets very offended when asked any questions with regards to grades. he hates it when students want to regrade for any reason, which is totally not reasonable.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: Hes really mean. He disses you and is very disrespectful. He will diss other universities and will say that the kids that are mannerless because the enter the other professors quietly and quietly sit down. Hes mannerless himself.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: He makes this course difficult compared to MGTA01 (for non business students), this is why the reviews are higher than they should be. The assignments cause marks to drop significantly and were graded too harshly.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: prof does not respect students, worst prof ever

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: I only went to 1 lectures and I ended up with a 4.0. All you need to do is memorize key terms of the textbook and look over his slides. His lectures can be very boring as he can spend 20 mins on 1 slide. The only downside was that our grade consisted of a midterm (40%) and final (60%). So if you fail the midterm, you're screwed. basically.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: The course heavily revolves around the readings and the definitions and vocabulary that are highlighted. Chris' lectures are great to attend but they honestly aren't mandatory since it's so textbook-heavy. The midterm was awful (72%) but the final was extremely easy (96%). The workload is extremely light since your mark is only 2 exams.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: He presents himself to be very approachable and friendly (to an extent, it is true), but at times he can be considerably rude for no obvious reasons. I heard him make racial comments towards ESL students (I have no reason to make this up). He can go from a sweet guy to someone who will scar you for the rest of your life in a second. Be aware.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: Don't go to class just memorize the textbook. He is an amazing prof and will help you any time you need it.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: don't need to attend lectures since its the same as the textbook. hes nice and caring. exam multiple chocie and fill in the blank are straightforward. short answer a little tough. he won't ever change your mark but he's generally very clear with his questions. easy class. textbook written by him and it makes every concept as simple as possible

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: Unrespect to students at all!

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: Awesome prof, really funny and you can interrupt him at any time, tell us stories as well. The course is really easy, just goes to the lecture and pay attention, very easy to get high marks.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: There are 2 midterms and a final. That's it. No assignments. You do not need to attend a single lecture to get an A. I studied for a couple hours before the second midterm and got a 95. Make some free recall queue cards for the fill in the blank questions and study the different market types and it's a grade 9 level course. That's generous.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: He is great and hilarious! Will keep you engaged and laughing every lecture. Yes he may be a bit rude at sometimes and thats why people rate him so low. His course is definitely a bird and the easiest at UTSC. His slides are copied from the textbook that he wrote himself. There are no tutorials would def recommend this course!

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: I'm a good writer and I have never attended his lectures- I have 80+ in the course. It's a straight forward class and through memorization you can easily receive a high mark. The TAs mark the assignments hard which is the only downfall

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: easy course, tests are short and straight to the point, just keep up with material (which is easy to understand) and dont slack and you should get an easy A

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: He's honestly not as bad as people portray him on this webbsite. At least for MGTA01, he was able to keep myself and others engaged and entertained. He paraphrases everything from the textbook, so when ur studying, primarily use the textbook and you're sure to get at least an 80%. Midterm and final were fair, and relatively easy, don't slack tho!

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: He is a great teacher,caring and passionate about teacher.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: Rude man and the final short answer was unnecessarily hard. He yells at people yet he looks like the Pringles man.

Name: Chris Bovaird
Review: Fairly easy course if you use the textbook and lectures together to study. Midterm and final are fair, marked quite tough though

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: Honestly as a first year student , Professor Leonard was the only professor i had that genuinely helped and gave feedback, he cared if there were any issues or conflicts that could interfere with midterms, finals etc and was more than willing to help you achieve a good mark, theres a lot of reading but it was still an enjoyable course

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: A lot of people take Leonard's class, never show up and just read the textbook, and then complain about the midterm and final. Seriously, just go to the lectures and be willing to learn, he is an extremely interesting professor who makes every lecture a ted talk. Highly recommend, even if you are in a STEM major.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: the best prof i've ever had.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: The best. Don't take my word for it, check out his Ted Talk!

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: I'm in neuroscience. Took this class just to fill a humanities requirement. every lecture was like a sledge hammer to what I thought I already knew. not for the faint of heart.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: Wow. Every lecture is a ted talk. just try and take it all in. this course is about your life, people.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: My favourite prof at UTSC! Lectures were life changing. His ideas are absolutely brilliant and while there is a ton of reading, the books are all great reads. Try to understand his main concepts for the essay questions and know the stories well for the short answer (SA qs can get pretty detail oriented). He reuses past exams qs w/ minor changes.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: Fantastic. As he says, "I don't give answers. I teach you how to ask better questions."

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: His lectures were mediocre at best. Would ramble on with his examples, and students never truly understood how his exams would be formatted.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: Amazing prof! Cares for the student to actually do well. Def recommend taking his class.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: I like Garry, allot. Power is an effect of relationships! I learned more from that one sentence than anything in this university.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: Not my favourite class or professor. Ended up no crediting the course. Too flowery and all over the place for my liking. The textbook was confusing but I did get to read some interesting books. Would not take another class with this prof again but you can tell that he loves this subject and has found his life calling.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: My favorite professor in my first year at UTSC. Although he goes off topic (this is like every few seconds), his lectures are hilarious. Even if you do not attend but read his books, you will definitely get a 4.0. Its the best course to cover the breadth requirement!

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: The best prof I've ever had. Everything he says is so insightful and it encourages you to actually think. Yeah, there were lots of books to read but it's an english class so there's not avoiding it. As long as you read the books, you'll be able to do well. (He actually gives pretty good overviews of them during the lectures).

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: He's incredible!

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: Best prof I've ever had. Changes the way you think. Fair grader. Lots of reading.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: in terms of what sort of grade you can get, it's simple: just read the book he wrote to accompany the lectures and you could get a B, just attend the lectures and you could get a B, just do the readings and ou could get a C , but if ou want an A you're going to have to do all three. he shows the relevance of the readings to the world we live in now

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: I managed to get a B+ in his course without doing the readings. I just showed up to the lectures and wrote down the points he makes in class. Lectures are a mix of being thought provoking and boring. I went back into my notes after class and reorganized them and grouped ideas and studied those. Would recommend doing the readings for an A though.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: The book accompanying the lectures is amazing--I've been letting friends borrow it who are not in the class and they have found it really useful for generating ideas for their other classes. Professor Leonard REALLY thinks outside the box and not everyone 'gets it'.

Name: Garry Leonard
Review: His course reader, while helpful, is very lengthy and has no proper structure. There are just many paragraphs, each of which somehow begin at one subject and conclude with another subject. Exactly like the things he teaches lectures: extremely hard to pinpoint. It sounds like one long paragraph, and so you must purchase and read the course reader.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Good lecturer, bad tester

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: He didn't allow to take a photo for his lecture. His lecture is all handwriting and he wrote so fast that the only thing you can do in the lecture is writing without thinking. If you ask questions after class he rarely answers you. So basically, study 223 all by yourself.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: This is a hard and boring course, but thanks to Uppal. He is the best math prof in uoft!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Makes math major courses more complicated than necessary.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: A great lecturer, really makes his mission that students understand the material. The homework assignment are fair and can usually boost your mark. His tests are tricky, you must really understand the material in order to get a good mark, cant just memorize the process of how to do a question

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Clear, wonderful lectures. He truly cares about students performance in the course and takes suggestions well. Shame that hes not the course coordinator this semester.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Solid prof. If you did well in MAT223, MAT224 wouldn't be extremely hard as some people said. He explained everything well and the level of difficulty of the tests were reasonable based on your quiz and homework.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: His notes are crystal clear and way easier to understand than the textbook, just make sure you have it if you fail to catch up with him in class. I think he is very systematic and gives you the intuition behind the abstract concepts, very helpful and important. Highly recommend him as a lecturer.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: cool

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Great math Prof., clear and organized lecture. Recommend him if you are taking mat223/224. Yet, not a very nice guy, not really accessible.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: His lecture is really well-organized. Dont skip any lecture because the lectures are continuous. Try to understand the examples which discuss in class and for MAT224, writing assignment is important to think deeply with linear algebra. He is a really good lecturer.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Sean Uppal is hands down the best prof in the mathematics department. He sincerely really cares about his students. I felt bad for him as he has to deal with first years who think they can do what they did in high school which is not study and then still expect an A. His tests are easy compared to the other math courses despite the low averages.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Rude. Be nicer to students - not everyone understands linear algebra terms on the first try, and people are shy. Just because some dude pulls out his phone at the back of the class doesn't mean he's trying to show you up and disrespect you.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: grading is really tough, the average of test 1 in fall term is 70, however we only have 48.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Finally, we are using a clear written txtbk for 224, but now we are doing this weekly assignment, and received emails suggesting us to study them for midterms, which is hilarious because each assignment contains two useless questions that have no practical use, but MIGHT help our understanding. He's making this simple course way too devastating.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: his lecture is well-organized, but u better not skip the lecture.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Useless lectures, terrible textbook.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Take more time and care about students. Rude. Can't beleive him

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Really harsh and tough

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Sean Uppal
Review: Will not take a class with him again.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: Make sure you actually read the book because he does pick out specific things from it and asks them on the exam. Additionally, lab participation counts a LOT so make sure to speak up - even it is a little it'll go a long way.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: Tests are very difficult and annoying, everyone likes him cuz he's a first year bio teacher with lots of enthusiasm but he would fly through lectures and there was no textbook.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: Barrett was an excellent lecturer and his passion for BIO120 was very evident, which made attending lectures fun, especially from 6pm-8pm. His tests were definitely challenging but not impossible if you put in the work and listened to lectures

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: I enjoyed having Barrett as a prof. He was very clear on what would be testable material (Especially his personal work as a researcher *WATER HYACINTH*). Keep in mind that because of huge class sizes, questions were not taken during lecture.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: ppl saying 'too much unnecessary detail; idc about who went to what university" etc shouldn't go to UofT. this info wont be tested, but is impt nonetheless. It's impt to know history, legacy, and impt people in the field esp when you go out and work. learn to learn, don't learn just for a test. itll get u thru 4 yrs @ UofT. Barrett was the best.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: Pretty Decent Prof

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: He taught one of my favourite and what I believe is one of the most important biology classes anybody could take. His lectures were great and his passion for what he taught showed. Thanks for teaching Barrett and I hope you enjoy your retirement

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: He's a great prof but it's hard to pay attention to him talk throughout the entire lecture. Not everything he says in lecture is important but if he's talking about his own research you better pay attention. His portion of the tests focus mainly on his own work rather than actual course material.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: A good prof whose lectures and required readings were interesting!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: While actual doctors teach real science about relevant anatomy and issues that are destroying human lives around the world, this guy is busy walking fields counting plants. Pathetic legacy.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: SUMMARY -- talks about past researchers and his life achievements/adventures with A LOT of passion - wish I could say the same evolutionary biology. His slides are easy to understand, you can leave reciting everything you learned but the tests seem to be a shoot or miss. Some like him for his accent and puns, in reality he ins't that great. :/

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: Prepare to see more than a few "cartoons." Prof Barrett is a very interesting and humorous lecturer whose love for evolutionary biology (particularly water hyacinths) is emanated through his every British word. He's been teaching for decades, and can convey the material in an organized and timely manner. His lovely accent is a crowning touch.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: His bio lectures were the best. Great prof; I'm going to miss him :(

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: Prof Barrett is the WORST lecturer I've had in my entire academic life. It feels like he's preaching his life experiences rather than the core concepts of evolutionary biology. I don't care about "X evolutionary biologist went to Y university and (yes/no) won a nobel prize," but for some reason it makes up 30% of the lecture slides & audio.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: Found him to be a quintessential lecturer of evolutionary biology. Really good at what he does.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: he really loves his water hyacinth

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: Prof. Barrett's lectures are intricate and amazing and I often stayed for the extra tutorial hour. He didn't seem very approachable one-on-one, but it is not surprising in late night first-year courses. I would absolutely recommend this lecturer.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: Very clear and concise. Has a knack for explaining concepts in a way that you'll remember them. Loved the course much more than BIO130, with the exception being that we had to know the names of the scientists for the tests. Loves his water hyacinths more than life itself. British accent is an interesting touch.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: He's alright. Sometimes funny.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Spencer Barrett
Review: His lecture material is not very difficult. But you will need to revise the material in order to do well in his part of the course.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: makes it hard for no reason. also needs a new method to teach her students. we arent in 1980 anymore

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: She was a very funny and respectable prof in lectures, but her tests were marked extremely harshly. Half of the tests and exam was theory-based, and it's impossible to get full marks on those. If your answer doesn't contain key words she wants, you will get a 0. The labs were super easy, but the midterms and exam really brought my mark down.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: This course made me way too stressed out compared to other courses. I even found calculus easier than this!!! I did not know what to expect for the final exam, which made my mark drop by like 10%, despite studying and redoing all lecture questions. She's a tough grader and its hard to get a full mark on her questions. Avoid!!!

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: First of all the marking scheme is a joke. Her lectures are choppy for the most part, she will jump from one slide to another without making any sort of connection or application. All of the midterms/exam have questions that are highly unlikely to be solved for full marks within the timeframe. Did I mention the marking scheme is a joke??

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: I firmly believe that CHM110 with Professor Poe is the easiest course on the planet. She takes lecture problems, changes the numbers and puts them on the test. THERES NO EXCUSE to do bad in this course. If you supplement lectures with textbook problems, you should just rain 100s on every assessment. Labs are a joke.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: Despite what you read on this site, prof poe is great! Make sure you attend her lectures because they're very important. Those who say tests are hard clearly never do practice problems from the textbook. Online office hours are extremely helpful and she's actually really nice during her OHs. She has a lot of knowledge and a great sense of humour.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: I took CHM110 with her for the first semester of my first year, and I had no idea what I had gotten myself into, she is just one of a kind! So, her lectures are very important so, take notes, I myself took pretty good notes, and I still did badly in her course, her tests and exams are HARD, and in general the marking scheme is a joke. TRY TO AVOID

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: I finished this course but don't feel like I learned anything because of how hard it was, and the fact that I couldn't relate it to real life/understand it thoroughly partly mainly due to her teaching.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: Overall she is a very nice prof with profound teaching experience. Although the tasks she assigns is heavy, it is still achievable to get a satisfying mark if you pay attention in class and clearly understand the method she taught to solve the problems, instead of reading textbook at home. Lecture attendance is ESSENTIAL.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: Great professor with a good sense of humor! Attendance is very mandatory because she teaches a method to solve chemical equilibrium questions that isnt in the textbooks or online. Pay very close attention in lectures because she refuses questions on tests and exams.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: The course content is heavy and the final test is really hard compared to midterms. If you don't do the suggested problems, you will not get a good grade.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: First year chem is not this hard but she made it hard; I did not like going to her lectures and it almost made me not like chem anymore, for too many reasons to list

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: shes loveable and makes lots of jokes and very expressive about her love for the Chicago Bears; shes also decently fair when it comes to her tests, just make sure youre prepared for the midterms!!

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: She knows her stuff, and she teaches we'll ask she asks is for you to pay attention. Her pace is nice and slow so you won't miss anything while she speaks. She is very funny once she opens up ��

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: AUDIO RECORD ALL HER LECTURES if it is possible. I found it really hard to hear her most of the time and although she would go through a lot of examples, she would say that the whole calculation is "GARBAGE" because we all just solved it wrong. Then instead of fixing it, she'd whisper under her breath explaining which step was incorrect.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: Her lectures make me very sleepy

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: One of the best prof I had in first year! Tho her first mid term test was hard!!��

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: For first year courses there's not a lot of wiggle room to actually pick a prof, but do choose a different if you can. The material was tough and she would make us memorize things that I have never used again. I remember memorizing this long formula that i forgot the day after the exam.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: professor poe is one of the most reputable professors in this campus, she has been teaching this course for a quite long time . you may hear horror stories about her, but believe me she is so nice even though she might seem unapproachable. the key for passing this course is attending the lecture, her tests are fair but you gotta study real hard.

Name: Judith C Poe
Review: The average was 35% on the first midterm. Her questions are very difficult. Everyone agrees. Try to avoid this prof.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Funny teaching style

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Lousy prof! Does not teach, pushes his political agendas instead

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Brilliant warm and caring prof

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Wow the TAs are terrible. Did well on both tests(90s) and yet the TA gives a 65 on the essay that we worked really hard on. No feedback was also given. Ended up with a 75. Ridiculous. Not to mention what a horrible disorganized course it was.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Tests were easy but TAs will destroy your mark with that essay worth 50%

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Excellent professor. Attendance is not mandatory, but can be helpful. If you do the textbook readings you will be well prepared. I highly recommend this course

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: His lectures are completely useless because it has nothing to do with the tests. You only need his books for the test. He is one of the worst lecturers. He makes the content sound so easy on his lectures, but his tests are actually super difficult. I did bad on the first test by studying his lecture, later I did excellent by studying only the book.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: One of U of T's real gems. Danesi's practically an institution. Always finds ways to make classes more engaging, the course material is easy, and his sense of humor and wit are world renowned. A real honor and privilege being part of his classes.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Danesi is super nice and cares for his students, but often digresses in lecture. He teaches from the textbook (written by him). Though the content itself may seem easy, the TA marks everything and likes to test very specific details from the textbook. Evaluations included quizzes, an essay, and a final exam. Overall, an enjoyable class!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: I had him for a first year seminar "Anthropology of Brands". He's a funny guy and a REALLY easy marker. He let us decide our essay topics and gave us free reign. His lectures were interesting, but sometimes they felt like they lacked substance - I don't regret the easy A though lol

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: he's a SUPER easy marker, and for papers he'll let you choose pretty much any topic as long as it's reasonably relevant to the course. tests are 100% based off the textbook, but i'd still attend lectures. he cuts them short a lot of the time and they're much more interesting than just the book, and he gets to know those who attend a lot.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Great professor, even greater guy. Passionate about what he does. Take Danesi's classes if you have the chance! I've had him for 3 years and have loved every one of his classes.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: He is a really nice professor. His lectures are pretty interesting too! Loved this class and I will definitely miss it.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Inspiring prof! Though the course content is interesting in the first place

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Danesi is one of the most memorable professors; he really stands out in this often cold institution. I got near perfect on both tests just from reading his book and writing notes on it. Although optional, I attended his class many times since he made them interesting. As a STEM student, this was my highest grade with least effort; definite bird.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Easy class. Don't need to attend lectures if you are willing to do the readings. Just did readings and studied the night before (got 80 on midterm and 82 on final). from the couple lectures i went to he lets you off 30-45 mins off early so thats a plus too

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Course was easy for credit, but useless for knowledge. He even dismiss the lecture one hour earlier than the schedule. He repeatedly insulted president Donald Trump during his course, which is very unprofessional. He should kept his politcal beliefs to himself and treat the course seriously.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: Nice guy, knows his stuff. Unfortunately, I think he's gotten a little too comfortable in his position. Course was extremely easy for someone in the anthropology or linguistics programme (most people take it as a byrd) & he jokes around a lot in his lectures. I skipped lectures, didn't do the readings and did reasonably well on the tests (all MC).

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: One of the most enjoyable and memorable profs I have ever had.  I couldn't wait to get to class most days. Made me feel like I am receiving true VALUE  FOR  THE TUITION!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Marcel Danesi
Review: He wrote the textbook for the class so his lectures are basically just going over his textbook and some articles from another textbook. His lectures are hilarious, he often gets off topic but he's really funny. Tests are multiple choice and easy if you do the reading. The paper is more tricky as the TA grades them.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: The best! His lectures are very clear and organized. He breaks difficult concepts down to manageable pieces and he is VERY available for students who seek help.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: He is the best. Orgo is not easy but he just has a way of making it doable. Great prof.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: He is just awesome, one of the best prof ever! He explains the concept super clearly and helps are always available. He made me love organic chemistry so much. His British accent made me concentrate more in class. Definitely would highly recommend this prof

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: I love this guy! Honestly the CHM247 lecturing team is BOMB!! Such great teachers who evidently care for students. Whenever I pass Prof D's office, his door is always open. Also, his accent made me pay more attention to what he was saying, and he overall has excellent presentation skills. I was lucky enough to have him for CHM136 and CHM247.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: He is my hero. Always gives a talk after every midterm and he will literally inspire you to do good on the next midterm. Very good lectures that are clear and concise. Covers difficult topics very smoothly and a generally nice and jolly person. Please take his Organic Chem classes, he's the definition of Sweetermans.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: Great prof!!! Made me enjoy organic chemistry in comparison to the prof I had for CHM136. Funny prof and his explanations are extremely clear and easy to follow.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: Great lectures, though tests are somewhat tricky.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: He made me like organic chemistry again. After dealing with Professor Browning last year I thought I was hopeless, but Professor D changed that. Go to class. His lectures are awesome. He explains everything so well. His test will definitely test you on some fine details, but if you go to class and work for it you'll do great.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: Probably one of the best profs out there, awesome lectures, very clear, gives you helpful study tips and tricks for remembering things during lecture. On the whole, an awesome guy and an awesome prof.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: He's a great prof in so many ways. If I had him for the entirety of the course I guarantee I would have gotten an A+. He makes it so his lectures easy to stay focused and he's very clear on what he expects you to know for the tests.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
