Review: Awesome lecturer but real tough test, I took his class last year, still haunts my dreams.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: He is excellent at explaining concepts in organic chemistry clearly. It's really easy to understand some complicated concepts as he breaks them down nicely and explains it in steps. However, I find his test questions are really hard. His questions are very tricky and require a lot of application.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: Best prof of the lot in CHM136. Really made concepts clear and did a good job of keeping the class engaged. He's pretty funny (even worse a banana suit to class for Halloween) and he clearly outlines what will be tested in tests. Would definitely recommend!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: He was one of the best CHM profs I ever had. Organized, clear and simply outstanding in teaching. His questions are very fair. Amazing prof.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: Best lecturer in chemistry, hard questions but fair.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: He explains concepts in organic chemistry very clearly and makes it easier to understand. However, despite this, his test papers are not easy to crack!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: Very clear in lectures. Explains the chemistry quite well. Pretty funny too at times. British accent to top it off.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: Great would be an underestimation. He teaches the Canadian Olympiad team for chemistry. Go to office hours.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: I honestly looked forward to his lectures. I don't even like chem that much but damn this prof was good at making me forget that. 11/10 I'm gonna try take more of his lectures in the future

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Andrew (Andy) Dicks
Review: An amazing lecturer! Super funny and friendly, really cares about the course. Make sure to come up to him after class if you don't understand something, he will help you 100%.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: I believe Dr. Peterson is a true teacher, learner and important for academia. Im glad I was able to take this class.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: The man among boys. Tells it like it is.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: Mr. Peterson is the definition of an alpha male. Most of the students in class would tremble in fear as he said "good afternoon ladies and gentlemen". His lectures are outstanding, showing utter dominance on the topics. Occasionally there would be some arguing from the back of the class but Mr. Peterson completely shut them down with facts.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: Best to learn from. Very comprehensive knowledge, lots of background.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: This maze of a man is amazing

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: Was a great professor ! Very inspirational

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: For once, this is the one person that showed me my lack of knowledge in supporting what i want to say. Me being a liberal thingy, i wish i could have the data this man has to back literally everything i have stood for so far. I lost everyone of my liberal friends for doing so. So, thank you, for showing me that i am not a lunatic

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: An honest man

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: I'm an avid listener of his Youtube series

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: Excellent teacher!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: His lectures were truly beyond what i could imagine

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: Great Professor

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: He was one of the most intelligent and eloquent people I have ever had the chance to meet. Provides space for discussion, deliberation, and disagreement, and respects differing points of view. Fantastic person and profound speaker. I know hes not at U of T currently, but if you ever get the chance to take a class with him dont think twice!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: Hes a good teacher

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: If he sticks to the subject matter he seems to know his stuff but then he enters into flights of weird speculation that he is passionate about but doesn't seem to be course relevant. Imagine a hyperactive teen who just got a library card and needs to share some random thought about each book he has read in an angst ridden stream of consciousness.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: Pretty good lecturer! Provides great examples for heavy concepts. Tough grader, but you can do it if you show up to his lectures.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: Best professor ever! You can do this!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: An amazing professor, with fascinating lectures and interesting course material. Open to questions and constructive, respectful discussion. Explains things well and cares for his students deeply. Also, love his book! It was an honour to have a professor with such a strong psychology background and one who is so respected worldwide.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: best professor ever!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: Jordan Peterson
Review: Amazing prof. Hung on every word he spoke, really makes you think deeply about tough issues. Hugely popular now in the media and has acquired a lot of fame which is actually unfortunate for the students of UofT who look to him as a professor, to learn from, to take courses from.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: Prof. Pesando is one of the gems of UofTs Economics Department. He has the best lectures and you wont need to read textbooks if you attend them. However, he has hard tests especially if you dont understand the foundational concepts. It is also very important to practice a lot before going to his midterms. Overall, I like his teaching!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: He's funny and clearly explains the concepts. The problem is that memorizing his notes isn't what's going to get you a good grade. He's a tough grader and his tests are harder than other profs'. His tests are vague and if your arguments aren't exactly the ones on his answer sheet, you get half the marks. His lectures don't prepare you for tests.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: His lectures are beautiful. No need for textbook use whatsoever. I'd suggest going to lectures since he explains it so well and his voice is so soothing, but his notes are super clear anyways.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: He provides really good foundation of your understanding of economics

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: Awesome prof, super clear and straightforward. If you are a first year student, MAKE SURE TO CHOOSE HIM AS YOUR PROF.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: I didn't even open the textbook a single time, his notes are so good and concise and his personality is infectious

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: Good prof. before this class every one said his class is quite easier than another. however, it is true, but still hard in understanding lecture and doing well on the test.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: Pretty good for eco101. Its a tough course in general so youre gonna have to put in the work. Do lots of previous practice tests and youll be golden.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: I would want to listen to his lectures again in year two.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: I really enjoy professor Pesando's lecture. He is an amazing professor I've ever seen before. He is responsible for students and respectable. He explained every economic concepts very detail.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: Must have prior Economics experience

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: Best Eco class! If you are RC student, don't miss this professor!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: He is a very good professor. His lectures are clear and concise, and he can be amusing to boot. The tests are not overly difficult, although it is crucial to understand all of the concepts thoroughly.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: pretty good

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: You don't realize that he is one of the best profs until you don't have him anymore. Definitely the hardest course I took in my first semester, but if you do the past tests and understand them you will be fine. Worked my ass off for a B-. If you're not a math person, he would be the best choice as he doesn't use numbers very often,mostly theory.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: Great guy and awesome prof!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: A really amazing professor, no doubt I would take him again! His lectures are explained very clearly and detailed. Although generally, ECO101 is difficult, you have to master the concepts to be able to score. Tests are challenging if you don't know the concepts but very fair otherwise. He is easily one of the best professors there for ECO101 :)

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: Despite what everyone says, he is actually a very good professor! The best way to succeed in this class is by doing past tests and going to tutorials, which become very helpful when it comes to studying for tests. Even if you bomb the first test (like me) theres still a chance, you just have to work for it and put in all your effort!

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: ECO101. HE IS amazing! his lecture notes are very good. I would highly recommend studying from past tests and go to the ecoman because he has loads of past tests. VERY important to religiously study the examples that are not in the lecture notes, he always puts these questions on tests and exams! Tests are not hard.

School: University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Name: James Pesando
Review: The course in general is pretty difficult but Professor Pesando's lectures are extremely helpful in breaking down some counter intuitive concepts. You need to put in some work outside of class to do well though.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: This techer is the bestest most wonderfullest techer eye have ever had in may lyfe.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Zooms in real nice. *Ahhhhh*

Name: Larry Smith
Review: good professor

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Decent

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Not need a lot of effort to pass that class

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Tests were awesome

Name: Larry Smith
Review: blah blah

Name: Larry Smith
Review: It has been more than 20 years since I took his class and I still remember him and the stuff he taught. On average, I skipped about 75% of the classes in Waterloo, but I made an effort to attend every single one of Larry's class. It's extremely entertaining. You laugh and you learn. Best prof ever!!!

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Really bad lecturer, constantly gets way off topic. Parades around the class talking about nonsense and then makes test questions about nonsense he talks about. Example question: Why was England such a great colonising nation? Correct answer: Animal spirit. Classes are a big waste time for anyone who follows the news.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Larry Smith is a pretty horrible professor, for people who don't at least loosely follow the news he's okay for teaching some day to day stuff. Otherwise I don't recommend him at all. He rambles incessantly about totally irrelevant topics. He does not teach econ correctly or properly prepare for higher level courses.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: BEST PROF EVER. Sometimes difficult to get a seat because about 100 extra people come to the class that aren't in it, just because he's that good.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Attendance mandatory, but his lectures are hands down the BEST EVER. People not in the class flood the classroom because he is just that good. You have to take his class if you can! Best prof imaginable.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Larry Smith is captivating. Best instructor I've had to date. Entertaining, knowledgeable, and shrewd, teaches in a dynamic and highly applied manner. Discards typical text-centric, dry structure of econ classes and makes the subject come alive. His career advice (and exams) kick your butt.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Larry is very passionate and makes the class an experience. I did not find the material overly hard and with limited studying could pull high marks. I did get tired of his attitude. He is a bit full of himself.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: After taking econ with another prof i realized how lucky i was. If you pay attention and read over notes a good mark is possible. I got an 92. So it is possible to do well with larry. His fast teaching style may present some challanges to students.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: He's the best economics professor at the University of Waterloo, period.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Larry is amazing He trains all his students like warriors He shows so much passion and will keep your attention for hours

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Very unhelpful at times.

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Larry Smith is the high priest of economists.  I wasn't even enrolled in his class and I was present for every single lecture.  Each lecture was the highlight of my week.  Taking a class with Larry Smith is an experience you can't afford to pass up, despite some of his crazy antics (or because of them!)

Name: Larry Smith
Review: Keep's you interested for all 3 hours of his lecture. Awesome presentation and the stories he tells are real world examples that have a practical value. Doesn't use textbook at all so attendance is a must. For those who love to memorize stuff from the book this course would be a nightmare, but for those who have a little bit of logic it would rock!

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Mansour's tests are fair, however, you won't learn ANYTHING by going to his classes. He tries to justify not teaching any of the content by saying that it'll make you put in more effort, but in reality it just means that you aren't given the right resources to learn. Your TA will probably teach you more in 1 tutorial than he will the entire term.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: The reason I'm passing this course

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: He's a great guy!

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Great professor. He gives great lectures, and he really gets to know the students. He likes to focus on key concepts, and moves really fast, so pay attention. Go to the lectures. His review sessions are also absolutely essential. Get the textbook, and do problems like your life depends on it. Beware the midterm (for real it's really hard).

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: His lecture is very interesting.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Absolutely loved this guy. My best lectures in ECE 1A term. His lectures were clear and hilarious at the same time. The man really makes a class lighten up. Would recommend Professor Mansour to anyone anyday.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Good prof overall.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Would definitely recommend! He's a great prof, explains the material well. Must warn you though, some people find his way of teaching to be unique and non-traditional, and hence end up not attending the classes. He explains the subject very well, and makes sure you understand why it works the way it is supposed to.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Amazing Professor loves to make classes interesting. Tells random stories about himself to get the concept of what he is trying to teach. I would love to take him up again for any other course in the future. The course itself is very tough and requires a lot of thinking.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: He's probably a little crazy but overall pretty good.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Absolutely amazing prof. His constant jabs at students and comments about baklavas and his stories are great. He made every lecture entertaining and focused a lot on theoretical concepts which was great.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: He's a knowledgeable professor, pretty interesting class, respectful person. Definitely learned a lot from him, however need to pay 100% attention to his lecture, he goes REALLY FAST during his lectures

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: He's a knowledgeable professor, pretty interesting class, respectful person. Definitely learned a lot from him, however need to pay 100% attention to his lecture, he goes REALLY FAST during lectures.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Great prof, definitely enjoys teaching.  Sometimes his lectures were confusing.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Great prof. Makes you work. Holds help sessions to make sure you understand. Enjoyable lecutres.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Great prof, great lectures. Holds tons of extra help sessions that are highly recommended to attend. Willing to help after class as well!

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: One of the best lecturers I've had throughout university. So popular that people will often be standing at the back and sitting in the aisles of the lecture hall. Really passionate about what he does and making sure everyone understands how things work. Amazing prof.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: I love how his explanations for key concepts in physics were so concise yet clear. People complain how his solutions to example problems are only in variables but tbh, you should've picked this up from high school.   He also had weekly extra-help sessions which were really helpful where he solved pretty difficult problems.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Great guy but his teaching style is a little unorganized. All he does is go through examples, but an upside is that he tried to make physics fun by sharing almost relevant stories. Has a lot of help session which is good if you wanted to actually learn the class material outside of class time.

Name: Firas Mansour
Review: Hilarious stories but unfortunately he spends all of his time either telling stories or conceptually doing questions. Examples done in class don't have numbers and that makes it hard to know if you truly understand the concept. He cares whether you understand the logic, which is great but don't expect to get good notes or good practice solving.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: This man is a beauty. Never had a prof that was so engaging, funny and good at teaching! A pleasure going to his lectures every week. 10/10 would recomend.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: tells lots of great stories, would recommend going to class

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Would recommend recording the lectures because he speaks super fast, but he is a fantastic, interesting lecturer who genuinely cares about his students and his course. Would love to have him in other courses, but unfortunately, this is just a requisite course for me.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Pronounces the word humans as "yoomans"

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Ennis made it really easy for me to love his lectures even at 8:30 am, he explains the concepts well and loves what he does. His passion is what makes him a great prof.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: He was hilarious and made it a joy to attend his lectures. Although there was a lot of textbook reading, the information is pretty interesting!

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Great prof, great lectures! Too bad he retired!

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Amazing prof. the lectures are so so good.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Excellent

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Dr. Ennis is my favourite prof in my looong university career. I can honestly say that he inspired me to pursue a psychology major and later on go into graduate studies in psychology. His lectures were riveting, funny, relevant, and I never had trouble focusing in his class.  His MCQ tests can be challenging for uninterested passengers. Be warned.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Great lectures! Funny guy who will keep you engaged in what he is talking about. He is very clear as to what you have to read (and it will be enough) and what is on the midterms and final. Excellent prof.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: This class was really interesting but boy was there a lot of reading to do!! Richard is an excellent prof and you can tell by the way he speaks that he is such a sweet guy. He always is great at clarifying his explanations. He really knows his studies and expects you to know them too! Regardless I definitely want to take more classes with him.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: funny guy

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Awesome prof enjoyed the classes i attended, would have went all to them if it weren't for the fact that is was a night class.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Great representational skills! Makes class fun and interesting.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Richard Ennis is an unreal prof. I would take his class again hands down. Lectures are very helpful and keep you interested. I found his jokes hilarious and looked forward to his class every week. Attending lectures is mandatory and so is reading the textbook. Content on tests is 50/50 (half lecture, half textbook). Must take lecture notes !

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Brilliant prof! He made the course content so much more interesting and hilarious.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: Fantastic Prof. Vey engaging, great sense of humour and extremely knowledgeable. Will be sad to see him retire. Excellent UW asset.

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: WONDERFUL PROF! Highly recommend. He is very engaging, and makes the class seem shorter than it is. He does give a challenging midterm... make sure you study! But overall the best first year prof I had

Name: Richard Ennis
Review: I've took 3 courses with this professor so far. He is such a great professor. One of the best  at the university. The course itself was very interesting as it had a lot of realistic content. The course itself was pretty straightfoward and manageable in terms of workload. I would definitely recommend this course for your seminar requirement.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Such a great prof, his lecture was really organized. He definitely care about his student too.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Really good professor who knows what he's talking about. Explains difficult concepts clearly.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Best professor I have had at the University of Waterloo. Lectures were clear and very engaging. Exams were challenging but students were well prepared due to the excellent teaching of the course.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Excellent Prof. The course itself is not easy. This isn't a course where you can just read the lecture notes and not go to class. The prof explains in details during lectures and answers all your questions. Overall just a great course and a great prof.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Very good prof - articulate, knowledgeable, and respected. Multiple choice on the exams is the only stumbling block in this course as the exams are otherwise fairly easy.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Amazing prof. Extremely clear explanations throughout the course. Great examples and clearly knows his stuff.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Definitely best professor that's taught me. If you have him you're lucky. Makes hard material seem easy just by how clear and organised he is during the lectures. Teaches with passion. Funny and helpful. Engages the class and challenges it. You can't not love him and not love his course. TA's were good as well and very helpful. Labs are fun.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Lectures are great, even long ones feel shorter due to the fact that he seems to prepare well and keeps your attention the whole time. He explains things multiple times so whenever you hear something that explains a concept well, I'd suggest writing it down since you likely won't hear it better explained from the textbook or your classmates.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Amazing prof for a subject that is tough, but super useful for your career

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Fantastic time doing MTE320 with him. Thorough in the topics, teaches with passion, interest and an understanding from the students POV. Makes the subject very fun, interactive, and interesting. Sets up field trips for students to learn about real app's of transformers.  Gives you enough opportunity to become thorough in the subject.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Amazing lecturer for a generally complex topic. Knows the material very well and explains questions and answers at an appropriate level.  Definitely one of the very best professors you can have at UW

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Very clear and concise lectures. Knowledge of the topics is excellent. Lectures lack excitement, but do teach the material well. Assignments and exams are sometimes worded ambiguously or confusingly.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Excellent professor. Knows his stuff and willing to help.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Well organized course structure. Tricky but fair examinations, but graded and weighted in the best interest of the students. Genuinely cares about the class and their learning process. The course had tough concepts but were made easy to understand due to his outstanding teaching methods. Overall, the best professor in the MTE3A semester.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Excellent Professor, but when it comes to clarifying specifics can be very unclear or confusing.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Couldn't be a better guy.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Really good prof, knows his stuff

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Great prof, really clear

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Great prof, clear and concise. Makes learning circuits pretty straightforward. Exams are a bit challenging but overall you'll be fine if you take it seriously.

Name: Ehab El-Saadany
Review: Great prof, smart guy, we even had a field trip.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: He was funny and really helpful. Really understood the first year struggle

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: I can't begin to describe my endless love for Carey Bissonnette. He is an extremely handsome man, great father, great professor and he is an awesome chemist. I wish he could have taught me all the chemistry I learned in high school as well. I wish Carey Bissonnette was a part of my life from the very start. Very amazing man, great husband & lover.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: Carey has really opened my eyes to chemistry. Not only is he a great professor but he raised a wonderful son. The best thing about his lectures are the hilarious punny chem jokes he makes throughout lectures. Great guy.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: Lectures are clear. He always come to the tutorials before tests. give good feedback.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: I learned a lot about the very roots of chemistry in this course. We were able to derive and understand lots of the basic equations that we were given in general chemistry. I loved this course. Dr. Bissonnette was very knowledgeable and  approachable, though lectures were slow. Time given for quizzes, and the final was not enough for me.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: He goes by the lecture material too slow and he goes off track almost every class. The midterm and quizzes were a disaster in which he tries to make up for the low class average by adding additional assignments to boost your grade. Not enough time to finish exam and also expects you to derive almost everything even though it's a chemistry course.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: Bissonnette is definitely very knowledgeable on the subject of chemistry. When he describes a concept, he goes into great depth about it, to the point where the relevancy becomes questionable - although, it is very interesting and helpful. He is a tad bit hard to follow at times, but he is undoubtedly a really good prof and chemist.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: He speaks very choppily, sometimes hard to follow and listen to for long lectures.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: he is the boringest prof i have ever had

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: He's really boring. Very slow too, talks about like 3 pages per lecture. Then rushes at the end where the tested material is located. Not the greatest in organization

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: He puts lecture videos online and give bonus questions on tests. I think he is not a born lecturer, but I think he has done everything he could to be a great prof.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: Cares about you, speak to him for guidance...

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: He's a good prof. he explains things slowly and clearly so that you really get it. Sure, he goes slow through the material, but this isnt always a bad thing. Chem 120123 are not hard courses, but I highly recommend keeping up with material and doing textbook questions regularly. believe me, dont screw yourself over. chem is just practise.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: The podcasts are a little underwhelming - he doesn't quite explain the material that well. He does NOT respond to emails and can be quite unhelpful during office hours. I would recommend taking the campus version (CHEM 212) in the winter instead. The assignments are fair, but he takes forever to mark them - I actually still don't know what I got.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: Doesn't always seem overly interested

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: works through the course notes at a very very slow pace... he can go on about one small subject for over 20 minutes easily. it's way too easy to fall asleep in his class, but he seems like a nice guy. hated the clicker requirement in lectures, but he posted lecture videos. he is also open to answering questions after lectures.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: goes over what you need to know, however he teaches slowly and screws you for the lab. overall a pretty good professor

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: Bissonnette is a fatherly figure who will make sure you understand everything before moving on. While it's true that he goes very slowly (hence screwing you for 123L), he's the best first-year Chem prof you could get. He's entertaining, knows his stuff, and will give you very helpful midterm/exam hints. Focus on the concepts and you'll do well.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: He goes slow, which is good for the most part but sometimes it can drive you crazy. He does explain things quite well and of course there is the bonus fact that he puts his lectures online. He's a pretty great prof...chose to have an 8:30 classes two terms in a row because he was teaching at that time. Can be entertaining at times also.

Name: Carey Bissonnette
Review: Very slow and clear, kinda boring

Name: Eva Lau
Review: Worst person in the world. She doesn't have a PhD and is cocky for nothing. She said that I was not university material when I saw her since I wanted to switch to economics. In fact she recommended me to transfer to Conestoga College. She refused to sign my transfer papers and thus I stayed in Sciences, and got into Queen's Medical School.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: She refers herself as a prof but she doesn't even have her PhD. Besides that, she is absolutely the worst person at the University of Waterloo. She's not qualified as a lecturer nor an econ admin. She told me that I was not university material and recommended that I go to Conestoga college. I did not take her advise and now I am in medical school.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: The worst prof I had first year. Lectures were difficult to understand. Self taught myself the course through the textbook. Highly recommend avoiding her at all costs

Name: Eva Lau
Review: Worst prof I've had thus far. Cannot explain concepts, when she does it's far more confusing. Has difficulty answer questions. Midterms and finals are very difficult.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: She teaches knowledge pretty clearly  and explain things thoroughly. The only problem is her tests are so difficult...

Name: Eva Lau
Review: She makes materials really clear and she believes in students that study hard. Sometimes she doesn't have enough patient when people ask her questions, but she always answer them when you ask during class. Her exams and midterms are not hard. She always hint you what will be on the tests in class, so make sure you go. SHE IS SO FUNNY in class, too.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: not a very good professor. I think she talks WAY too loudly that its actually distracting you from what she is actually saying.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: I was very disconcerted when I read Eva's reviews before going to her class. I actually loved her, I thought she had lots of great little examples and she explained things in a practical way. Course was well balanced between midterms and the exam!

Name: Eva Lau
Review: can't even focus on her class

Name: Eva Lau
Review: Terrible professor. She can't explain anything well and doesn't even attempt to clarify anything. Avoid her at all costs.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: She's a great prof, with a wonderful sense of humour. Attend classes, as the things she cover are usually heavily covered in midterms and exams. I recommend her over the other econ profs.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: the wrost ever

Name: Eva Lau
Review: Prof is sometimes hard on students, but really is able to push students to their potential. Course was good, but definitely learned alot more life lessons about uni and tackling exams!

Name: Eva Lau
Review: Can't speak English. Tests had many spelling mistakes. Lacked clarity.  Good at linking concepts together but take Larry Smith's class.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: If you attend all classes this is a bird course. I went into this class knowing absolutely nothing about Econ and I came out with a decent mark. She may have an accent, but it's understandable, and if you do good on her quizzes than you're fine for the midterms and final! Very good prof!

Name: Eva Lau
Review: Cool prof

Name: Eva Lau
Review: She was a lot of fun and made lectures hilarious, but I learned close to nothing. The textbook had no actual information and was written entirely in examples. Not a great course, but she's a nice person as long as you don't ask questions.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: Worst prof ever. You nicely ask for clarifications from her incomprensible banter, and she dismisses you and says you're ignorant. Wow, what a difficult person to deal with!

Name: Eva Lau
Review: To be honest, class was really easy if you've taken Econ before in high school and/or if you actually study. Lectures are not mandatory if you understand the textbook. If you don't, then this might be a challenging course because she isn't great at delivering the material. Exams were all MC and straight-forward.

Name: Eva Lau
Review: Great professor in my opinion. She doesn't like when people ask questions though because she wants you to think for yourself. She has a great teaching style to ensure you understand the material. She has an accent (i.e. probrem/elah-tiss-itee) but is still understandable. She definitely knows her stuff - audio lectures are helpful too.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: BEST CS115 PROF

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Very entertaining prof, can tell he is passionate about computer science.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Amazing Prof! His lectures are soooo interesting. Would definitely recommend to take any class with him.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Was in his section in Winter 2018. One of the best profs I've ever had, very smart and caring. The last lecture of that term was unforgettable.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Great Prof, love his final lesson! BIG RESPECT!

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Great prof and you can tell that he's passionate about lecturing. He keeps the lectures entertaining. However, he doesn't post his slides which sucks but that's the only downfall.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: One of the best CS profs I've ever had. He's got so much passion for teaching! Lectures are super interesting and organized. Only thing I didn't like is that he doesn't post the lectures slides.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: One of the best lecturers at UW!!!

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Professor Vasiga has really engaging lectures. He does his best to make a dry course CS 135 as interesting as possible. He gives good examples to present CS concepts so you can understand them easier. Overall, he made a really dry course interesting and engaging to participate, listen and not fall asleep. Clearly, he is doing something right.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Would definitely recommend taking his lectures XD Very cute and funny

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Great, funny prof.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Amazing prof, would love to take the rest of my CS courses with him!

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Great!!!

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Troy is by far one of the best professors at uWaterloo, top 3 in my opinion. His lectures are incredibly helpful as well as funny, never a dull moment in class so you'll definitely pay attention. On cs241 the assignments are hard but Troy is incredibly active on Piazza and always available on office hours to give feedback. Exams are pretty fair

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Just one word: Awesome!

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: great prof.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Really great prof. He explains class material very clearly, and he is very humorous. The class loves him. And in general a very nice person.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Has very good humour, and can explain concepts using it.

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Pretty good and humor  Very clear

Name: Troy Vasiga
Review: Amazing professor. Clear, consistent, concise. Uses skeleton notes; you better show up to class to get the annotated versions. He really walks you through the content and you get a thorough understanding of how compilers work. The only course I have made EVERY effort to attend!  1010, all my female friends have crushes on him. Some guys do too!

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: He is a very nice and approachable prof. However, he is done in by poor course structure. It is hard to define the main learning objective of this course given the various course topics. Furthermore, the insistent use of a computer business simulation program named "Mikes Bikes"  does not help enhance the course concepts. Nice guy, bad course.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Seems really nice, took the course online and barely listened to lectures (very boring).  Knew the information inside out but midterms were still tough as it is all cases instead of knowledge.  Studying helps but does not give good marks.  Mike's Bikes is a weekly annoyance also.  Multiple choice has similar options that are hard to discern often.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: -great guy but his teaching style is not the most engaging -Bob is really friendly, helpful and funny, it's unfortunate that he chooses to incorporate Mike's Bikes in his classes. Not the greatest choice of learning tools. -this course definitely needs to be redesigned.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: I took his AFM 131 class online, which saved me from his lectures (which I hear are dreadful). The group project was demanding, the material (including the book) are poorly written. Generally a terrible class and prof: confusing and cluttered. If you need help go in person- hes the most warm and useful person to person.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Show up and pass - bird course

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: worst prof ever

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: One of the hardest courses in first year. Information from lectures are unclear and unfocused. Vast amount of details from the textbook and many case problems on exams. The significant amount of grammar errors can distract the students and cause confusing during the exams. Not sure why we still have this prof teaching us.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: The amount of "stuff" in this course is too damn high.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Worst prof ever. You learn a lot from the textbook if you've never taken international business in high school. The problem is that the midterms and final are not based on any of the lectures or textbook. The business strategy game is stressful. In-class iclicker quizzes do not produce marks unless you score very high in them.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: What makes this course worse is that the midterms and finals are totally messed. They do not correspond to anything you have learned in the course. The whole point of this course is to get like a 90% before the final exam so you can drop 10% after. But if you get a hard TA and get only a 80% before final exam, then say goodbye to your 131 mark.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Interesting course, learned a lot. Its refreshing to see everyone else's posts whom agree that the midterms and final exams literally have nothing to do with the course--- I studied.. I knew the material.. and it did not help me in the exams.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Nice guy but terrible teaching style. Lectures don't help at all. Final assignment is very unclear and long. Midterms are weird. Boring class.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Like other people are saying, he does know what he's talking about. He isn't very good at teaching though. The classes are really boring and not all that informative. The information from the book, the online modules, and is all different. The main reason for the poorer is because the exams are unclear and aren't related to the course materials.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: I don't see the issue with this guy.   He clearly has passion for what he teaches and genuinely cares about the students.  Opinions may be skewed because of a bad group in Mike's Bikes, or perhaps the planning of the course which could admittedly be improved.  However without concrete suggestions he always responds to emails and is approachable

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Reading the comments below, I'm not sure if some of these people should be in university. Good prof, stays on topic, expects textbook reading, covers areas that need explanation in class, challenges students on tests, clicker questions and test questions are from the readings (or direct applications), always willing to help, REALLY KNOWS HIS STUFF!

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Really nice guy, terrible prof. Class is really dull, unless you really really love accounting. Exam questions are worded poorly. All the material learned in class is applicable to the Mike's Bikes simulation game, but not so much real life scenarios. There's iClicker quizzes every class, other than that there is no reason to show up to the lecture

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Bad Prof, midterms are totally weird

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: Worse prof ever. Doesn't really teach in class, expects students to discuss and come up with the answers ourselves. Articles and videos are extra boring, but you have to pay attention because it's on the in class clicker and on the exam. Mikes Bikes is one terrible business sim game, barely relates to real life. Discussion board is stupid too.

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: IF YOU HAVE TO TAKE THIS COURSE, TAKE IT ONLINE! everything i have leaned i have taught myself from the textbook and apparently that is not good enough as im reading the comments below.. his questions are worded in the most confusing way! i regret taking this course... the professor tries very hard but it is not working...very boring and CONFUSING

Name: Bob Sproule
Review: his multiple choice are too confusing, sometimes its a matter of luck not knowledge

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Taken 3+ courses from him over the years, used to really enjoy them but his lecturing gets old FAST with the same catch phrases, material, studies, etc. Insists that his grading/tests aren't tricky if you work hard but his level of assessment is ambiguous enough to keep the avr. low so don't expect 90s from him - even if you study like a fiend.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Incredibly intelligent and so knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches. Also a really engaging speaker. Found the tests really hard though. A lot of what I felt were smaller details from the textbook so you need to be really thorough when reading, making notes, and studying. He doesn't post the slides and attendance is really a must.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Fantastic class. my favourite of my entire undergrad career. highly recommend.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Burris is a very good lecturer, one of my favourites so far. He does have a bad rep for having very difficult tests, however it just requires a specific type of studying. Instead of memorizing what he says in lecture you just have to really think about all the material and try to make connections. Do this and you will be fine, I finished with a 90!

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Prof. Burris is easily the best professor I've had so far here at UW. He's engaging, witty, and extraordinarily insightful. I often heard my classmates complain about the ambiguity of his test questions, but I think those complaints came more from people who hadn't studied properly than from those who truly knew the material well. LOVE HIM.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Actually tests your understanding of the course material, NOT how well you can regurgitate information. Tests make up your entire mark, they are difficult if you don't know how to study or do M/C. He gets a bad wrap because people are lazy. Don't be lazy and you will enjoy this class.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Ugh, my second class with this prof. I really enjoy the lecture material and his persona, however the tests are so freaking difficult, very ambiguous questions. its impossible to get a high mark unless you're genius. dont recommend taking this class or any other classes with Burris earlier than in your 3rd year. Huge load.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: he is great but tests can be tricky!

Name: Chris Burris
Review: I am in Arts and Business CO-OP and I took this course during the spring term.  I have heard amazing things about Professor Burris and he did not disappoint. I did extremely well in this course (100 percent) and I had an amazing experience with this Prof. His lectures were clear and concise. The slides he used were really helpful.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Do not recommend it unless it's mandatory. If taken, do not take the tests lightly. attend all classes and keep reading the notes

Name: Chris Burris
Review: I've been with many professors during the 3 years at UW, and I can confidently say that Prof B is by far the best prof I've ever seen - followed by prof Ennis. He is a natural born public speaker, he is passionate, witty, and laid back. His exams are pretty easy as long as you keep up with the topics and listen to what he teaches! Best prof NA

Name: Chris Burris
Review: One of the best profs at Waterloo. Extremely dedicated to his work and overall an inspirational guy. Tests are tough, but getting an A is possible. Class is mandatory for passing! there are no slides to go off of, so make friends in class for notes!

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Tests were extremely hard for me, though I guess I could have studied a bit harder. Assignments were super fun and really helped you apply course material! Prof is also hilarious and a great lecturer!

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Dedicated to the research, amazing lecturer, and is genuinely excited about the course content.  He works hard and expects you to do the same.  He is very helpful for those putting in a genuine effort to engage.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Best prof I've ever had in university. Really cares about what he is teaching and is incredibly engaging. Assignments are tricky but you get a lot out of them.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Dr. Burris is a great prof. I hate 3 hour lectures, but honestly his always go by very quickly, definitely the best lecturer at Waterloo. You HAVE to go to class because he doesn't post slides and even his slides in class don't contain any information, just titles. The reading is pretty tedious but essential to pass. Test are tricky but doable.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: He is a funny professor and is really passionate about his work. He makes the content easy to understand and provides examples that are really interesting. However, I don't feel that the tests accurately represented the material and were very difficult to receive good grades on. He warns you that the tests will be tough from the beginning, though.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Dr. Burris is a wonderful professor and extremely charismatic. You really need to study for this course and make connections. The exams aren't based on definitions or concrete ideas; they are abstract. For PSYCH 232, very little psychological research was presented and personally, I would have identified it more with a philosophy course.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: Sick teacher, super funny! Interesting Class, you definetly won't be bored.

Name: Chris Burris
Review: The way he lectures is interesting and easy to digest. The courseware is really important. If you read it, understand it and can summarize what all the ideas are then you will be able to answer all the questions on them. Some questions on the tests clearly test your understanding rather than memorization. Understanding is the key.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Thought you retired, but you are like the energizer bunny, I shall wait to see the battery run out. OK lets Try 1V instead of 3.3V. Surprising You can function with 0V too.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Terrible professor

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: One of the few courses I finished and actually felt like I learned something useful. Barby has some issues in his methods (flies through notes yet somehow has time for four lectures of "Q/A"), and you'll hate him during the term. That is, until you realize he cares more about making us good engineers than passing us with high grades.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Puts all other professors i considered bad to shame. Will not hesitate to fail an entire class and will do absolutely nothing to prepare you for the exam. If you manage to pass, be ready to move on from his course having gained zero useful knowledge other than how to deal with incredible stress.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Pretty bad

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: One of the best professors. He will motivate you to study. He knows the material really well. It was hard to follow his lectures but he gives you a lot of practice problems. This course will prepare you well for future circuit courses. Make sure to do all the assignments, attend tutorials and ask him for help during office hours.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: One of the best professors I have ever had. At first glance he may seem rough and rude. But it took me a co-op term after the course to understand the worth of what he teaches and why he goes hard on the students. His grading scheme may seem gargantuan but irl, it lets you get 90s easily. Real gem, knows how to make his students good at EE design.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: "Who let him in the college!? While is he still in the college? When will he leave the college?Why would he let anyone be taught by him in the college? Why would he grade anyone in the college!? " These are the questions that pop out In my head more than the semester questions....

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Not a good person. Mocks a lot!! Should be give resignation ASAP!

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: I'm sorry but I don't understand why the department in nano eng. dont see why this guy shouldn't be a professor. Maybe he's good at a researcher, but as a lecturer, he's terrible.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Arrogant, prone to shouting if mad, simply does not care if you fail. In fact, seems as though he WANTS you to. If you can avoid him, don't just walk away - RUN.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: RUN

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Avoid

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Can't teach anything. None of the students can follow his lectures.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: so useless

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Associate Professor, Senior Associate Chair Ha Ha Learn to get your self out of a paper bag Ha Ha

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: James Barby is a total sick baller OG.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Difficult course and hard exams but I guarantee you will know how to design circuits after taking this course. Very well taught.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Best professor in my opinion. Lectures are challenging but very practical. They guy teaches you stuff which will make your star in the industry. Very approachable. Always help, never says no. Had many office hours to help students. HONEST, SIMPLE and STRAIGHT FORWARD professor. Cares about Students.

Name: James A (Jim) Barby
Review: Miserable, sad man.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Best prof ive had so far, highly respected for his yeaching abilities

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Wasn't even in his section, but watching his lecture videos got me a 90. Seems to genuinely care about the success of his students. Amazing guy.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: DO NOT call him Richard! Other than that 10/10 best prof I've ever had.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: HE IS AWESOME

Name: Richard Marta
Review: tbh dont see what all the hype is about, hes okay but definetly not as good as ive heard. avoid asking questions during lecture as hell rush through it and might not even answer it properly so go to him after or during office hours but yeah very average nothing special.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: I had a terrible experience in his class. He doesn't like being asked questions. I would not recommend his class or teaching methods.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Rick Marta is by far my favourite prof in my undergrad career. For some, chemistry is not an appealing subject but Rick Marta makes an effort to get you excited about learning through his passion for chemistry. This course is difficult if you don't keep up with lectures but Rick records all his lectures so you never miss a thing. Great guy.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: He honestly seems like he loves teaching

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Great professor! So helpful, does a really good job of making sure things are clear in lecture. He posts lecture videos, annotated notes, and practice quiz answers, lots of resources to help you do well.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: I only watched his online videos and got a 100%, even if you aren't in his section his videos are available. Do all the practice questions in the course notebook and don't worry too much about assignments (understand them and do them as they are worth 10%) but his tests do not exhibit the difficulty of the assignments. Best prof at UW.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: he is awesome and makes clear and precise lectures!

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Strongly unrecommended. He was extremely rude in person and in emails if students had questions. He did get better with time, but there was no reason to be rude in the first place. Being a professor (lecturer!) does not give anyone a blank card to be imperious.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Marta was definitely the best first-year prof I had. His classes are unreal and he's great at explaining tough material. Go to his office hours if you don't understand something and he'll make sure you do. Great guy, wish him the best.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: So-so. Don't think he has a nice voice - I think his way of speaking is actually unsophisticated and needs to be more academic. As a lab instructor, I found him to be labile in his personality. Overall, I wouldn't recommend him. However, he can be nice with more interaction.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: His voice is nice, and posts lectures online

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Quite dismissive of a student if they ask questions and tries to make it seem like they didn't have good background knowledge. He's not bad when it comes to asking for extensions, but that's about it. Wouldn't recommend him because he is overrated and has communication issues - lacks civility.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: He is a really nice guy. He is really easy to approach and really understanding. However, he goes on long tangents that have nothing to do with what we are being tested on. We could do the entire course in half the time if he didn't ramble so much. It is sometimes hard to know what they want you to know for the exams.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Unrecommended.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Amazing prof! Had him for chem 120, 123 and chem 266l. He really knows his stuff and is great at explaining. For chem 266L, the lab environment is super chill and labs never take the full 3 hours plus no lab final.

Name: Richard Marta
Review: Had him in first year and he was pretty great. But now that I have him in the second year lab he's not so great at all. He wants us to finish as fast as possible by telling us how fast other sections finished, like it's a competition. He gets very moody with students in the lab when we ask questions, especially about TA grading. Over-rated!!

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Students have to attend her lecture to get the note. Her lectures and notes are clear. Little harsh about the class rule, no cell phone during class time

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Bad course experience, I regret selecting this section for Professor Vaughan. She was not willing to solve your questions about the economy. I should have to choose another professor. My friend chose another section where professor speaks clearly and shows a lot of models and examples to help their own students understand.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: To start with, as an English native speaker, I cannot understand what she said in sometimes. In addition, if youre willing to take her course, I advise that you can just download all PowerPoints and read it by yourself. When she teaches the lecture, she just read the powerpoint. If UW gives me a glass and microphone, I could also be a professor.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Professor Vaughan is one of the best econ profs at Waterloo. She explains things very clearly and also provides her own notes. She is also very caring and has a wonderful character (but no phones in her class lol). Easy tests and finals and definitely would take her class again!

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: If you love playing your phone during lectures, dont choose her. Or else, you will find her interesting and engaging in class. Amazing teacher and the tests are not hard if you studied.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Excellent, engaging lectures. Definitely made me enjoy Econ 102 more than I expected to.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: A bit strict in class about cell phones but at least she makes the lectures funny and enjoyable. Has her own in class notes but they're mostly to help you understand concepts.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Her lecture was amazing!

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: No phones or talking allowed or she will call you out. She is a very sweet lady--but super tough!!-- and one of the best profs I have ever had. Very smart and articulate, but very kind and sweet as well! You can tell she is very caring. Accessible outside of class. Overall awesome lady and best econ prof I've ever had! Legend of the faculty.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Super caring and helpful. Very clear lectures.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: She was a great prof. The course material is pretty hard but she is very helpful during office hours. Very enthusiastic. Hard quizzes.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Truly cares about her students and the course material.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: She is overall a great lecturer. Gives lots of notes and cares about her students very much.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Vaughan really is a gem. The people who dislike her are the ones called out in class for being on their phones. She has 0 tolerance for disrespect in her class so keep quiet and leave your phone in your bag. You won't regret it because her lectures are hilarious. She explains topics well and is extremely receptive to questions for clarification.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Quirky prof. Not the best with the material. I would only recommend taking her class if you have no plans to do any higher level econ courses, otherwise take a different prof who will actually teach you what you'll need for the following courses.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Cares about her students more than any prof I've ever had. Everything is organized well, and presented in a manner that sets students up for success.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Great lecturer.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: If you actually go to every class and listen to her attentively, she explains material clearly and you won't have to read the textbook at all! Her slides are great and she gives hand-written class notes with sufficient time to write them down. Her slides, in class notes, and study guide were enough for all exams. Exams were fair insofar you study!

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: She's a great teacher especially compared to the other economics teacher. She uses the textbook slides but she does make her own notes that is actually helpful. Answers any questions. Speaks clearly and talks slowly so everyone understands. She actually waits till everyone is finished typing out her notes. A bit intimidating but she's quite chill.

Name: Maryann Vaughan
Review: Professor Vaughan is one of the best econ profs in the school. She's very insightful on the topic of macroeconomics and you can tell she truly enjoys her field. She is definitely fair and as long as you go to her classes, you'll do well on her exams. Her notes and slides were all I really needed to get a great mark in the class.

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: I had him for first year, and I thought he was a decent lecturer. But as the years went by, I realized that he did not prepare me well. There's a difference between getting through a course, and then getting you ready for the next course. I wish he would have taught a deeper understanding of the concepts versus making everything easy.

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: Ian is a really nice guy. But he only touches the surface of each concept. When you ask for more details, he doesn't know them. That's good for those who just want to pass the course, since he teaches easy and has great lectures. He tries to avoid tougher questions and does not follow up, but expects you to read up on it yourself.

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: Really amazing prof. Didn't like the course too much but he was great.

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: Ian is just great! The best professor I've had. Very clear, organized and engaging.

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: What I like most about Vanderburgh is that he explains everything very clearly while also keeping the interest of students who know the material. He's funny, very intelligent and makes it a joy to be in class. Also, even though he's a busy guy, he's always helpful if you ask.  Absolutely the best prof I have.

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: One of my favourite prof!

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: He was our substitute teacher for a couple of math137 lectures, and he was awesome, as always. I actually chose to come to UW partially because of him! I was in a week long math seminar at uw during grade 12 and luckily had him as our lecturer. That's how good he is!!

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: The side-effect of having Ian as a first-year course prof is that I am now forever comparing other profs to him and none is even remotely comparable (well, perhaps with the exception of Joe West).  Also, he seems to be an all-around accomplished guy.  Hell, he plays piano for our school choir and runs marathon annually, what else can he NOT do?

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: Just awesome, period!

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: He is one of the best profs in u of w I think. I have taken math 135 and Pmath 340 with him. His class was very interesting and not very hard to follow. I strongly suggest him to be your first Math 135 prof if you are a new math students in u of w.

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: BEST PROF EVER!!!

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: One of a kind!

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: Absolutely amazing professor. If you can take any course with him, DO IT.

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: What else can I say?  Read all his "fans'" comments, they're all true. :)  GO TO HIS CLASS!!!!  I was inspired to go to his 8:30am class just to hear lecture!! Teaches BETTER than the textbook--no need to buy course material as long as you attend all his lectures! He's SO friendly, and will know your name--such a young course coordinator!(only 30!)

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: Ian is my GOD!! Not going to his classes should definitely be a crime! He was so nice and helpful. When our class clapped when he told us he was engaged he blushed, funniest thing ever. I think we should work on cloning Ian multiple times to teach all math classes!!

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: Ian was by far the best professor I had this semester.  He is extremely knowledgeable, really teaches the material well, and he's pretty funny at times.  I actually really enjoyed the class just because of how great of a prof Ian was.  I would definitely recommend his classes

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: his class is the only class i even consider going to at 8:30 in the morning... although i still fail at waking up....

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: Everyone was saying how great of a prof. he was but I didn't know until I took this class... and yeah, definitely one of the best!

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: Ian is absolutely wonderful!  He's really patient with questions... if you have the slightest chance to take his class, take it!  It's well worth the extra work!

Name: Ian Vanderburgh
Review: The only prof Ive had who made the class so interesting, I would have rather gone to class than teach it to myself! Amazing people skills.

Name: Stephen New
Review: The man who is well-known as a beauty in mathematics.

Name: Stephen New
Review: When you watch Professor New teach, it is evident that he is in love with math. And this really gets flushed out over the course of a term. He knows his stuff upside down and backwards. He is a wonderful teacher, and although he comes up with the most difficult questions possible, he will adjust your marks fairly. He is a very nice man.

Name: Stephen New
Review: Respect.

Name: Stephen New
Review: Super Knowledgable. Great man.

Name: Stephen New
Review: The man is a legend.

Name: Stephen New
Review: Ah, legend. Without a doubt his class is the hardest out of all my first year courses. The content is harder than 147 but it is easier to get a good mark on a 145 exam because Marcoux does not curve 147 whatsoever. He is very patient, very helpful, EXTREMELY helpful, and if you genuiely like math, you will not be bored despite his monotone voice.

Name: Stephen New
Review: Great prof!

Name: Stephen New
Review: Really Good prof. The lecture contains the right amount of stuff that one doesn't feel that it's too much while he has to be super active to catch up with the pace. Meanwhile he explains stuff clearly and he's mostly free after class. Although this lecture is at eight thirty in the morning, I don't feel like missing any one of the lectures!

Name: Stephen New
Review: simply the most knowlegable prof I had ever seen

Name: Stephen New
Review: great

Name: Stephen New
Review: Really clear and concise professor, but his assignments are lengthy and difficult so be expected to work hard. He does curve a fair bit though.

Name: Stephen New
Review: I loved the course and Stephen New's lectures. He occasionally makes mistakes on the chalkboard, but this was a non-issue for many as he provided typed-up lecture notes with very few errors. Extremely difficult assignments and exams (midterm was much easier than final though).

Name: Stephen New
Review: Extremely hard course, assignments were designed unbelievably difficult but the midterm test was much better while comparing to  the assignments...

Name: Stephen New
Review: Good prof

Name: Stephen New
Review: Hard course hard course. Need to speed up taking notes, but amazing prof!

Name: Stephen New
Review: If you're looking to fast track your mathematical understanding, look no further. This man has peerless knowledge in almost any area of mathematics you can name, and yet he is able to clearly and simply explain even the toughest and most abstract of concepts. While his assignments are incredibly difficult and push you to your limits, they're fair.

Name: Stephen New
Review: Easily one of the best professor you will ever met. It's going to be very hard as he is extremely rigorous and proves everything. But you will really learn a lot and see things clearer if you see it through. Tough assignments, tough exams, but the final score will be curved. It's totally worth the effort at the end. Plus, he is really funny.

Name: Stephen New
Review: Awesome prof.

Name: Stephen New
Review: Snew really knows how to be precise, which makes his lectures easy to follow. His assignments are tough, but he gives hints if you ask for them.

Name: Stephen New
Review: Snew is one of the best profs you can get at UW

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Amazing!

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Rohan is one of the best profs at the University of Waterloo. He makes lots of jokes during lectures. The content isn't always straightforward but he ran two extra help sessions each week to compensate. He respects students and students respect him. In fact, he knows many students by name. Midterms were insanely difficult so be prepared.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: A real one, will be missed

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Too bad he is retiring, he is an amazing prof. He is so kind and caring and also super funny.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: He gives amazing lecture. Conveys ideas clearly and gives a lot of examples. Midterm can be a bit tricky. Final is much nicer.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Great prof, as someone who hated physics in high school I actually ended up with a semi okay grade and crammed for 16 hours before the final. The midterm is brutal (and multiple choice) but our final was very fair and they must have curved it a lot. He's funny and his lectures are the only ones I've never skipped.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Rohan cares. He cares about each of his students. Their attendance, their participation, their grade. If students are willing to try and reach out for support, Rohan is there to support. He is a great lecturer and makes lectures entertaining. He is quite a respectable man and professor.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Best lecturer of all time. Read the bible outside class to prepare

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Absolutely amazing with his lectures. He is extremely enthusiastic and cares about his students. His exams are insanely difficult though, and many people fail them each time. You may have to take his class twice, but at least it'll be fun.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Hilarious guy

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Challenges you to do the best and cares most about his students learning. He likes to give many difficult examples and they help develop problem solving skills. The midterm and final were both very difficult but he wants to make sure you have learned the fundamental concepts of his course. He was definitely the best professor in my first semester!!

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: By far the greatest professor I've had in my 1A term. This course was by no means easy: 60% of the engineers that wrote the PHY115 Midterm failed, and the final was from another world. However, Rohan puts forth his utmost effort to ensure that his students succeed. Try your absolute best in this course and don't be discouraged by your marks.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Rohan has opened up a whole new world in the subject, and now I find myself studying physics as a break from other subjects. Not because it's easier, but he has made it so much more enjoyable than I could have ever imagined. It's such a privilege to have a professor like him!

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: He's a great man. I'm remember him from 20 years ago, and he's the only guy prof from Waterloo I'd give the time of day too.  Thanks for being a great guy, inspiration, and doing justice to a great science.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Rohan goes above and beyond what you would expect from a university professor. He genuinely cares about his students' success, and he makes every class enjoyable by being upbeat and inclusive.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Incredible lecturer. The first university lecture I ever attended, and to this day the best prof I've ever had. Lectures are informative and entertaining. Difficult course, but he does everything he can to help you pass.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Good prof; he provides an extra class to solve for some difficult questions weekly.  But if you talk to others when he is talking or you are using a laptop during his class, he will ask you to leave, pretty rude.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: He was a substitute for my regular phy115 prof one day.  He is really energetic and makes things make sense.  People from my class run to the bio building  to get seats in his class.  When I was writing my mid term in access ability he gave me a hint on a question I was stuck on, I ended up solving it. It was the one with the train and the car.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: Great prof. Go to help sessions. If you don't have him as a prof, brace yourself for the worst exams of your life. INSANE course.

Name: Rohan Jayasundera
Review: He makes class worth going to, best first year prof.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Its definitely an honour to have him as my professor.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Dan was the best! There was never a dull moment in any of his lectures, to the point where I was actually excited any time I had calculus. He explains everything in many different ways for different learners, answers questions and is just overall a funny guy. Definitely my favourite in the math faculty!

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: The best teacher/Prof I've ever had. Step by step analysis of all possible questions. Pay attention in his class and you are guaranteed a good grade.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Dan is sooooo AMAZING! He is hilarious and tell some really good jokes during classes. He makes calculus easy for me. I would absolutely take his courses again!

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Math 136 is an extremely challenging course, however Dan is an AMAZING lecturer that makes linear algebra seem not that scary. He is engaging, explains concepts well, and also has weekend sessions for extra help with proofs (this was very helpful). Dan is great - you're lucky if you have him!

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Math 136 was a toughie. Stuff was really hard to understand and grasp but lectures made it better. Dan is always enthusiastic about class and him making us recite the definition of a basis every time we start class gave me highschool vibes as well as served as a great reminder to what a basis actually is :) Hardest course I've take in uni. glhf

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Great prof. Lectures are engaging and easy to follow. He's also helpful at office hours. He doesn't give solutions to his practice problems which is a bit frustrating sometimes but it's because he wants you to try to figure it out yourself. You can always compare solutions with other people or ask at office hours.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: The absolute best

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Great prof. Makes 8:30s enjoyable with his never-ending energy. He's very good at keeping the class engaged and being funny while teaching the concepts very well. Also, his exams are very fair, designed for you to do well if you know the basics. Highly recommend!

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Best professor I've ever had!

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Amazing prof! Gave great explanations and made linear algebra very enjoyable and easy to understand!! Ended the class with a pretty good mark.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Absolutely love this professor! He's hilarious and genuinely cares about his students. His attitude creates a really fun class atmosphere which is quite the achievement if you consider the difficulty of the course.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Easily the best teacher I've had at university. To be 100% honest, Dan the Man is a little bit quirky (you'll know what I mean if you've had a lecture with him) but his quirkiness keeps you engaged and comfortable in his classes. Linear Algebra is hard to teach and even harder to understand. However, Dan Wolczuk makes it not only bearable, but fun.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Amazing prof, wakes you up for 8:30 lectures. Always a fun class.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Pretty good prof. Made lin alg interesting. Would love to have him for Math 235.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: The winter 2018 term is a "test" term - this is the first time that assignment worth 5% and final exam worth 70%, I think this is a very good strategy to figure out which type of teaching is the best. I think it is reasonable to set assignment weight to be less to help student use assignment to learn rather than earn a high mark on assignment

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Awesome prof, can tell he really cares about his students. FInal exam was pretty long (14 questions compared to I believe 10 questions in fall 2017), but the questions were reasonable. I wasn't enrolled in his class but I went to his lectures all term like many others. One of the few courses where I was constantly engaged during class.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: He's definitely a great instructor. Very passionate and intelligent. However, since he is the leader for designing the course, I'd like to share my feedback about the course arrangement, which I don't think is quite reasonable: The percentages of assigns and exams are very unbalanced. People even didn't bother to do the assigns.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
Review: Took both MATH 136 and MATH 235 with Dan and needless to say, I enjoyed both of his courses. He organizes both courses and tries to get around 70% average for 136 and 75% average for 235. Overall a fantastic prof, I recommend taking 136/235 only if Dan is one of the profs for the term.

Name: Dan Wolczuk
