Review: The knowledge itself is hard, but really enjoyed had it with Dan! Really care about students!!

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: He literally taught us nothing. His only notes were so disorganized that it couldn't even help either. Learnt more by Googling course material.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Does not know much physics. Should only be teaching SCI courses. Nice guy though.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: His lectures are disorganized. He often spend a lot of time on correcting his mistakes during lecture, and sometimes he states an example without doing it, forcing you to look it up yourself. In fact his lectures contain very little content. He likes to tell jokes which I think is good, but some people don't like it. Homework and exams are long.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Shouldn't be teaching imo. Doesn't go through examples, doesn't give solutions to in-class examples. All round avoid like the plague

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Literally doesn't teach. Every example he does contains an opening statement, then a "...", and finally the answer. Best learning experience I've ever had.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Well for starters, I don't know what I have really learned in this class. The prof spends a lot of time talking about random stuff. For the midterm he said specifically what was on there and then didn't put it on there. Next he didn't teach half the material for it (ie/ polarization through media). If it wasn't for the textbook I would have failed.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Very polarizing figure in the undergraduate physics community. I am with the Dislike crowd and frankly don't understand how others think he is okay, but to each their own. He is literally banned from teaching certain courses as a result of student-organized petitions.  Nice enough guy but unfortunately overshadowed by his inability to teach well.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: I heard so many rumors that he was awful but O'Donovan is easily one of the best profs I've ever had. He's very energetic and funny in class. His office door was quite literally always open and ready to help. He follows the textbook extremely closely and provides handouts to supplement it. His tests were very fair, no surprises, a bit long though.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Very interesting and humorous prof.  His has passion teaching his class. The teaching pace is fast but it follows Griffiths and appear to be very clear. Has bonus essay worth 5% for final and can lift up the final grades a lot.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: By far one of the worst teachers in physics. His tests are not similar to his assignments or his lectures, he does not explain things well in class, he does not answer questions clearly, his notes are complicating things introduced in the textbook, and he will basically give you the answer to a question in office hours instead of helping you learn.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: You can't tech a course worse than O'Donovan. Its like trying to cool something below absolute zero.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: This guy is one of the worst professors in the University of Waterloo. You will not learn anything related to the course. His exams are stupid and if you ask him how to code something or how a function works he'll just tell you to google it. Avoid him like the plague.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: The Griffiths book is excellent, and this course followed it pretty closely. Something about his lecturing style is exhausting and hard to learn from. Not a fan of the puns...

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: On the surface, it's hard to tell what's wrong with this professor, but something is. The best that I can say about this class is that the textbook was excellent, but my knowledge and understanding of electrodynamics has decreased from exposure to O'Donovan.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Unreasonable and useless

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Assignments were half-decent. Midterm was decent but it was belled, so hooray! Final was one of the worst I've ever written, so I'm waiting for the bell. Goes too fast during lectures. Attempted to teach us unnecessary material. He tries really hard but he just doesn't explain things well for our level of knowledge. Interesting guy, though.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: In theory this should have been a very easy course. Why there was an essay for a phys course is beyond me. The assignments are ridiculous. Doesn't teach any of the material properly and expects you to get it from the textbook, which is the worst I've ever used. Ludicrous how many marks are docked on assignments for trivial mistakes.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: He makes a lot of puns. We cover a few chapters of Marion-Thorton. I don't like the idea of writing an essay for a phys course. He has a lot of energy for an 8:30 class. Kinda like what I imagine Robin Williams would be like if he were a physicist.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Lots of mixed opinions about this professor but I really like his teaching style and course organization.

Name: Chris O'Donovan
Review: Very poor prof. I wouldn't mind his jokes if he knew how to teach but the doesn't. He expects everybody in the class to already know how to program. The median for the first test was 50 and that includes some 100's from people who already knew how to program so it was actually ~ 45. He is also very rude to people who ask questions.

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: my favorite human

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Best econ prof at UW

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Best econ prof. Always asks you to come for help when you need it. Lectures are great, boring but not bad. His curve sketching style saved me on the exams. Final is long (100 multiple choice) but as long as you know the lecture notes and do the study guide thoroughly, 90 is easy to get.

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Carvalho was a GREAT prof consistent throughout the term. His lectures were extremely clear and he made things sound so easy which was very encouraging. Attend lectures and try solving the study guide and you don't even need to touch the textbook! The exams were pretty fair given that you go to class and obviously put some effort in. Awesome prof!

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Best Prof so far.

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Amazing Prof. Go to lectures and you won't have to read a single page of the textbook.

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Amazing prof he is clear in his lectures. Doesn't use a PowerPoint so you need to go to class. He is very friendly and is willing to help you during office hours

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: He is amazing! Would love to take another class with him.

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Really cares about students and will tailor grading criteria according to students.. After first midterm, he decided that whichever midterm mark is higher will be worth more, and final exam wasn't cumulative. Really funny and will always help. Always tells you what you're learning that day

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Amazing lectures with no PPT at all

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: He can always keep my concentration to his lecture, though he never use the PPT

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Very fair and clear prof. Knows his stuff, and delivers information very well. Study and go to class, you will get a good grade.

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: He doesn't believe in any of the technological resources like learn, powerpoint slides, iclickers, etc. As a result, you better be in class if you don't want to fall behind. He only has you do readings to drill in what he has discussed in lectures, nothing more. The lectures are impressively clear, and the tests are fair - you know it or you don't.

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: - Take Econ 101 with Carvalho - You don't need the textbook if you have Carvalho - If you make notes in class, you will be fine - Very helpful - Very friendly - Wants you to do well - Tells you what will be on the midterms - Available outside of class - Funny

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Great prof! Having never taken any kind of business course, I sometimes struggled to keep up but he is very concise and the concepts are simple. Going to class and doing the study guide questions are both absolutely crucial to doing well.  Ginal is worth a lot but if you study you'll be fine!

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: A very helpful professor. Did well on finals. Improved my grades by 23% by approaching him and seeking his guidance. Economics was a new subject for me. Only midterms and finals Covers all the topics in his lectures but can be very vague at times. I had to refer the textbook and study guide because this was a new subject for me!

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: He makes sure everyone gets the material in class. Patient, understanding and brings comedic relief to the study of economics.

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: great prof, explained everything clearly! His midterms were easy (mostly 3-4 chapters quizzed on) and final wasn't cumulative.

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: Always takes a strategic approach to the organization of his lectures and will explain in detail if questions are asked. The exams and midterms are tricky, but as long as you study the notes, textbook and familiarize yourself with the study guide you will do good. I highly recommend taking his courses not only for his knowledge but also his humour!

Name: Emanuel Carvalho
Review: I'd rather him than other profs.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Her lectures are can be pretty dry but she records and uploads her lectures which is nice since her classes are usually morning classes. The midterm was pretty easy - almost a direct replication of the practice midterm. Final was really tough though so beware. Tutorials are not super helpful but are unfortunately mandatory.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Christine Dupont is a very kind professor and clearly shows her passion for biology through her lectures. The great thing about her class is that she records her lectures and posts them for students to access later. The issue with her class is that she talks really quiet and slow about unnecessary info, and speeds through complex topics.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Not great at lecturing. She is pretty boring and monotone. She basically reads from the textbook. Attendance is not mandatory. I would recommend reading the textbook over going to her lectures.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Her lectures are fairly entertaining and she has podcasts too. The tutorials are obsolete. The only problem I see is, her examination style is of the logic recursion style where you try to parse A AND B OR C AND NOT D in the definition sense, rather than a holistic comprehension/application approach to evaluation (although there's gene maps).

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Don't take her courses if you're  a wimp. She's a tough marker and she will make you feel like you're an idiot if you ask her to explain something twice (welcome to the real world), but there is a lot of professional value to be taken from her courses. She is a very tactful lecturer and takes her job seriously. One of the best BIOL profs.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: I don't know if it's just me but her lectures are somewhat boring because she doesn't get straight to the point. She will repeat something 500 times that you get lost. (Buy her CD, it's better). Her midterm was easy and the 5% bonus are awesome. I just skipped all lectures and still did great on the midterm. The tutorial is absolutely useless.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Great prof, funny stories, best class of the year

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: I thoroughly enjoy her lectures as she has a lovely speaking voice and is clearly interested in the course material. The midterm was one of the most difficult I've written and lectures didn't seem to be in as great of detail as required for the midterm. The final was more the style of her lectures. Homework is over the top for little grade percent

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: She uploads podcasts/lectures online which are a great help before the exams! The way she teaches helps you understand the course material a lot better. She doesn't stress textbook readings too much, which is great! Loved hearing her lectures, very interesting if you pay attention! Tough grader, but gives a 5% bonus. Not too many assignments/quizes

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: If your interested in the material you're going to enjoy the class. If you're just taking it as a required credit it can be seen as a dry course. Biology background is not required as she explains all that you need to know. Podcasts are available for all lectures and power points are all posted online well before the lecture.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Excellent lecturer. Clear, concise, and easy to understand. Provides extra material on LEARN that was helpful for studying (games, flashcards, etc.).

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: I should first start by saying, she's very pretty and has a unique sense of style!  You're going to want to be driven to learn and do well.  Learn so that you are specific and detailed.  Great prof!

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: She is so picky in terms of marking yet does not go into nearly that much detail in lecture.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: The prof is very good. Her powerpoints are very clear and only have the information you need to know. Her lectures can be fairly boring and no necessary to attend. However, she is very helpful and will work with you until you understand the concepts.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Amazing prof!

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Very interesting class, loved Dupont as a prof. Tutorials were okay, midterm and final were a challenge. Study hard, use the lecture summaries or pay attention in class if you want to do well. Very smart lecturer and a very engaging class. Textbook is fairly useless. Can't wait to take biotech and virology with her!

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Best prof for genetics

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Christine manages to make genetics into a bore. She tests you on the most random questions and you can clearly see she's sick of teaching this class. No passion whatsoever. Also, she never mentioned that you needed a Pink Tie calculator for the final (any calculator was allowed at the midterm) and then told you to put it away. Useless prof.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: Christine is very detailed and clear with her explanations. Although it may take time to get used to her lectures at the beginning (especially the nauseating colour schemes), she is an engaging professor. Her podcasts of each lecture and practice exams make studying for exams easy and effective.

Name: Christine Dupont
Review: A very engaging prof. Class is not mandatory due to her posting her lecture videos. She is very clear and is very caring towards her students.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Kenneth Ragan is a bit of a shock for many U0 science students. He likes to make it seem as though professors want to trick you and do not want you to succeed. If you need extra help, go to FrezCA or hire a tutor. I definitely thought I was going to fail the course, but a lot of studying for the final helped. PHYS 102 is much better.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Though he is a smart professor, he fails to teach well. His lectures only cover the most basic ideas. Don't rely on his practice exams for practice - although some questions might be from there, he never posts solutions. Just skim! Redo all CAPA and understand EACH question. Use videos/textbook as this man is useless.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Got a B because of the curve. Lots of people I've spoken to got A's because of the curving as well, do not be fooled. His teaching is terrible - to be honest, terrible is an understatement. He is a nice professor who is willing to help outside of class other than that try your best and do not feel bad for doing poorly, do not blame yourself.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Albeit a difficult class, he makes lectures interesting. Truly a prof to look up to.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Tries too hard to be funny, to the point where it distracts from teaching the course content. Lectures are 1.5 hours long but could easily be condensed to an hour due to him rambling about quiz results. The questions covered in class are very basic and he doesnt give access to sufficient practice material that reflects the difficulty of the exam.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Pros: Funny. He clearly knows what he's teaching at a fundamental level. His exams are very challenging. He does not give one-step questions and interrelates multiple concepts, which forces you to study. Cons: Very fast paced, if you don't have any physics knowledge. Lab grades feel too random and are heavily dependent on partners and TAs.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Short answer: Dr Ragan is one of the best professors I have ever had in my life. His vivid and inspirational lectures possess the gravity to pull you into physics, no matter which major you are in. Kind, patient, and willing to guide people through their problems, he is also an extraordinary life coach for he teaches you how to learn.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: I did well in the class because I'd taken physics c before in high school, but otherwise it would've been a train wreck. Content is very fast paced and no time is spent deriving formulas. Since you only learn the basic intuition, you might find yourself glued to the formula sheet during exams. Also, major Steve Jobs energy, for better or worse.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Lectures are fast-paced and it's very easy to fall behind. Exams are challenging if you don't have a strong foundation in physics, This course is straight from hell.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Prof Ragan is so inspirational and funny. He always gives clear concepts and indepth explanations. He makes me love phys classes. I don't think he is a tough grader. The exams are not that difficult but you might need to make extra efforts off-class to understand the knowledge. There are lots of resources you can use anyway. Great prof again!

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Professor Ragan is a phenomenal professor; the way he teaches is captivating, and allows for one to never feel bored in his lectures. Yes, his exams/assignments are difficult, but he is very transparent with what he expects out of his students and makes it well-known that work is required to do well in this class. I would love to have him again!

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: The most infamous PHYS professor in McGill. After taking his course, I know why. He gives superficial content in class with simple examples. Midterm and final exams include multiple killer questions. For students like me who never study Physics so well in high school, he will destroy you. Do not trust his past exams b/c they are easy. Practice!

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: He gives very funny and clear lectures, but what really makes him stand out is his patience and kindness to students after class. The content is hard, but we all respect him. Now.... this is before the midterm..... so i am probably the most unbiased I will ever be

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: He makes physics seem so logical, always gives real-world applications. Had him for Phys101 and going to his lectures were entertaining and inspirational.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Many complain about Prof Ragan because his class and his exams are difficult. I came in to PHYS 101 with no past Physics knowledge (oh the magic of public American education). He truly cares about everyone succeeding. His lectures are entertaining and really helpful. I hate physics but he made it bearable for me.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Clicker participation can earn up to 5% bonus. Relatively good lecturer, but speaks fast. However, lectures/examples are NO WHERE representative of what you should expect for the exam. Assignments/labs easily graded. Very easy for anyone who puts in minimum effort to get a good grade. Very difficult to earn a great grade.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: one of the best profs in McGill. Amazing lectures yet challenging, very very organized , midterms and finals are hard but they are fair.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: He gave me a feeling that he got really good eloquence, which was quite fascinating. However, the instruction or explanation in many sides of the course could be quite vague or ambiguous. There were both assignment and exam questions, which confused people a lot. I hope Prof. Ragan would get improved regarding to this side.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: I didn't take physics in high school and I studied a lot for his class. He speaks FAST. I had to pay close attention in class and review after class. His exams were overwhelming to me.. You may be able to do it well if you really make good use of your time during the exam and think and try your very best. Besides all that, he is smart and kind.

Name: Kenneth Ragan
Review: Good prof, hope take his course again.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: I toke math180 with him. I'm not good at math so the class materials are still difficult for me. But you can understand all if you are hardworking. His office hour is super suggested. It's an enjoyable class and you won't waste your time.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: I bet Sid is nice person, even though I have not seen him smile, like ever. I just don't understand the outstanding reviews he gets ( I had a mediocre at best experience).He does do an okay job at explaining things but also goes super fast on important things, that are in the exam. Midterm was fairly easy BUT THE FINAL OMG was a spit in the face...

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: trudeau is actually a homie. lowkey failed math 122 but that wasnt even his fault, im just stupid. homeboy is literally the greatest good you'll ever have. PLEASE take his class, 11/10 would recommend his amazing lectures.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: He is really good He is so good at teaching that even the hard stuff is easy to understand GREAT LECTURES

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: I took him for Math 180, the course is made up of 25% webwork, 15% attendance, 20% midterm (multiple choice easy), 40% final. The final was 50% multiple choice (super easy) and then 50% theory questions which were extremely difficult and didn't reflect the practice problems. Overall it's an easy GPA booster if you put in work

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: Really impressive lecturer and genuinely a nice guy. IMO people overhype how difficult MATH 140 is with him. I thought both the exam and the midterm were really fair. Just do a lot of practice questions and make sure you're very comfortable with the material. Also be able to sketch y  xe^(1/x).

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: Prof Trudeau was unorganized and unhelpful. He failed to return our midterms on time and when he did return them, we had to wait an hour while he organized them. In class, whenever students asked a question, he would often be unhelpful, and belittle the student for not knowing the answer. His email etiquette was dismissive of student questions

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: He never wastes a second of class. Every second is spent at examining the material and mastering calculus. Exams are from the book and as long as you master the material you will be done with the midterm an hour early

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: His flow of the class is super logical and well structured. Not a single word is said in vain. The multiple-choice aspect of the exams aren't ideal and he doesn't give many partial marks. A very good experience overall!

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: He might be good for the intro math classes (100-level), but he sucks for ODEs. Makes most of our exam multiple choice, in which you have to do full steps just to get to the answer. It messed up a lot of our final grades. Exam was brutal.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: Sid always says do the practice problems in the textbook, in fact his lecture is a practice session also with very clear explanations. Go to his lectures and do the examples with him you will be fine. He always makes math life so easy. I was with him for math 140 and 141. Highly recommended.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: Sidney Trudeau is AWESOME. I didnt have him for my section, but he was the course cooordinator. I got 40% for that midterm, the worst grade Ive ever received at McGill. From then on I started attending Sids lectures and took his advice and practiced ALOT, did almost all of the questions in the textbook and got 97% for the final.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: I recommend choosing him for Math140&141. His lectures were very clear with a lot of examples questions solved in class to help you understand. Do practice questions and read a bit in the book if you occasionally feel like not getting it all. There were no surprising questions in his exams. Finals can be harder than midterms but still very doable.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: An excellent and inspiring professor. It was apparently his first time teaching math 263 but he did it very will. Can't understand something? He has office hours twice a week after the lecture and you can ask him all your questions. As good as in calculus if not better.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: He's lectures are interesting and inspirational. Homework and tests are not that hard if u do practices on textbook.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: It's when you lose something that you realize how valuable it was. Clearly miss Sid. Trustworthy prof but to some people, the material was covered too fast so be careful about not being late in course progress. Hard final, but you just have to worry about doing better than others (this will definitely help when they curve up the grades).

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: The course is fast-paced but he'll take the time to explain every question, and he does so extremely well. Great teacher however the final (worth 75%) was tougher than anything seen in class.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: Sidney Trudeau is truly the best Math professor/teacher I have ever had. In terms of explanations in class, he does a fantastic job being clear about the material and questions. That being said, he is quite monotone so if you get tired or off-task from that sort of thing it could be an issue. My only gripe was that the final exam was far too hard.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: His lectures are very clear and understandable. He is always receptive to all questions. His office hours are usually very busy, but he makes time for each student present. His midterm was easy and his final was doable and fair. He tells his students to do all the exercises in the textbook. If you do, you can definitely get a good mark.

Name: Sidney Trudeau
Review: As a student coming from the French school system, I can tell that this course was hard for most of us French. Good teacher, but he's fast-paced and it's hard to grasp the course material perfectly. I had to take many extra tutoring class to understand the content of this class. The Final was carnage, but he curved the grades (good lord)

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Prof Roy is really a character at McGill. He is passionate about his materials and researches but he is unclear and his questions are indeed tough, and what makes the situation worse is that each point corresponds to one point of overall mark. So, people have to work extremely harder on this course if you are not that kind of "genius" Roy expects.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: I know no one who got an A within my friends (who usually do). Through what I have heard, only people who have taken the course twice (failed the first time), have done actually well in the class. One thing I learned: THE EXAMPLES GIVEN IN CLASS ARE IMPORTANT.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Had him for bio200 morning section... absolutely awful. I couldn't differentiate the important testable material from the small details. The quizzes were extremely difficult even when i did study for them. Midterm and final very tricky and hard to get through, i had to question whether we even learnt some of the material. Unfair.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: He is the worst teacher I ever had. I WILL not take any class with him again.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Avoid at all costs. The guy uses complicate and elaborate vocabulary to explain something quite simple and it takes hours for us to grasp what he really wants. He is very disrespectful towards his students and not willing to take time to answer questions. I had him for the second half of the course and basically taught myself the course with NTCs!

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Worst prof ever. If you ask him a question, he will ask you, "what do you think?" If you don't know, he will make you feel stupid by saying " you are supposed to know this", and if you guessed a right answer, he'll say "see, you answered your own question." Very impatient. No help at all. Very confusing/disorganized lectures. NTC "teaches" better.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Not the worst lecturer ever but a very unlikeable character. Does NOT create an atmosphere of respect. Basically told us to stop emailing him with dumb questions. His quizzes make no sense and when we tell him so he doesn't care. Uses complicated words for no reason which makes an already hard class even worse.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Summing it up: 1. AVOID 2. AVOID 3. Did I say avoid him? 4. Fast-paced; either uses childish words or very complicated words. 5. I do not recommend attending his lectures, waste of time (use the recordings). 6. USE! THE! NTCs! 7. VERY, very very (emphasis on very) aggressive professor who belittles students for their questions. 8. lol

Name: Richard Roy
Review: BIOL 200 was the hardest class I've taken at McGill thus far (it's my third semester). The amount of content tested on this exam was an insane amount. It took me 8 hours to read my review notes ONCE over. Studied HUNDREDS of hours for this exam and still probably didn't get an A. Rick Roy's teaching made it so hard to understand the content. AVOID.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: If possible, avoid the 1st section of this course (Bureau and Roy) which is usually taught at 8:30 rather than 11 or so. The 1st section is much more challenging, having different tests with lower averages. The material is interesting but the tests are unclear and unfair. The lectures were poor, as was Roy's attitude through the whole course...

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Be ready to memorize tons of materials which don't get tested in the final.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: I don't even know where to begin. His teaching is circumlocutory, informal, and very unclear. "The amino acids almost kiss each other"? Seriously? He displayed his anger on his students once because he was getting hundreds of emails from confused students about the concepts he taught. Hasn't he ever wondered WHY? USE THE TEXTBOOK. USE NTCs.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Lecture style is hard to follow, little clarification. Do your NTCs and pre-readings in the book. Watch lecture recordings at a faster speed and be prepared to stop them frequently. He didn't provide representative practise and wondered why the class was upset about the difficulty of the midterm. Some language choices made me uncomfortable.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Incredibly hard to keep up with the vocabulary he uses. Not very well at articulating concepts, and puts unfair questions on midterms and quizzes. Must keep up word for word, I recommend NTCs for this course.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Talks so much that he loses his train of thought and confuses students, can't articulate well, uses either unrefined language like "grand-daddy" or over the top language - makes it very hard to understand. Does NOT foster environment of mutual respect. Told students that he would lose faith in them as individuals if they asked a "what is" question.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Bring a thesaurus to class. Uses words that I don't think he even understands. Talks way too much and just ends up making things more confusing. In order to do well you have to transcribe everything he says in class. Also kinda mean.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Roy teaches passionately, but uses vague language when speaking about precise processes. Use the textbook to understand the specifics. I did not like him as a teacher, as he is intimidating and the quiz questions are unclear & may talk about details we have not seen in class. For the final he said: Many choices can be true, select the most true -.-

Name: Richard Roy
Review: this is a hard course, but not as terrible as its made out to be. the midterm is easy (hastings part). richard roy is an interesting man for sure and maybe a bit intimidating at times, but he is lively and really loves biology. i wouldn't take the course unless you have to - try to take another bio if possible. 65% of your grade is the final.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: This guy sucks so much, by far worst prof, worst educator I've ever dealt with in my entire life.

Name: Richard Roy
Review: Richard Roy is a passionate and engaging professor. The course material is extremely interesting for those who like molecular biol. That being said, the course is very dense and you'll need to understand every concept and memorize every example given. He will test you on it. It is a tough but easily manageable course as long as you keep up.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: Professor Roth is a very good person. He made changes based on students' needs, such as offering tutorials twice a week. In math 314, I learned more than what I expected at the beginning. He pushed me into another level. I wasn't expecting myself to choose mathematics before that, but I am sure now. Sincerely.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: Professor is passionate regarding the content of Math 314. He provides clear examples in lectures and assignments on materials that will appear on exams. So diligently study both, and there is no reason you should not be satisfied with your mark. Additionally, Professor is an excellent lecturer and the course has great applications to Physics.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: Roth is a very kind prof, his lectures are very clear and his way of teaching is very good when you get used to it. For math 314, I advice you to do the assignments regularly, even though they are not graded, so that you are prepared for the exams (which are a mix of assignment questions and examples seen in class). Overall, Roth is a great prof.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: I cannot understand those AWESOME comments. I literally put my life on this course but its a total disaster. Many people around me feels the same. Though examS. I only hope I can pass thank you Roth

Name: Charles Roth
Review: If you do his assignments and review his lecture note well, you will for sure receive good grades. He is very responsible, he cares about his students. Those who sais his exams are hard are those who did not pay attention to his assignment at all. He is passionate about teaching.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: His classes are not enjoyable at all. I feel like it's a complete waste of time

Name: Charles Roth
Review: I don't understand why people like him. THOSE ARE LIES!!

Name: Charles Roth
Review: DO NOT TAKE HIM!! He doesn't care about his students! All the lessons are rushed!

Name: Charles Roth
Review: Prof Roth is so so so caring! He actually listens to students, takes their advice, and is willing to change based on their needs. Handwriting may be hard to understand at first, but after several lectures you would appreciate how colorful the lecture notes are! Very clear notes and representative examples if you put effort to read through them.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: An insightful superman standing on his position for the entire life at McGill.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: Wish to meet this great man earlier. Every time I shake hand with him, and I feel like some superpower is transferred on me and I should do more math.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: My hero, in short.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: Roth is the nicest prof I've ever met in university. Do the assignments and go to his lectures and u will get a good grade.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: Nobody is able to teach this course except him.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: This course separates talented engineering students and normal engineering students. If you do not get an A, it is only because you dont work hard enough,not the difficulty of this course.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: Man of the world. He never stops teaching. As a student, I highly respect what he did in class. He should be awarded for the greatest contribution to math at McGill. Legend math, legend man.

Name: Charles Roth
Review: Great prof ever in my life!

Name: Charles Roth
Review: The greatest mathematicians!

Name: Charles Roth
Review: The legend of mathematics never stops!

Name: Charles Roth
Review: OMG take the math course with him is like taking a rocket to your destination. Fast and solid

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: Ive taken 208, 209, and 306 with Paul and honestly, I think he's just better at teaching higher level classes. I hated 208 and 209 and I had such a hard time understanding and studying for these two classes but 306 was amazing. Went to all classes and he has a good sense of humor for people who can understand it. Paul deserves higher ratings!

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: Midterm is twice as hard as the final, you will for sure pass this class. Don't be scared. 208 & 209 are much more difficult than 306, just focus and study well for the midterm and final. Don't depend much on this Professor because of course he won't treat you well if you admit you don't understand some things: the usual.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: He really cares about his students and does his best to engage us in class. He loves when students participate and really cares about helping those who want to do well in the course. His exams aren't too difficult, and cover the information he discussed in lectures. He's also very funny. I highly recommend.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: He is straight up not a greater lecturer. However, you can easily learn the material and get a good by reading the textbook and summarizing, doing the multiple choice from the study guide, and reviewing his ppts for the extra content. You dont need to go to class or conferences. Also, his exams are very similar to the study guide.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: First of all, I tried going to class, I really did, but its impossible to stay focused. he goes into several tangents, takes so long to explain a simple concept that I lose track. out of all the 500 jokes he made (when I went to class) I admit laughing like once, but cmon it gets annoying.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: You don't need to go to class. Just read the book, the extra material slide, and do the study guide til you understand every question.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: Awful. Absolutely awful experience. The driest orator Ive ever had the displeasure of being in class with. Irrelevant tangents are to be expected.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: won't take it again

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: The professor gets angry that students do not attend the classes. As a result, he warns people that most of the students are going to do bad because they don't come to class. However, the reason students dont is that the lectures get very boring and makes you drowsy.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: Very funny guy living his best life. Not nurturing, but makes final review sessions. No overtime on office hours (fair). Bad choice for a mentor, but not terrible or unreasonable on his exams. Students mostly dislike him because they have preconceived notions about Econ and it's a required art class. Prepare for British humor. Gruff but caring.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: Sure, he's a bad prof, but the hate comes from people upset about bad marks. His midterms always have D averages (so be wary) but he literally warns you about that on the first day! If you study the textbook and REALLY do the study guide Qs an A is achievable. Just be prepared to teach yourself the material to make up for bad/disorganized lectures

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: I dont understand why ppl hate on that guy so much! His exams are hard, but are definitely fair and representative of what we see in class! They are a lot based on comprehension, so dont try to learn it all by heart! Only thing i dont like is the fact that his slides are disorganized! Also, do exercises from the study guide! Extremely helpful

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: Seems like a cool person. Funny & good-natured. Very smart. He's just a horrible teacher. Horrifically disorganized re: layout/availability/consistency of lecture slides etc. Easy to get lost/zone out. You have to be an amazing independent learner with the iron will to attend every class, focus the whole time, and review daily or at least weekly.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: Most overhated prof. This guy is so funny, made me want to attend all his lectures. Decent at explaining, but definitely review the textbook and rip the practice questions until there's no tomorrow. Really tough midterm. Final was super fair, with tons of the questions being exact copies from the book and midterm. One of the best profs at mcgill

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: This is the worst teacher I had during my time at McGill. His lectures vary from incredibly boring and simple to impossibly difficult and unclear, with nothing in between. He doesn't care about his students, makes no effort to make sure he is being clear and treats his students extremely poorly. DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASSES WITH THIS TEACHER. Do not.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: As a professor, he is clearly passionate about the material. Econ is a difficult topic and while it is not necessarily the most accessible course, he tries to provide students with the means they need to succeed in the course (office hours, conferences, opportunities to ask questions). This course demands lots of work and commitment to studies

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: For ECON 208, you are better off reading the textbook than going to class. he interrupts students mid-question and doesn't even answer the question fully. The majority of people fail the midterm and he blames it on the students when it's really his teaching style. Definitely not taking his class again.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: Retiring soon and it shows. If you're at McGill and you can avoid taking 208 or 209 (whichever he decides to teach) for another year max, he won't be here anymore so you can be safe. Takes a petty stance toward student attendance in his classes bit does not change anything to get more people to come. Would rather punish entire group.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: Worst teacher I have had at Mcgill by far, mumbles and doesn't explain well. His powerpoints are disorganized and all over the place (the ones in class are different from the ones he gives online). You need to do the econ labs and the study guide if you want a chance at getting a good grade.

Name: Paul Dickinson
Review: The worst ever DO NOT TAKE HIM

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: Great prof. but his lectures are a bit boring in my opinion but the material is clear. Midterm was really difficult but the final was quite easy. You have to read the books if you want a good grade! Graders are really though for the paper.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: He's a very engaging and funny lecturer, though a bit confusing at times as he can move from one idea to another quickly and it can be hard to understand his point. The material is super interesting, the 2 textbooks are well written and easy to study, though his exams are somewhat harder than the average psyc exam. Really enjoyed the course overall

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: Psyc 331 was a great class. Prof. Taylor is an all-around good guy. He may ramble on sometimes during lectures about his experiences but it's all in good fun. Read the books, do the work, and you'll enjoy the class. It's very enjoyable. Study HARD. Exam questions can sometimes be strange but if you do the readings and study well, you'll be fine.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: Don's class was great! I loved the content. I you enjoyed Social Psychology you will enjoy this class as well! He is a Great teacher with so much experience... His books are a good read and not too long. The tests are not easy but doable. I recommend this class.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: I don't understand why people rate him badly, I'm an B student and finished with a A- and didn't put much work into it. The teacher is amazing, funny, and clear. He is repeatable but for a reason: it'll all be in the exams. Exams are detailed oriented, and pay attention to his anecdotes, but text is so small and it's easier than  most psych classes

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: Professor Taylor is quite a showman.  Expect it and enjoy the ride.  You will have a good time on top of learning a lot ! You can expect a bit of repetition but its ok.  As for the evaluation process. Sadly consistent with the faculty of Psychology, it is meant to meet a bell curve.  Get help from previous students to know how to prepare  succeed

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: One of the better Profs I've had in Psychology, and there are a lot of good ones. Really interesting and engaging lectures, and the content is easy to digest if you pay attention. You won't ever be tempted to skip class. His exams, well, Psych exams are always hard. Go see him in his office, even if just to chat, he likes to meet his students.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: very entertaining and funny lecturer loved him!  the material (first half) is so interesting, after the midterm it gets dull and repetitive. the midterm was fairdetailednot much different than any psych exam. the paper is annoying but doable (hasn't been graded yet so i can't say much) readings are less than other psych courses.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: PROS: Fantastic lectures. Very interesting material. Very engaging. Funny. CONS: Exams very tough, require enormous attention to detail.   Know each theory inside & out, pay attention to his tangents (there are many). Also, let him finish a thought before you get offended as he often gives voice to all sides of a debate so as to set up a point.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: The only B I have received in the last two years of my undergrad. The gradings on the paper (worth more than the midterm) are a complete hit or miss (you either get an nice grad student grader or you don't). His material is interesting but there is ZERO structure to the course and most of the time it is story time. NOT worth lowering your GPA for.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: This class is a must. You'll never want to miss a class! Text is exactly what's taught in lectures and is SO small. I ended up loving the material and learnt a lot. Paper could not have been more straightforward. Easy A if you put in the work (and there isn't much of it). LOVE U DON!!

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: Don't know why he gets such a bad rep. Exams were fine. Paper was beyond straight forward. Should be especially easy for psych students. Plus, he's a good story teller. This is one of the birdies of the Psychology program, but really worth taking since its not as dry as some others.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: Amazing prof. Loved the class.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: I took this class years ago yet still remember points he made clear as day. A very enjoyable class which makes you just want to sit back and listen - but do take notes too.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: Only teaches his own research. Story-telling style of teaching with a lot of humour. You go to class not because it's necessary (it really really isn't) but because he's so engaging. Not about marks (don't even break a sweat) but critical exposure to a group of undervalued Canadians.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: I love Taylor! Really funny and expressive character (as most social psych profs are). His exams were a bit weird. Some were really straightforward and related to the lectures/book and some were not. It's really a crapshoot. Regardless, study as much as you can and you'll probably end up with a good mark.

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: AMAZING TEACHER! He simplifies tough concepts into very simple explanations. He's quite funny too; each class can easily lighten up your day by giving you a nice laugh, as well as learning some useful and interesting stuffs! However, his exams are definitely hard; study the lectures VERY well, because he will likely ask very minitious questions...

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: The guy was really great, approachable and down to earth. He is funny and tells in depth examples to make the theory's relate to life. Class is really easy as long as you go to class and take notes on the stories he tells, they may seem like little antidotes but his tests include them (I think its to make sure people are going to class).

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: He is awesome, but make sure to take notes on ALL of the random stuff he talks about in his lectures, no matter how irrelevent it seems. He tests on everything. But he is still one of my favorite professors at McGill. Classes are so much fun!

Name: Donald Taylor
Review: Taylor is definitely my favorite prof at McGill so far. He's very interesting to listen to, I always lookedfrward to his class! If you take careful notes on the textbook and study the details of his lecture its definitely possible to get an A. A midterm and a straight-forward paper. Highly recommend it!

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Midterm was multiple choice and intentionally tricky - lots of "all of the above" options or vague differentiations between answers. Goes off topic in class, making it unclear what material should be focused on for evaluations. Reading-heavy (and he expects you to remember minute details from dense material).

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: I hated the textbook. The lectures were ok (but too fast). Loved the opportunity to discuss current developments in the region at the start of class.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Beyond Rex Brynen's history as a prof, POLI 340 was disappointing. He tries to make the content engaging by telling anecdotes but most of his analysis is extremely west-centered and relies on orientalist tropes. It is very difficult to keep up with the readings, which are often just descriptive. This course fails to engage critically with the MENA.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: There's a lot packed in the course, but you'll learn a lot too. Wish he would lecture a little slower, but he slows down if you remind him. Really helpful outside of class.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Really interesting class, with lots of insight into peacekeeping and negotiation.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Very intensive class but definitely worth taking it. You will learn A LOT about politics in the Middle East and Brynen makes it very interesting to learn. He talks very fast but lectures are recorded. Readings are heavy, but you dont need to read all of them in order to get a good grade.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Very knowledgeable, and the material he teaches is interesting, but he talks too fast and is not an engaging lecturer. Also, very specific and tough multiple choice exams.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: An amazing, hilarious and interesting teacher. Has done amazing things in his career, is super fascinating and inspirational.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: i took a Poli class with bRynen, hE was fine but he Does really mAke you work for The grade. yOu will def have a unique expeRience, though.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: I just took POLI 340, and really enjoyed it. There's an awful lot to cover, but you end up learning an enormous amount. Some don't, but I really enjoyed the anecdotes and examples. He knows his stuff.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Tons of reading; some of which ends up to be a waste as most of the exams are from his lectures (except a bit for the final). Very pompous and teaches from 'his perspective'; not really helpful as its biased. Somehow brings in anecdotes which are not even related and derails the class topic. Not worth it. BUT you learn a lot about the Middle East.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Really unusual class, much more focused on applying political science than most POLI courses. Course reading are generally UN-type things, which can be rather dull reading, but are intended to be more real-world than a textbook. I loved the simulation, but not everyone does--it's a lot of work.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: OK lecturer (good by dept. standards). He adores his own voice, especially when it's about himself. Along the way, you'll learn a cool thing or two. He has a really annoying habit of teaching from his very particular view of the world & derides alternatve views. His grading scheme is incoherent & grades (& regrades) are often very unfair/favoritist

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Lectures: really fun and interesting, very knowledgeable, beware note-takers because he talks fast and nonstop Readings: totally manageable and OK to skim Assignments: put in the work and you can easily do well

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: I put in so much work in this class and still didn't feel like I got much out of it because Brynen doesn't make the material very accessible. He basically just uses lecture to brag about his expertise. I would also advise students to look this professor up in order to understand what he's involved in outside of the classroom. Strongly advise, even

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Yes he is funny, yes he is knowledgeable and yes he is well aware of this himself and doesn't hold back on bragging and calling people who do something wrong "idiots". Loved this teacher at the start, learned a lot (facts, no theories), but by the end I was tired of his loud and speedy lectures and his 30min answers to student questions.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Took him for 340 and 450. Was wow'd by the first and was left pretty indif by the other. 450 doesn't teach you analysis tools and different perspectives the way 340 does. The simulation was pretty cool, but the rest was just restating basic facts if you've studied conflicts at even a moderate depth in the past. 450 paper grades were unfairly harsh!

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Professor Brynen's lectures were funny and engaging. He is very knowledgable on various political areas in different countries. He speaks very quickly,  especially when giving examples, would recommend to watch the lectures after class. He often has a question period at the beginning of class that may sometimes take up more than half of class.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Really good at teaching in LEA132 but terrible if he replaces your TA for conferences (very overbearing, doesn't let people speak). Grading was very easy. Would highly recommend to anyone who liked or did well in INTD200. One presentation, conference participation, one paper, a final, and a multiple choice midterm.

Name: Rex Brynen
Review: Speaks very fast (watch the lecture recordings after class tbh) and goes on tangents, but is VERY knowledgeable (esp. on the Middle East), funny,  and lectures are overall very interesting. Midterm (20%) was MC and u needed to read almost ALL the readings to answer it, research paper (25)% graded strictly, final (35%) on specific topics- read up!

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: He's such an energetic lecturer- usually I don't pay much attention in class but Professor Ken can get anyone passionate about economics! In fact, it is because of him that I transfered out of management into economics. It also helps that he is v attractive (went to A LOT of office hours)

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Such an easy class and such a cool prof! His assessments are very easy and his lectures are a lot of fun. Only downside is he has no clue how to use mycourses. If you miss a lecture there are no slides or anything to learn from, that content is lost to you forever.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: The nicest prof youll ever have at McGill. He doesnt try to trick you and exams are very easy. Dont need much studying to ace the class.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: ECON 227 was a train wreck on the administration side (lost exams, grades never coming back, etc.), but KMack cares a lot about his students. If you go to class and put in enough practice before his exams, you're very likely to get an A (plus you get to hear his awesome bagpipe playing at the end of each semester :D ).

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Although an absolute disaster administratively, Prof Mackenzie is one of the best lecturers I have had at McGill and also one of the most sweetest and generous. The exams were very easy if you went to class and took notes. He also provided and went through past papers that were nearly identical to the exams we had. An absolute gem!

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Professor MacKenzie is a gem- the nicest prof you'll find at McGill. Always makes time for students to see him after class/during office hours. Exams are straightforward with no surprises. An A is v achievable if you keep up. Sometimes he needs organizational assistance, but keep in mind he has to handle 3 sections of the same intro course.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: A nice prof who obviously cares, but extremely disorganized. Never prints enough copies of midterms, and once made 30 students leave and come take the exam a week later because of this. Changes his office hours without warning and regularly skips or reteaches material because he forgets what we've done. Easy class but stressful and frustrating.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Professor KmacK is very entertaining and clearly works because he loves his discipline; he isn't in it for the money or the job conditions. That being said, beware of his confused ways to teach and evaluate his class.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Sweetest prof out there! He makes stats really accessible to students who have no math/stats background and always provides example questions and past quizzes/exams so you know what to expect when you're tested. He's ALWAYS available for questions, and even had office hours on weekends because he genuinely wants his students to succeed.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Extremely disorganized professor: lost 100 quizzes (grades never returned), never has enough handouts/quizzes to give students when he needs to, forgets his calculator or other things and makes us waste time. This professor seems completely clueless and it isn't fair to have such professors at University.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: If you take down good notes during lectures and do his practice quizzes, midterms and finals multiple times until you understand every type of problem, there is no reason that you shouldn't get an A. No surprises on exams.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: KMac's lectures are boring as he takes very long to explain each process and he usually does a lot of errors in his calculations. However, he clearly knows a lot about statistics and that's nice. Don't expect your midterm grades to be returned. We're already entering second semester and I still don't have my grade...

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: It's clear that KMack is very knowledgable about ECON, but his ability to transfer that knowledge to students is nonexistant. Syllabus is outdated, and tbh useless bc he doesnt follow it. No one understood how much each exam was worth. No explanation was ever given. No grades were distributed. Went into the final not knowing where I stood.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Extremely knowledgable, amazing at lecturing, is very patient/kind and helpful during office hours, and clearly just wants you to succeed (unlike many ECON profs). BUT, administratively, he needs assistance. Loses assignments, forgets to assign assignments --- the syllabus will not be followed. Be comfortable not knowing where you stand pre-final.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Best prof at McGill, he posts previous quizzes and exams on mycourses, there IS a textbook but if you go to class you don't need it. He goes above and beyond to help his students. Period. You get what you need to throughout the course to get an easy A but it's stats so you have to do the problems, it's not KMack's fault if you can't handle that.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: I think he is the best professor at McGill. He is very kind and nice to his students. He is always willing to help his students and very kind hearted person!! Definitely willing to take his course again!

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Best prof there can be at Mcgill. Everyone who says his class is difficult is at fault for not attending the lectures. Just attend his class, listen to what he says carefully and do the papers he gives you, and you will DEFINITELY do well :)

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: No ppt, no books used. His handwriting is awful to be honest. He forgot to announce our last semester's quiz grade and also this term's. The course is sleepy.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: Slow pace. Spends too much time on some things that should take 5 min. Lectures are basically worthless so you have to do all the work at home.

Name: Kenneth MacKenzie
Review: KMack is so disorganized that its hard to follow anything in this class. The fact that theres no textbook doesnt help either. Granted, Im more of a textbook vs go to class type of person but with KMack neither works. Just do all assignments over and over again and cram everything, put whatevers left on the crib sheet and hope for the best.

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Show up to class, do all his recommended practice exams/extra problems and try to do them asap instead of during the final study period (this will help you write a better data analysis paper). The midterm was hard but the final was a breeze if you study hard (also you're permitted a cheat sheet for the final). Definitely take this professor!

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Amazing Prof! You should go to his classes, because sometimes he doesn't post the answers for the slides on mycourses. You don't need the textbook, because his lectures are extremely clear and he provides tons of practice questions for each chapter!

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: The final was such a mess, but Glenn was a good prof. Go to class and do the quizzes. Start the final paper early! I got a 69 on the final (clearly curved up) and still got an A because I did well on the online quizzes and paper. Try not to depend on the final.

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Tons of study material (almost too much!) I like his teaching style, because even though the lecture hall is large, he makes it really personal, and his class notes are really all you need. I didn't look at the book so don't  buy it!  Always helpful in the office, but work for the midterms & paper coz the final is HARD... Final is honestly unfair.

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Not my prof but I went to his classes because I couldn't understand anything K Mack was teaching. His slides are actually amazing and make the hard content very easy to undersand

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Brilliant Prof! STRONGLY recommend

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Really good teacher , courses are clear and helpful , and exam are pretty easy

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Great teacher, really funny and clear! Loved him! Even though I don't particularly like stats, I really enjoyed the course thanks to him !!!

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Organized, Clear and excellent Lecturer!

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Don't need textbook, do the quizzes by yourself, listen to the professor, concentrate during class, he is really clear in his explanations! He is always there for you when you need his help. Practice on the quiz questions. Very nice prof, so sweet, I truly liked his lectures :D

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Good Professor!

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: The best prof i've had in my university career thus far. Is eager to help and teach as long as you are willing to put in the effort.

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: good teacher, straight to the point,  DO NOT BUY THE TEXT BOOK , you have all you need in his notes.

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: He's been teaching the class for the longest time out all the proffs. He know the material really well, maybe a little too well. He gives you abetter idea of what stats is about, rather then just teaching you definitions and how to solve problems. Go to class, use his the notes he gives and with a bit of practice you'll be fine.

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: great guy great fun

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Great professor. He is extremely organized and his slides are very useful. go and see him during his office hours if you have questions because he is SUPER helpful. He also makes the occasional hilarious comment during class. Don't miss him if you have the chance to take him!

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Great teacher. Always willing to help, and encourages students. Grading scheme makes sense. He's very lenient on marks (for example, he won't take points off a final if you make a simple addition mistake). Kind of funny. Not the easiest class but he tries  to keep you into it.

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Very helpful prof, very nice. Better attend the class to do well as many concepts are used again for different application so can get confusing. Recommended

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: Very enthusiastic. Provides a lot resources for extra practice and understanding.

Name: Glenn Zabowski
Review: He is nice and clear, always willing to help.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Literally the best math prof you can have!! His teaching is clear and well organized, conveying his passion about pure math to the audience. Having a lot of office hours, and always willing to discuss any math problem with you :) Just make sure to attend every lecture because lecture notes wouldn't be posted!

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Notes are enough for you to understand the material, textbook is good reference. The homeworks are a must - skip them and you fail. You need to memorize the theorems and proofs given in class and the tricks in homeworks. Do all this and it's an easy pass. Great lecturer too, was never bored.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: One of the best profs. If you take MATH 254 and he is your prof, you should feel lucky.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Lectures are amazing, but assignments are hard and long. Both midterm and final are more difficult than the practice ones, but still fair. Overall he's a good prof.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Very good professor.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Math lecturers like to hide in "McGill"'s brand.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: You may think he is overrated at first, but he cares for the students since he holds frequent office hours and curves the exams if they are too hard. His lectures may be a bit all over places but they are still the best math lectures in McGill. Very nice person and his introverted enthusiasm in math is charming.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Really nice teacher who is always accessible after class - his office hours are almost everyday! Even though the class is hard, he makes it so much better! Study the notes and the assignment questions and you should be good for the midterm and final!

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: The best math prof ever at McGill.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Very nice professor!

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: I'm not sure why people are complaining about Math 247 (previous ratings). His lectures are extremely clear in my opinion and his homeworks are challenging and help us learn the material. Yes, the midterm was a bit long, but he adjusted for it by curving the midterm marks. He clearly cares about his students - he has office hours nearly every day.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: His lectures are very disorganized: he will speed through writing notes and then a while later realize he made a mistake in the notes and we have to go back and cram extra stuff in places. He doesn't reference a textbook that has the material to each lecture and doesn't post notes. He throws in jargon without defining and is overall a bad teacher.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: This year's MATH 247 is way different from previous years, he's not testing the same thing from assignments any more. Exams are super long, class notes is a bit disorganized and he is not following any textbook which makes it worse. The assignments are good, but some questions are confusing. Honestly, if you can take 223 instead of this one, do it

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: He knows everything by heart such that he can fluently teach every single concepts and proofs without a note or reference. His shelf is full of different versions of calculus/algebra books, which shows how much preparation he devotes for teaching. The only complain is he tends to give overly easy exams, even in advanced math courses like 254.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Axel Hundemer is the man. There are no words to describe how good his lectures are. Never seen someone so organized and intelligent. Has multiple textbooks in his head. He's the only teacher at McGill that I've had who has clearly prioritized students over their own research, which is refreshing.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Best Math lecturer at McGill.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Work for it and you'll get an A. Made me love calculus.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: He is absolutely the best professor in the whole math department!! Take his class, pay reasonable effort and you will definitely get a fair grade.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Axel is an amazing prof!! Really cares about his students and explains concepts in a simple way.  If you do the assignments then you will be prepared for the exams.  Personally really did not enjoy Analysis, but having Axel made it a whole lot better.

Name: Axel Hundemer
Review: Axel is a great professor ! He cares a lot about his students, show up to class, learn all the proofs and assignements solutions by heart and you'll get an A. He always gives hints about what will be on exams and all midterms grades will be dropped if you do better on the final.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: i really like Rhonda. This was my first time taking stats and she really made me love it. She's funny and classes are fun. there's 3 assignments, midterm and final. The assignments you can easily get full marks on because she lets you resubmit and her exams are fair. She goes through material slow and ensures everyone knows what expected. recommend

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Prof. Amsel has been teaching this course since dinosaurs roamed the earth and it shows. Although she may be respected amongst students and the Psych Department, her lectures are mediocre - she doesn't do a good job explaining and does not make her materials accessible. Chooses not to record lectures although there is a clear accessibility concern

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Prof Amsel knows her material very well, is an amazing lecturer, and always checks up on you during class to see if anything was unclear. Class moves at a slow pace as a result, can be redundant sometimes, but I think it's good for those who are new to statistics. Very unhelpful during office hours, however, which is a shame.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: I really love her classes even though I struggle hard with Statistics. I occasionally even find myself *liking* doing a statistic problem now, which I NEVER thought I would say in a million years. She doesn't use computers so get ready to calculate by hand, but I think she is passionate and dedicated and a fantastic teacher.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: She is a very knowledgeable person and wants her students to do well, so much so that she seemed almost angry when the midterm average was lower than she had hoped for (67%). She can be a bit sassy (which is great, in moderation). Her grading was fair and you should be able to do well in her class if you attend and review your materials.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Dr. Ahmsel is a great professor but be ready to put in the work. Attendance is mandatory since she doesn't record lectures. A lot of her exams are based on the practice questions in the course pack so as long as you stay on top of that and do it weekly you will be fine for the exam.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Keep in mind if you're considering taking this course: -The avg grade for midterm was a 67% - Be ready to study a LOT on your own time and do a bunch of practice problems. -Also a must to show up to every class to get a good grade, seeing as nothing is posted online

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: So I actually disagree with the person who commented below - I think she is a very fair professor, very understanding, and genuinely wants her students to do well. The exam was fair, and she is a very patient person who is willing to explain things again and again until you understand.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Rhonda is one of the worst professors I have ever come across. Her exams have absolutely nothing to do with what she taught in class the entire semester, complete inability to teach the material effectively, she makes everyone feel bad about the questions they ask and downplays what she is looking for. Do not take her for PSYC 204 sats.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Amazing teacher, I love you

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: If math isnt your thing make sure you get Rhonda. She is clear and good at explaining difficult concepts. There are a lot of homework assignments but you get points for corrections. Getting an A is pretty doable if you do practice questions

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: I don't enjoy stats but I adore her, she does everything to make sure you're actually understanding and keeping up with her. She doesn't expect more than she should from her students and her personality just brightens up the room.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: 350 characters isn't enough to express how amazing Professor Amsel is. She is undoubtedly one of the best professors I have come across. She genuinely wants everyone to succeed and makes them understand and love stats. She makes herself very available and explains everything until everyone understands. This woman deserves every award in the book.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: I absolutely loved her. Made me want to take more classes with her. I liked math before but was never into statistics, and she made it really easy and interesting. Very straightforward and will call you out in front of the whole class, but that just makes the class more enjoyable in my opinion.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Great prof. She's an interesting lecturer and she's dedicated to her students' success. I've seen some comments that she can be stern with people when they ask questions. I didn't see that at all in her (maybe people don't understand her sense of humour?). She's very caring and understanding. I highly recommend taking a class with her.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Rhonda was an amazing prof that made statistics, a topic that is fairly dry and boring for many students, more accessible, easy to understand and interesting. Her lectures were engaging and focused, and she grabbed most students' attention. Also did lots of review. Class is fairly easy if you do the problems in the course pack, textbook is optional

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: I don't find math particularly hard, but still I think she made statistics extra easy and mostly entertaining. Learn this stuff good and you will better understand and interpret information in other courses. It makes those courses easier. You learn a way of thinking which is harder to forget than pure facts. Very likable course and teacher!

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Rhonda is the best prof ever.

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: She is dedicated to making her students understand

Name: Rhonda Amsel
Review: Rhonda is a very nice but spunky professor. She isn't afraid to talk down to anyone, but she is also ready to help if you need it. She may not be the most comforting professor, but she is there for you and makes everything easier than it seems. She allows for multiple questions from the class during class time and overall, she is a great prof.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: The lectures are amazing. He's knowledgable and makes it easy to understand. However, there is a lot of reading (a 350 pages book) and the exams are very detail oriented Still would recommend

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Really overrated in my opinion. He's charming and funny, but his course is just bad. His exams are really unfair -- he tests on material that is downright arbitrary (ultra specific and irrelevant to main ideas). His lectures don't have much real content, but you're expected to know every tiny detail he says. The book is dense and boring.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Prof Koestner is a very passionate teacher with clear teaching methods and loves to tell stories (which are part of the exam!), which makes the class more interesting. However, his exams are difficult and very detailed. We are required to read 3 books and expected to memorize 90% of the material for each.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Professor Koestner is a really good prof and this was an amazing class. Not only was the material interesting and engaging, but also, getting a good grade was very doable! You have a midterm and a final (which can count for 90% if you want!). Would recommend rewatching the lectures to revise for the exams because he is quite detailed!

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: I took Koestner for both Psyc332. and Psyc471 - as long as you do the readings and follow in class you'll do great. Koestner is an amazing professor and his material is useful/engaging. I wish I could take him again - (psyc471 is easier than 322 in my opinion)

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: I took PSYC 471 thinking it will be as easy as PSYC 332...I've never been so wrong. His exams are way too detailed to the point that even if you study for 2 weeks straight for this class, apparently, you will not have learned enough. PSYC 332 was also detailed but it was focused on one book; this is focused on 3 books, so the details are tripled.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: You don't realize how much motivation plays a role in everyone's life until you take this class. The concept is applicable to all areas of life. This was my last semester at McGill and it really made me reflect on life and my education thus far. Enjoyable class, good lecturer. It's not academically rigorous, but it gives you tools to use for life!

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Best class ever! Koestner used real life examples and makes the topics very interesting. There's a lot of readings but the books are actually fun and easy to read (but do read them). He also has a lot of grading options to help you As this class

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: If you are interested in psychology and not a psych major, I recommend this course, all the material is applicable to life. Some is a bit common sense but it was a pleasure to attend his lectures. Koestner is a good story-teller and he makes the material accessible. 3 books to read, all very informative. Really liked Deci in particular.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: He was a lot of fun to listen to, the lectures were amazing!! The exams on the other hand didnt actually test your understanding of the material, they were more focused on the details of the stories he tells in class and the stories (not the material) in the textbook. Its easy to do well though, just study the stories and everyones names.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: BEST PROF IVE HAD SO FAR!!! Loved his class! Super interesting, funny guy, great lecturer. He clearly knows a lot about what he teaches about and gives tons of examples and funny life stories to exemplify concepts.
