Totally loved this class probably will take his other class because of how great a lecturer he is! There is a book to read - 320 pgs.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Koestner is hands down the best prof I've had. You have to know literally everything he says: his own opinions, his life story, the authors' views, etc. It's so worth it even though his exams are super detailed. Not hard to do well if you're really invested in it. The only class I actually remember almost all of the material from.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Professor Koestner is amazing and by far my favorite professor at McGill! He made Pysc332 so interesting, and uses lots of his own interesting personal stories to make the material applicable and easy to understand. His tests are extremely specific, but it's totally worth it!

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Such a sweet prof! So kind and funny. Makes lectures fairly interesting. The tests are normally multiple-choice. The exams are hard, you really have to take good notes (even on things you don't think are important!).

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: By far best class I've taken in PSYC, he clearly knows how to teach and plans his lectures perfectly, tests are way too detailed on both lecture and textbook material but it's honestly worth it - everything is super interesting and the examples he uses make it easier to remember. Prf. Koestner is simply amazing!

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Richard is the best prof. I loves both personality and motivation. Lectures really help you understand the material and are interesting to listen to! He shows a lot of videos and shares personal stories, which really helped me connect to the material and he tries hard to make it relevant to a university student population. Wish he had more classes!

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Koestner's classes (332 and 471) are the best classes you will take at mcgill but you CANNOT half ass it or you will do poorly. Tests are 50% lecture 50% readings material, but 100% of the material is interesting. The reading material is easy if you read attentively, the lecture questions are hard but Keostner gives u all u need to do well

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Hes amazing. Passionate, caring, and loved by literally every other students i talked to. Make the 3h lectures enjoyable. The exams arent easy and you must engage with the material and take the time to really understand and remember the examples he gave. But worth it.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: I found PSYC 332 with Koestner to be quite interesting. Although the material can sometimes be boring, he made sure to make it interesting. He is very sweet. Midterm was really easy, but the final was kind of hard; a lot of people complained and he himself said that it was going to be difficult. He ended up curving a lot of people's grades.

Name: Richard Koestner
Review: Probably the best teacher I've had at McGill! His midterm was not easy because you really need to know details and read the books he assigns. Also make sure you know the details of his personal stories. However, he is great at lecturing, makes psychology really fun and class is never boring.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: The best teacher in my life. My respect for this incredible professor. He changed my life. May he rest in peace.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: The finest professor at McGill. Truely cared for each student. Thank you Professor Donovan for a wonderful case class.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: I withdrew three times but took it with Donavan and passed. I am really glad i did. I enjoyed his lectures and glad i took it with him. However our grades were curved down because the average was so high

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: Avoid taking a course with Mr. Donovan at all costs. Multiple choice portion of exams rarely include material taught in class. Deducted the whole class average by 5% as he believed an average of B+ was too high. Huge ego, in and out of class.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: Summary: Course: Interesting Content, Very poorly taught by prof. Donovan Professor Donovan: -Tests include material that was never taught -Rarely replies to emails -Huge ego -Will repeat stories of his 'successful case competitions' every lecture, then rush through material

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: Hard exams with obscure information and examples; repetitive lectures; interesting content but poorly taught. Doesnt respond to emails regarding extensions or conflicts and huge ego makes him unapproachable and hard to reach. The human embodiment of yikes with all the unnecessary comments and self-serving personal anecdotes.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: Course concepts arent challenging, and yet RGDs exams are impossible to succeed on. The mix of obscure-at-best and never-taught-at-worst concepts make the exams less a measure of a students knowledge and more an arbitrary normal distribution grade generator. Add in brutal group work + inaccessible TA hours and this course was truly dreadful.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: hard to get a good grade in his class

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: This class is not as hard as it has been portrayed. Memorize the slides and you can get an easy A- (wish someone had told me before). Go to class regularly because his slides aren't self explanatory. His slides are bullet points and he elaborates in class. Go to class during the EXCEL and ACCESS lectures otherwise you won't be able to do it.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: Big ego. I think that's why Mcgill's business school is not as good as U of T. Like to consider the freshman "case babies". Many profs in Desautels have those egos. I think that's why McGill has been ranked out of top 50 university in the world.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: Wondering what class you have next and realizing it's Donovan's is a very satisfying feeling. Lectures are interesting, you don't see time going by. Beware of the Excel assignment, don't wait too long to start it. Final was clearly easy when you know the stuff, but it got curved down apparently so I was somewhat disappointed about my grade.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: Prof Donovan is great: super knowledgeable, smart and makes lectures engaging. He does like to talk about his achievements but always stays on schedule. Get ready to here the same stories a couple times and the same phrases (ex: "it was downhill from there baby" or "bare with me for a second")

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: He's a really great prof if you are interested in case analysis/presentations. Has a specific sense of humour. Will talk lots about splashy the whale. I know a lot of people who took the class P/F but I didnt and did really well. He expects improvement but more importantly you showing effort for improvement. The workload was super manageable.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: Lot of students love to give Donovan criticism, he's a very polarising figure but you can definitely learn a lot from his classes and definitely brings over substantial experience to his classes. Personally I enjoyed taking class with Donovan and found his stories very engaging and interesting, albeit repetitive at times.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: I actually respect Donovan's life experience, but he's a real bad person. If you're a girl, expect minimum A-, if you're a guy, well, good luck. I learned a lot in his case class, but he has the absolute biggest ego you can find in a prof. It's too bad because I really enjoyed the actual class, but his character ruined it for a lot of people.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: BIG EGO, loves to talk about his achievements. Expect nothing when you try to ask for help outside class. "I dont have time", "Every excel works differently, thats how far i could go". Basically not answering anything is his answer.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: With Professor Donovan, it all depends on the student and a bit of luck. Luck in the sense that, success with his multiple choice questions are a question of flair. Simply learn everything by heart and try to make links.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: Uses cringey catch phrases in place of punctuation during lectures. Probably best not to waste time watching lecture recordings, just read slides briefly at home and take notes/make cards for textbook material. Group projects unrelated to course material.

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: best prof ever to have, definitely knows his stuffs well, exams aren't hard as long as you understand his lectures, everything straight out of class lessons so you should definitely attend!

Name: Richard Donovan
Review: BIG ego

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: I haven't seen mathematician instructor better than you! You are the best mathematician instructor! The ideas in the class are cohesive and flow together smoothly without disruption in the train of thought! You are amazing!

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: A really great professor, but lecture notes are definitely not enough for you to get a high mark, likes to include at least one question from outside the notes which sometimes you will lost a lot of marks for. Also I know it's the student's responsibility to find extra exercises, but it would be great if you included some more in e-elearning.

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: Great professor !

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: all respect to Prof Sababheh , whish him good luck in future

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: It was one if the best courses I took, I learnt a lot  of interesting and new things in the best possible way. It was a pleasure

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: A great teacher, with excellent knowledge. Skilled in teaching, gives feedbacks, he is also inspirational.

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: teaches well but the quizzes are the toughest.

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: Simply one of the best professors.

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: Great prof

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: he is a very good doctor and can send the informations in the easiest way .

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: Skipping one lecture will cause you problems because you will lose a lot of usefull information. But the dr. remain repeating the main things over and over in order to be used to it.

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: He was a great professor. Although the mini tests were super hard and I failed 3/4 of them, I still ended up with an A because I pushed and studied well for the mid term and final exams.

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: He is respectful do his best  Never late  Cover everything  Don't miss any point Help the students and listen to them  He know all the students in his class  He allowes  students to take photos for the board  His quizzes are more professional than the midterm and the final

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: He is perfect and amazing .

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: He is the best doctor that i have met in the university. he is helpful , cheerful, and hopeful . He is from the type of doctors who dont make the material hard for the candidates, he just make it simple in his own way

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: He was amazing dr and genius

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: Your quizzes are so hard

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: He really helps the students who always attend and do well in class, and he respects his students and the students respect him, and overall he is a really good professor.

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: Great dictor fhat gave the information very clearly and was passionate about the course

Name: Mohammad S. Sababheh
Review: Amazing teacher

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: At first I almost dropped the class because Lecker seemed so tough but after the first week this became one of my favorite classes. There's work to do for every class but mostly just a few short poems. Wanna get a good grade? Participate. That's it people. Raise your hand, say things and write in the discussion. Don't half ass and pass

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: A pretty tough grader, and I'd say that if he agrees with what you're saying, you'll do well. Grading is subjective anyways, but he takes it to a new level. Personally, I didn't like him too much. The material was pretty interesting on the other hand. My TA this year was incredible though!

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: I liked Lecker. His lectures were very interesting and depending on your TA, the conferences can really help clarify things if need. He has really insightful things to say about what we read, he's very knowledgeable about the content&the authors and encourages people to give their own ideas in class. Have the readings done before class, its a must!

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: Do not recommend if you are not an ENGL major; its a hard pass.  Not approachable at all, and puts himself before his students. Attendance is mandatory and participation is crucial (in class + online discussion boards and he keep track of how many times you post).  Midterm and Final, both essays. no other assignments. Tough grader.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: Professor Lecker is someone who clearly knows what he is talking about from a professor's point of view. If you are not an English major you will find yourself being utterly confused and frustrated in this class. He isn't very approachable nor does he try to aid the student's understanding. When it comes to exams he is very vague.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: really challenged me to reflect on what it means to hate people...

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: He knows his stuff... but not there for his students. Very distant professor and not very approachable. VERY harsh grader. Do not take if you are not an English major!

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: Mailing it in. An Abomination.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: just not interested anymore, it's so obvious

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: Professor Lecker is an expert on Canadian Literature. He makes a real effort to help his students succeed. It's not at all an easy class and it really depends on the TAs that grade your exams. I enjoyed the class and would suggest it to friends. Remember it's not an easy A. You need to put in the work in order to do well.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: I ended up having to use notes from other Canadian lit. classes just to understand what was going on in lecture. Disorganized, uninteresting lectures and a prof who won't listen to constructive criticism from students is a bad combo. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: Most boring& uninteresting, painfully suicidal class ever. Do not take if you like to think freely and interpret literature the way it is supposed to be-subjective. He wants you to think like him, so in the end you are only pleasing the prof. Zero motivation and interest to attend his class. Most people are bored to death

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: very boring class. pretends to want to get to know you, but he secretly wants you to think just like his interpretations. lectures are painful to get through.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: Lecker is awesome. Engage with him. Get to know him. Don't get so defensive about the supposed "ego" that everyone on here is talking about, and just let him open your eyes a little - you might like what you see, you might not, but either way, taking his class is essential for learning how to talk about art.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: Fairly unintelligent, and narcissistic as the day is long.  If you accidentally make him feel threatened your grade WILL suffer, as his grading method is entirely subjective

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: Has a true passion for Canadian Literature, and is one of the best professors to study under if you wish to learn more in that field. He gets you into a routine of writing constantly which is tough at times, but gets you engaged. A little intimidating to speak in front of sometimes in the lectures, but there are conferences and a discussion board.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: He specifically sets up the assignments to make everyon arrive in class having done the readings, and to help people keep up and do well. It was tough having a mini paper due twice a week, but then we got to revise them and submit the month's worth all together for the grade. No midterm or final. He encourages discussion, and coming to his office.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: Beyond useless

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: people that dont like Lecker do not apply themselves in class. He is BEYOND helpful - always encourages students to see him in office hours. He encourages participation which makes the class more interesting. Take a class with him. Great prof.

Name: Robert Lecker
Review: He picks favorites and if you're not on his good side, or you don't agree with his ideas, he makes you pay. I have never had an issue with a professor but he is AWFUL. Trust me, stay away!

Name: William Brown
Review: I have to agree with others. All the classwork is way too difficult from the start. He jumps into the hardest problems from the textbook without going over the theory first, scribbling on the board and giving no explanations. Exam was brutal. My lowest grade ever, despite working my hardest.

Name: William Brown
Review: If you want to get an A in this class you need to do every problem in the text book.  Many of the hardest problems on the exams are taken directly from it.Also the areas where questions stump you in the exam aren't in the concepts taught, but in little algebra tricks you may or may not have learnt in high school.Any time you see a trick-REMEMBER IT

Name: William Brown
Review: His lectures are poorly planned and rushed. The exam is also obnoxiously difficult. Sure, it's meant to test a student's understanding and skill, but this exam merely tests how quickly one can find hidden and obscure forms of equations. Last time I checked, McGill is not Concordia. Why are we being tested on our cognitive creativity?

Name: William Brown
Review: Probably the worst proff at McGill. I think he enjoyes watching everyone fail. Not helpful in or out of class. Just horrible.

Name: William Brown
Review: Not all of your college life will be pleasant, and prof Brown is bounded to make sure that all those who took his course are aware. I feel like that instead of acknowledge student progress and effort, his pleasures,if he genuinely enjoys it, obviously lay on the other side of the balance. Wrap up, FML, I had to take this course.

Name: William Brown
Review: Horrible professor and an even more horrible person. I emailed him asking him what the average on the final exam was and he replied by telling me that he doesn't normally publish average as they are not very revealing. (i.e. it was probably under 50 and he doesn't want to look bad)

Name: William Brown
Review: This prof will take whatever little love you had for math and smash it into oblivion. He makes his exam questions unreasonably hard. I would recommend taking this course at a different university. I really think this guy shouldn't be teaching at McGill.

Name: William Brown
Review: Absolutely the worst teacher I have ever witnessed in my life - in all possible aspects. If you like the subject, he will destroy all interest. It may even be beneficial that you do NOT attend classes since it is a complete waste of time. Anyways, just prepare long and hard for very unexpected exams and grades!

Name: William Brown
Review: better be a big curve

Name: William Brown
Review: The course does have a somewhat challenging final, but it is a fair exam. If the course is taken seriously (4 credits means at least 4 hours of work outside of lecture and tutorial each week) the exam and assessments are straightforward. Dr. Brown is very open to questions and takes time to address them, but you have to ask. Initiative is key.

Name: William Brown
Review: I used to love math... didn't think it was possible to have such a bad math Prof. Well ladies and gentleman, here he is. The exam was impossible, and nothing reflected of what he "taught" in class. There better be a big ass curve.

Name: William Brown
Review: It's not only his extremely hard exams, but his seeming lack of interest in teaching and desire to be anything but helpful in classes that make him an awful professor.  He tells us to study from the book but then makes his exams harder than any question you might find in the text.  Gives the impression that he likes failing people.  Good luck.

Name: William Brown
Review: Boring, needs to retire and exams are insanely difficult.  I didn't learn a single thing from this guy, and to make it worse the exam was so brutal.  Avoid this guy at all costs.  I used to like math... then I had Brown.

Name: William Brown
Review: He doesn't seem to want the class to succeed. He could care less if everyone failed. Exam was very tough, there should be a big bell curve. His exams are 10000x harder than the quizzes and WeBwOrk. Be cautious, study as hard as you possibly can. He writes all the exams for 140/141 so it doesn't matter which prof you actually have.

Name: William Brown
Review: Professor Brown is likely Lord Voldemorts brother. His lectures could kill Harry Potter........

Name: William Brown
Review: It's way past his time to retire. I don't understand why the school keeps such a horrible prof. He just simply doesn't teach and puts questions on the exam that we've never discussed or seen before.

Name: William Brown
Review: He simply doesn't teach... by his own admission. My parents went to see him because they couldn't understand what was going on since I'm a good student. He told them "I don't teach" his exact words... its simply incomprehensible to me

Name: William Brown
Review: Prof. Brown has truly passed his prime, if he had one. He spends half of every class repeating course information everyone already knows. The problems that he goes through in class (not that he gets through many!) are really quite simple ones, making attendance unnecessary. I went to class for a quite place to read my textbook. (No one is there!)

Name: William Brown
Review: No matter which professor you have for your Calculus course, Brown sets the exam, and the exams are truly impossible. He's inescapable. Prof. Brown, if you can't teach on the level of a first-year calculus student, you shouldn't be teaching them!

Name: William Brown
Review: this class was pretty easy. going to class isn't that necessary since he has typed notes that he copies down on the board. assignments are a bit challenging, midterm is very similar to previous years. for the final study his old finals, midterm and assignment 4-5, plus verbal proofs from previous years and you'll ace the class.. i did.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: Fenster is an amazing professor, like just watching his lectures brightens up your mood and his CHEM181 lectures were so clear and enlightening, making it really easy to study for the exams. Love this prof, he's adorable and his humour is amazing!

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: He's such a cutie and funny.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: This teacher deserves an award. He is outstanding. Makes the material very interesting and loves his job. I have taken 2 of his classes and loved both of them. Would highly recommend.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: Very good prof

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: HE MADE ME FALLIN INLOVE WITH CHEMISTRY!!LOVE HIM!!

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: Great Prof! He's very clear and classes are interesting! Fun class

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: His classes are really interesting! The course in general is a great one but I loved Fenster's lectures and his little stories that always had a twist in them :) He's a great prof to have :)

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: Awesome prof! Has fun demonstrations, and explains things clearly. Listen to his random stories though, they appear on the exams!!

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: I took World of Chem Drugs with Fenster, and he was fantastic. Very funny, genuinely nice and sincere man. There is no textbook so you must attend class, but attending is enough as long as you take your own notes. He is very understanding, also, that not everyone has a background in chemistry and explains things for the common arts student.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: I love Fenster!! he is a great prof. His exams are super easy. Make sure to listen to all the details in his stories during lectures because he puts the stories in the exams. The materials he cover are really interesting too!

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: Fenster incorporates Chemistry into History making for great lectures and an even easier time trying to learn the material. Solid Prof!

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: His jokes are hilarious. Makes good use of his time. You will learn a lot when you attend class.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: legend!

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: Listen to his stories and don't bother reading the text.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: Fenster is the tsar bomba in the world of chemistry. Made me laugh every class. The Man.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: it's like being in kindergarten all over again. I loved his lectures. You just sit back, watch videos, listen to super interesting side stories and actually learn!  Personally, my favourite chem prof.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: Interesting and patient with people asking questions in class.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: terrible because he focuses on side stories and not actual content

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: Leats favorite lecturer of the WOC crew but they are all very good. This is a very interesting course but beware, no0t as easy at it looks. Buy the NTCs and re-read them and you should be fine.

Name: Ariel Fenster
Review: He's great! His side stories are interesting and keep you from falling asleep. I really enjoyed his lectures despite not being the biggest chemistry buff.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Fantastic Lecturer. She changed the marking scheme for the P/F assignments (10% of grade) to basically become normal assignments, just out of 2, halfway through the course. Participation mark made no sense - Received absences for when I was present, and was marked present when I was absent R assignments are too long for too little marks..

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Prof Stolle is very sweet, she gives engaging and interesting lectures and makes the content accessible. She pays close attention to feedback and she is easily accessible outside of class. I would totally recommend POLI210 as an introduction to research methods.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: This is a good class for learning some skills and how to do research. The prof is very nice and really cares that students learn the material. Makes dry materials super fun. Lots of office hours, very accessible. There are many assignments and quizzes but I felt that helped me keep up the pace in this class. take it if you can.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Maybe the least communicative professor I ever had. Relied a bit too heavily on polling and guest lecturers, and the lectures weren't terribly captivating. Seemed like a nice enough person, but not terribly understanding. It's an easy class to do well in if you keep up with the workload, but not a very fun one.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Not a brilliant lecturer - relies too heavily on polling to try and explain concepts for her. Also found that she wasn't very communicative to students, and when I tried to reach out to her she was just kind of unpleasant to me, and way ruder than I was expecting. Take her if you have to, her class is easy, but not fun.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Professor Stolle was one of my favourite professors at McGill. She is caring, compassionate, and loves to hear from students on interesting ideas for research projects they have. Loves what she teaches and is incredibly helpful in providing feedback. Clear grading criteria and very approachable for extra help. Easy A if you do the readings.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Best class I've taken so far at McGill. Different from other Poli Sci classes in a good way. This class puts the "science" in political science. Loved loved loved Prof Stolle -- she knows her stuff and is great at presenting it. My only issue with the class was the amount of guest lecturers. I understand why she does it, but I wanted more of her!

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Easy relative to other poli courses. The polling she uses for attendance broke a lot. Most of the class is taught by TAs so go to them if you have any other questions: they are super helpful. Stolle is also extremely knowledgeable and experienced so even though its TAs marking all your stuff, she's great to talk to if you're genuinely interested.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Overall a pretty average prof. She's extremely smart, kind, and has a good sense of humour; but often spends too much time on in-class surveys. Uses many guest lecturers, which can detract of the continuity of the course. Gives many small-medium assignments & weekly reading quizzes, as well as participation marks, so your grade is well spread out.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Worst prof I ever had at McGill. She doesn't even teach half the classes, which makes it hard to adjust to the various teaching styles presented throughout the semester. For the classes she does teach, she focuses 90% of her time on turning point and is very unclear. Don't bother going to her office hours either, she's rude and unhelpful.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Only take this class if you need it for honours, because the material is boring. Prof Stolle is clearly super smart but isn't great at explaining some basic research concepts. I actually liked that there were so many SPSS assignments because it makes the final assignment easier to complete. The reading quizzes also made it hard to fall behind.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: she's an alright prof. The class has so many little assignments that take way too long to complete for it being 2% of your grade. It would take months to get the smallest assignments back. Lectures were alight.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: I found the SPSS program that we had to use really difficult. There are a lot of readings and small quizzes/assignments throughout the semester which can be good since not all the weight is put on the exams, but also means you're putting a tons into the class throughout the semester. I like Dietlind as a person but dreaded her class

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Dietlind was nice and funny but the course content was just so boring. SPSS data program was so hard to use and the TA's didn't do a great job teaching it. Would never take this course again but would take another one of Dietlind's classes.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Dull material. Takes a month to get the midterm grade back. Weekly quizzes and assignments. Updates the syllabus an excessive amount of times and yet it still isn't clear. SPSS program is taught in conferences only, which are dull, unclear and very unhelpful. Don't take this class if you can avoid it.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: She is truly one of the nicer professors at McGill, tries to have a true interaction with the class and is very clear even though some of the material can be difficult, it can be overcome easily by working and going to class AND conferences. However, the course is divided in a way you can get an easy A or A- with reading tests and participation.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: This class was very dull-unless you need to take it, I definitely wouldn't suggest it. LOTS of guest lecturers, often took away from the cohesiveness of the material. When she is lecturing, it's pretty easy material to follow and she isn't bad at her job, but there were way too many assignments and attendance is 15% of your grade which sucks.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Course can be a bit boring and basic at times, but I found the tedious assignments  to be quite relaxing. Proff Stole might not be the best teacher in the humanities department, but she does a good job and is clearly passionate about what she teaches. Now the second midterm was soul crushingly hard espetialy compared to the first, so be aware.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: Dietlind is one of the most passionate professors and loves what she teaches. The class is interesting and informative but you have to keep up with all the readings and homework. A lot of assignments on which you will spend a lot of time but if you want to do research later on then take this class. Don't take it out of fun.

Name: Dietlind Stolle
Review: The prof is great and caring, but the material is so boring. Wouldn't have taken this course if I knew how much assignments count. Word of advice, if you want to be able to do the assignments, be present at the conferences.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Don't show up to class, watch lecture recordings at 1.5x speed and you're set. Oh, make sure you do the assignments alone. Check the answers for the midterms because my first midterm had an error, and when corrected made my grade jump from a B to an A. Vybs is a really nice guy tho, super helpful.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Joseph is a really good person who cares about his students immensely. With the larger class sizes, it can seem a bit disorganized, but just make sure to see him in office hours (show up early). Exam questions can be broad, but he makes up for it with lenient grading. Midterms are not ideal as they were online, but the final exam was very fair.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Wrong. Everything is wrong. Assignments full of mistakes and get correct 12 hours before due date. Ambiguous during lectures giving inconsistent information. One formula today, different result tomorrow. TAs have no clue what he's doing and feel bad for us. Very slow and boring lecturer but at least its recorded and can be sped.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: One of the most humble and easily approachable profs at McGill. Yes the materials in class are dated and he sometimes lacks clarity, but given how CS and tech have involved, University is rendered useless anyway. Would recommend.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Horrible. He is incredibly ambiguous: his tests, assignments, and slides require multiple clarifications as they all have egregious errors in them. He constantly makes up terms and doesn't tell the class, leading to further confusion because his definitions, like everything else, are unspecific. His slides and lectures contain little information.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: My 6 year old nephew could write exam questions in a less confusing way... seriously the material is really easy, but the questions are asked so ambiguously that you lose marks.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: One of the great profs in CompSci, although sometimes infuriatingly vague. Cares about students, and deserves more credit for it than he gets. Office hours are like lining up at disney world, but worth the wait. ALWAYS VERIFY YOUR GRADE ON ASSIGNMENTS/TESTS. (There's almost always grading mistakes by the TA's). 2x recordings ;)

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: He is a good teacher and explains very well, but his lectures are too long.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: One of the nicest persons at McGill, but lacks clarity throughout. That said, would recommend. You don't learn anything useful for a living at school nowadays anyways.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Nice person, but the assignments are completely nonsensical.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: nice person. Said everything on test would come from lecture and slides, which are adaptations from textbooks written by himself. Was true to his words. Ended up taking 206 and 273 with him, and most likely 303 this semester. Lot of time invested in hw and (re)reading lecture + notes by other profs of same class. Can expect work to pay off though.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: He will help you outside of class if you ask him. Lectures are alright, but his slides lack information. Easy midterms and assignments, but he writes them in a very unclear way, which gets confusing and results in silly points loss. Fair grading but with very little feedback. Not a lot of ways to practice and prepare, except by using the textbook.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: He was ok. The final is not hard as it may seem. I think it was relatively easier than the midterms in my opinion. The level of difficulty varies in his assignments. Some are very time-consuming, and then there are some that are incredibly easy. Overall, I consider him to be a good professor for this course.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Writes extremely unclear and bad assignments and exam questions. Explanations of concepts and ordering of material is mediocre at best. Only good quality is that he talks obscenely slow and so you can watch lecture recordings at 2x

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Starting to grow on me, his slides are garbage but very easy to skip class and listen to lecture recordings on 2x, bring a highlighter to his exams as half the time is spent comprehending what the question is asking. Very nice guy though and I would say very fair when it comes to averages on exams/ listening to class.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Pretentiously stresses good design principles but assignment specs require things to be done in the most inefficient ways, resulting in bad design. Not the professor to take if you want to learn anything useful. You're better off learning what you need elsewhere.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: He can be unclear sometimes, but you'll just have to make an effort and go to his office hours to clarify things. He is very approachable, patient, and doesn't seem to judge no matter how stupid your questions might be. Certain assignments can be long and time consuming, but he had a huge team of TAs and help was very accessible.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: He's a fine lecturer but his assignments and exams seem to be written with the intent of being as unclear as humanly possible, although they would be fairly easy if he could actually figure out what he's trying to ask of you. It should be easy to get an A if you learned reading comprehension by studying the works of small children.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Be prepared for a lot of very minor concepts to play a major part in the final exam. But Vybihal is a really good prof otherwise. Very clear and gave good examples.

Name: Joseph Vybihal
Review: Really not a bad guy, he cares about the material and readily answers questions in class and online. As a lecturer he is VERY dry. so much so I found myself sleeping in some of his classes. Slides are also somewhat disorganized so it can be hard to go back. However everything on the exam is on his slides.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Doug Allen is a great professor. The course is overall hard but his explanations are very good. Read the chapters before the lecture and never skip class

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Requires tons of reading, and going to lecture. Yet still you won't be able to get high on your test. walk into the final, skipping 90% of the questions cause I have no ideas what the heck he is trying to ask. bUT end up passing w a B- cause I guess the curve was that low. But you do learn a lot about real life from him and he is passionate.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Prof. Allen could make inspirational presentation.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Funny and natural lectures, he wrote the textbook so he knows what he's talking about. Professional, engaging, honest, he wants you to get it. Lots of students said he was a tough marker. The exams are difficult, with questions not from the textbook.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: He is engaging during lecture, however he rushes slides and does not explain things fully. HIs tests are unreasonably difficult and the way he structures his tests does not promote the idea of learning. Even though you study the material and go to lecture, you can still end up with a very poor mark. Take it with someone else.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: A legend. Best lecturer/prof I've had. -Read the chapter before lectures. -Actually go to lectures. (and pay attention) -Do every homework question. I definitely complained a lot during this class, but it was well worth it. Doug is very passionate and knowledgeable.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Professor Allen is probably the best lecturer I have had throughout my two years at SFU. Class is at 8:30 but still manages to keep you engaged. He has a unique way of teaching Economics and applies to ongoing real-life events, unlike most professors. This class requires a lot of time and work, however, you can obtain a good grade if you work hard.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Doug presents economic ideas/principles in an unique way, applying concepts to everyday life. After taking ECON103 with him, I felt like I truly learned economics beyond the textbook (plus, his lectures are engaging!). Be warned, this class requires lots of work to get a good grade. Exams are heavily theory based. You either love him or hate him.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Doug is clearly passionate about econ. Hardest class I've taken so far in Uni but I am a first year in my second sem. I got an A+ in 105, but finished 103 with a B+. He teaches the concept really subjectively but overall lectures were helpful and the class is curved. It is a rewarding class and interesting, but to get an A you have to work hard

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Doug is really passionate about Economics, but I personally found his lectures hit or miss; either I listened to the whole thing and learned a lot, or I tuned out about halfway through. If you take Doug, I definitely recommend doing lots of the textbook questions since he lets you replace your midterm with your final if you do better (saved me).

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Class is too hard

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: I always found the field of economics distasteful and boring, but after taking Doug's 103 class I've come to really appreciate the study. His passion for the subject was really motivating and I'm definitely gonna remember the topics he taught us for years to come. Haven't had the final yet so don't quote me on everything.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: everyone should take one class with doug allen at some point in your education for the experience. it's very clear that hes good at what he does and he shows it. however, his exams are made as if you know as much as he does. extremely high quality prof with a pretty high difficulty. avg for midterm was around 53%

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: nothing has made me cry as much as this class has. good prof, but hardest class ever. makes me want to drop out of school. midterm is really hard

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: nothing has made me cry as much as this class has. good prof, but hardest class ever. makes me want to drop out of school

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: I remember him saying something about changing your view on economics after you take his class and I believe it really worked! His textbook was the best I've ever read. If you read his textbook and understand the main concepts it won't be hard getting a good grade in his class. He really knows his stuff and can explain every concept so well!

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Professor D is awesome. I took his ECON427 Law and Economics. It was one of the best course I have ever taken at SFU. Professor D is very knowledgeable and inspirational. Not only does he talk about theories, he also took time to help us write concisely and efficiently! If you were here to learn, take his course. Cuz you are going to learn a lot!

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: Incredible prof, with a great course and a very unique and effective textbook/teaching method. Fun and casual when you want it, and straight to the point when you need it. If you understand the concepts (some may be difficult to grasp -- take your time reading and understanding each concept carefully), the course is a breeze. This prof is a gem.

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: he teaches economics like a theory class if you're interested in learning how an economist thinks of the world - he's your guy not sure how good he is for prepping students for higher level econ no math on the midterm or final - all application midterm is forgivable - blessing don't regret taking his course but won't take him again for other econ

Name: Douglas Allen
Review: I thoroughly enjoyed all of my lectures thanks to Doug's unique style of teaching. You can really tell that he is both passionate and knowledgeable. But if you are easily offended or can't have your views criticized you should avoid this class. Like other people say be prepared to study A LOT outside class, but the reward is amazing!

Name: Brad Bart
Review: Lectures are good, however they aren't mandatory since he posts his lectures online. The assignments however are very time consuming, and are quite tough. However, if you do well on the assignments, you'll do well on his exams as they are based on his assignment. Intimidating, but he's approachable during office hours. Exams fair. Needs more TAs.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: Brad is one of the best lecturer in SFU CS, explains key concepts clearly and does not drown you with information. Kudos to him for postings the lectures online too. The con is he tries to assert dominance through enforcing a strict order in class, which I find unnecessary. Exam questions are based on assignments, so definitely study them.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: Although he is approachable during office hours, he is a hard marker and is ruthless. Get ready to work ALOT. The weekly assignments that is each worth 2% is very time consuming.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: He is the only Prof who can explain everything clearly and in detail, amazing! I never expect I will find a prof like him. And you don't need to find online courses from other universities to help you. There are so many profs in SFU test something never appear on anywhere of their PPT, but Bart's exam is fair, you learn, then you will get A.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: The lectures are very interesting, he gives motivation and ways of application to almost all concepts learned BUT the workload is ridiculous. He's probably fine if you don't have other difficult courses to worry about and want to eat, sleep and sh*t CMPT295, otherwise I'd just avoid him. 2% assignments normally take 8hrs to do, final exam 200 marks

Name: Brad Bart
Review: There are pros and cons about this prof. Pros: lecture notes are organized. There are recordings. Approachable during office hours. Cons: He doesn't care about his students. He puts up assignment questions that have very vague terms. Final exam is unethically, extremely hard. I can tell he just enjoys failing students. no respect for him.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: Dont take this professor if you dont want to spend your entire two days on assignments. 4th assignment worst (5 days spent without any credit as it did not work properly and class average for that assignment was 16%)

Name: Brad Bart
Review: Worst instructor ever!!!

Name: Brad Bart
Review: His lectures are easy to understand but his exams and assignments are really tricky. Sometimes you will be confused whether you are studying a 300-level course. Although I passed, I decided to retake the 225 but not his.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: This guy is drama king on his lecture but nobody go along with him.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: Extremely organized, his lecture notes are great, but expect to read up on the material after the class. The textbook was super helpful. Prepare to give up your nights before assignment deadlines if you put it off until last minute. Exams are fair.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: Excellent lectures that are paced well and easy to pay attention to. Weekly assignments worth 2% are a time commitment and are difficult for their grade weight, but helpful with learning the content. Marking was done ridiculously fast, with marks returning the day of, or the day after. Brad is a bit intimidating, but with him you can learn a lot.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: midterms were fair, final exam was very hard. assignments were extremely difficult, one due every week, each worth 2% (ridiculous for the amount of work they require). prepare to self learn a lot of the course as a lot of the assignment material is not covered in his lectures until after the assignment due date.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: He is a good instructor as he provides all the things that you need to know in his lectures. His assignments are pretty long and difficult and even if you get the right solution, you can still loose a lot of marks because of the incorrect output format. His quizzes were challenging but some were not. Both midterms and final were very fair.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: The best prof in SFU!! His assignments and quizzes are free mark. Final is super easy

Name: Brad Bart
Review: One of the most easy cmpt prof sfu. He post all the codes in the class so we do not need to copy the code from the class. He tells everything what will be on the exam so you just need to study what he asked to study. Midterm average was 90% and Final average was 83% which got curved up. Take him for GPA booster!! The class average is B+.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: Probably one of the most anti student profs I've ever seen. Won't post notes, no sample exam questions, no exam keys, no partial marks. On top of the extremely time consuming assignments he gave completely different lab quizzes to different lab groups. One group had an average of 75, the other 14. He didn't really scale the class, average was a C.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: I didn't really like him as a person, but respect him as an instructor. He is very passionate about teaching and actually gives good lecture. However, I find his lecture notes somewhat vague and it makes assignments really challenging and takes very long time to complete. So, I highly suggest that you go to his office hour for questions

Name: Brad Bart
Review: Before I was complaining about brad because the low average of this course. But after the grade released I noticed that he is not that brutal. As long as you reach the mean and median. He will give you B-. Its true that his course is hard and have a lot of work need to do. But he is a good instructor. Its worthy to take 295 with him.

Name: Brad Bart
Review: he is way too hard of a marker, avoid this class.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: not bad

Name: Peter Horban
Review: do the work and study and you'll do well if you aren't an idiot

Name: Peter Horban
Review: With that said, he can be very helpful and a good Professor for those that understand the subject I'm sure will excel.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: PHIL 110 was one of the hardest subjects I've ever taken.It's kinda like boolean logic, so you need to have a computer type mind. I took it for my Q requirement dont recommend as an elective.  For ppl struggling like me you can still possibly pass. My first midterm was 12/36, second 15/36. depends on class aver. as he scales marks. I got C- in end.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: The most professional professor I've ever had. His lectures are crystal clear and you can tell he spent a lot of time preparing them. He tells you that you need masterful understanding of the concepts and the terms to do well in the course, which is exactly what you need. It was a pleasure to learn from him. Sad that he is retiring.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: This class may seem easy... until you get to the exams. They are VERY tricky and there is JUST enough time to finish them, IF AND ONLY IF you use your time wisely. Average on the first midterm was about 17/36, which he says is normal. He seems to enjoy having his students suffer... study hard, and you won't be one of those students.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: Horban's Phil 110 class Is extremely hard! I'm outside of the major and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. The exams are only 40 minutes and you don't have time to get through it all! Its ridiculous. I'm sure he's a nice guy but the class is super hard.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: Great lecturer. Provides good notes and is clear. The class is hard, but its philosophy so it's supposed to be. Be careful on the tests, they are very tricky. An in depth understanding is needed, really more than you can study for.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: One of the best profs I have ever had.  Every lecture was engaging.  If you put the effort in, you will get a good mark. He is very intelligent, and always makes a strong argument. I would love to take more classes with this prof.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: You can tell he is really passionate about his teachings, and tries to make it as interesting as possible. His notes were clear, but exams were based mostly on material from the readings. Attend tutorials, they helped me most! Exams were fair as long as you READ!

Name: Peter Horban
Review: You can tell he is very passionate about his teachings, and tries to make it as interesting as possible. His notes were clear, but the exams were mostly based on the materials from readings, which were often long and boring. Attend tutorials, they were the most useful for me! Exams were fair.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: I took 5 courses this semester, I had 4.0 GPA and I got B in this course. His exams are tricky, VERY TRICKY. Expect to know the unexpected and answer questions you do not understand. Don't be deceived by easy lecture material, do all questions in textbook and pray that you will do okay on midterms. This course seems illogically unfair to me

Name: Peter Horban
Review: Never take Phil 101, logic and reasoning. Waste of you life

Name: Peter Horban
Review: he is a very excellent teacher!!! fantastic, gentleman, have sense of humor!!! must take his course~!

Name: Peter Horban
Review: Professor Horban is fantastic.  His voice is pleasant. He is very friendly and easy-going.    However, just be wary that during midterms, he gives a "two minute warning" make sure you have your test ready to hand in. Lateness is not acceptable. Some people complain about the difficulty.  PHIL 110 is hard, but he does a great job of teaching it.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: Clear and interesting lectures. However, he is completely anal in his style and he gives exams that he expects the average to be 40%! Feels like he wants you to fail. Hate the prof because of his actions, not his lectures though. Stay away from him.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: Horban is a great lecturer, with a very pleasant voice.  His exams are tough, but in answer to other complaints, he warns repeatedly before an exam how the papers are to be handed in and in this matter he is absolutely inflexible.  The best prof I had this semester, will definitely take another class with him

Name: Peter Horban
Review: Horban is a great lecturer, with a very pleasant voice.  His exams are tricky, and you are required to follow his instructions exactly, but he's fair.

Name: Peter Horban
Review: The worst professor I have ever had. I have never ever seen any rude, mean teacher like this idiot!!!!!

Name: Peter Horban
Review: this is probably the worst professor i have ever had. he was a extremely rude when i went to see him in his office hours and provided no form of extra help.the class seemed like he'd taught it a few too many times, some of the forms he handed out were circa 1993! he ruined a class which seemed like it may have actually been interesting.

Name: Russell Day
Review: He was really, really good at giving practical and helpful lectures. Prepare to read lots though. Quizzes were highly easy, Midterms were a little difficult but doable to get A's consistently if you don't slack off.

Name: Russell Day
Review: Weekly quizzes and iClicker questions so class is essentially mandatory. Knows the lectures by heart and is clearly interested in the topics. I was never bored some other students didn't like him. Extremely organized, all quizzes are planned in advance and grading is as in the syllabus. No feedback on the assignment. The etext site is very helpful.

Name: Russell Day
Review: I literally taught myself this class. Read the textbook and take notes to pass the exams lol. Never showed up to lecture and got same mark as friend who showed up. At least there's no final.

Name: Russell Day
Review: Honestly not that bad, a lot of people complaining he has a lot of tests, but I think it's better because there's less material you need to study for the test. As long as you read the chapters and attend most of his classes you'll do fine on the exam. It's honestly not as bad as some people are saying it is

Name: Russell Day
Review: no point to go to class he just reads from the slides which is literally the textbook. only reason I went was for the bonus questions. super hard to get good grades on written part of exam with the average being 9/20. mc was hard too. no point to study you'll probably get the same mark if u guess.

Name: Russell Day
Review: Lectures are not helpful at all... a total of 8 iClicker quizzes and 4 exams.

Name: Russell Day
Review: It has too many works to get done U basically have exam once a week He said its assignment but its frickin term paper His lectures are worse ive ever had its no use for exams there are no information from book it is useless period.

Name: Russell Day
Review: This professor give so much work and has exams almost every other week. His assignments are basically term papers. He does give enough information in lectures but asks so much specific question in tests. the lectures are basically none existent because its of no use.

Name: Russell Day
Review: There is no point in showing up to lectures, you basically have to teach yourself this class.

Name: Russell Day
Review: tests are all textbook based.

Name: Russell Day
Review: PSYC102 He is a very interesting professor, he really tries to engage his audience. He uses a lot of questions from the textbook, so as long as you study the textbook, you wont really need to attend lectures, but I recommend going for clarification.

Name: Russell Day
Review: Decent prof. I didnt do the readings before class so I did not get much out of the lectures but he seems to be very passionate about what he does. Tough essay test portions but all doable when you put the work into it. lots of Iclicker quizzes, 4 term tests and a short project.

Name: Russell Day
Review: His lecture is useless you can find everything on textbook and his quiz and midterm are all about so details. The average I believe last semester was C cause he even changed the scale after the last exam.

Name: Russell Day
Review: Lectures aren't necessary, tests are on the tricky side. He is an ok lecturer but made a few inappropriate/creepy comments. The class overall is a lot of upkeep, and the new book is a lot harder to read than the old edition. I studied a lot but still barely passed most of the midterms. Other assignments help to grade boost. Class average was a C+

Name: Russell Day
Review: not a good choice for 100 lvl class

Name: Russell Day
Review: Russell Day is a great prof to have for psych. He is passionate, engaging, and funny. He clearly outlines criteria in class and don't expect to get perfect if you skip lectures.

Name: Russell Day
Review: His lectures are really boring but he tries to make it interesting. Really don't even need to come to class. Just show up for iclicker quizzes and exams. You're better off reading the textbook than attending his lectures. His exams have an MCQ part and an essay part. He usually tells you the essay part the class before so make sure to go that day.

Name: Russell Day
Review: Lectures are very boring and you do not need to attend class to pass. Focus mostly on the textbook because his lecture quiz and term exam questions are from there. His lecture slides are totally useless. He definetly expects way too much for a first year course. Content was not too hard to grasp, and is an easy A class.

Name: Russell Day
Review: You don't need to go to lecture but READ the textbook. Most multiple choice questions are example scenarios, essay question is really difficult. Boring prof and same with his lectures.

Name: Russell Day
Review: Lectures were dry and boring, as most of the material is ripped right out of the textbook. Russell tries his best to make the class entertaining, but fails as he goes on random tangents sometimes. Attend lectures for the iclicker quizzes, and read the textbook religiously. The average for the essay parts of the exam were really close to failure too

Name: A. George Alder
Review: Poor choice of textbook. Never bothers including links in emails, prompting hundreds of students to waste several seconds to go to canvas just to open a link to an external site. Most of the experiments are flawed (strong lurking variables and correlations to them). Prof does not have the courtesy to remind us of a test 7 days way.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: I'm a sophomore CS student, and by far this guy's the best prof I've had at SFU. I took this for my b-soc requirement and do not regret it.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: Psyc100 is basically a grade 12 level course in terms of content and difficulty. There was 4 "term tests" throughout the semester but no midterm or final exam. Before each test, there would be 1 or 2 i-clicker quizzes to prep you. George was very engaging and made lectures fun. The content was also interesting so that helped a lot.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: Read the text book to succeed in the i clicker quizzes! Attend ALL lecture & tutorials, and it's not hard to do well on your study which is a grade booster if you get feedback from the TA along the way. Kristina was great. Biggest tip to do well in this class is stay on top of readings!

Name: A. George Alder
Review: George is an entertaining prof and explains concepts clearly. Always willing to help. The questions for his iclicker quizzes are weird, almost like you need to be in his head to get the right answer. I read the textbook for them and still got around 90% for the quizzes tho. 75% of the marks are from the TAs so ur grades depend on them.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: He is an awesome prof with a lot of knowledge and experience to offer. He has been teaching psyc since before you all were born. Make sure to keep up with the weekly quizzes, start the project early on semester, you will be just fine. His TA choices are not always great however.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: PSYC100 He talks EXTREMELY fast, and has no regards to answering questions during the lecture. He makes students submit questions through an anonymous q&a portal, then he'll choose what to answer next lecture. He once dismissed our class 50 minutes early because his computer crashed, we had a quiz coming next lecture.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: He really just summarizes the textbook but you need to come to class for quizzes and tests. You will do better when attending lecture but its not crucial. Decent choice, seemed alittle bored sometimes but is a funn chill guy.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: He was a competent prof, didn't really like the grading system he uses (only top 10% of the class can get an A) if you're only aiming for a B/C you can easily achieve it. He doesn't cover everything in class, so it's essential that you go and read the material. Attendance optional except for scheduled quizzes/tests, all notes in class posted online

Name: A. George Alder
Review: I loved this proff! He was super organized. He spoke through the course in such a proper way where he would go in steps and it was not confusing at all. He never skipped things, he knew his stuff, he jokes around a lot. Some how he kept all 300 of us laughing. totally recommend

Name: A. George Alder
Review: I loved this proff! He was super organized. He spoke through the course in such a proper way where he would go in steps and it was not confusing at all. He never skipped things, he knew his stuff really well and made it interesting. He also posts his lectures up. He jokes around a lot. Some how he kept all 300 of us laughing. totally recommend

Name: A. George Alder
Review: Alder was entertaining and personable, but the course itself was mediocre and non-engaging (not really surprising though since it's an intro class). 100% read the textbook to do well on the term tests! Not a terribly difficult class, as long as you read the material and pay attention during lecture as he does explain concepts pretty well.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: Be prepared to read because this course contains heavy reading! The professor is very knowledgeable and answers questions before class. The TA's are also heavy markers so be prepared to study extra hard for those written assignments. There is also an extra 6% in credit if you attend the research participation (optional).

Name: A. George Alder
Review: an iclicker quiz per chapter and test every two chapters so keeping up with the material is essential (there's no final however). You have to read the textbook in order to do well on the tests!!

Name: A. George Alder
Review: He is a Great prof, a lot of reading to do but getting an A or a B is defiantly doable in this class. He marks you based on many things so there is always room for you to make up.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: Adler posts lecture slides online so you're able to access it; he will show videos and give funny examples. Lecture slides are useless for the term test BUT useful for the 10-questions-i-clicker quizzes and that's it. TRUST ME WHEN I SAY YOU NEED TO READ THE TEXTBOOK IF YOU WANT THAT B+ AND ABOVE. You can ask anyone who has taken this course!

Name: A. George Alder
Review: Good course if you like psychology. There is alot of reading to do, and lectures are reccommended but you could get by with just reading the book. He marks cumulative so it works in your favour usually. All the TA's do the marking, so use them for feedback. Does actually care about his students as he has an online source where you can ask Q's.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: He is good and a funny prof!Be ready to do a lot of reading, chapters are long and text book has a lot of memorization.i-clicker quizzes and exams are really based on understanding the concept ( he gives scenarios on all MC questions). there is no final exam for this course only 4 term exam. TA's mark really hard especially on essay questions.

Name: A. George Alder
Review: George is a really cool and funny prof, but the class material is super dry... TAs are also really hard graders, class averages for test essays were always low. The textbook is really boring but you have to read it to get a decent mark in this class

Name: A. George Alder
Review: No midterm or final, there are only 4 term tests which is really nice as you dont have to remember massive amounts of information. He goes kind of fast through lectures so I suggest writing the lecture notes down before class, & reading the textbook chapter. this way you'll be prepared and actually benefit from his lectures.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Greg is one of my favorite CS profs at SFU. He structures his class so that the weekly exercises are straightforward but rewarding. His notes are great, so you don't necessarily need to go to class. The only downside is you need to memorize Python for the exams. However, the exercises are extremely helpful for that.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: I learned a lot in his class. The weekly assignments were well tailored to be challenging but also figure-out-able. Greg was very helpful in the lab time, but those labs came at a price. The course was condensed into 2-hour lectures each week, which were really hard to stay attentive in. The class was curved down unfortunately. Tests were hard.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Awful professor, he even has coding mistakes in his lecture and acts like it is expected for a prof to have mistakes. He marks unfairly and the course it too reliant on exams. Everything must be done in his old fashioned way to get marks, takes marks of for working code even if its in industry standard. He's one of those devs that refuse to update

Name: Greg Baker
Review: "Intro to web development", no. This class was taught with no respect to people who have never worked with Javascript for the first time. If you aren't already familiar with coding, DONT TAKE THIS CLASS! Plus, he's a terrible lecturer, does not reply to emails, and the amount of time you have to put into assignments each week is too much for 1%.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Excellent. One of my favourite courses! The weekly assignments are well designed to help understand the lectures while still being fun.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Easily the best prof I've had in my 4+ years at this school. Always willing and ready to help, explains things clearly, easy going. I have zero complaints! Highly recommend, but be prepared - he does expect students to actually do work and learn.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Light hearted lectures. Assignments are sometimes unclear. Really good prof overall

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Exposure to functional programming and other niche programming languages. Although greg baker was a solid lecturer, the course was not all that memorable as most of the assignments were dull and haskell (which greg focuses on in this course) is likely a language you will never use again.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Nothing special. An average instructor.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: He also tries to keep the course material as relevant as possible to the current time. He understands the student mentality so he will try to make the course enjoyable and sometimes cancels lectures because "Monday sucks"

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Greg is awesome. He puts a lot of effort into his class notes and assignments, and it shows. He is really knowledgeable (although he likes to go on one too many rants). I learned a lot from this class, and it is great that the professor is very passionate.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Greg is a very chill guy who explains all concepts clearly and thoroughly. Weekly exercises really ensure that you have a good understanding of the languages learned (Haskell and Go). Midterms and final were very fair with no surprises, and were mostly coding based. I will definitely try to take another class with Greg if I can!

Name: Greg Baker
Review: The assignments are super unclear, but he is an amazing instructor which teaches you a lot. If he could improve the assignments documentation, definitely deserve A+ for teaching ability.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: Good professor

Name: Greg Baker
Review: He is very unclear in class, he never replies my email when I have a concern.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: This prof spends a lot of time creating the materials for weekly exercises and lectures. However, he is a very tough marker and unclear. The guy is rude when he is being asked with questions that he thinks is straight forward. I would definitely not going to take anymore class with him.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: He turn simple material to complicated course, I would avoid Greg in the future.

Name: Greg Baker
Review: self centered character, rude when you are asking for help

Name: Greg Baker
Review: He is a tough grader, keep in mind that constructive feedback are absent in his class

Name: Greg Baker
Review: He is one of the worst lecture I have met, he couldn't explain a simple concept, always over complicated it.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: Professor is such a boomer that he doesn't utilize PowerPoint slides at all. Everything is in person and nothing is online. When you submit for weekly homework, you have to show up in person to submit. Big unlucky for those that take a 8:30AM class with him. Lectures are 3 hours and are as dry as the desert without water. TEXTBOOK MANDATORY.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: For the midterm, we are given 2 hours. The class is 3 hours long. The midterm is as long as finals for some class and we are given 3 hours for those. Literally 95% of the class was there till the end because the test was too long. And all notes are by paper no lecture slides which make focusing on the lecture so hard for 3 hours. Teacher is stuck

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: This teacher is the ABSOLUTE worst teacher I've taken in my 3 years post-graduate career.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: The teacher is stuck in the prehistoric age dry class and even drier teaching style.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: This course was the most confusing course I've taken at SFU, not because of the content because of Allan and his unorthodox teaching methods. He does not use nor post any lecture slides and you have to write everything down whilst in class, imagine writing for 3 hours straight. His notes are scattered overall don't take him take anyone else!!!!!!!!

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: Yo would love this class if you get close to him. BUS 207 depeneds on calculas. it taks time, but in general, loved Allan and my exerince with him, looking forward to take BUS 478 as soon as he ofered the course.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: This was the most unreasonable course I've ever taken. I went to both the TA and profs office hours, redid his assignments a billion times, and spent an entire week studying for the final. The prof is condescending when you ask him questions, and I genuinelly feel that he takes pleasure in seeing students fail. Not qualified to teach.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: Hard to work with him. He did not have any material ( no slide, no practice). His tests so difficult with true/false question (explain). I would like to avoid him if you want to pass or save your money. Gook luck!

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: Didn't like the fact that he doesn't use powerpoint, he is a tough grader too

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: Allan is by far the best prof ever! Take 207 with him only! He has a simple approach, come to class, focus for 3 hrs, go home do the assignments, and you'll be fine. No pre-readings, no quizzes. All assignments are practice questions. and his exams are based off assignments. I wish other classes were like this. pay attention to his notes.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: When you walk into Allan's class, you do not realize the journey you are about to undergo. Upon entering the arena, Allan's warm and welcoming nature provides an air of comfort that makes students feel at home. He presents economics in a way that will make you laugh, learn, and cry tears of joy. A remarkable man, the very best beedie has to offer.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: Overall, He was a alright professor who teaches you to understand the material. But when it comes to the exams, the questions are similar to the assignments, but more harder and trickier to solve. I did not buy a textbook and just used my friends. The assignments and notes are the only things you should focus on when studying for exams.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: I wish I would have done better but thats on me. This is an amazing professor. He is great at teaching and he's hilarious. If you do your assignments on your own you will not have any issues with the midterm nor the final. All I will say is: if you do as he says, you'll succeed.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: I have zero respect for this bald guy. He does very minimal to provide secondary sources to help his students learn. If you go to his lectures, he will go at a fast pace and not allow his students to write down the materials. The worst part is that there are no lecture slides or notes. So, this class tests you on the things he says and thats it.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: IF YOU ARE READING THIS PLEASE AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS. This guy actually does not teach. He puts in zero effort in this class and doesn't have any lecture slides or any secondary sources we can refer off of. Basically, he expects us to memorize every thing that comes out of his mouth. This guy is one of the most arrogant professors I have ever had.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: Class attendance in necessary as he does handwritten notes; his style of notes are very sporadic so when you are reviewing for exams it's difficult to understand what is going on. The textbook was only necessary for assignment questions but not necessarily for course content.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: teaches you to understand material, not to memorize it. If you like logic and math (leaning more towards finance) you'll probably love this class. Textbook use is minimal, only for a few easy questions on the homework. if you wanna save money split a textbook between you and a few friends. Use his notes and assignments to study.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: Surprisingly ended up being one of my favorite business professors as he makes a dry course more interesting with anecdotes and comedy. The only complaint I would have is that some of his in-class examples do not apply to the weekly assignments leaving you to figure it out by yourself or go to a TA, who aren't very helpful.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: Homework average is super darn high, and averages for exams are usually low. Follow his advice and do the assignments over and over again. Don't bother reading from the textbook, his T/F or MC questions come from stuff he mentions in lectures that he doesn't necessarily get you to write down. Funny guy, not as bad as everyone makes him to be.

Name: Allan Matadeen
Review: I scored very poorly on the midterm, but worked very hard to prep for the final exam - redoing assignments and understanding concepts and passing the course. Allan is a great personality but the course is very demanding. Attend EVERY lecture!

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: Very knowledgeable, she has interesting lectures. iClicker questions during class for credit. It doesn't matter if your conclusion is wrong, as long as you defend it.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: This is too difficult for a 100 course. Her lecture is not high-quality compare with what she expected to her students. Do not take her class.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: I do just fine at stats but couldn't crack this weird pseudo-programming philosophy. I passed the class & still have no idea how; lectures vary between horrifically byzantine & yawn inducing. No time for midterms, which are themselves a nightmare. Book isn't helpful, neither is she. Absolutely murdered my GPA. Abandon hope all ye who enter here.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: She's the best

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: Don't do this to yourself. Take something else.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: The material interested me, including both of the textbooks. But when 55 min feels like an eternity, something is wrong! The lecture slides felt incomplete and dry. Her expectations regarding exams or essays were non-existent. I love philosophy, but not enough to sit through these lectures.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: Do not take this class. Her explanations are all over the place, not only that but TAs are no help. Regret taking this class.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: There are lots of iclicker questions so participation in lectures is mandatory. Lectures move really fast so dont blink or youll miss something. TAs always say theyre confussed and stressed when you go for help. Grade scale/curve is TERRIBLE, you get little time to do exams, exams are marked SO HARD mc with a twist is absolutely horrible!

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: lecture material is often overcomplicated, leading to confusion on course material

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: Where to begin... PHIL 100W requires class attendance because she makes iClicker questions and some of the material from class discussions ends up on the midterms and finals. The term papers are very hard to get a good mark on. Average of the class for the midterm was 16/31. Tutorials didn't help at all, made the material even more confusing.

Name: Jill McIntosh
