Review: she was alright, not the best teacher but not the worst, i thoroughly enjoyed showing up to her classes, mainly because it was fun because of the students i got with my group!

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: this prof is the worst prof I ever had, she goes through materials really quickly, does not explain things well.  her lectures are boring ah... but u are encouraged to participant in lectures by doing iclicker quizzes, highly recommend u to do that so u can gain as much credit as u can even u dont know the answers, just randomly select one.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: I am in her PHIL105 class and she goes very slowly. Without showing up to a single tutorial, I've had no problem getting an A on the tests. Most of the class was common sense so long as you can remember the important vocabulary. Although her slow progression through the material is boring, it is very clear and you are sure to understand it.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: in my opinion, the material of this class is not hard but super confused. it is important to have a tutor outside of school if you want a good grade.  but the professor is suck!! she is not nice at all!! she used the words such as " don't bother your TA""that's not you business""i'm not repeating myself" and reject to answer you or help you.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: Although attendance was optional for tutorials I do recommend you attend them, because the content is heavy and confusing. Class average was 40%; it was a difficult course. She essentially read off her written notes during lectures which she emailed us each week. If you're confused, GO AND SEE YOUR TA because the grading criteria is very specific.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: Like to put students on spot. Especially those primary or first language is other than English.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. Her lectures completely suck. Either you skip, or fall asleep during lecture. The exams are tough, very hard to understand, and are set up so that you fail. Unless you are going into phil, DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. Trust me!! you will fail or get a D. Hardest class ever. harder than calc...

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: The subject matter she teaches is very difficult but I think she is doing her best. There is every opportunity to go to her or a TA with any issues you are having. She is also pretty friendly albeit intimidating. In this case blame the course not the teacher.

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: terrible class. biggest mistake. 1st class that ive ever done poorly in. tried very hard, attended hours etc etc, but still failed as her exams are BOGUS, insanely vague, misleading and marked unfairly. lectures also do not help, and concepts are poorly explained, if at all. trust me and DO NOT TAKE

Name: Jill McIntosh
Review: One of my biggest regrets in life is taking this class. I took this as an elective thinking it would be fun to learn but the information is too dense and her slides aren't engaging at all. She goes really fast during lecture and does't make her notes fillable on word so its hard to keep up. If you're thinking of taking this class, DO NOT.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Like Shafiq as my teacher very much. His lectures are excellent. Never miss them. He gives lots of examples and he relates the material to stuff we can understand. We finished midterm exam and unlike some teachers he covers only stuff we have covered in class in exam and marks were very fair. He will call you back on weekends if you have questions

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: the guy starts talking shop the moment you ask a question

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Shafik is by far one of my favourite teachers. He is always accessible and wants you to succeed in every way possible. He focuses on teaching until the whole class understands. This means he will never rush his lectures and will dedicate 3 to sometimes 4 classes for one chapter. Make sure to take Shafik if you ever get the opportunity.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: I am there at 8:30 a.m. for his class, and on Fridays yeah! I love this prof. His classes are great. He involves you in lectures when he gives examples. Makes things crystal clear. Need more like him. Good luck getting in his class. I waited to get in his class now for 2 semesters and finally

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Amazing prof. You'll actually enjoy going to class. I dare you to sit in the front;) haha. Just study examples and terms, you'll do fine. :)

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Shafiq clearly loves law by the passion he shows in his lecture. Attending his lectures is like going to theatre and you get a performance. It is like being entertained while you are learning and it is painless:) he is very good. One of my favourite teachers 4 sure.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Good teacher but lectures are a bit on the longer side sometimes. He could give a longer break in the class. Examples are very good but some examples a bit too long

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Best prof I have had at Beedie, hands down. Waiting for the fall semester to have his other course in ethics. Will also take his employment Law course when he teaches.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Taking business ethics and also business law with him at SFU. His classes are always full, even the early morning one on Tuesday at 8:30 . He comes very prepared to perform. He is very good and has a way of making material interesting and enjoyable with real examples. He is always available to help, even okay taking calls at his office.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: BEST PROF EVER! Took 393 with him never really studied just went to lecture and took notes, he gives really good examples so you don't really need to study hard for the midterm or final! But all his classes have really big waitlists which sucks! Really wanted to take 303 with him but the waitlist was all filled up. Wish he taught more classes

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: One of the best professor I have had at SFU. Great entertaining lectures. Read the book to get the harder questions on the exam.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Shafiq is an ecellent prof. Very caring and smart. I took his business ethics class and found him very good at explaning difficult concepts with examples. Fair marker. He loves people participating and very good at getting people to participate. Very respectful. I am taking bus 393 with him in the fall. Just got in his class. Was on waitlist.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Amazing lectures, easy to understand, always prepared and very engaging. I will take him again in ethics course business 303. I wish he would soon teach employment Law course. My friend took his employment course and said he was excellent.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Best teacher I have had at SFU by a mile and a half. I wish I had taken him in Bus 303 because his bus 393 class rocked. He is really good.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: I took CRIM 1116 at Langara with Shafik and he was my favourite teacher because he was hilarious and taught the material effectively. The two downsides are he isn't approachable when you don't get something ,which effected my final exam mark and would've gotten it right had he explained it, and his exams are short but he tries to trick you in them.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Best professor at SFU by a mile. Shafik is engaging and makes the material so interesting to the point where it excites you to go to lectures and learn. Would highly recommend taking any class with the GOAT.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Amazing prof, never missed lecture! Love the way he teaches, everything just sticks with you when you are studying for exams. He has a strict no cell phone rule but overall a really funny and inspiring prof! If your taking 393, take it with him he's the best!

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Loved Shafik, he is so great! He is very interesting to listen to since he has lots of passion for law and brings up hilarious examples in class to relate to the concepts he is teaching. Very easy to sit through the lectures because they are super entertaining, don't skip them tho he tests on what he covers in class. Never opened the book

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: Super duper guy. His lectures are really really good. He tells stories to explain difficult concepts Andy uses examples you can relate to in your own life which makes it understanle. He loves participation and will remember your name if you participate and use you in his examples. I am surprised he remembered my name in a class of 90 students.

Name: Shafik Bhalloo
Review: I had prof Shafiq for bus 303 and enjoyed it so much that I have him for BUS393. He make law and ethics very easy to understand and he has really good example to break things down in bite sizes to make you understand. His lectures are really good. I am there at 8:30 in the morning. Not many classes in the last 3 years I have woken up for at 8:30

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Has a clear teaching style and a good dry sense of humor that brightens up the lectures a bit. Exams were fair so long as you take notes during lectures, since he mentions specific things that will be on the exam. Definitely recommend the online course, it's one of the more straightforward online ones I've taken

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: First things first, he's pretty funny, and it makes the lecture not so boring. He tells you EXACTLY what's going to be on his exams. He only posts parts of notes online, so go to lectures. The exam is based on the review slides he shows in class, but also bits from the textbook about that slide that you wouldn't know if you didn't read it.

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Hands down the best crim prof ever. Extremely easy as long as you attend lectures and tutorials for all his notes. Barry keeps everything simple, and you have to be incredibly dumb or lazy to fail his course. BONUS- he's hilarious

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: I took both Crim 101 and Crim 104. Loved Barry in both. He's an amazing teacher and goes into depth with his lectures. When lecturing he'll make jokes (like sending the TA's up to the students that talk during lecture to beat them) and have funny pictures on the slides to keep students engaged. Would definitely take his classes again.

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: You definitely have to read and memorize to do well in this class but he doesnt trick you, his tests are exactly what the notes are and he grades pretty generously. He always has good TA s. You dont need the textbook and hes hilarious.

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Dry lectures, be prepared to type 3000+ words every lecture and do not bother reading the textbook. Just remember his slides.

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: BEST PROFESSOR EVER. CRIM 101 WILL FOREVER BE MY FAVOURITE CLASS. I can't even stress how easy this class is. Just memorize all the notes absolutely no need to do the readings. Start studying for the midterm and final 1 week in advance memorize 1 chapter's notes per day and you will get an A I promise you. Make sure you memorize ALL the notes.

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Intriguing lectures and very funny guy! He sets out clear expectations for the class and sticks to it. You have to memorize a lot but the info isn't difficult. One of the best crim profs at sfu

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Barry is nice and passionate about what he's talking about, tests aren't too hard if you read what you're supposed to and pay attention in class. Talks about important things in class that you don't get from the textbook and his lecture notes that he posts online aren't completed so you have to go to class to get the information!

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: He's a really good prof, but he doesn't post his slides so students have to attend the class. Tut attendance and participation are really important. Before each exam, he does a review of important topics, and if you memorize that review you can get 100%. What you get on your paper depends on your TA (hope yall get a nice TA :D)

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Barry is a GREAT prof. No tricks on exams or papers and a VERY generous marker. You have to come to lectures and tutorials to achieve your grade but class is not difficult. The TA's were really approachable. 10/10 recommend!!

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: This is the second class ive taken with Barry and he is my favorite prof. You need to attend lectures and take notes, but if you do you can get an A. His tests are fair and easy to do well on as long as you attend lectures. He cracks some jokes and tries to not make it too dull.

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: The only thing you really need the textbook for is for your term paper otherwise everything you learn in the textbook is covered in lecture. Pretty much everything you need to know for the midterm and final is in the notes, so as long as you copy down the slides you are good to go. He doesn't post the slides online, but he gives you note outlines.

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Funny guy who tried to make the more boring material funny. Tests were super straightforward and based on memorization. He highlighted all important material for us in the lecture before midterm & final. Textbook needed as not everything covered in class was in enough detail. Notes posted online are only outlines, must attend lecture for full notes

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Pretty funny guy. Makes the 2hour lecture more bearable. Exams were SUPER easy and straightforward. If it wasnt for my paper that pulled my grade down dramatically, I wouldve received a solid 98% in the class. Definitely recommend

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Laziest prof ever. Did the bare minimum to run a course, 2.5 lectures were literally just Hollywood films. That said, easiest A+ ever, and you don't need the textbook because his lecture slides are just a regurgitation of it and he doesn't test on anything more. The paper was a godawful topic (but short).

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Interesting professor. He tries to put humor into the lectures to make it less boring and difficult. His lecture notes are heavy so beware of that. 20% for participation for tutorial seems peculiar. He does not upload lecture notes. To fairly put, nice course but wouldn't want to take it again.

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: He goes over basically everything you need to know in lecture, be prepared to take notes though. Doesn't post anything online so you gotta show up unless you wanna read the textbook. He gives plenty of time to write everything down and does review of everything you need to know for the midterm or final the lecture before.

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: Tests are based on lecture and tutorial slides, he's funny and interesting (even thought he mostly just reads off his slides).

Name: Barry Cartwright
Review: I enjoyed this class so far the mid term was really easy if you pay attention in tutorial and lectures. A large part of your grade is participation which can easily boost your mark. The lectures are clear and he gives time to take all the notes needed. You do have to attend but it isn't painful to sit through.

Name: David Cox
Review: tok gis class and failed royally, good thing prof COX had some "extra credit" ;)

Name: David Cox
Review: Worst prof ever met, and his lecture is so boring. Basically what he do is just reading his hand written lecture notes. The best thing of class is the classroom, help me get sleep easily.

Name: David Cox
Review: Very boring lectures content is okay. Easy to teachyourself material read slides and text. Could easily skip lectures.

Name: David Cox
Review: He is the worst prof i ever had in SFU. His way of teaching is boring and so hard to follow. Come to his lecture doesnt help at all because all he do is just reading the lecture slide. His exam marking are so difficult.

Name: David Cox
Review: As everyone says, his lectures are pretty boring. I bombed the midterm, stopped going to class and just studied everything on my own and finished with an A (final mark can replace midterm mark). His exams are fair, just study the lecture notes and the textbook and you will do well.

Name: David Cox
Review: Prof Cox is definitely very knowledgeable about the subject. Though as a 400-seminar, wasn't much discussion. 1 final paper + in-class presentation. His exams make you think (not direct memorize-spew of info), and he adequately prepares you with his in-depth notes. Easily accessible for questions (responds e-mails pretty quick). Fair grader

Name: David Cox
Review: You can tell that prof. cox is trying to not be boring. he inflects his voice and gives real-life examples. In spite of which, every time he speaks, I just want to go to sleep. The good thing is that he gives you notes so that you don't have to read the textbook. Stil, it's best not to take his classes. He's the most boring prof I've ever had

Name: David Cox
Review: His lecture is really boring. You don't need to listen any lectures. Just read your his notes, which is really similar as textbook. Just read notes and hand in assignment. And his exams are fair

Name: David Cox
Review: Although I found his class boring, he teaches ECON 105 the way it should be taught. He is definitely an easier compared to the other profs. I found the final easier than the midterm. To do well in his class, you should be constantly reviewing the KEY concepts in his lecture notes, read the book and BUY THE STUDY GUIDE!!!!!!!!

Name: David Cox
Review: People who say his lectures are boring are people who have no interest in Economics. David is an awesome lecturer and gives great explanations of macroeconomic concepts. Read textbook and attend lectures.

Name: David Cox
Review: his exams are fair. If you study the textbook, you should do well. His classes are boring but he makes up for it by giving easy exams.

Name: David Cox
Review: Notes are hand written and scanned into a 30 page pdf. file but are very thorough and clear so you can essentially teach yourself. Lectures and tutorials are quite dry and not very engaging - thus only 20-30% of the class actually attends lecture. Exams are MC and long answer, which are difficult but fair. Average mark on midterm 55-65%.

Name: David Cox
Review: Skipped most of his lectures. Boring lectures. Just buy the textbook and use the study guide. Read it and do questions from the study guide. Got an A on the midterm and studied simply by reading the textbook and doing questions on the study guide. Final is decent as well. Teaches Econ how it should be taught. No complaints here

Name: David Cox
Review: Easy course, but makes it hard. mid term is fair but final is not really relevant to the material covered in class. Lectures are heavy.

Name: David Cox
Review: His lectures are long and boring. Rarely attend the lecture. Tips for getting a good grade: READ THE TEXTBOOK AND YOU WILL BE GOOD. I was below average for the midterm cuz I just read his notes. Spend 3 days before the final to go through the whole textbook and got an A for this course.

Name: David Cox
Review: Lectures were dry, basically read the notes that he posted online. Notes were often unclear and missed some points so it's a smart idea to read the textbook as well. Exams and homework were decent. My main issue with Dave was that he didn't scale or curve the class at the end and the class average was a C. Decent prof and class as far as ECON goes.

Name: David Cox
Review: He's an alright prof. No need for lectures because his notes and examples in class are literally a copy of the textbook. You don't really need the textbook either other than for the questions and clarification. Assignments are short and easy. Tests are perfectly fair and easy if you do the study guide and study his notes.

Name: David Cox
Review: Lectures were very dry but useful for the midterm short answer questions so sit in the front to pay attention. There are homework assignments but they are fairly straight forward. Overall, the material itself is pretty easy to understand, but I would not recommend taking this course if it is not mandatory.

Name: David Cox
Review: Dave's notes are very thorough with everything you need to know. I actually gave up reading the textbook after the midterm because the textbook is extremely dry and instead just relied solely on the notes and listening to his lectures. He is clearly passionate about economics and taught the material well. He won't inspire or amuse but he's solid.

Name: David Cox
Review: Going to lectures for this class is not necessary as his notes are a copy of the textbook. Exams were not too difficult. Averages are low but it is not hard to do well if you read the textbook, look over his notes, and do the assignment questions. He does not curve his course so don't rely on a low class average to get a good mark in this class.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: This is an extremely demanding course so you need to be determined to work hard. Has high expectations but does set you up for success if you are willing to put in the hard work. Do not take many courses alongside this course, you will need to spend everyday doing math to succeed. Do all the work as the tests are fair and based on them.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Currently in this course for PDPn requirements. It's October now, and this course has already made me switch my entire plan for graduation. This is by far the worst math course I have ever taken in my UD degree. It's literally horrible. Good luck to all future teachers with this course. I'm happy if I barely pass.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: DO NOT under any circumstance take her class. If you are given this prof drop the class. She is the least understanding person I have ever had the misfortunate of interacting with. Started the class by joking about how inaccessible she is and the semester went down hill from there. Dr. Menz does not realize that first years does not have PHD's

Name: Petra Menz
Review: take her if you wanna fail 157

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Dont take math 157 with her unless you wanna fail

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Decent math prof. Felt bad because she was constantly joked about and turned into a meme. Her slides are helpful. Exams were fair.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Prides herself on how hard her class is and how many students she fails, do not take any of her classes.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Previous calculus experience would be a big asset. The prof goes through concepts at an unrelenting pace; blink, and you'll miss an entire slide of notes. Studied using her lecture notes and IQs (never touched textbook nor did any CNQs) and got solid marks on the exams. Walked out of most lectures confused, but her teaching style kept me focused.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: I did not take Calculus in high school and I still managed to get an A+ in the class. I just did the questions provided in the notes and it was enough to understand how to do other similar questions. The midterms and final were easy and fair.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: The class isn't hard as long as you are naturally good at math and/or have taken calculus in high school. As someone who did already take calc, I can say that Petra didn't do the best job at explaining certain things and I usually just used my knowledge from calc 12 because her methods were wack. Also, learn the correct notation on everything.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Honestly, the exams are much easier than the paper worksheets and online questions. It isn't even comparable. She puts very easy and fair questions that are nothing like the notes as the notes have much harder questions. It is an easy class granted you pay attention and practice problems/do homework without googling everything.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: She is too smart to teach a basic level course like 157. It's difficult for someone that smart to teach students who have no idea what's going on. Feel guilty complaining as she does care for everyone to do well and tries to give us bonuses to pass, but this class was just SO hard. Overall, wouldn't recommend 157 to anyone because you will HATE IT.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: I WAS SUPER SHOCKED AT HOW THE NOTES MADE NO SENSE BUT THEN THE FINAL WAS EVEN HARDER!!!! This was one prof i will never forget for life. Dont take this prof!

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Please save yourself the sleepless nights and take a different prof!

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Final was nothing like the notes, notes were nothing but fill in the blanks. Math is not being taught the right way.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Trust me, never take this prof's math 157. If u need it, just take a different prof. She is Slightly mean. Lots of homework(you need to spend at least 3-4 hours on hw every week), Incomprehensible lecture(rush lec and think everyone already understand it), terrible note(bad hand writing, and left lots of blank in the note, go learn by yourself!)

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Obscure midterms that have questions youve never come across before, uses true/false questions for a math midterm, expects you to know everything, way too many concepts in this course to cover in 13 weeks.

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Save yourself the work and choose another prof you will regret taking the class with petra. If you dont believe me see for yourself!

Name: Petra Menz
Review: I couldnt follow her way of teaching as she blew through notes super quick in her lectures. She was not engaging at all. Dont reccomend at all

Name: Petra Menz
Review: Came in motivated but after the first mid term she didnt seem to care much about explaining her methods and her notes became really dry and hard to follow!

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: I took 105 & 106 with Pearce. He is probably the best profs for those classes, as he did not expect anything serious from students. Be aware of his exams (very tricky MCQ).

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: Took in 2016. Pearce had some interesting points to make, but overall there wasn't much to learn. I wish he had put more time into making the course substantial. We spent many hours of class watching vaguely relevant movies. There were almost no tests/assignments. He's kind of a crazy prof, but that also means he's interesting to talk to.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: Steven may not be the best at teaching, but, he makes the class super easy! The average for the class was a B+ and the exams were not very difficult. On top of this, he's very funny and I actually enjoyed coming to lectures. The group project can be tricky if you get a poor team, but that is completely separate from the teaching material anyway.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: The worst prof I have ever had hands down. Avoid at all costs because you will not learn anything. Spend your money on a prof that you will actually learn from and wont have waste your time.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: GOOD professor, funny guy, not a tough grader.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: This guy is not good if you want to gain knowledge but if you only needs grades then take this guy.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: Steve is not a good lecturer, just reads slides of text to you, not even covering useful material, and complains about having to be there. Makes inappropriate jokes and is very unprofessional. Midterm and final are almost all multiple choice and almost half the questions are based on his opinions. Avoid.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: I loved his lectures. class was math heavy, with extra theorems.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: Contrary to what a lot of students say about him, I thought he was amazingly witty during lectures. He tries to engage the students with almost a comedic approach. He's very blunt, and let's you know ahead of time what to study and lookout for. Cheat sheets are allowed for midterms, and if you visit his office hours, he's genuinely a caring guy.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: discourages asking questions in class and ESPECIALLY through email. Lectures are basically useless; read the text and lecture slides. He'll hint half of material on the exams in the last few lectures leading up to an exam. Make sure you know how to answer questions on previous exams-- they will be very similar

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: Cheat sheet for midterms. Hints at questions that will be asked. Slides sent in email. Graded homework (10%). Class ends early. Textbook, WIkipedia, few sources for slides. Rude to students and TAs. Expects us to know terminology and material before it is covered (during lectures).

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: Enthusiastic guy. Seems very intelligent. But horrible lecturer and either is unwilling or unable to pass on basic information on either course material or course logistics. Worth seeing outside of lectures - he's helpful then.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: I regret not taking CMPT300 with a better prof. He "accidently" sends out the answer key for old final exams but intentionally has some wrong answers on them so people don't just memorize them. More concerned about keeping the average high so he doesn't get fired rather than making sure we learn the material. Final was all MC. I didn't learn much.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: Clear on what to be expected on exams. Slides are snips of Wikipedia which means he just reads off slides. Read textbooks to grasp concepts before classes. Always double check your grades. Final exams had wrong answer keys, so for the midterm exams. Otherwise, it's easy with Steven

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: This class was very disorganized probably because it was his first time teaching Cmpt 110. Overall his lectures were not as bad as it seems and if you read the lectures ahead of time, this class is a breeze. His final had some questions which were not in the study material but it's scaled so you'll end up with a higher grade than expected.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: I took 2 courses with him back to back and he is fun. He will tell you exactly what is on the exam. You might not understand the stuff in class but reading his slides and marking important ones will do the job. It's highly likely you will end up with good grade without understanding most of the stuff. Good luck!

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: He was really easy on us UFV students, at least this semester. No quizzes, easy assignments, short lectures. His lectures consist of 70-90 slides but ends up being half of that as he'll tell you what to study and what not to. The midterm was almost all multiple choice, but are really hard and require you to know your stuff to choose the correct 1

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: He is a legend, definitely should take his course. He is inspirational, and wont let you just memorize stuff, but let you understand it and absorb it.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: He is my favourite teacher at university of Fraser Valley. His way of teaching is really interesting and funny, which makes us easy to understand. Hope to get good marks in this course.

Name: Steven Pearce
Review: Very disorganized prof. Copies and pastes material from wikipedia onto lecture slides and tells the class to "read it". Assignments at the start were nothing like lecture material because he ripped it off the online class. Way too much theory. Lazy prof, does not help during office hours. TA is even worse.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Genuinely nice lady who cares that her students do well. Encourages a lot of in class participation and tests on things she may have not went over in class but were in assigned readings. If you show up to class and pay attention you could pass with a decent grade but you really gotta go over the readings and understand material to get an A

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: An amazing professor who genuinely cares about her students education and their well being.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Dr. Ro is nice and tries to do her best to convey the course material. The course itself however is all over the place in terms of content, and as it being the first time she was teaching it, the class and TA's were left wondering what's going on frequently. I know she had personal problems this sem but it led to a lot of disorganized mess for us.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Awful prof! A lot of course materials and readings. Exams are difficult.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Y'all this class had me dyiNG like the workload is crazy and you have to read some dried up textbook + other articles. I mean I'm getting a good mark and all but there's just so much happening that it hits you like a bus and you just wanna lay in a corner and cry. If you're taking this as an elective ha ha run for the hills don't do it!!

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: She's very motherly. Her exams are quite difficult if you aren't caught up with readings or if you don't show up to lecture. She is very specific with what she wants for your exam answers (must be detailed answers). Always keep up with readings, show up to lecture (participations questions), go to tutorial! Ask questions! Do assignments!

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: HATED this class lol. Took it as my B-Sci and wouldn't recommend. The exams were soo hard and there were A LOT of tutorial assignments and readings. Literally so many readings and documentaries that you have to watch. Super hard to keep up with especially if you have other content-heavy courses. There is also TopHat participation every lecture...

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: A good prof, but has a lot of expectations. Exams are a bit rough but only if you don't study accordingly. Be prepared for lots and lots of readings (textbook is hella dry) because they will show up on exams. Other then that, she's a nice prof once you get to know her, study hard, do the assignments properly, don't slack and you'll be fine.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: In terms of Dr. Tucker she is a nice enough prof. I personally felt like she picked favourites which made participating in class less enjoyable. Her lectures are 3 hours of pointless she just rambles and covers easy stuff and skips harder material. Her lectures are somewhat clear but I taught myself a lot. WAY TO MANY assignments and papers!!!!!!!!

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: (for 307) In my opinion Dr. Tucker seemed "nice" but when I spoke to her privately she was a bit rude. I did not like her teaching style she gave us 5 quizes one every two weeks, 3 long tutorial assignments and 2 heavy papers. These conflicted with several other class test times! Her quizes were not the easiest and her lectures are terrible!

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Dr. Ro genuinely cares about her students. She teaches you how to study smart. She tells you absolutely EVERYTHING you need for exams and her assignments in lecture, it's up to you take notes. I feel like people who didn't do well most likely just decided to study only off her slides. Listen to what she actually emphasizes and repeats in lecture.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: One of my favourite profs, shes super engaging and makes the content enjoyable to learn

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Dr. RO is AMAZING! She is such a good prof and is very helpful. She gives great advice on how to do well in class and actually wants her class to do well. Be sure to attend lectures, since they are very educational and try to get through textbook readings and pay attention to review sessions.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Horrible professor. Her laugh and tone of voice is obnoxious, and she uses vulgar language.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Course was dull, with a ton of reading (30 pages-ish a week) but my issue was with the tests. It's an introductory course, but Dr. Ro tested on very specific things from the textbook or from, say, one slide in a lecture. So you might have understood the concept, but it didn't matter. She also took attendance in class, but was late multiple times!

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Dr. Ro is very passionate about what she teaches and cares about her students. Her lectures are extremely organized and she's always looking to improve so that students can learn better in her classes. She will drop major hints on what to expect on the midterm/exams but be prepared to study and read the textbook.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Very well thought out lectures. Very helpful outside the class especially in office hours , gives one on one advice. Must read the textbook if you want to do well.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Took HSCI130 as an elective - did not enjoy at all. The course material was interesting enough, but Dr. Tucker was not a great professor. Very "my way or the highway", which spilt over to the tests. Tests were hard - very specific and crammed in too much material. Not enjoyable, and a ton of reading. Also very tough with attendance.

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: Dr. Ro can seem a bit intimidating but once you stop by her office hours she is one of the best profs in the HSCI faculty. She drops MAJOR hints on what will be on the midterms and final, as well as being super accessible with her pre-exam online chats! Make sure to stay on top of your readings and ask questions! Definitely recommend!!

Name: Rochelle Tucker
Review: This prof gave lots of opportunity for questions in lecture and through online google doc talks. Unfortunately despite these efforts I had a hard time connecting to course material, lectures were mandatory and we used TopHat, an app to check how often you came to class. I found that she was often unkind, her way or the highway kind of character.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Anne is a sweet prof. However her lectures are very boring and not very helpful. I found the textbook and the tutorials to be closer related to the exam material.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Attends every lecture and relies on youtube videos to understand the material. Funny how 5 minutes videos explain so much better than her 2 hour lecture.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Prof was really boring and basically just read off the slides

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: her lectures are so boring! She is the most boring professor I've ever had and her slides and messy and unorganized. Homework assignments take hours even if you don 't put full effort into them. A pointless class that has just done nothing but make my stress and anxiety skyrocket.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: very unapproachable.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Very nice person, relatively boring teacher, and a wild marker. You can follow the criteria until the cows come home and still end up with a C on an assignment. Luckily the class content itself was pretty easy.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: The class is meh, I mean it is accounting it's going to be pretty similar across all teachers. Coming to class really isn't all that neccesary because there is so much content to learn, most of that learning comes from the book, not the class. Also the final was extremely long, I mean at least 60% of the class was still there till the end.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Grades based on her imagination.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Just seems like she doesn't care about being a fair marker. I've heard of numerous cases where students didn't get the marks they deserved. Overall unapprochable and her lecture slides are useless for studying. Took her last year and speaking on behalf of what I'm hearing from her this year - she seems to have gotten worse?

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: her lecture is really useful and her test is not that hard.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Stopped going to lectures less than halfway through the semester and did well on the midterm and although they're not marked yet, I feel like I did just fine on the final. The textbook is helpful for practice questions/general clarification. PRACTICE as much as you can as this will really be what helps you on the exams. Seriously, just practice.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: There are few who very clear with what they teach. I always understood what she was teaching in class. There is no point in missing class, firstly you've paid a lot to be there, and when you have someone teaching who has worked for the largest accounting firms (BIG 4), you HAVE to be there. Her office hours are helpful. Gotta work hard for final.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Exams are hard and there is barely any time to fully complete them. Pop quizzes but they are marked quite easy. Theory questions on exams are difficult. Lectures are dry and not necessary. Take your own notes!

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Anne is an extremely professional and well-spoken lecturer. Her passion for accounting can be seen through her engaging lectures and clear explanations. BUS 251 can be a tough course for many people but she takes the time to slowly explain concepts if you get to know her. Highly recommend!

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: She is one of those profs that would be worth it to wait until her class is available Many people around me found BUS 251 a challenging course, but people who took this course with me taught by Anne, found her lecture great Although I had it was a 5-7 pm lecture followed by a 9-10 pm tutorial, I did not even miss a single one of them

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Understand your financial statements and how journal entries affect them. If so, guaranteed A+

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: no just no.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Be ready for long and heavy exams with very little time.  A bunch of people didn't even get to finish the exam under 2 hours. If there was more time or less questions, I think a lot more people would have done well on her exams.

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: Awesome professor! She was super willing to help out and I actually learned a lot!

Name: Anne MacDonald
Review: It was a pretty standard accounting class. She is a nice teacher and does a pretty good job, the material is just a bit inherently dry.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Probably the worst prof I've ever had. When I asked why my paper was graded low, he said it was because I got a low mark on my midterm. I would stay away from Gary, his lectures are pointless and boring, exams are all on the readings, which ae very dry

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Amazing prof. Inspired me to change majors to cmns. Interesting and engaging lectures. Well-informed with pop. culture. One of the best memories at SFU. Would definitely take more classes with this prof. You learn AND you have fun!

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: amazing prof, hilarious and outstanding. Ideal Prof.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: The online course is just mountains of reading, extremely irritating online discussions which, unless you get very lucky, you have to drag your group-mates through, and writing assignments. If you like the topic, you might like the course; if you have a passive interest, just take something with less reading because it will monopolize your time.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: CMNS has a lot of readings, duh, but the lecture is where it is at. Gary is a fantastic lecturer and has honestly been the main reason why I switched majors. He knows how to make every topic (even the dreary ones) interesting and keeps lectures entertaining. If you have trouble with anything him and his TAs are fantastic. Really recommend this one.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: I think I am in love with Gary, seriously I am really bad about skipping class- but I lived to go to Gary's lectures. He was always funny and engaging and basically possessed all the qualities one could hope for in a prof. Also, if you do the most readings you will get a good grade in the class, exam format is super fair- he wants you to pass.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: He is a good professor, but his classes can be boring and long. Very easy course

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Gary was an amazing prof! Funny and gave many interesting examples that aided the points of the lecture. He made dry course content as easy to follow as possible, overall great prof.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: 3rd year and he's the best prof I had at SFU. Sparks great interest when relating material to  current events. Topics and approaches are modern and engaging.  I wish all my communication courses were taken with this prof.  Either attending lectures or completing all readings is decent for exam prep.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: How can you go wrong with a guy that drops an F bomb right in the first lecture? Gary is engaging, incredibly intelligent, knows his stuff and passionate. He is the reason that I am pursuing CMNS. However, be prepared that he doesn't talk about the readings at all. Great prof, would highly recommend!

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: He gives great examples to help students understand broader concepts and his exams were better than i thought ! Just make sure to read the readings and listen in tutorial very well; I feel that the grades really depend upon the TA you get since they are the ones marking your exams and term paper. But i don't recommend this as gpa booster!!

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Great teacher, easily the best prof at SFU, the way he talks to you when you approach him gives you confidence

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Gary's lectures are interesting and fun. You'll get really engage in the stories he tells!

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Gary is a great professor. He's a really down-to-earth kind of guy, who always has something interesting to say. I would definitely recommend taking this class, and although this is the only course I have taken with him thus far, I would recommend any of the courses he teaches. Cool guy, decent class.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Absolutely the most entertaining lectures I have ever been to. Gary is the sort of guy you would want at your holiday suppers.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Such an awesome professor. The course material is interesting, and the prof really keeps it entertaining. It's not an easy A type class, but it is so interesting to me that I want to put in the extra time to study. I think because of this prof, I'll pursue a degree in communications.  I love going to my lectures and tutorials for this class.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Took back on 09, very interesting. Great lectures.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: His lectures are very dry and he puts an excessive amount of text on the slides. The TAs were nice but not helpful at all. This course brought my whole GPA down and it doesn't even count for WQB. It was my first communications class and it completely turned me off the whole field. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: Honestly, this professor is why I'm pursuing communication studies. He is one of the best professors I've had at SFU. The readings can be dryish, but the readings are essential to understand the course. As well, lectures are quite important, as he expands on ideas necessary to grasp an understanding of the course. If you take 110, take it with him!

Name: Gary McCarron
Review: This is one of the most boring classes I have ever taken at SFU. CMNS 110 requires a lot of reading, and the reading is super long and dry. His lectures are not always related to the readings too, so it can get a little confusing. He is a very nice guy though, and tells some pretty interesting stories.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: Worst prof ever. His midterm and final is extreme hard and he had not even mention these stuffs in class. He is a very sensitive and emotional people, very easy to get anything into personal. He will suddenly be in a great rage about anything he does not like even give you a 0 for your midterm just because you glance up at him.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: i learned nothing

Name: Scott Pai
Review: Never choose this course especially with him. His teaching is really bad. He would skip the topics and ask you to watch you tube video to increasing His views. His overall performance is FUDU.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: It was a really really hard course and his pronunciation is terrible and he can not speak English that well but if you sit on the first row of the class he will give students better grade for their participation.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: The course was hard. You need to put in hours, understanding the theory and doing the problems. Solving the entire textbook. Due to its difficulty for a 200 level course one would have a tendency to put the blame on the professor. He was decent in my opinion, lectures are clear and to the point, he tells you what to expect (posts sample tests).

Name: Scott Pai
Review: Class average is only C... If you work with another prof, class average is B-

Name: Scott Pai
Review: Scott teaching habits: -Lates for class -Tells us to bring another prof's notes, but barely uses them -Uses 1 example or anecdote and repeats again & again -Occasionally says "HELLO!" to make sure you are listening -Makes us read his "reading assignment" which are poorly filmed YouTube videos -Goes overtime to teach new and important content

Name: Scott Pai
Review: I am majoring in Comp Science so STAT 270 was one of the mandatory courses that I had to take. The course itself is the worst course I have ever had. And Scott himself is no better than the course. The average for 3rd midterm was 47% and he literally said "If u guys fail, I won't have sympathy for u". Don't waste ur time and money.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: Do not at any cost take this course. No matter how hard working you are it will and i repeat IT WILL CRUSH you. He first off, never make it to class on time, extend the class cause of his lateness, does not offer decent office hours that correlate with the difficulty of his class, does not explain. His exam are was to long and impossible to finish!

Name: Scott Pai
Review: All the negative reviews are really accurate, just please do not take a class with him AT ALL COSTS, just try waiting for a semester where a decent prof is teaching this course. SCOTT PAI IS THE WORST PROF EVER, he deserves a 0/5 rather than a 2.9 on here.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: He thinks he is very nice. um.... avoid him

Name: Scott Pai
Review: friendly reminder: for CS major, STAT 270 or Bus 232 is only prerequisite of CMPT 353, for data science major, u may take STAT 203, for statistics major, u may take STAT 270 in the summer 2020 because the offering of STAT 285 will not be in the summer. for ur GPA trust me, any lecturer is better than him. Online STAT 270 is also nice, if you follow

Name: Scott Pai
Review: WORST prof I have EVER met in my LIFE!!! Exam is so hard and time consuming that you won't be able to finish it. The exam is WAAAAAAAY harder than other profs. If you are not a genius in STAT, then avoid him at ALL COST! Save your money and spend it on more meaningful things.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: This class is a waking nightmare, and if you really REALLY think you should take it, you might just be more braindead than a coma patient.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: Awful and very rude. The more effort you make, the more frustrating you will be. Midterm is extremely long and hard and not possible to finish.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: this guy sucks! misses stuff that the course is suppose to offer, and he attitude stinks!

Name: Scott Pai
Review: Scott makes this class extremely frustrating. More often than not, he will rush through important topics, leaving us on our own. He almost never comes to class on time, leaving us in lecture for longer than we should be. Despite his hints, exams are very lengthy and difficult, resulting in abysmal averages where up to 80% of the class will fail.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: Actually, online stat 270 or bus 232 are very good choice in the semester. This man makes a 200 course become extremely hard and unclear. He doesnt know what the key points are in the course. AVOID this man! Dont ruin your life!

Name: Scott Pai
Review: He can teach the concepts decently, but doesn't finish the content in class, skips almost half the material in lectures. The class has 4 midterms, with no review lectures. Terrible professor, you'd be better off taking this online and self-studying. Our last midterm had a 31.7% average.

Name: Scott Pai
Review: Even if you have to take a semester off to avoid the course with him! Lectures are close to unhelpful, you need to learn a lot.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Absolutely no denying that IW is a highly knowledgable, passionate, and engaging professor. It is a tough class and understandably some may be frustrated that all class material not on exams, but ended up taking so much more away from course than simply completing credit - everlasting knowledge about the world's history. (Ps. I'm not a geo major).

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: The textbook is quite expensive but pretty essential to passing! Take the map quiz seriously, it'll definitely help your grade. The lectures were quite interesting. This professor is very enthusiastic about the material, which is awesome! I would definitely recommend this class, but be prepared to work for your grade.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Ivor Is by far my favourite prof I've had at SFU.  His eccentricity and energy make every lecture enjoyable.  He almost treats lecturing as an art form and therefore does not simply reiterate powerpoint slides as so many other profs do.  Exams are difficult, partially because he likes to ask a few obscure questions that you didn't bother studying.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Ivor is very passionate about geography. He however, is an old school professor and does not use powerpoints or display lecture notes. You need to keep on top of lecture as the material is key to passing. Extremely difficult tests that he is proud of and term paper criteria is vague at best.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Amazing lecturer and although he doesn't use slides, the way he present keeps you interested and listening throughout. Personally, I liked not having slides because I pay all my attention to listening and not copy-pasting slides as my notes. Don't miss class though because it is difficult to catch up and yes, he makes you work for a good grade.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Winton is old school which means you have to work hard for your marks. No freebies. He did say in his lecture that no one will receive an A, which I found a little daunting, however, he is a very good lecturer and keeps the class engaged. You will learn from him but if your looking for an easy class, this is not it. Memorize your 600 page textbook!

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: I don't know what these people are talking about. If you read the textbook and pay attention in lecture, there's nothing he puts on the test that's unexpected. He's super enthusiastic, and an exciting lecturer. Don't expect this course to be an easy A+, but A+ is definitely attainable.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Don't let the comments for this class scare you off. It's most certainly not an "easy A," and his exams with destroy you if you don't study. However, Winton is very clear and interesting to listen to in Lecture. He finds email inefficient, but he is very helpful and kind if you attend his office hours and get to know him. Great prof. Great class.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: I've never had a prof that refuses to talk to students after class or during breaks, but then there's Ivor. He just absolutely refuses to accept emails, and honestly he's quite rude. An interesting, passionate, and funny lecturer, but his tests are unfair, and he never has slides. Bring laptop to take notes, and you BETTER read the textbook.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: He only give his outline, never have lecture notes, class average is very low, and he never reply emails.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: hes a good teacher and he knows what hes teaching. the problem i had is if youre an engineering student or similar and are taking a set of other heavyloaded courses, this course is NOT gonna help which in that case wont be a GPA booster.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Hands down my favorite professor at SFU. What a character Ivor is ... eloquent, passionate, and entertaining! Ivor is old school -- be prepared to work hard and don't expect easy marks. If you are willing to learn then I urge you to take one of his classes.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Wanna wake up in the morning? He is sensational and energetic. Simply the most fairest and straight-to-the-point prof I've ever had in 5 years at SFU. To enjoy the class, you better keep up with him. Those who complain are just crybaby slackers who couldn't keep up with his level of competence.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Ih, what can I say. The class I guess you can call it straight forward. He always reads his notes in a very quirky way. He does like to play with his vocal strings. map quiz is pretty easy if you are good with memorization. The term paper is pretty iffy, but nothing bad. His midterm/final tho is most likely going to destroy you. Not an easy B even

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Actually a great class, the lectures are very intriguing. Ivor is a funny guy in a quirky way. You need to attend the lectures, he does not use a powerpoint and the outlines he sends out are very limited. Do the readings, they're necessary. And most of all prepare for the map quiz, it is most definitely worth it

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: He is very passionate about his classes and it shows in his lectures. He has very high standards, but he is fair with his marks. He also has map quizzes, which are pretty much free marks. He gives you the list of all the places he expects you to learn and we have 4 chances to take the quiz. One of the best profs ever.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: I thought Ivor was funny and the lectures were pretty interesting  for the most part. There isn't too much work in this course. Study hard for the map quiz and try to ace it the first time. Term paper wasn't too bad. He is a fair marker. Exams were fair as well. Overall, good prof.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: One of the best profs I have had.  He demands a lot, and is a fairly tough marker, but is fair.  You get what you put into the class.  I highly recommend his courses.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Ivor is an old school professor. Don't expect to come to this class for an easy grade. Pay attention in lectures and you will do fine. He makes it pretty obvious what to revise for during his lectures. I don't know why people complain so much about the map quiz. You have FOUR attempts to get over 15. Very doable if you put the time in.

Name: Ivor Winton
Review: Ivor is probably one of the hardest markers I have ever encountered during my University education.  However, he was one of the best.  If you want to get something out of school, take him!  If you're not studious though, go take someone else, you won't survive.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Emrul tried his best to be hands on & teach us real life application of 315 concepts. He also gave us a lot of advice for our career. Despite being busy, he made himself available for help whenever possible outside lecture. I got below average for midterm and still landed an A with hardwork and his help. His last lec was so inspiring I almost cried

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Emrul cares about his students and focuses on the useful and applicable aspects of econometrics rather than on convoluted details. For instance, he highlighted the importance of following past literature and using similar control variables. I found that advice, and others he gave us extremely applicable while writing my ECON 490 thesis.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: ECON 425 with Emrul was my favourite course. It is a good mix of theoretical and applied. Emrul emphasizes the real-world and intuitive meaning behind numbers and not just surface level understanding. He also made sure to incorporate real life case studies and experiments which was very useful to learn about.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: I would highly recommend taking a class with Emrul. He truly cares about his students and will take the time and effort to make sure they understand a concept. He makes you work hard for your marks, but he is always clear about what to expect on a test or exam. Wish I had taken more courses with him.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Dr. Hasan is enthusiastic and caring. While he goes off on tangents or tells irrelevant stories at times, they're generally funny and add to the class atmosphere. Participation matters as there are iclickers. He genuinely cares about students, respects mental-health, and makes up for lost lectures by doing them online.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Emrul has been the best prof I've had at UBC! He's so passionate about his students' success. Taught practical things that we can use in our career and focused on really helping us understand what we need to know. Gave me a great foundation for graduate courses, and helped so much with my 490 paper by giving econometrics ideas and new techniques.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Professor Hasan is the best professor I met during university. Super clear on grading criteria, and gives amazing lecture. Makes you become interest in finance and Econ in his own way. His investment class is super help in passing CFA level 1 exam. Take his class and you won't regret it! Truly inspirational!!

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Great professor. Truly inspirational and takes the time to explain everything in class. Inspired me to pursue my CFA. Fair exams. Miles better than someone like Blazenko, which I didn't do too well in but exceled in this class because of Emrul's teaching method. Do not skip class!! He guarantees you'll do well as long as you come to class, true.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Great ProfTook both his ECON383 and ECON355w. Although there is a lot content in the lectures, you can get good grade if you listen carefully in his class and do enough practices. I like his teaching style, always teach us by using real life examples-show us the bank website to find things that correlated with concepts.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: He can efficiently communicate his knowledge of finance and economics with his students. I never felt like missing his lectures even on my off days. Great Prof!

Name: M. Hasan
Review: He is a really good prof. I like his teaching style, and it's easy to get a good grade.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: AMAZING prof, and he really cares about his students. Stuffs that I learned form this class with Emrul can also be applied in real life. For example, Emrul gives valuable advices on selecting and buying mutual funds from his own investment experience.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: I like his enthusiasm for econ. He discusses trade theory with easy examples from real world that helps me to remember the outcomes.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Emrul works hard for students and he is very eager to help after class. Highly recommended.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: He is new to UBC but he is a great teacher. Our class is only 50 minutes long each day so he kind of has to rush in more classes but he explains the concepts well. I will recommend him highly.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: You need to self study in this class, otherwise it's difficult to learn

Name: M. Hasan
Review: polite and kind, hard-working on helping you

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Emrul was hands down one of the BEST profs at SFU. I did not do well on the first assignment or the midterm, but he gives ample opportunity for you to do well if you work extra hard for the final. He was also extremely fair. I am so sad that he's being taken away from us by UBC.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Emrul is an amazing prof, probably one of the best I have had at SFU. Regarding the structure of the class, there is an individual assignment, group project, midterm, final, and participation/attendance marks. Tests can be tough, but are very easy to prepare for - he gives a good heads up on what to focus on.

Name: M. Hasan
Review: Emrul's classes are't easy because the content itself is tough grasp. If you pay attention in class, take notes and do practice questions, you will do well. He will always take time to explain concepts if you are having trouble and cares about his students. Formula sheets aren't given in exams, but you will survive without it. Great prof overall!

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Gordon Lee is the G O A T

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Gordon makes jokes and tells tons of stories during lectures so theyre actually enjoyable to attend. Definitely one of my favourite professors. For exams, if you know how to do all the questions on his practice exams, you will pass.

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Absolute king. He made Econ really fun and interesting. Go to his office hours if you don't understand a concept, he will help you understand everything perfectly!

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Gordon is honestly the best prof I've ever had, his lectures are in depth and interesting, and his use of stories to convey economic ideas is brilliant. The man is about 80% of the reason I switched my major to Economics, he makes even the most simple topics fascinating.

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Great prof, entertaining and funny. A few strange questions on exams that where not really covered, but overall pretty easy. Workload of my other classes limited my study time, but an A should be fairly easy.

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Gordon never returns emails but just attending class is enough to receive a good grade. His lecture notes are mostly textbook material with a couple of topics that do not appear in the textbook. Amazing, engaging lectures that are typically clear and straightforward to understand. Only negative is his notes get a little messy when it comes to graph

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: GOAT of Econ

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Gordon Lee is a beauty and one of everyones favourite profs. His lecture notes are clear and concise and he does not use the textbook ï¿½ï¿½. Went to see him a few times during his office hours and he is very helpful and really cares about helping his students. His tests are definitely challenging and require more than just looking over your notes

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Mr. Lee is an approachable man willing to help his students. He does not post his notes and the only thing I would critique him on is they are not super straight forward at first, but with studying you will understand. His tests come straight from lectures, so do not worry about the textbook unless you need something explained in a different way.

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Dr. Lee's lectures are engaging and the content was explained in depth with alot of examples. His exams are fair game to what was in the lectures. Textbook use was minimal, only needed for clarifications.

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Have had two classes with this prof- he is absolutely amazing. Genuinely cares for his students, has really engaging lectures. Doesnt post his notes online, so attendance is a must. A bit of a tougher course (and he is a tough marker), but you will do well if you put in work. Very clear criteria for midterm and final (laid out what he was testing)

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: A real g

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: A comedian and a prof all in one! One of my favorite profs thus far. He's great. Lots of classroom-related stories to help absorb the info and some non-related lol.. Must show up to class as he doesn't post his notes. Exams based on class notes only, but the online assignments are based on the textbook. Would take again 100%

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Fricken hilarious. Has awesome stories that break up the lectures and make it worthwhile to show up. Cool coloured pens.

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: One of the best professors i've had. All you have to do is sit in class, relax, and take a few notes. His notes are very well laid out and easy to follow. Tests are pretty easy given you pay attention and know what your doing. 10/10 would take again.

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Gordon is a great prof. MUST attend lectures cause he doesn't post notes online. He only tests on lecture notes (NOT textbook). Recommend getting the online textbook cause you need them for online assignments. He tells amazing stories and genuinely cares about his students. I'm not taking economics unless he's my professor lol

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Gordon! Lee! Such an amazing prof. Me being awful at math, I was worried about this course - he explained the concepts so clearly it wasn't a problem. Gordon truly cares about the wellbeing of his students. My only complaint is his exams are tough. Attendance isn't mandatory but I TOTALLY RECOMMEND IT purely to hear his funny stories and jokes.

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Lectures are very interesting and the jokes and stories he has are funny and keep class interesting. I started from viewing the class as a nuisance as a morning course to looking forward to his detailed and funny lectures. Very accessible through email and office hours. Would recommend to others.

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: He gives really good lecture notes, explains things very well, and balances his lectures with funny stories. He cares about his students as well as their well being. Would recommend!

Name: Gordon Lee
Review: Gordon is one of U of A's legends. If you have the chance to have him as a prof, do it. He's funny, makes his subject genuinely interesting and provides clear explanations. You do need to go to class, but it's worth it. He looks like Santa Claus but with chest tats and he keeps his lectures interesting with funny jokes and stories.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: He was our lab coordinator for CHEM 10X this year and he actually made the labs an enjoyable experience. Also, if you wanted to see him and learn from your mistakes on the lab final, hell explain everything clearly to you.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: Had him for the lab. Labs were pretty straightforward but there was lots of background information needed to do the pre labs. Make sure you're really careful with sig digs cause TAs like to take lots of marks off if you mess up.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: Yoram is your average lab coordinator who evidently has put in lots of work to ensure the smooth running of his lab. little to no errors in the lab manual and TA's were constantly prepared and ready for the labs . Overall Yoram did a good job.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: Disclaimer: I didn't have him for lectures, just wrote the final exam for credit. He's a pretty nice guy but docked quite a lot of marks on my exam for tiny errors like using another method for a calculation instead of the "preferred" method. If you know how he grades you definitely won't lose those marks, good luck!

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: "I cannot ask you about everything, but I can ask you anything".

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: IS ONE OF THOSE PROFS YOU MUST HAVE AT LEAST ONCE IN YOUR LIFETIME!!!!!!!!!

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: chem is my worst subject, i failed (got 40%) on the midterm. However i worked very hard and got 74% on the final, which boosted my Chem101 mark to a C lol. Apelblat is a wonderful prof, very clear and funny. He over-hypes the final which is good.. otherwise I might have not worked as hard as I did. he has chicken-scratch writing tho

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: Outstanding professor. A true master of his craft.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: He is an amazing prof. His final would be really hard so make sure you work hard. He is really helpful in office hours. In order to do great jusy follow every piece of advice he gives in class. Also make sure you understand every thing taught in class. He will say before exams," I cannot ask everything but I can ask anything".

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: Overall, he's a great prof.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: Very thorough and absolutely explains all concepts that you need on exams, practice questions reflect exam material pretty much to a cinch. The only area to be desired is his monotone voice, but he tries to make lectures as engaging as possible with cartoons and benign sarcasm

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: He's really kind and felt bad for not knowing all 400 of his students' names. He gives part marks in exams. His midterm was easy and the final was pretty hard. Like, not crazy though as I've heard from others. I don't know. Just pay attention and listen. I didn't do that though...

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: SO GOOD. Responds to emails fast & is helpful during office hours. Lectures are awesome, I actually learned during them (unlike all my other classes...) Final is a tough one but it's curved so it doesn't really matter. Looking back, he's the BEST prof I've had in uni so far. Would recommend & take again. The man makes you love chem & him.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: This guy is the BEST prof there is. Yes, his exams are tough-- but it doesn't matter because the class is adjusted (so don't worry about tough exams). I'd rather have a low average than a high (Like Jensen or Sai Yui). Yoram's notes & lectures are amazing, you genuinely learn from him whereas in Jensen's & Sai Yiu's you memorize problem sets.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: His lectures are organized, and he sticks to the topic instead of wasting a lot of time like Jensen. However, Apelblat teaches a very easy class. chem 105 is light on math, so he artificially makes it more difficult, by leaving out information and using dirty tricks on exams. On practice exams he stated they would be nothing like the final.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: I TOTALLY LOVE this Professor SOOO MUCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! :)

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: Took Dr. Apel last semester for Chem 101 . No doubt that he was very well organised regarding his notes. Quizzes were hard, midterm was easy and final was very hard compared to the midterm. Final had a lot of conceptual questions but still managed to get a B (above av). Prof gets boring in his monotonous voice during the lecture .

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: After Chem 101 with Dr. Apelblat, I changed my major to Chemistry. Apelblat encourages both traditional textbooks and modern online notes for studying.  May seem intimidating at first, but he spends his office hours with an open door to anyone that tries.  Very well respected, and his respect motivates his students to do their best. Attend lecture.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: Best choice out of all the first year chemistry professors. Explains things in a clear and concise manner, and brings some levity to the class when he can. Very fair with marking, and is willing to hear concerns regarding  the marking done on exams. 5/7 would take again.

Name: Yoram Apelblat
Review: Apelblat was definitely a professor that wanted you to try your hardest to push your limits - but if you were willing to go through that effort, he would be there to help you. Make sure you do the problem sets and some of the readings, as well as go over the practice midterm and final for a very clear idea of what the tests are like!

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: One of my least favourite profs

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: Tests were challenging in that the questions were very specific. To get a great grade you'd need to know the textbook inside and out on top of attending lectures (and paying attention to them.) He is definitely enthusiastic about the material and cracks jokes now and then, though there's something about his lectures that make me tune out halfway in

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: You can tell he really cares about making the lectures entertaining and wants all of his students to do well. There is plenty of textbook reading (as not all test material is covered in class) but if you dedicate time to go through the textbook, pay attention in class, and occasionally review notes this class is super easy. Amazing Prof!

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: His lectures are pretty dry (fill in the blank notes) but he tries to be funny so ill give him that. Every friday is ePoll so those are the only mandatory days. I took AP Psychology in highschool and still found his tests were a lot harder than his notes

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: Easy course with easy professor. He is friendly and makes a lot of jokes in class. Fill in the blank notes. Said tests were 50% on textbook and 50% on lecture. Not true. Just know the class notes inside out and you will be fine. Has an assignment which is easy if you just follow the rubric. Also epoll questions, which are just participation marks.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: Amazing prof. I wish I could take all of my psych courses with him

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: Prof is energetic, always keep his lectures lively and not boring. Unfortunately, it has extremely bad notes which are worded like jeopardy questions ... what is psychology? Gives three assignment which is easy marks which you will get 100% unless you're beyond stupid. Final exams are based off what he says in class, textbook and his notes.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: Entertaining professor, but a heavy workload when it comes to memorizing the material. Lots of people skip the class but I would definitely reccommend attending it in order to recieve the particpation marks and absorb all the little facts he says. The tests are long and wordy but if you memorize the material you'll do fine.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: I think people might be projecting their hatred for BMod as a class onto this professor. He's really funny, his notes are great, his tests are okay. The self management project is not bad at all. The hardest part of this class is the material itself. Very dry, so it's hard to study- I didn't do too well either. He's the best teacher for it though.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: Not a bad prof, midterms were pretty light, and lots of opportunities for easy marks. My only problem was his final exam. 120 questions in 2 hours that had more to do with little studies in the textbook than the actual important material we learned in class. As long as you're willing to memorize every part of the textbook, you'll do fine.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: This class was interactive so it was a good learning environment. BUT the cumulative final left me speechless with 120 questions and a class average of 69%. The material is naturally a bit "wordy" but he could have provided a bit more guidance to prepare for the exams.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: 5% participation mark; guaranteed if you come to class. 'Self-managment' project worth 15% can be a booster as well. Marking can be over-critical as you can lose over 10% on a project component for imperfect APA citations. All that is countered by very difficult exams. Avg for final was 69%. Would rather trade-in the easy 20% for less crazy exams.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: The material in this class is easy and straight forward. He's decent at teaching but because of how self-explanatory a lot of the terms are I found it a bit dull. His exams however, are awful. 120 question final exam of oddly worded, often not straight forward questions. The average for the final was 69%. I studied extensively and also did poorly.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: His "interactive note" (a.k.a. get incomplete notes and fill them in class) is quite dumb but pretty useful. He will make you read a lot but THEY ARE ALL USEFUL MATERIALS, you gotta learn for yourself once, not only for your grades.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: His exams are 50/50 lecture and textbook, so keep up w the reading. Lecture notes are shared via eclass, but going is still a good idea, it's just not a huge deal if you miss. He does a fair amount of ePolls and there's 3 (very short) papers. The papers are easy 100s and really boost your confidence. Highly recommend this guy.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: Self management had gaps between phases which was nonsense and TA was harsh on grading. Never able to review exam. Dry material . Tough exam testing your memory only. eclass and textbook practice are useless with nothing similar on exam. I'm fine with the material but not with this his exams and how he teach. Self study would be much better

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
