Review: I can tell why he is so highly respected, but his notes and tests are tough. The final is cumulative, he has no study guide, so make sure you read the textbook and review your notes throughout the semester. I wish I did this from the get go because the course would be way more enjoyable.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: Extremely dry material. I hated the self management project as I felt like there needed to be more instructions about the expectations (I personally was marked by a new TA and mentioned multiple times that I didn't understand why I was docked marks but received no response.) Final is cumulative and there is 22 chapter so good luck !!

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: He was a really funny prof and he made the material really interesting. He made his midterms and final based 50/50 off textbook and lecture so you need to read the textbook.

Name: Karsten Loepelmann
Review: LOVED HIM. Funny, makes class VERY interesting. Extra information on his lectures (testable), MUST read textbook as well. Midterm is straightforward, but need to put in the work. A lot of course load to review. 3 minor assignments , research participation, ePoll questions, 2 Midterms. A very doable course if you are willing to dedicate some time.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Go to class or don't, as long as you do the weekly assignments and practice exams you will be fine. Many exam questions will be similar to the practice and there generally won't be any surprises. She also gives multiple questions and lets you pick which ones you want to answer (like pick 23 or 57)

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Although I enjoyed ECON 101, ECON 102 was a dud for me. Almost every lecture was boring because the content was taught at a very slow pace than what I'm used to with my other courses. You may tune out, so keep yourself occupied (read the text book, maybe? That's a good idea!)

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: If you ask for help in a very direct way, she will answer your questions really well. Otherwise she always goes off on tangents about small details that do not have much to do with the big picture and skims over the important material. Her notes are also very disorganized and unless you know what you're looking for the textbook is your only hope.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: PPT are wasting time, cannot get points during class. She just reading and reading, worst prof I ever met!

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Lectures are as dry as it can be. I stopped going to class about 2 weeks in. Religiously read the textbook and you will get easy A. Lecture notes online are pretty useless, but the practice midterms are useful (only do recent ones as anything past 2012 is outdated). Extremely rude prof. Would not recommend this prof to my worst enemy.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Her lectures are dry and boring. I was interested greatly in economics until she came along. Also, she openly mocks students if she needs to reiterate something for them. Would not recommend as I learned more from the textbook than from her.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: One of the most boringuninteresting professors ever. The lectures are next to useless, and the only way she'll answer your questions is if you ask privately, otherwise she'll humiliate you in front of the class. Don't bother showing up. Her tests are easy, and 90% based on her powerpoints (thankfully available online, albeit with poor grammar)

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Textbook will provide better explanations.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: rude

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: She uses stories and the lives of fictional characters to help explain economic concepts. She means well, but her lectures are pretty boring. I attended all her classes but i don't pay attention. The textbook and mock papers are your best friends. The textbook is really people friendly and it will help you a lot. Overall, she a'ight.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Her lectures are dry but they are mandatory because she purposefully omits some extra slides and answers in her online notes. Her exams are not tough as long as you study her notes carefully. Online assignments are nothing like the exams. Textbook isn't necessary, her notes are good enough.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Her class was very boring. Hard to get high score on her exams. She gives samples before exams. However, the question of exams are much harder than the sample's that she gave to you. If you ask for help, she will be very happy to help you.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: She seems pretty stand-offish but she was very accommodating to me and totally saved my semester. I found her lectures very clear, but anyone who didn't had a hard time getting answers from her in class. If that's the case then read the textbook and do the assignments. Put the effort in on your part. I'll be taking 102 with her next semester!

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Quite boring, reads off her powerpoints and posts them online. Assignments are super easy.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Around half of the students go to class because her teaching is boring and class ppt are terrible. She destroyed my interest in economy.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: My experience was pretty negative on the whole. Professor Kamp is very intelligent and knowledgeable; unfortunately, she is less skilled in breaking down topics. She seemed frustrated with questions, and openly mocked students that raised their hands as if they had somehow failed by not understanding. There are better places to learn Economics.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: I do not understand why she has such low ratings. Her explanations of difficult ideas were so clear that i did not have to use the book. She is a really nice professor, and her exams are fair and challenging at the same time. You will only think she is boring if you have no interest in economics. She was one of the best profs of my first year.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Her class is very boring, but she is always willing to help, holding review sessions where you can ask questions. Her exams aren't that hard and the best way to study is to do the practice exams a lot before the actual exam.

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: The best way to do well in the class is to look at her notes from the slideshows, and do all the practice tests.  Hard to stay focused in the class, but I imagine there aren't a lot of exciting ways to teach Econ if you don't already find that type of stuff interesting

Name: Susan Kamp
Review: Prof makes you feel stupid, but the class is straight forward. I still grimace when I see her in the halls of Tory though.. such a rude professor.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: Really enthusiastic and passionate guy, the exams are worded super tricky and if you don't have as super well rounded understanding of the topics you might get confused. Great sense of humour and definitely would take again.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: AVOID at all costs / Midterm was manageable but the final was insane. It's basically reading comprehension where one word throws off your entire answer. / Rushed material after midterm so half the final wasn't actually taught to us. / Worst professor I've had for my entire degree.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: Very funny and a prof that knows what he's talking about. His exams can be challenging, but the style of questions are thought-provoking and require you to deeply understand the material.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: His tests are hard, but if you study hard you'll do well. He's a great teacher and I didn't even read much of the textbook, I still got an A. He's very passionate about teaching. He's accessible outside class and is patient when you have a lot of questions. His notes are good, but I'd advise you attend classes

Name: Richard Moses
Review: Dr. Moses is an amazing lecturer that is so, so passionate about biology. You must attend his lectures, however, because his posted notes dont make sense on their own. His tests are difficult, but fair if you attend class, do the assigned homework, and ask for help when needed. The tests ARE DOABLE if you read his questions extremely carefully!

Name: Richard Moses
Review: Dr. Moses clearly loves what he is teaching and is very enthusiastic. Tests and quizzes are hard, make sure you are doing the readings and practice assignments! Overall, Dr. Moses gave good lectures but the tests are challenging.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: So he's pretty dry in class, but for some reason picks the exam room as a place to bring out his sense of humour. This dude straight up looks at me during the exam, says "Wow, looks like you're struggling" then walks away. WHAT A SAVAGE

Name: Richard Moses
Review: Professor Moses was very passionate about what he taught. His tests and quizzes were difficult, so make sure you review your lecture notes intensely before doing tests.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: He's clearly very passionate about what he teaches which is great. Tests are only passable if you read the textbook material and do the assignments. His quiz at the beginning of the year is very easy and not at all a representation of the midterm or final, even though he says it is. Notes are posted online but if you don't go they wont make sense

Name: Richard Moses
Review: Amazing lectures! He is really passionate about what he does and it shows. However, his exams are horrible! They are badly worded and confusing. This is a first year course, however the exams are not first year level by any means.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: He is a good lecturer, and tries to make it fun and interesting for us. As everyone else has said, the quizzes and tests were very difficult (especially the final), and I relied heavily on my lab mark to get me through this course.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: Very clear tests, without tricky questions. Most of his MC have 1 decent answer, which you'll know if you read the notes. Lectures are fun. If you miss class, the notes are self explanatory. The course is slightly time consuming, but fair. Lab component is harder than lecture. His rating should be much much higher, and he's great in office hours.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: He is a very entertaining prof, and is obviously passionate about the material. However his tests are very difficult, and I would consider the tests way out of the difficulty range for a first-year level course. This class would be great if it wasn't for his tests as they truly try to deceive you which I find immoral.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: His lectures are great, very engaging and interesting. However, if you need a good gpa I dont suggest taking his class. Tests the very tricky. The content itself isnt bad but the way he words answers are very deceiving.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: How do I study from this guys notes

Name: Richard Moses
Review: Every quiz is a trick question. We come to class to lean knowledge, not literature devices. Quizzes are useless. Only one question per quiz, and it always be a tricky question. Ready to 0?

Name: Richard Moses
Review: There's hardly anything in his notes so going to class is kinda mandatory and unless you can remember the 2 billion things he says in class, you probably have to audio/video record. His tests are brutal

Name: Richard Moses
Review: A man of many memes. Bio 108 wasn't the most exciting class, but Dr. Moses still made the lectures as enjoyable as possible! His Midterm and final were another story though. The majority of questions were so specific they were easy to trick you if you didn't 110% know the material.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: Richard made bio 108 a nightmare. His tests and quizzes are way to hard to understand. The mc questions are ridiculous, a) an answer, b) a different answer, c) different answer, d) a and b, e) a, b, and c. His class averages are in the low 50s because of how hard his tests are. I wish I never stayed in that class.

Name: Richard Moses
Review: His exams are REALLY REALLY DIFFICULT. He's passionate and he really knows the material, and he's hilarious, but this course is extremely information dense and he tests on very minute details. Take good notes, study hard and you'll pass.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: I love Dr. Harrington's lectures. It was fun, very helpful, and pretty much a review to high school biology. Quizes and tests are reasonable, it is not easy, but not hard if you study well. Side note, his draws faces on every cell or organism on the white board and his drawings are amazing and easy to remember.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Mike was a great bio prof. He tests straight from his slideshows and what he says in class, but he doesn't post annotated notes so you have to go to class... plus there's an ePoll you get graded on. However he is very specific with his exams which made it harder to study for because you need to know EVERYTHING, but if you study: easy A.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: This class was not too difficult because all of the tested material is very specific to the PowerPoints Mike shows in class (also available online). He goes through lectures very fast so be prepared to write down lots of information. His midterm and exam are fair tests and all the answers to each question on the exam are from the lectures.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Not a good prof at all. Do not take this class!!! He does not care about his students at all and makes it seem like he wants all students to fail. Even if you get a 90 it is very unlikely that you will get an A. His grading system does not seem fair. He is NOT caring at all and attempts to be funny when he is not.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Pretty nice and funny guy, but his midterm and final were ridiculous. Told us he would test us on things we didn't know yet. Even though I absolutely grinded, getting 20% over the class average on both tests (finished with an 84) still landed me with a B+.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Hes a nice person but his midterm and final are overly difficult. Getting a 95 on his final only got me a 3.7. His 4.0 are 92% and higher. The scaling only negatively effects you

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Funny but you have to show up to class. He doesnt just read off his slides he goes into way more depth in class.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: I really enjoyed his classes. You can tell he is very knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches. The course itself is kinda boring, but he makes it very interesting. Actually paid attention in class. Would recommend. However, do not get behind because he goes fast.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: He is an ok prof. He has very vague slides that are full of only pictures and a few keywords so you really have to pay attention to what he is saying. He talks a lot about irelevant content and skips over important things. He loves to draw pictures to explain things. Funny guy but horrible prof. Be ready to be tested on literally anything he says.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Funny guy, interesting lectures. Do ALL his practice questions (twice), get a feel how he tests, and don't waste time memorizing the lectures (won't help you, he tests problem solving, not memorizing). Sometimes puts unfair questions on the test but they're just to bring the average down (course is curved). Final was just like the practice.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Notes a minimal, but I didn't mind because it made studying easier. Exams are generally somewhat fair. Make sure you go to PAL sessions.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Assignments were seriously a pain, make sure you get a good group of FOUR people to do these. Questions are very very ambiguous and marking is super hard on assignments. Midterm was very fair but the long answer portion of the final was not something straight out of left field. Avoid for 201.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Mike is a good professor, you have to attend lectures if you want to pass this class, but he makes them interesting and easy to follow. His exams are quite tough, you have to put A LOT of effort into studying for them if you want to do well. So i don't recommend taking his course if you have a big workload. Overall really enjoyed his class!

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Overall, his lectures were hard to follow. His lecture slides are no help so you really have to be listening to how he explains his slides. Be ready to draw, because he tends to draw a lot of things. He can be really general in some of his explanations but that does not mean that he won't test you on every single detail.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Overall a pretty ok prof, he tried to relate with students and be funny which I appreciated. Clicker questions were easy marks as long as you show up and do them and sometimes on exams, and the exams were very broad, sometimes asked convoluted questions or covered literally EVERYTHING so be prepared. He also asked questions on videos from class.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: He talks really fast and his power point are essentially useless. You HAVE to go to class if you want to do well and draw ALL diagrams he draws on the whiteboard. He is very clear with his expectations though and his exams represents what he teaches which is nice. If you do that, you're set for the class, the lab portion is what'll get you're mark.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Curriculum was interesting, but having Mike as a prof made me absolutely despise bio. I felt scared to ask questions after receiving one-line e-mails back. I had never experienced this with a prof before. Marking for the assignments I felt were unfair as some of the answers were not even mentioned in the research article. Stay away by all means.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Hes a great lecturer and knows what he is talking about. The material was very good and he had a good way of explaining it all. His final exam was probably the most difficult test Ive ever written. He tested on very specific content which he hardly talked about and stuff he said wouldnt be on it, was. Good luck and memorize everything he says.

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: Loved him in Bio107, hated him in Bio201. Tons of info in lectures but slides are very bare & he tests on extremely small details. There were four group assignments - 2 were marked fairly hard. Pay attention in class and definitely memorize everything - even if he says not to worry about it

Name: Mike Harrington
Review: I would recommend Doctor Harrington for BIOL 107, but not so much BIOL 201. His PowerPoints are very vague, and he tests on very detailed concepts, which I found difficult at times. His midterm was quite hard, but the final was quite the opposite. Doctor Harrington can be helpful at answering students' questions on SQUIRE. Going to class is a MUST.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Sometimes concepts are hard to understand in his lectures but you can tell he really cares about his students because he always makes time for them outside of class. I went to his office hours a few times and for the most part he does a good job of answering questions. His tests are fairly hard but manageable if you study and do the problem sets

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Dr. Yiu obviously loves teaching Chem. He is always happy to see his students and even happier to answer their questions. Even in the largest lecture hall on campus, he is willing to take the time to answer as many questions as possible. Attending lectures isn't mandatory to pass with good grades, but worth going just for the happy energy!

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: I love Sai Yiu, I thought his lectures were so entertaining, he has so much energy when he's teaching and loves interacting with students! He provides a lot of practice content, and if you study off of that you will find that his tests are very straight forward. His quizzes are helpful as well and manageable. One of my favourite profs!!

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Best chem prof ever. Super enthusiastic about the course and he knows what he is teaching. Lecture notes were great. Problem sets often reflected tests and usually there is a couple of trick questions. But do his problem sets and you will do fine on tests. Willing to answer all questions and cares about his students

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: The online quizzes were so hard. I found the lectures quite boring and long. Although he does seem to care for his students and has a lot of office hours. However, when I showed up to his office hour, he had an attitude of why were you not paying attention and this is so easy you should know this.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: I had Sai Yiu for 101 and for 261. He was definitely better at teaching 261. In my opinion, he posts all of his class notes and every time I would go to his lecture, I would just zone out because of his thick accent anyway. So to be in his class, you've gotta rely on teaching yourself the concepts. His exams really test EVERY detail so be prepared!

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: His slides are pretty good. His tests are semi hard but it just means you have to put into the work. If you see him in office hours he explains things well. He really does care about his students.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Sai Yiu is very enthusiastic about organic chemistry, but he has a tendency to blow through the harder concepts and slow down during the easier ones. He is very passionate about the subject, but sadly his tests can be quite difficult and tricky.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Everyone hates this guy but I don't have anything against him. The midterm grade was low and everyone was talking about how unfair it was but I thought it was exactly what he told us. I found I knew what I needed to know. Even looking back on it now, I could take that whole test with high school knowledge and still pass the thing. We're ok with Yiu

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: The best professor that the University of Alberta has to offer. Simply incredible in the way he is able to grab his students' attention with his powerful arms and maintain it for the entirety of his class. Before his class chemistry was simply a course I needed for the credits. Now it has become a lifestyle that must be fulfilled every day in life.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Sai is a solid professor who cares about his students success and is willing to answer any questions. His notes are good and his tests resemble the practice problem sets, his final was a bit tough as it was around 16 pages all written. His accent is quite strong but if you pay attentention in class and refer to the notes he posts you'll be okay!

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: A little hard to understand, but he is caring and knows his stuff. Provides lots of practice and is accessible outside, but his exams are harder than the practice questions given (expected). Notes are well made, but he also kind of rambles on and teaches until the last minute and may start a new topic when there is no time, but recaps it later.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: All his notes online so they're really accessible and you don't have to go to class. I went to barely any of his classes and only read his notes and also Youtube and still did decent. His tests are very straightforwards and no trick questions; everything on there was on the notes. Overall, he is a solid choice and a very cute and funny prof.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: he is hard to understand, gets stuck on practice problems constantly, midterm/final are way harder than practice questions/tests, does not make class objectives clear, will teach up to the very last second (including starting a new unit with 2 minutes left). he seems like a really nice guy, just not a very good teacher.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: I love Sai Yiu so much

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Sai Yiu was one of my favourite profs, he is so funny and passionate about what he is teaching that you actually enjoy it. The midterm and final are very similar to problem sets, so know how to do them. I am taking him again for organic chemistry this term because he is good at explaining and accessible out of lecture.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Overall the material was explained well. The material did seem to be above and beyond what one would expect from an intro level chem course but the problem sets and sample exams are almost exact templates of the actual exams, so if you can do them you dont really need to attend lectures. However, beware that the final exam is brutally difficult.

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: What can I say about this man? He is extremely knowledgeable, brilliant and absolutely caring of his students. Unlike other profs, his notes are not simply just powerpoint slides. They are full-length pages and he goes through them with you during class. He thoroughly explains concepts and provides humorous analogies to explain concepts!

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Super nice but that doesn't help much. He says to complete the problem sets and you will be good to go but I had difficulty in his class. Final was pretty tough. Would not recommend if you find chem difficult

Name: Sai Yiu
Review: Problem sets helped, are more similar to the exams than his practice exams. He is very kind and caring for his students but his exams also tend to be hard, and very long. His TA might wreck you though so good luck.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Honestly a real gem. If you take her 107 class, I highly recommend not skipping because she can speak off the lecture notes but specifically tells you if it's going to be on the midterm/final (which is also great about her bc you'll know exactly what to study). Very similar to a high school teacher, very very caring

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Only posts skeleton notes so you must show up. Notes are organized and clear. Lectures are engaging and entertaining. Very clear about what is expected and gives lots of hints for the midterm and final. Don't forget to study pre-midterm material for the final, was tough. Makes you work for it but you're rewarded in the end. Strongly recommended!

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Dr. Kachur has a lot of energy in her lectures and makes the learning very entertaining. I really enjoyed her class! However, her assesments were tough, especially the quizzes, as well as the final. You have to make sure you know your stuff if you wanna do well in her class.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Mixed feelings about Torah. She was great; very engaging lectures (50 min felt like 10!!), found the midterm to be very fair as she tests straight from her notes and what she says in class. However, we had these online quizzes that were ridiculously hard, but managed to get 100s by collaborating with others which was nice. Difficult final...

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Overall, Dr Kachur is a good teacher. I didn't love her teaching style, but its much better than lots of other profs. Notes are only available in class. Exams are straightforward, but it's easy to underestimate the amount of content. Also she says she only tests on the written notes, but the downside is that you need to know every little detail.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Dr. Kachur makes class fun and interesting. Shes got a lot of personality (the good kind) and lets you know what you should focus on to do well on tests. This semester they started active learning quizzes, and Ive averaged 55% on them so far, but got 88%+ on the exams. Those quizzes are definitely difficult.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Torah is amazing! She really is a great professor all around and would be beneficial for a lot of first-year students because she seems more like high school teachers in the best way. She cares about how students do. The lectures are always super funny and she gives out "attendance marks" where she gives away test questions for those who show up.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Strongly recommend this prof especially to any first years out there. Torah's lectures are incredibly engaging and she WILL make you totally interested and excited about all the topics you are learning. Torah's tests tend to reward effort so do what she tells you to do and listen to all of her tips in class. Easy A but you MUST put in the work.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: This class was responsible for 90% of my stress last semester. I can't think of a nice word to describe the way she taught the class! Her assignments were graded horribly and the exam questions didn't make any sense and on top of all that, she just makes fun of you if you ask any questions because she expects all her students to be like her.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Low class average, very tricky and tough exams. Curved but only to a B-. Her lectures are very engaging and definitely helps to understand. You must go because ehse has fill in he blank notes and you cannot get them from her more than 3 times in the year

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Her lectures consisted of just writing down a bunch of facts without much explanation of them. The flow of topics didnt make sense either. Shes obsessed with STIs and breast milk. She told us to focus on pathogen profiles but that didnt actually matter on her midterm. I loved her 107 lecture but found this lecture awful.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: She clearly has a passion for the subject, but the format of her lecture (copying whatever she writes) doesn't really help with understanding material. It would be better if the material was presented and provided and then explained/elaborated. The practice exam she provided was not representative of the exam question format she used.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Torah is very straight to the point and really helpful at answering any questions. The assignments were tough, mostly because questions out of 5 marks were usually all or none. The midterm and the final SA were mainly problem solving based questions, Torah likes those a lot (especially western blots). The course itself is really interesting.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Her tests are so unfair and hard. even if you understand the material and studied everything you'll still end up being confused with her exams. Her lectures are fine but her tests do not match. I did do good in the course but I would never take her again.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: This will probably be downvoted. But I really like Torah, I think she is a solid prof. I did not do well in her class lol, but that wasn't because of the assignments or ard tests, its because the course is nothing like any bio course in the first year. Its a hard course with a great prof.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: I don't know why everyone hates on Torah. She for sure tests different than other bio profs (not just straight memorization), but I really enjoyed her lectures. As for the comments about her being arrogant or rude, I have never found that. I really enjoyed her class.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: I've taken BIOL107 with her before and I really enjoyed it. I don't quite know what happened with her in this course. Her pacing of material was awful, she was inaccessible outside of class, arrogant, her test poorly written, and her feedback was non-existent. She insisted on using some outside message board for questions that didn't work for me.

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: She is a great person and very approachable, but I don't understand why she wants her students to fail badly! Her exams are the worst and the assignments were just a waste of time you could spend one hour or one week to solve them and you'll still get a low grade. Unless you're the type of student who enjoys torture, don't take her class!

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: Torah is passionate, and lecture's alone are good. Otherwise I found her uncaring, and sometimes rude. She once didn't show up to an office hour I booked with her so I waited and she didn't come. BIOL 201 assignments are very hard. Maybe for some classes she's good, but specifically BIOL 201, avoid her. Hardest I've ever worked for a B+

Name: Torah Kachur
Review: She is so passionate about what she teaches and it shows - her lectures are very engaging and she takes and answers questions very well. Her exams are not simple regurgitation - you need to be able to apply what you learn (which is a good skill to have anyway). Her notes are the best I've seen, but she doesn't post them so you need to attend class

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: His accent is very hard to understand, and then he says he writes things down so you can understand what he's trying to say, but his handwriting is worse. I had to withdraw because he didn't teach well. I had to teach everything myself.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Simchi is a great prof. His notes are very useful and give a good idea of what to expect for exams and he always uploads them online after class. During his office hours, he was very helpful. I sat in his tuesday thursday lectures, so my only complaint is that they can feel a bit boring and monotonous by the end.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: mah boy!

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: He is really friendly and care about his students. Although his English has accent, he writes down almost every words he says. Do know how to teach. But you have to work for it. International students friendly.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Aside from the heavy accent, Simchi is one of the better Stat 151 profs. He is very helpful during his office hours and genuinely wants to help you. Lectures are heavy and although he posts annotated notes online, he takes lots of notes on paper he doesn't post, so go to class.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Alireza made me hate stats like there is no tomorrow. he'll straight up tell you that half of the class fails stat 151 on the very first day. his notes are all over the place. you need to work really really hard to pass his class. I don't recommend him at all if you have any other choice.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Dr. Simchi is a fantastic prof! He has a heavy accent, but he knows it so he tries hard to get his point across and make things easier for the students in the class. His tests are very straightforward and if you make time to see him in his office hours, he is actually very helpful (and will sometimes just give you the answers )!

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Simchi overall is a good man. You can tell he really cares about his students and emphasizes quite a lot how important it is to pay attention in class. He is kind of repetitive and it's harder to understand him because of his accent, but if you pay attention you can understand what he wants to say.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: He really clearly cares about how his students do and he makes funny jokes sometimes, but he does have an accent and can be a little hard to understand sometimes. I sat at the front of the class and I think that made it better. If you struggle he will be more than willing to help you outside of class. Class was just overall hard but hes a great guy

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Nice enough guy, Hard class. It does not help that he is hard to listen to from his accent and monotone voice. Try not to skip class like I did. Luckily I had good partners in most my group projects, but group labs with random people in a 100 level often mandatory class is not great. Find another prof to take or even to go to their lectures instead

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Simchi is a very kind person and very helpful and friendly when approached. However, his lectures are extremely dull and it does not take long until you are lulled away by the repetitive, monotonous, and eventually indistinguishable-from-the-last-sentence style of his combined accent, teaching style, and well.. the fact its stats. Use Khan academy.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Not the greatest prof. Strong accent, monotone voice, talked very slowly, but nice enough. His notes are decent, but you can learn just as much off of Khan Academy tbh. The exams weren't too difficult, but the lab portion was absolute hell. If you get stuck in his class just go to someone else's lecture, they're all the same.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Papa Simchi is a beautiful man. He really goes deep for that y bar, and his notes are good, lots of examples. 10/10, has an accent, but he's honestly really smart. Do the practice quizzes; super helpful. Gonna miss you Simchi!

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Simchi has some amazing notes, seriously, even if you're in another section, his notes will be helpful. I didn't find his accent terrible, but understand other people's gripes with it. You can learn all you need for the standardized STAT 151 exams from his notes and the textbooks alone, but attending lectures will still help tremendously.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Stats is always difficult, that wasn't my problem with this class. Ali Simchi has a very thick accent, which I also don't have a problem with. But he is very hard to understand, and gets mad when his lecture of 300+ students doesn't answer his questions. He comes off quite condescending, and is constantly revising mistakes in emails and homework.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Simchi is a great prof that really cares about his students. As long as you do your homework and pay attention in class, you will do fine in the class. He has an accent, but you get used to it.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Yes he has a really thick accent but you get used to it. He takes his time through the hard concepts and does a ton of examples in class. He tells you exactly what you need to know for exams and his practice problems are great.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: yes his accent can be difficult to understand sometimes, but his notes are top notch. you dont necessarily need to go to every single lecture he went to, bc he uploads inclass notes. for the midterm and final just skim through his in class notes a few times and you should be set.

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: He did a great job teaching this course. His explanations were detailed and clear, and he frequently pointed out common mistakes students make. He genuinely cares; he makes a point of reminding the class to do homework and contact group members. Having him as a prof made the course much more manageable!

Name: Alireza Simchi
Review: Terrible lecturer and has a VERY thick accent. Claims to take students feedback into account but never makes any changes. Went to him for help and he was condescending, rude, and told me I was stupid for not understanding the material. Avoid at all costs.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Blaine makes a class that could be pretty dull very interesting . He is funny and entertaining without being disorganized, his lectures are still very clear.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Blaine Mullins was far and away my favourite prof. He cared about his students and made his lectures fun and entertaining. He tests on what he says, so get ready to know some random factoids, because he gets pretty specific

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Mullins is a beauty. While there is a lot of note-taking required in class, he makes it so fun and interesting by including tons of interesting and helpful videos and creating a great atmosphere in the class. His exams can be a little challenging though, since he does include stuff from just his lectures and from just the textbook. gr8 dude tho

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: A very caring professor with excellent lectures. He shows videos in class to make the content more entertaining. He posts notes online, but they are mainly skeleton notes as you need to attend class to obtain more detail about the content. Most of his exam questions test what he says in class, but there a few textbook questions as well.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Blaine is an amazing professor. I had him for both 104 and 105, and I never missed a lecture. He kept his lectures entertaining,  and is an overall funny and personable professor. Attendance is absolutely essential in his class however, as the midterms and exam are mostly based on the lecture. Attend class & take notes and you will be fine

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: He speaks clearly,  note posted online wasn't enough, need to attend class. His class was amazing and never felt bored, I took his 104 as well. Exam questions were based on what he said in class and can find it in textbook. He is knowledgeable and overall a professor with good teaching strategy.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: He's a great prof. Highly recommend that you record his lectures since his power points are not detailed and typing/writing everything he says can be a hassle. The textbook isn't needed much but I recommend lightly reading the chapters because at times he tests you on things that were not covered in lecture but are covered in the textbook.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: One of the best profs I have ever had. His lectures are super interesting and he loves what he teaches. You must go to class and write down everything he says but if you do, the exams are easy A's. Tuesday Thursday classes can be long and boring but I never felt like his class dragged on. I would recommend him to everyone.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: You MUST attend lectures because he tests basically 100% from them. Type your own notes, the notes he provides are just skeletons of what he teaches. I really loved the non-cumulative exams, this made it easy to do well and stay on top of the coursework. His lectures were entertaining. I loved the class! Gonna miss it.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Took both 104/105 with him, it was the most exciting and fun lecture. He is very well organized, gives short (video) breaks in the middle of notes to help us relax. His exams are very lecture heavy so if youre willing to take decent notes; HE IS THE BEST PROF! TAKE HIM.  (p.s. you must note EVERYTHING he says)

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Dr. Mullin's lectures are painful to say the least. Tested on useless meme videos with dolphins shown in class. Must show up to class to take down notes because lecture slides have 4 words per page. He comes across as condescending and cocky as he does not answer questions in class.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Must attend lectures, powerpoints are pretty much just outlines of what he says. Also be able to write/type fast because he talks fast. Found his exams to be pretty  random: half the questions were things discussed, half were just stupid and unrelated and meant to confuse you. Comes across condescending individually but lectures are entertaining.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Hands down my favourite professor. He makes coming to class fun and interesting with his jokes and lots of videos to make the lectures a little easier to sit through. It has been nothing but a pleasure being in his class and if he taught other psych courses I'd definitely take him! Just make sure you show up to class and pay attention!

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: DONT EVER SKIP LECTURES. hes good at teaching, funny sometimes. some questions on exams are very very stupid.  even if you walk out of an exam feeling like u got a 100%, u didn't. fine in lectures, but dont talk to him in person. comes off very rude and condescending.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Going to lectures is so important because in the midterms and finals he asks things that were said. Also, the online textbook with practice questions was also helpful and I did much better on the midterm where I also studied from the textbook.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Hands down the best prof I've come across. His lectures are interesting, lots of video clips and interaction. He makes the material very easy to learn by using tons of examples. Make sure you study notes and textbook for the test, don't skip lectures because he asks specific questions from the lectures on the tests. Overall amazing.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: He's very intelligent and up to date on issues such as gender, race, sexuality, etc.. so that makes for interesting lectures. But his tests are difficult, and will often rely on specific details. His posted notes aren't the best, but they are sufficient. It's better if you print/download them ahead of time and write what he says on the notes.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Never taking his class again. tests on the smallest details to make sure you attend his lecture, doesn't matter whether you know the material or not.... not helpful and very condescending. if you take his class you will have to type notes because he talks too fast and doesn't care whether you got it all down, because his power points are bare bones

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Was not a huge fan of this guy.  Below average in terms of lecture quality and effort. Unhelpful during office hours, and our TA sucked: he had neither the lecture notes nor the text book. That aside, Blaine is funny. His lectures are entertaining. TIP: STUDY FROM YOUR LECTURE NOTES. I didn't even crack the text book and received an A.

Name: Blaine Mullins
Review: Exams are designed such that if you dont write down every specific sentence he says in class, you will lose a lot of marks.  The information missed CANNOT be found in the textbook.  His lectures favor people who type their notes; he talks fast.  Furthermore, he puts very little effort into his notes (e.g. poor grammar/punctuation + spacing).  avoid

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: He is a very funny professor if you also like movies and pop culture because you might get more of his references, personally they made the lecture easier to attend. Using the textbook plus attending class helps a ton. He is very helpful and is fast at responding to emails. I would highly recommend him if you need this class!

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Great prof

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: He was a good prof. But his notes are not the best to study from so reading the textbook or another profs notes would be helpful. He explained the material well and made lots of joke (not all were funny).

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Paul is super engaging & makes jokes to add interest. He explains material a lot better than just his notes & does examples in class, so going to lectures is a good idea. I sometimes felt like Paul didn't explain stuff as well as he could've because he seems like he "just gets it" easily & can't break it down to an intro stats class level

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: His jokes were funny at first but got really annoying really fast. You can tell which questions on exams are made by him based on whether or not there's a forced pop-culture reference. Btw, those questions require a bit more reading comp to solve due to the fact that the joke he put in there distracts from the substance of the question

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: As far as material goes, it's the same for every other stats class at the UofA. However, Paul really does try to make it engaging for everyone. I am not a math person by any means, but I did better than I could've thought. Yes, he explains everything better in class, but you should be going to class anyways. Highly recommend!

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Paul was an excellent professor who made class engaging and fun. He would joke all the time and his jokes were always content related. Hes also very understanding and patient so if you need help dont be shy to ask. He goes over a lot of content in class so if you dont go you will be lost when it comes to examples he goes over specifically.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Paul is great. Very funny and engaging. there is a lot of assignments but theyre not very hard and give you multiple attempts. Thanks Paul

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Stat 151 is sometimes unbearable, but he actually makes lectures alright. Solid prof, funny guy. Usually enjoyed going to class. However, if you struggle with math, I wouldn't recommend as he goes fast, but otherwise would totally recommend.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: He's amazing as a person but not as a teacher who is teaching entry level stats.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: IMPORTANT THING: GO TO CLASS. or the notes will make no sense. And make sure FOLLOW EVERY WORD HE SAYS in the class otherwise you won't understand him. Last thing, SLOW HIM DOWN IF YOU FIND HE IS TOO FAST. JUST STOP HIM BY ASKING QUESTIONS. Then you may get a great grad.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: As a person who is horrible at all things math I can 100% recommend him for stats. The course is quite dry but he does the best possible way of brightening up the lectures with his jokes. I took it in the summer with him so it was a little fast paced but yet again, hes an amazing prof so he did a great job at teaching us.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Mans just amazing. Over three years I've done at the U of A, I have never understood a course so darn well. His dad jokes only make it more entertaining and if you pay attention 100% during the lectures, those long homework assignments are a breeze. I took him summer term (no lab partners) and found the hw assgns helpful asf. BEST TEACHER NO CAP!!!

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: On the first day of class he spoke with a Russian type accent for at least 30 minutes and then said 'Well enough of that fake accent". It was hilarious. I would highly recommend taking STAT 151 with Paul. Go to class and take notes because he doesn't post them. The homework assignments are long so don't leave those to the last minute either.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Not a bad choice for stats. I didn't mind his "jokes" but he got pretty condescending sometimes, often repeating like "people always get this wrong but it's so easy I can't understand how". Otherwise his notes are solid and lecturing above average. Textbook not needed since assignment questions are posted but assignments take days to complete.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: His notes were confusing, vague and were not informative in terms of understanding the material. They were more like, "copy definition, paste definition". On top of that, none of the notes were uploaded online. I am only giving him a 1/5 instead of 0 because his jokes were occasionally chuckle worthy and seemed like a nice guy.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Paul's classes weren't terrible to go to as he throws in lots of jokes and puns to try and make a subject as dry as stats not as boring. However, his notes are relatively hard to follow and the examples he uses are somewhat confusing.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Paul is awesome

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Tries to be funny in class and explains the important bits way too fast for one to grasp the concept.

Name: Paul Cartledge
Review: Stats at UofA is hard despite of which teacher you decide to choose as your teacher. It all depends on the work you decide to put into the course. If you skip class or don't pay attention, you will fall behind. You will have to be in groups for labs with people you do not know. Paul is one of the best STATS teachers at UofA. He teaches well!

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: I did not like his teaching style at all, he writes the notes on a tablet but he keeps scrolling up and down which makes it hard to write down the notes. Even though the lectures were very slow, I couldn't get all the notes because he would scroll up right after he wrote the notes so I couldn't copy it down in time.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: I could not understand this guy at all. I don't think he can even understand himself because he seems confused most of the time- in fact, students had to correct his solutions often. That being said, his online notes are decent. Exams weren't too bad, make sure you review textbook questions.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: Enver was my favourite prof in my entire first year, extremely good at teaching a very challenging topic of linear algebra. I attended other lectures and can say he is by far the best lin alg prof at the uofa

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: bad prof. end of story

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: His notes are really inspirational. Even if you don't listen to his class, you can still learn all the things only by the notes. His notes are always better his lecture itself.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: He's an older dude but his teaching has benefited from this. He teaches the important stuff and works through related problems.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: An amazing professor teaching a quite difficult course.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: Enver is very accessible outside of class, and his notes are fairly good, though still hard to understand without attending lectures. Math 114 will be harder than high school calculus, even if you've done IB/AP so be prepared to actually study.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: Not good :(

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: His accent does require some getting used to, but after the initial adjustment you will really enjoy his class. His material is relevant to the questions you will be tested on and his notes are excellent.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: The accent is okay once you get used to it. Even I can understand it and it is my first year to Canada as English my second language. Tests are not easy but fair. But there is a curve in his class and it is about between c+ and b- so there is nothing to worry about. Just do everything he posts on eclass.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: It was confusing how he explained his method to solve problems, but his notes are good once you understand the concept. Just need to do lots of practice problems to do well in the class. Midterm is easy, and final is fair, but has more challenging questions that were in the notes and textbook. Barely anyone attended the class by the end.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: Dr. Osmanagic's accent is thicker than my Biology textbook. His notes are decent and he goes step by step through examples in his notes. His tests, however, are difficult, but as long as you practice you will do fine. He explanations are not as helpful when you ask him questions (and judges you when you don't understand a concept). Overall mediocre

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: A lot of his examples are good for doing the homework questions (He makes the webassign questions and probably the written) Hes got a thicc accent and sometimes raises his voice randomly in class (to wake up someone?). The midterm was fair if you can do all the assignments. The final is quite hard and you'd have to do a lot of practice to get a B.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: I struggled with understanding him in the lecture, his accent is very thick and he speaks quickly so you need to pay attention. His notes were great and very helpful. I would have gone to all of his classes with the notes provided printed out prior to class if I could have done it again.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: He is really helpful in his office hours and cares for his students. He emphasizes a lot on key points where students make mistakes, enjoys teaching the course. If you go to his lectures and understand what he is doing you are set for math 209. I did bad in the midterm but he inspired me in his office hours which helped me give the best final ever.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: Awesome prof for Math209 taken over spring term. Basically you can read and internalize his notes and you will be ready for any exams thrown your way. The labs however were terrible, they didn't help much in learning the material and were rather stupidly hard.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: I found parts of this course to be difficult, however the notes that are posted are good and fairly easy to follow along. The lectures were average and a bit boring but informative. The examples used in class were similar to what was on the exams. The labs were great and helped you learn the material well.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: Awesome prof, gotta be one of the best math profs at the university. Math 209 turned out to be a breeze with him over spring term. Very well organized and very good online notes posted after each class. Read his notes and ur good for exams.

Name: Enver Osmanagic
Review: It takes a while to get used to his accent and writing, but in the end it is worth it. His notes have examples that are similar to those on assignments and he is way better than most of the other profs.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: This was my favourite class and Alison is one of my favourite profs now! The way she lectures makes it so easy to take notes as she pauses at the right times. Her lecture material is actually interesting and not just the same as the slides/textbook. She's a fair grader and is easily accessible for help.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: One of the best profs I have ever had. Very friendly, explains topics clearly, gives hints about exams. The exams were fair, but you definitely need to study. Attendance is mandatory because sometimes she says things in class that aren't in her posted slides but are on exams. Textbook is mandatory because there are some text only questions

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: She's a a great prof willing to answer any questions, the exams are straight fowards just make sure you write down everything she says.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Easily the best prof Ive ever had! Her class was pretty difficult and you had to know all the material for the exams but the class was extremely interesting and she was an excellent and respectful professor. There was a lot of information to cover but she always made sure to make sure everyone understood.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Her exams are hard if you don't put the work in - you basically have to memorize all of your notes. She gives a great overview of the criminal justice system with specific issues intertwined. She talks quickly, but if someone asks her to repeat she happily will. She wants you to succeed if you put the work in.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: She talked fast which made it really hard to take adequate notes. You have to go to class because what she teaches is not on the slides she posts, and you have to read the textbook because she doesn't cover that material in class but you're tested on it. her exams are really difficult and worded to trick you but they were all non cumulative.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Excellent when teaching about criminal justice policies; however, the large portion of the course focused on policing was abysmal. A combination of cherry-picked videos and strong opinions formulated by someone with no practical experience left me feeling like watching Bad Boys II would have been more authentic and informative...

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Really good prof, 2 midterms & final all non-cumulative which makes it easier! At the end of each chapter you watch a video which helps with lecture stuff. But you have to be ready to write notes all class but she goes over MOST textbook material for you so really helps & easy straightforward tests for the most part. Really recommend this prof!!!

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: I really enjoyed her lectures as she is very knowledgable in her field and she made the topics interesting!! But get ready to type as she talks all class. 2 Midterms and a final (non-cumulative) which are primarily lecture based but each exam does have around 9 questions from textbook and the videos watched in class. Definitely Recommend!!

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Steps to success to get an A: -attend class. She gives info that is not in slides nor text -read text. She purposefully leaves out teaching some stuff from the material to give points to those who read it. Overall, she is quite fair in her question types, and if you ask for clarification during tests she will lead you toward the correct answer!

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: She was a great, engaging professor and I enjoyed going to class. The wording of her questions can be tricky and you need to read the textbook in depth

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Two midterms and a non-cumulative final. I love that because it's predictable and low-stress. They're difficult, but Dr. Dunwoody doesn't try to trick you. Her lectures are clear and interesting, and she always answers questions. Super accessible outside of classes and gives clear explanations. Favourite sociology prof. She is super knowledgeable.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Go to class and take good notes because the exams are mostly from her lectures. If you put in the work and memorize her lectures, it's an easy A. There were 3 projects/papers that were marked pretty easily. Overall, thoroughly enjoyed this class. Lectures were very interesting and it is clear that she is very knowledgeable about the CJS.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Dr Dunwoody does not play games. She is certainly passionate about the course material and extremely knowledgable. 3 exams, 3 reflective projects/papers. Projects/papers were great ways to boost your marks, but beware the exams are hard and you have to know that material inside and out. Definitely have to work for your mark in this course.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: She is the worst professor i've ever taken. First of all, she speeds in the class like crazy , her lectures are super fast and you must be a fast typer in order to go with the flow(does not repeat). Secondly, two midterms and one final - all Multiple choice and heavily weighted which can mess you up if you make a mistake. Get ready to be sued!

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Really great lecturer. I took this class in the spring, 3 hours twice a week, which flew by. Her lectures are fascinating and she uses films as teaching material. She is not an easy grader and the first portion of the class focused on theory, which can be a challenge. However, she is helpful, clear in her lectures, and respectful towards students.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: Not really sure why her rating isn't higher. She is very passionate about the CJS and is very educated. She is a tough grader but the expectations are fairly clear. For exams, keep writing!!! you loose marks if you aren't specific. She gives practice exams and is awesome for one on one clarification. Take her class, I recommend her!!!

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: She is very knowledgeable! Her notes only have the most important stuff (posted before class), and then she fills in additional information that she tests on in exams. Attend class and be detailed oriented and you will do great. One of my favorite class I have ever taken.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: This course consisted of 3 exams (MC + short answer), the choice of a paper or participating in a debate, and a term paper. The material is pretty straightforward, the textbook is necessary to answer some MC questions on the exams, and Dr. Dunwoody is a very clear speaker! Presented lots of interesting material and documentaries.

Name: Alison Dunwoody
Review: She expects word for words answers on the short answer, very hard marker. Thought i aced a midterm and did awful based off her marking.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Prof. Wheelock always made our Physics class enjoyable with her *usually* friendly/polite personality. The only times when she wasn't so nice were pretty reasonable - not enough seats for everyone (meaning people of another class weren't supposed to be there) and taking pictures/videos of lectures/slides without permission.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: One of the most interesting classes I have ever taken, Dr. Wheelock made this course fun and easy. Exams were very clear though the fine details (and exceptions) were super important.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Okay guys, I'm gonna be 110% honest. It is REALLY hard to get a good mark in this class simply because there's no organized way to study for it. The lecture notes are EXTREMELY condensed (to a point where they're pointless). Tips: pay attention/ take notes from weekly videos, (im not kidding), Highlight important theories/ formulas, review pastexam

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: She is about an average, I don't see anything spectacular. She didn't make the topics very interesting.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Competent with the material, explains concepts well and is organized.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: A lot of the material that was in this course was in introductory level chemistry and physics classes so for the most part it is quite straight forward. She does test a lot on theory so make sure you are familiar with your notes. The worksheets she makes for homework are very representative of the midterm and final which was pretty straightforward

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: PHYS 130 consisted of three professors in my semester. Every first year engineering student would pile into her lecture since her note material was the most applicable to the exams. She would get quite frustrated with the overload of students, so be thankful if you are registered in her class. Fairly easy to understand and follow.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: From my experience, her lectures were excellent! She did seem a little condescending when I spoke to her one-on-one during work sessions in lectures.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Maya's a very safe choice for physics-- very fair exams and thorough notes. She seemed a little intimidating but was caring (changed hmwrk due dates when requested). I really dislike the NECESSITY to go to class (her notes are empty), but thankfully she goes at a nice pace so there's enough time to write everything out :) good prof

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Not a terrible prof but she drones on a lot which can make it really hard to stay engaged. The course content was relatively easy however, her exams are only out of a few points so a bad mark on one of them can really hurt. Probably wouldn't take again.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: She takes it very seriously but you can tell she wants to be there. The final was SO hard it was actually ridiculous but I guess you can guess your way through it considering it's all multiple choice. She's probably the best PHYS130 prof because kids from other classes would always come into our lectures.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: I found her great, but tough. If you can do the problems sets independently, you're pretty set for the midterms (fair) though the final will be a lot harder and will require lot more prepping (2h final, too many Q's). She does a conceptual class with clicker concept questions along the way, so once you start struggling, it's best to get extra help.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Really good professor. Explains concepts clearly and has fair midterms and finals. If you do the practice questions and pay attention you'll do really good. She also really nice when you go visit her in her office.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Maya Wheelock is an amazing professor. Her lectures are well structured and organized, making them a highlight of my long days. She is easily accessible in office hours and really wants you to succeed!

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: She is one of the best profs in University of Alberta. First, if you are willing to listen in class, you are basically guarantee a C+ without studying. Her notes are easy to read, informative and useful. Second, People literally fight for sit in her lecture. LOL Third, come to class very early to make sure you can get a good spot.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Wheelock is an amazing professor! You need to go to the lectures because the majority of her notes are hand written and she does not post them, but her tests are straightforward; as long as you redo the homework problems and read your notes you will do well in the class. She's a very smart lady and truly wants her students to succeed in her class!

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Maya is definitely the best professor, she's always willing to help you even though it's Friday night. Her test is doable if you study the materials she posted. For sure, I will take her classes again.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: Maya Wheelock saved my physics mark, I could not have done as well as I did without her. She has made me enjoy physics and I will never forget the help and support she gave me in all of her office hours when I did not understand a concept. To do well practice practice practice from her quizzes and the textbook, I nearly did every single question.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: I'm not gifted enough or interested in physics to do well in her class. She tests on key points and likes concept questions. The midterms were good but the 50% weighted final finnessed my grade so cheers to that. If you know the concepts and the formula sheet though, it should be okay.

Name: Maya Wheelock
Review: She is very passionate about her work which makes u more interested in class.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: CMPUT 174 killed me over the spring a couple years back and I had to drop it but this guy was pretty cool! We made games in class and stuff. Didn't know he was a psych prof... he seemed very CMPUT-y to me so this is cool!

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: He didn't repeat a single outfit all term. I'm impressed, Geoff!

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: I really enjoyed him and his lectures, but the course was quite messy. He dropped quizzes and adjusted marks left and right, and it was always to our advantage but it still made it very hard to gauge how we're actually doing in the class. Super ridiculous scaling of project grades made quizzes unnecessarily stressful. Not awful but could be better.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: 1 midterm, 1 final, group prj, biweekly writing (free 15% if you just go to class). weekly article reading. great lectures; 3 hr night class but was engaged the whole time. the more tired he is, the faster he talks and more he stumbles on words but its kinda endearing. half written half MC tests, tough but fair grading. amazing hair + fashion 10/10

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Tough course. Lots of articles, no textbook. Exams are written with little MC questions. Hard marker. He cares, but honestly, it's either you can write it well or you won't. As someone else stated, this course was just poorly designed.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Geoff is a great prof, had him for psych 105, but this class was ridiculously hard. I believe the midterms were an average around 50 or below, i had to drop it because my GPA took such a hit even though i was prepared. Essay is very hard to do well on, not enough time. Id stay away from this class.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: He's actually a really sweet prof, which is why I was pretty bummed I had to drop this course. This was the first time he taught 303, and it was a disaster to say the least. I think the average on the midterm was a low 50. I'd gladly take another class with him, but if you're debating this course, don't. Find something that won't kill your GPA.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Geoff was probably the only reason I didn't drop out of INTD 400. He was good. Sandra was terrible.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Geoff is one of the few good lecturers at the U of A Psyc dept. However, this course was clearly designed very poorly. He said this yr was his first time teaching the class, so that could be why. As someone who's doing good in the class, I honestly do not blame half of the students who dropped. The exam deff does not reflect one's knowledge.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Nice guy. Good lecturer. Hard class though and the exam format does not really reflect students' knowledge of the material. Some people are not good at writing and the exam is 70% essay. It's also marked hard. Only 50 minutes to write 5-6 paragraphs and 10 m/c. Lots of article reading. No textbooks.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: hard course, lots of readings. more of philosophy than psychology but interesting/engaging lectures. exams are hard but he gives essay prompts beforehand so you can practice them reproduce them during the exam. genuinely nice dude, really caring. could come off as a bit rude at first though. will sometimes give you tea if you go to his office hours

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Geoff is basically the best teacher ever, his lectures are SO interesting and he is genuinely a great guy. Make sure you read the textbook and DO the quizzes. He really gives you a great chance at getting a great mark. Best prof I've ever had.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Lectures are interesting but be prepared to get wrecked on the exams! TA marks really hard. This is a very difficult class. Expectations are not clear.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: If  the essay is worth 70% of the midterm marks, I feel like he should have focused on teaching us how to write good essays. He only did once after the result of midterm1 turned out to be so low. This class isn't doing what it's supposed to eat doing - to learn about theories in psyc. It's more focused on writing. Take if you're good at writing

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Took 303 with him because of all the positive feedback here. I now regret it big time. It was his first time teaching 303 so I guess that the reason why the expectation for students isn't clear. 2 midterm (consist of 70% essay and 30% mc). Only 50 minutes to finish the essay. Average is really low. Exams are marked very very hard. Stay away

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Dr. Hollis was an amazing prof. I took both his Psych 104 and 105 and finished with A+ in both :) As long as you read the text and take notes in class you should have no problems in his class. Would definitely recommend to anyone!

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: GEOFF HOLLIS IS THE BEST!!! He is funny and extremely clear when speaking. His lectures are to-the-point yet interesting. I took psyco 105 just because psyco 104 was so good with him. It was also very easy, because the textbook is really fun to read. If you get anything less than an A, it is NOT the prof's fault.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Hollis is a very competent prof. He has a good grasp of the subject he's teaching. Lectures are standard, laid back but are simply an elaboration on what is in the textbook. His grading is pretty fair in that you get an easy quarter of your grade by finishing and doing well on your quizzes online, with a cap of 6 times. His exams are long but easy.

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Geoff seems nice and laid back during lecture.  You get an easy 25% of your grade from online quizzes when you can use the textbook (would suggest the ebook) and the midterm and final are based directly off class notes and lectures. Seems nice in lecture but pretty rude one-on-one or via email

Name: Geoff Hollis
Review: Dr. Hollis is one of the best profs I've ever had. He is so engaging with his lectures, they make the material more fun and very memorable for studying. He does have quizzes almost weekly online, these can be tough, but they are doable. These quizzes are what really boosted my mark and my exam marks as you must read your text book to even pass.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: She jumps around, says everything is "testable", gets upset when students ask questions, her exams have several grammar errors, and repeat questions (she asked the same question 3 different times), and all in all, is not a good professor. It's difficult for me to even bother showing up.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: I didn't go to Alice's lectures after receiving a 63 on the midterm. Her lectures were so basic yet long that I found my time better spent reading from the textbook. I got an 80 on the final. Depends on your learning style, but I found her lectures sporadic and lacking details tested on the exams. TEXTBOOK WILL BE YOUR BEST FRIEND

Name: Alice Khin
Review: probably the worst prof at the uofa. good luck

Name: Alice Khin
Review: Ignores every single one of my emails, wouldn't let me preview my test (even though she allowed every other student to do so), and humiliated me in front of the whole class when I left the class early (even though we are all allowed to leave lecture whenever we feel). She jumps from info to info and leaves me wanting to drop out of Uni all together

Name: Alice Khin
Review: Alice bounces around from idea to idea, never really finishing a thought. She goes back to finish a couple lectures later but that leaves you scrambling to make sense of your notes at the end on the semester. Memorize the slides and listen to what she says but don't take everything she says is "testable " for cash.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: i thought she was confusing in Nurs106, then I stepped into her Nurs116. Alice is very knowledgeable and you can tell she knows what she talks about, jumps from one topic to another so fast you cant understand what she is saying. She will rebring up and tell you more information about an idea like 15 minutes after instead of saying it all at once.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: Alice is not your ideal professor. Sadly, she is your only option if you happen to be in the collaborative nursing program. She tests very specific content, pretty much expecting you to know EVERYTHING. If you happen to be stuck with her, all I can say is good luck and RIP.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: Although she is a caring prof and funny, she can come off as a bit condescending and unorganized - some days she will go on and on about a certain topic only for her to correct herself on the next slide; not that easy to follow along if you are not used to her accent. I relied on master A&P and self-studying (going on ahead to review more) to do g.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: I LOOOOOOOOVEEEEE ALICE. the course is kinda much and there is an overload of information but she does her absolute best and tells us what we need to know for the exams and for life in general. class attendance isn't mandatory but if you want to pass you should definitely attend class.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: She is definitely not an ideal professor. She goes too fast, and it is quite hard to understand her at times. I did not enjoy the class with her at all :( She's also quite rude sometimes.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: She is quite insulting. She thinks she's funny when humiliating students for asking questions. This class is taxing as it is and it's no help when she literally completely skips over slides because "she just doesn't have the time to explain them." Regardless, I encourage you all to have faith in yourselves and take a deep breath. You can do it.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: It's a tough class as it is, and her mispronunciation doesn't really help.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: Alice is great example of what a caring prof is. She is very kind and good at explaining concepts. Would Love to have Alice as a prof again. Exams are fair, and reflect information from the slides. Recorded lectures were so helpful because the course material is so dense.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: She is the best prof Ive ever had. Very knowledgeable and really cares about her students. She will explain the concepts until you really understand

Name: Alice Khin
Review: Alice is a very knowledgeable professor but cares more about you knowing small, irrelevant details, than she does about you knowing general concepts or anything that can help you moving forward. Due to her education (she is BRILLIANT) she has trouble bringing it down to a novice level. Ultimately memorize the slides- she wants you to know IT ALL.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: Alice was an OK professor. Sometimes her accent is quite hard to understand but she is usually good about writing the tougher words on the board for us to see. She is very knowledgable but I often found she would skip around a lot, getting off topic and never finishing what she was saying in the first place. Textbook was helpful but not NEEDED.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: Alice only mentions the testable material in class. The textbook is required if you want that A. She's also is hilariously sassy, so if she asks a question, you better know what you're saying or face being roasted in a class of 200+. Lecture is super heavy and taking Bio IB in high school really helps.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: I dreaded going to this class. Alice was a great professor in that she was funny and knew the material, however with her accent it is a bit hard to understand her. there was so much information every class that my brain wanted to burst. Powerpoints ranged from 70 slides to 232 slides for each unit.

Name: Alice Khin
