Review: Alice is pretty confusing in class, and she while she reads off the slides, a lot of the things she tests on are said orally. So pay close attention! She did her best to teach, but she's super smart and doesn't understand that the students are very new to this.

Name: Alice Khin
Review: 2 hours is a long time to spend in class, but Alice made it worth it by giving a lot of hints for what would be on exams. Her exams were challenging but fair. The only thing I would change is maybe going over more difficult concepts more than one time instead of reviewing easier ones. She has a good sense of humor too.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Read books and do not care about what he teaches in class. He only text about what he didn't mention. Have to guess what is important because he never think what you think. Assignments are difficult and you only have one chance to submit them. Especially not recommend for international students.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Andrew's lectures were boring since he just read off the slides which were based off the textbook that he co-wrote, but he seemed very enthusiastic about what he was teaching. The assignments were wordy/confusing and the final was rough, but was curved unlike his midterms, which I found much easier compared to the final.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: I took his class online and looking back at it, the first 80% of the semester did not matter in his class. The final was worth 37% and was a must pass to pass the course. The material in the course was nothing like what was on the final. The practice final exam was irrelevant. The Final was random questions and a luck of the draw if you would pass.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Amazing Prof! Funny as hell, he made class interesting. The midterms and the final were not too hard, however the web assigns were confusing. The concepts in the assignments were not fully explained for the homework and the wording was confusing. However, they do not count for much nor are they indications of the tests.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Andrew Wong is the man! He'll make 102 really interesting and easy to learn! Do not take up the chance to take him as your prof! The tests are easy, just read the textbook a little and do the weekly practice questions. I loved his lectures, he's funny too and super approachable. Took him in summer, 10/10!

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: His class is really interesting but I honestly stopped going after a while (lectures were unnecessary). Assignments were not too hard but also weren't reflective of the exam questions. Midterms were super easy unlike the final which was really difficult. Didn't matter much since everyone did poorly, bringing down the class avg.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Midterms: Know lecture notes, do connect questions from the textbook. memorize questions pretty much and ur good. *Optional* Read textbook if u have time, will help. Straightforward exams. Final: Know the last 4 chapters in depth, unlike midterms. Gotta read textbook well, memorize lectures, do connect Q's, and his prac final. More difficult.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: He is a good prof, lectures were informative, not necessary as he just follows off his own power point slides which is a purely condensed version of the textbook. Textbook is mandatory, must read the chapters thoroughly to do well in the course. Mid terms are v-easy, disagree with the comment below, the final is much harder even if you study well.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: The assignments are confusing and don't really reflect what you need to understand, but both of the midterms were fairly easy, which is why the final seemed so difficult. However, it was a fair final everyone just wasn't expecting it. Super nice prof, lectures are kind of a waste of time though.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Questions on assignments and tests are poorly worded and vague. Some questions test on what noun "which" refers to. Marks don't reflect understanding. Final was difficult and didn't relate to class work. Everyone did poorly on the final, so an A was roughly 81-87, and A+ was 88+. Amazing lectures and super open to help you outside of class.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: I totally disagree with the viewpoints that his class is not intriguing. The final exam is really relatively hard, but if you read the textbooks throughly you can get very satisfying grades. Reading, so you can harvest.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Class time is often wasted, I stopped going to class after less than 2 months. Midterms are incredibly easy, scored in the 90s despite not going to class. His textbook is all you need to do well. Other 102 sections get formula sheets, he doesn't. The final came out of nowhere, ridiculously hard, not representative of class material or assignments.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Has his own textbook and presents lectures based off of it so attendance is not mandatory. Midterms were both super easy but final was quite hard compared to the midterms! However, is a super approachable professor and is easy to understand if you attend lecture.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Hes a really nice and funny, I really liked him as a person. The midterms were reasonable and related to the lectures and textbooks, it reflects well with how much you studied. However the final was nothing like the practice exams, assignment or midterm, it was so hard, tricky and unfair, hence took more time to think and 90mins was not enough.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Thought the lectures were informative and enjoyable. Very light mood and he has a funny humor. Midterms were tremendously easy, however the final is very hard. Does not reflect anything you learn in class or assignments done online. Overall dissatisfied with the lack of guidance he gives in regards to what to expect.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Easy to follow along in the class. Everything in the lectures can be found in the textbook.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: Reads word for word off the presentation slides which are also word for word from the textbook (which he is a co-author of). Class was dry and moved slow but overall good quality. Assignment questions were vague and graded strangely but a lot of answers are already posted online.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: You don't need to go to class to pass his course, he wrote the textbook so if you have the textbook and his slides you have everything you need to do well in the course. Weekly assignments with the online textbook program are required so you have to buy that. Exams are all multiple choice and very simple.

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: love his accent especially when he says 3 but his lectures are based off his textbook which is easy to read and follow along, I did bad in the majority of the connect hw but got 90's on the midterms, class average low 80's so yea overall recommend you should take his class

Name: Andrew Wong
Review: I really liked him for Econ102, but he was an awful BUEC prof. It seems like the department slapped him with this class at the last minute. He has trouble solving his own questions, refused to tell us what was on our formula sheet ahead of time &wouldn't provide solutions to recycled practice exams. He's a lot better suited for macroeconomics.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: She is a kind professor. She explained patiently when I went to her office hour. And she also gave us feedback about the exam and homework.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: The best Math teacher I have ever had. She is amazing. Explain everything clearly. Exams are similar to samples. Willing to answer all your questions. Highly recommend for everyone.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: Leonard is a good prof but to do well you have to go over your notes and re do the examples. She goes over material fast and Posts notes online but if you skip class youll have no idea whats going on. Her tests are fair compared to other profs with class averages around 60-65, Trevors classes were always around 50%. Get wize course for midterms

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: Worst prof I've ever had. Doesn't explain concepts and just expects you to know what's going on. Honestly super unhelpful and doesn't seem to care about her students. Provided no material for overall practice for the final.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: Leonard graded midterms out of 45, when most other profs graded out of 25 - this makes a huge difference because you have an opportunity to get way more part marks. She goes through material quickly, but so do all the other profs... She is easy to understand and posts her lectures online.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: She is not a good prof. She does not explain concepts very well as she does so once and very quickly. You are always scrambling to write things down and her writing is quite difficult to read. I would absolutely not recommend her

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: Horrible prof. She overcomplicates the most basic concepts and if you haven't taken Math31, it's impossible. The only way to get through is was to zone out her lectures and attempt to relearn the concepts from Math31 notes. Her homework is ridiculously hard and her midterm reviews have mistakes. She also answers questions horribly. SWITCH PROFS.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: Taken Math 115 a few times and she is by far the best prof I had. Heavy on the assignments given but that could be due to the condensed spring semester. She was very good at answering questions and was kind and funny. All in all, would recommend this prof to anyone.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: I took math 31 in highschool and I still found MATH 114 to be a difficult course. Leonard goes relativley quick during class and often times I'd find it hard to copy down all the notes. She does post them on eclass though. I found her to over complicate easy topics that I was taught in highschool. If you work hard you'll do well.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: For me, her hand writing is poor, sometimes hard to see. The notes are available online as pdf, no worries.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: For a student who took math31 in highschool, Leonard is a relatively good prof. She gets straight to the point in class which is good. Notes are posted online so dont worry about copying them down in class. Shes helpful in office hours but if you want a more comprehensive explanation of things i recommend going to decima.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: Her writing is very neat but her lectures are very boring and dull. She mostly just writes down examples and proofs without really explaining them. The weekly assignments are not fun and can be difficult. However, the midterm and final were pretty decent because she posts a practice test on eClass before so we know what types of questions to expect

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: She is very monotone, but her notes are amazing. If you go to her during office hours, she explains things clearly. She's also very nice

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: I love math and enjoyed the content of this course, but Leonard made the course very hard. If you did not take calculus in high school be prepared as this course will be a ride. Leonard assumes that we all have taken it and does not actually teach the concepts, just gives definitions and examples. She seems annoyed when you ask questions.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: She's a good professor, she knows how to teach. Her lectures are always logical and clear and easy to understand. Midterm is easy, but final exam will be harder. As long as you study and do your homework and practice exams, you will be fine.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: Great professor. Notes are well organized and easy to understand. If you are international students who worry about professors accents, I strongly recommend this professor since she speaks clearly. Professor Leonard is super patient with students and her lectures are AMAZING!!!!

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: I grew to like her over the semester. I took math 31 and i think that helped me a lot. Many people find her notes too fast and not helpful, but I found that if i tried to work through the examples as she did them, it was very helpful. Easy midterm and final, would recommend if you took math 31.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: Overall pretty good prof who is nice and clearly knows her stuff. Started out skeptical of her teaching, but definitely got better over the semester (or I just got use to it). Midterm was a challenge but final wasnt bad at all as long as you go over class examples. I would say that taking calculus in high school is a must for her class however.

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: Great prof!

Name: Elizabeth Leonard
Review: I didn't take calculus in high school and this class was the hardest class I've taken. Professor Leonard didn't make it any easier. If you end up with her as your prof, be prepared to spend many hours in help sessions, because her lectures are not only unhelpful but also extremely boring. Get out of her class if you can!

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Kirk has to be one of the best profs that University of Alberta can boast of. All those who are really interested in physics and want to work out of their comfortable zone, Kirk is the guy for you. You cannot absolutely miss him.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: He teaches realllly fast and sometimes it was hard to keep up, but it is understandable because it is a large course. A great prof and advisor. He is really passionate about the subject when he is teaching it which makes any class better. I'd say my rating is closer to a 4.5

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: One of the best and most solid profs I've ever had! He can also teach u lots in easiest way, he is so caring that he is willing to provide u the clearest explanation about anything on courses.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Kirk is the best physics instructor Ive ever had. He truly cares about preparing his students for the future and treated our 100 level class like we were a 400 level group. He took the time to learn everyone in our class name, which is a great show of how he likes to develop student relationships to give meaningful feedback.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: This course is incredibly difficult; it includes mathematics well beyond that expected of a first year student. It also has hw sets that will cause early hairloss. However, once making it through the experience, it all comes together and makes sense. Kirk cares and the difficulty of this course is only because he wants to prepare us for the future.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Best professor I have ever had!

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Great and Knowledgeable Professor

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: I loved this class. It was very difficult but definitely one of my favorites. Kirk is a very nice guy who really tries to help the students understand. Passionate and amazing to listen to in lectures.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Awesome professor! He gave plenty of study materials and made sure to cover every part of the course in great depth. The unfortunate compromise to that though is that this is a big course. He doesn't waste a second of class time and moves very fast. I often had a sore hand after taking notes! He has a lot of character and is really likable!

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Kirk is a really smart and kind professor who will help those who need it. His lectures could be intense at times but his notes were great. The tests and assignment questions were difficult if physics isn't your best subject, but certainly doable. Had to put in a lot of work to boost my mark after a hard midterm but would definitely recommend him!

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Kirk is very funny, engaging and made an effort to know everyone in a class of 100 students. but his tests are hard. even though he would tell us the basic concepts and what general ideas to study for the test, he picks the hardest possible question from this. not going to lie I cried a bit after the final. but if you put in the work you'll do okay

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Extremely insightful homework questions, but at the same time could be difficult for someone who is not really good at his high school physics. Amazing lectures which let you have a deep understanding to physics. Best physics teacher!

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Amazing well respected professor, amazing help with anything regarding the course and even help with planning future classes and helps with other courses aka linear algebra, calculus, etc. Amazing man would definitely take his class again!

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: This class wasn't easy, but Kaminsky was an amazing prof from start to finish. Our midterm average was hella low, so it's understandable that he was giving a bit of an attitude for a week after the marks came out, considering how much work he put into us. Class was never dull, easily most enjoyable class for me in this semester.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Great class! I learned a lot :)

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: Kirk cares a lot, but is condescending. Attendance is mandatory, and you have to put in the work at home. This class is not easy, and often his lectures feel like he is trying to explain the concepts to someone who knows it already, rather than a student learning them for the first time. Not a bad Prof necessarily, just not for everyone, or me.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: His lectures are heavy and fast, but he is very good at expaining the concepts, he is super intelligent, and the examples he did during lectures were very helpful. I'll definitely take his class again.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: He is a great prof.  He takes one of the hardest courses (PHYS 230) and helps you to thoroughly understand the concepts.  He has very difficult exams but he is great at lecturing and they are often entertaining.  On top of all this he is a very intelligent guy, this allows him to be able to teach even the most complicated topics to idiots like us.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: He has a deep knowledge of what he teaches, and the concepts behind them.

Name: Kirk Kaminsky
Review: One of the most interesting profs i've ever had, but also the hardest class i've ever taken. This class single handedly made me lose hair early and caused ulcers to ravage my gastrointestinal tract. To those entering this class, good luck

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Most students who gave PT these high ratings are only cuz he may be funny, gives out answers to a few asignment Qs, and ends early; yet vague about how really is he a good prof. No practice materials for exams, notes not that great. He is grumpy and rude. The way he treated me was awful for some time misinfo from the SAS for midterm. Disrespectful!

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: No practice questions to prepare for exams at all especially for bonds which weren't in the textbook nor on the assignments and turns out there were at least 6 questions on the final on bonds. The only thing he provides are his messy lecture notes which aren't even that great. He doesn't actually even give out answers to the final, just asignments

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: No practice questions to prepare for exams at all especially for bonds which weren't in the textbook nor on the assignments and turns out there were at least 6 questions on the final on bonds. The only thing he provides are his messy lecture notes which aren't even that great. He doesn't actually even give out answers to the final, just asignments.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: He is really good at teaching and does a lot of review for the final. Attending lectures is so important. I don't think a textbook is necessary.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: His random quips and asides are entertaining, I'll give him that. However, students who take ECON 203 thinking that it will boost their GPA should be aware - the Economics department has adopted a new grading policy. This is the only class I've ever taken where 90% has been curved to a B. Kind of destroyed my willpower to do well, to be honest.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Best prof I've ever had

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Most students who have had Tracey rate him highly because in 203 he plays music at the start of class, cracks jokes, gives away answers to the final, and ends classes early. I see why those who only take 203 as a GPA booster like him. However, his minimal teaching doesn't set you up for long-term success in ECON, & in 303 his grade scale is rough.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: His final exam literally ruined my career path in economics. Thanks for letting me switch my major, you and your awful final with minimally taught notes and no textbook use. He was legit the cause for my depression and made me re-think my career path even though I tried very hard. I finished with an A in 301 and that's supposed to be the harder one

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Best prof Ive had. The tests are fair, hes very clear and helpful on what will be expected. Also hes hilarious in lecture. Dont be on your phone or youll be called out. If youre in lecture, take notes and listen and youll do well.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Love him

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Best Econ Prof. Straight forward and easy to follow along. Go to classes and you will do very well on all aspects of the course.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Peter is a good person (I had him for 203) but I found that he is a better 203 professor than he is a 303 professor. With the new rule change for the grading scales within all econ classes now, his grading scale is very difficult and I'm worried about his final exam for 303.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Best prof ever

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Econ 203 was mandatory for me. The level of disrespect I got form him was unbelievable. Papers/midterm were easy but the final was ridiculous, most kids failed. When I approached him with my accommodation letters he refused to accept them. Older mindset, says kids who don't show up are just lazy. I guess my medical condition is a joke to him

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: I just wanted to say I took eCoN 203 wITh pETeR tRacY and I loved it.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Best Econ class I ever took. It was really interesting and easy to follow.. I recommend you to take this class during spring if it's offer. Go to class and you will easily pass the midterm and the final!

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: A really good prof. His notes are helpful and going to lectures is a must, but for the most part, reading the textbook is the key to getting additional information and more thorough explanations - only thing that was tough was bonds and options since it wasn't in the text. Extremely funny and for the final, READ THE TEXTBOOK!

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Tracey has a good reputation, but that's not a good reason to take a class with him. While he gives out exam questions directly to you and his bonus marks are helpful, those are futile when his grading scheme is crazy. What should be a B+ is a B- and that screws you over massively at the end of the day. Great guy but mediocre prof at best.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: He is hilarious and his lectures are clear and concise for first year Econ courses.

Name: Peter Tracey
Review: Peter Tracey is the funniest prof you will ever have. 11/10 take his class. Overall it isnt a hard course but you need to attend every lecture or youll fail. He teaches out of the textbook so you cant just read the text and expect to pass. He will also give you tons of direct questions from the final in class. His lectures are comedy every day.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Dumas is a SOLID PROF. I wouldnt say hes easy but his tests are very straightforward. Incredibly smart guy but so humble and understanding. His lectures are hilarious. One of my favourite profs in my university experience.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Best professor I have ever had.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: This is my second class with steve after intro soci. He is really funny and always gives hint for exams, so I would say attendance is necessary in that sense. His tests are okay, but sometimes have really random things that I feel have no real significance. You need to read textbook to get an A.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Dumas is Hilarious ! his lectures are very interesting and the content is straightforward. the textbook is a must-have because he pulls questions from there, so you always do the required chapter readings for any midterm. you are only graded by 3 things which is the only downside .

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Very funny prof who is very passionate about the subject. Lectures would sometimes be a bit boring and information would be repeated but other than that i enjoyed the class a lot.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Good prof - teaches well. Knows what he's talking about. Funny too, but his tests are difficult. Very specific, you gotta memorize statistics. There's lots of minute details from the textbook in the exams. A fairly standard soci class. if you did well in 201, you'll do well in 327. if you didn't, then don't take it.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Very good and funny prof, made the content interesting to learn and had great slides. Posted slides on D2L which was very helpful, sometimes goes over slides too much but still helpful. Tests have a lot of questions based of slides and small textbook! Would recommend!

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Really engaging in his lectures. He sometimes asks questions about textbook readings on his tests. Some of the minor stuff that I thought weren't gonna be on the midterms actually ended up being on the midterms. Funny guy too.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Lecutres were kind of boring but you needed to go because he adds on to the powerpoint. Tests were honestly kind of hard because he had such SPECIFIC questions from the textbook. Also on the final he had questions we didnt even talk about so?

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: The lectures are not at all mandatory. He posts his lecture slides online and if you read the textbooks you can do well without going to the lectures. He is very entertaining and engaging. Purely test based but lots of reading. Overall loved the course.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Steve is hilarious! As long as you show up and stay actively engaged, you'll pass! He tells you where to focus in the textbook as well which is awesome.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Awesome prof! Course grade is purely exam-based, which I liked. Be warned that the exams are more textbook-based than he suggests, but there's no need to go into great detail in the textbooks; just know the case studies generally. Lectures are entertaining and engaging, and course objectives very clearly guide studying!

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: his lectures are fun, but get ready to read the textbook, learn all about his personal opinions. Other than that, if you read, attend lectures, then you will do great! he has a good sense of humor .

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Amazing prof, makes class entertaining and not boring, lectures arent mandatory because all notes are posted. If you read notes and the textbook its an easy class. Tests are very fair and straight forward, he makes everything very clear and easy to understand.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Dr Dumas made this class really interesting, and was very clear in his expectations for midterms and the final (which were noncumulative). If you read the assigned textbook chapters and go to class, it's super easy to do well. He gives out hints about the mts in class, and he puts some of the practice questions posted on D2L on the actual mts too.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: This class is not an easy A- you need to study hard to realistically get a B+/A-. You MUST go to class and write down everything he says because d2l slides are not enough. Exams are tough since there are TONS of textbook chapters you must read carefully on top of class material. The perk is that lectures are interesting and Steve makes class fun.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: This has been my first class with Dr. Dumas and he is by far one of my favorite at UofC. His lectures are engaging and I can respect the jokes he throws into class to make it more fun to learn the material. He is always there to answer questions. I would say though that if you want to do well, attend class and read the textbook. A gem!

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Steve is a gem, he made classes super amazing, and was super funny. Textbook readings are long and required to be read in detail for good marks. Tests all MC, and generally simple.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Anybody who says Dumas has difficult tests has clearly not studied very thoroughly. Although his tests can be specific, he gives plenty of hints in lecture and the textbook questions are based primarily out of the society in question  just take good textbook notes and know generally what the chapter is on and you will do great.

Name: Steve Dumas
Review: Best professor at the university, HANDS DOWN! I would take any class of his, regardless of whether I needed it or not. Dumas is funny and amicable whilst also a great lecturer. I have never laughed as much as I did in his class. I would also recommend you attend each lecture as he gives great hints for exams and stories to help you remember!

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: most amazing prof I have ever encountered I cannot say enough good things about her as a person and about her teaching style.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: The only Prof I've had that responds to emails in 5min >. But fr, it seemed like no matter how hard I studied I just could not get high marks, the class average for most tests was 75. U will prob Ace this class if u are just general gifted in the application of knowledge

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: the GOAT. Melissa is the BEST PROF EVERRRRRRRRR

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Dr Boyce is seriously the best prof at this university, she is incredibly caring of her students and will answer every email her students send her, she mentioned in class that she spends 5hrs a night answering emails. She is so amazing and I feel like everyone at uni should take this course with her.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Melissa is hands down my fav teacher i've EVER had. I'm in my last sem haven't had her for a year but u WON'T REGRET taking her classes (I took almost all of hers). She is incredibly intelligent, caring, funny, and unbelievably helpful/supportive. I failed an exam and she did everything in her power to help me improve. 1000/10 would recommend.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Really great prof. Everything taught in lectures is clear. Expectations on what to study for the tests are also clear. Reasonable marker. Just pay attention, take notes and you'll do great.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Dr. Boyce is an amazing lecturer and you can tell she truly cares about her students. Shes very easy to reach through email if you have questions and she gives great feedback. 2 midterms (non cumulative) each worth 25% team project worth 12% Research participation worth 4% Tophat worth 4% (only marks for participation)

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Dr. Boyce is an amazing professor. I would say class is not mandatory all the time as she does post lecture notes online. That being said, however, she does talk about studies she does not always put in her slides that do show up on exams. There are lots of opportunities to boost your grade so long as you do them. I would definitely recommend.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Dr. Boyce was a fantastic prof. Explains material very well! I'd just take notes on what she said rather than the bullet points on the notes. Lots of practice questions and tophat questions so you should definitely go to class. Textbook wasn't required! Applied testing questions

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Would honestly show up to a class Im not even enrolled in if she was teaching it. Literal goddess of a prof, super easy to learn from her. If I ever make it, Im giving her money for early retirement because she deserves it tbh.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: After failing math I was genuinely concerned about statistics, but completely thanks to Melissa I received an A+ in this class. She makes the material so understandable and is genuinely the best professor I've had at this university. Tons of practice questions are provided which is great. She is funny, caring, and knows how to allow you to succeed!

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: She is a fantastic prof. Lectures are never boring and she does everything in her power to help you understand the material. Her tests focus entirely on material taught in class. 14/10 would recommend.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Highest grade I've ever got in a math course! If you're like me (not mathematically inclined), Dr. Boyce is the prof for you. She made the material fun to learn and provided meaningful, easy to understand explanations. Reviewing the powerpoint slides BEFORE going to lecture will help you get the most out of class.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Don't be fooled by all the good reviews - she is really nice and amazing but YOU need to put in the work if you want to succeed in this class. No trick questions on exams. don't need to show up to class - the lecture notes are on d2l. she makes it really easy for you to do well if you put in the time. easy class overall tho.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Melissa really is as great as you would think after reading all the great reviews. She makes a usually boring subject (Statistics) FUN, and engages with the class during lectures. Even if it is possible to do well without attending lectures, I highly recommend you do just because of how great she is!

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Melissa is literally the best. She is so funny and engaging during lectures, but beyond that, she genuinely cares about her students. She is always approachable and understanding outside of class, and responds to emails right away. Considering the number of students in this class, it's impressive she makes everyone feel like they matter. Love her.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Can we all take a moment to appreciate our queen. Bless this beautiful woman.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: Goes on irrelevant tangents in class and test material is all on slides so you don't have to go to class really. Textbook use was non-existent.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: I am in love with this professor. If Melissa ever needed anything, I bet the entirety of her class would show up to help because we all think she's amazing. It is legitimately impossible to not love her. I generally don't even show up to classes, but I went to every single one of her lectures. God bless this wonderful woman.

Name: Melissa Boyce
Review: God sent down Dr. Boyce to show all unworthy students how to statistically analyze experimental data. I used to be a pessimistic idiot but my hope in humanity as been revived with this goddess of a prof. I swear, the t-table is actually the word of God and she's here to send a message. SHOW UP to her teachings and you will be enlightened.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: The Calculus God.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: Great at laying concepts out and explaining things without frivolous details so, his notes are the equivalent of the bible for studying this course. However, inclass examples are comparatively easy in most cases, so dont fall into the trap of being too confident. Do all the labs, reviews, and ace the assignments and inturn you'll do great.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: Great teacher with absolutely amazing notes. Outlines specifics and even gives shortcuts to make tough applications easy, an actual genius. A bit of a jerk when it comes to external help/notes, though. Due to the way the class is curved it's almost impossible to fail, but also nearly impossible to get above a B. Final is hard, study problems!

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: He may seems scary but he's very nice and explain things very clearly to his students

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: Very good prof.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: Go to his lectures because he verbally gives hints and shortcuts on how to solve problems, but does not post those hints. Lectures are clear and to the point; he does not waste your time. The midterm and quizzes were straightforward so if you do the review sheets he makes you'll be fine. Just go to class and pay attention and you will be rewarded.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: A math god

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: I had Elsabrouty for 275 and 277 and he is still great. Obviously Math 277 is harder than 275, (more theory heavy), but if you attend his lectures and do the math labs then you should do fine.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: He's pretty chill but can get a bit intense if people from other lectures sneak in or if people are talking. Covers material pretty well.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: A professor that is a good teacher that has examples to work through during lectures.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: Amazing!!! He goes through everything you need to know in full detail. He goes slow and shows all of his steps in solving the problems. The tests are difficult but if you know how to do all of the problems from the WISE review then you'll be ok. Also DO NOT waste your money on a textbook for this class only buy the MathXL code (if you need it).

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: Content's not easy (it's not supposed to be, it's the hardest calculus course), but honestly woulda been harder without Elsabeauty. Quality content. What a guy.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: Amazing prof. This class doesn't have a textbook but you would never need one because the lecture notes are so good. You don't have to go to class but should because he gives hints about what is on the tests.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: He's a good prof. Clear explanation and complete notes on D2L. He curves the grades of the final too so you end up a better grade than you're expecting. Only complain I have is the grading. I finished with a 92% and that translated to an A- . That's a little harsh considering this is a challenging upper level math class and not an easy elective.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: There were only 4 assignments that's worth 20 % and the rest is based upon your midterm and exam. He is a fair guy, best professor I had this fall, and he loves to help. If you have any questions he is willing to help out and make some time. His lectures are absolutely mandatory!

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: He's a great prof, but extremely overrated. He teaches you everything you need to know for exams, and is the best choice when compared to other calc profs, but he goes very slowly, and doesn't interact with the class/ notice when we have questions. Also, he gives us no extra practice for exams so we didnt know how to prepare besides using notes.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: This is the prof you want for 275.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: I don't think he is that great of a professor anymore, although my brother, who attended his class in 2007, said he was great. His lectures are composed of examples that you have to memorize, and he never explains the logic behind the things he is doing. The finals are only 2 hours long, and you can only get an A if you memorized ALL examples.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: THIS GUY IS AWESOME!! He was very concise and clear and pretty much tells you what is on the midterm if you listen carefully. Would 100% recommend him for math 275.

Name: Yousry Elsabrouty
Review: Elsabrouty is the BEST math prof a student could ask for. He truly knows his stuff and everyone respects him and he respects the students. If you can, take a class with him because he will change the way you look at math. Amazing, phenomenal, and exceptional!!

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Good lectures, obviously knows what he's talking about and works to make them engaging. Things emphasized in class may not be emphasized on the quiz. Seems kind of unapproachable.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Won't speak to students outside of class, and won't answer emails, literally says he doesn't have an inbox for his email. Tells you to memorize certain things for tests, then doesn't test on those things, instead focusing on tiny details he mentioned in lectures that aren't even in the textbook or lecture slides. Absolutely horrible.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: absolutely terrible prof. told the class on the first day to NOT go to his office hours or ask him questions after class. thought this was a joke so I went to ask him a question after class and he yelled at me and told me to ask someone else. Very confused about why someone who seems to hate their job would choose to teach students.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Super good prof. Easy to follow lectures and he posts his slides on D2L. The tests are super easy if you put a little bit of time into studying. The textbook isn't needed, although i found it very helpful. Make sure you don't skip lectures otherwise it can be a little difficult to know what to study for the tests.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: He is a nice person, however, it can be hard to understand his accent at times - hence, making it harder to understand the course material. He is very enthusiastic about the content, however, the course is very lecture focused and doesn't make sense if you don't have a strong understanding in science.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: This class is very enjoyable. The lectures are interesting and the prof has a great sense of humor. The textbook lines up really well with the lecture material presented. This makes studying with the textbook super convenient. The textbook also has practice exam questions at the back. The exam format is very straight forward.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: GLGY 209 taught by Dr. Georgescu is a fine science option especially for non-majors. The textbook is quite useful (he wrote it) and is worth purchasing. Like any natural science class the lectures can get boring but he usually is good with being concise and often ends them early. Class is easy enough and he often gives our grade boosts.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: honestly this prof wasn't that bad, but his lectures are very confusing and all over the place. I did better by not attending and reading the text at home. Only good part is that he gave tons of bonus marks, making it possible for non-science kids like me to succeed LOL.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Dans a real gem! Hes always willing to stay a few minutes to answer questions after class and does stellar review days. His lectures sometimes goes a bit fast, but its always clear.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Dan's a real gem. Although this course was extremely demanding and is arguably one of the harder science options, Georgescu made it fun. He's extremely caring and will go out of his way to ensure that students get the best marks possible(ie;giving startups/pre-exam review sessions). His accent's not heavy at all. Attend lectures and read the book!

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Yes, his lectures are vague & he can be difficult to understand, but if you put in the work you can do great. Get the textbook because that will save your life for studying. I rarely attended the lecture & just taught myself the material from the textbook (super easy). He does tell you what will/won't be on the tests. And he's hilarious.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Lectures closely match textbook, so make sure to read through it once before ur exams. Attend his review lectures if nothing else as he will say exactly which sections you can skip when studying. 40/80 of the final questions are copy/pasted from midterms 1&2. This class is not hard, but you do need to prepare for the exams.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: This is not 'Rocks for Jocks' and should not be treated as such. People who give him bad reviews clearly don't try hard enough and think they can just show up and get an easy A. He is not perfect and isn't the best communicator but his 3 tests are fair if you actually read the book and come to class. As an Arts student 209 was fine science option.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Honestly, the way this class is taught is horrible. We aren't all PhD's... You know there is an issue when you curve an exam by giving a starter of 40% and its avg is still low 70s.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Great Prof, always learned a lot in this course To succeed is literally use class notes and read thoroughly the textbook! People find it hard because the lack of effort they put in, but with effort can be a fun and enjoyable and learn a lot with this class! But taking glgy 209 before this glgy 307 helps a little bit too!!

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Terrible prof. Do not. DO NOT take any classes with him. This was supposed to be an option class for non majors and he freaking treats it like we're doing a masters degree. Terrible book (written by himself that is 100$) terrible tests and a guaranteed fail. AVOID HAVING HIM AS A PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: Easy to tell he is passionate about his work. Teaches this 307 class like we all have had prior knowledge. His textbook was obviously edited by a blind man. Horrible teaching style, vague lectures & the tests are all multiple choice with 5 possible answers. Stay away from this class if you are an arts student who needs a science option.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: No consideration for students, can't even reply to emails in a timely fashion. Terrible professor.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: What he does very well is present vague lectures that do nothing but waste time, where real learning is to be done in reading. But, alas, Dan does not believe in posting reading schedule and by god, why would he make a course schedule? I hope your ability to read minds and follow along are great because his lectures are drab, boring and useless.

Name: Marius (Dan) Georgescu
Review: What an amazing prof, passion really manages to rub off on non-major students. A lot of people take this class expecting an easy A, but that certainly isn't the case for GLGY 209. I read the entire textbook and went over any possible content as the tests can throw some curveballs your way. Take this prof, he is intelligent and passionate.

Name: John Manzo
Review: Manzo was fine as a prof. You can do well just by putting in minimal effort. There were minimal assignments/tests, all of which were reasonably easy. His lectures are amusing but lack structure. He's an amazing entertainer, however his tone and demeanor can quickly shift from amusing to terribly condescending.

Name: John Manzo
Review: Manzo is a riot to have as a lecturer. He's hilarious and engaging, but he gets off topic a lot. His lecture notes are very disorganized, literally 80% of the content was from the textbook. Manzo's tests were fairly easy, and his study guides tell you exactly what you need to read so you don't waste your time.

Name: John Manzo
Review: If you're easily offended Manzo's class is not for you, he tends to overshare about his life but he's hilarious. He gives study guides about specific parts of the textbook to study and there's a good change his "practice questions" that he goes over will appear on the exam. He's a real beauty and would take again in a heartbeat

Name: John Manzo
Review: His expectations are clear, and its an easy class. If he stayed on topic in lecture his classes would be great. I think he's been teaching for too long. When people say he goes off topic they don't mean he goes down the rabbit hole on something to do with sociology, they mean that he is talking about stuff that has NOTHING to do with sociology.

Name: John Manzo
Review: Manzo was an absolutely incredible professor. He is by far the most engaging, interesting, and knowledgeable prof I have ever had. I genuinely looked forward to each class because I knew I'd be laughing half the time due to his hilarious remarks. Super easy class, literally only 1 assignment and the midterm & final. that's it. 10/10 course

Name: John Manzo
Review: Best class I've ever taken. If I become a professor, I'd wish I'd be like him.

Name: John Manzo
Review: Manzo was a pretty average professor. The class wasnt overly difficult but your grade definitely reflects the work you put in. Lectures arent necessary but definitely helpful, only downside is he gets off topic a lot. His study guides tell you exactly what is on the test, and exactly what you need to study. Tests are 80% readings, so do them.

Name: John Manzo
Review: If you already have an understanding of soci concepts, its pretty easy to read the text, follow the study guide, and get a good grade. The essays were also easy. But the lectures were pointless and he wastes so much time with irrelevant stories. I had to take this course as part of my major, but I'll try to avoid taking another one of his classes.

Name: John Manzo
Review: The test that we had to write were confusing and designed to trick you. Nothing in the class is straight forward with him. If you have Dr. Manzo, I recommend switching out and to a different professor as quickly as you can. Although he is very funny and makes class fun, he does not teach well and the test are very hard to get good grades on.

Name: John Manzo
Review: The only redeeming quality about Dr. Manzo is that the study guides he posts almost entirely cover the questions on the tests. As a result, it is not necessary to spend hours reading the entire textbook as he pinpoints the necessary sections to read. If you're willing to put in the effort and study, you will do decent in his class.

Name: John Manzo
Review: While Dr. Manzo at first seems like an amazing professor due to his personality, as the year progresses, it becomes apparent that he is very bad at actually teaching. Whereas other classes use their time effectively, most of Manzos classes focus on jokes and personal life stories which would be fine if he wasnt teaching a paid university course.

Name: John Manzo
Review: Mr. Manzo, calling him Mr. in hopes that he reads this because it pisses him off. in no way does this man think he should be getting the respect he thinks he deserves because he does not know how to treat anyone well. I have never felt so threatened in my life.

Name: John Manzo
Review: I laughed out loud when I read the "Would you take this class again?" section because I would NEVER in my life ever want to interact with Manzo. He talks down to you in such a derogatory tone, it makes me feel like a kid again.

Name: John Manzo
Review: Would never take a class with him ever again. I didn't really like being talked down to either. If you find yourself in a class with him, RUN.

Name: John Manzo
Review: His lectures are very informative yet once you come out of a lecture, you are just laughing at his jokes. Don't be offended by his humor, that's just how he is, and if you can't take a joke, Dr. Manzo is not the prof for you.

Name: John Manzo
Review: I really enjoyed Manzo. He is hilarious, and while some people find him offensive, if you can take a joke, he is hysterical. His lecture notes were light and easy to follow. If you read the textbook you'll have no issues in this class. His TA was a HARD marker for essays though, good luck getting anything more than a 60% on those.

Name: John Manzo
Review: john is the best prof I will ever have. He's hilarious, I spend most of my time laughing my ass off in class at his jokes and his lecture slides are pretty light. had 2 essays marked by TA that weren't too bad and midterms are only 20 questions which he gives study guides for. really nice guy, only class i actually enjoyed showing up for.

Name: John Manzo
Review: Manzo's initially hilarious. As the semester progresses, you notice some of his jokes border on culturally offensive, though I think he means well. As a prof, he is unapproachable and regularly makes fun of the questions he receives in emails during his lectures. Tests are very hard considering he spends most of the class talking about Carl's Jr.

Name: John Manzo
Review: Will give you very harsh feedback in front of everyone for presentations and has very unclear instructions for all assignments. Good for 300 level, but 400 level courses, would never recommend. Do not want to ever interact with this professor again.

Name: John Manzo
Review: Manzo is extremely unclear in what he expects in his papers and gives you a 50% on them if you're lucky. When I asked for help he literally told me "Honestly you're driving me crazy and I no longer want to have face to face interactions with you", and I only went to his office once the entire semester. He is a horrible human and professor :)

Name: Scott Robison
Review: I liked the way he taught STAT 213, he made the very dry material engaging. His writing is a little messy. I do recommend going to class because what is said in the lecture really helps during the assignments and quizzes. The assignments, quizzes and midterm are all marked by the computer so no room for bias.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Scott knows the material well and has been teaching it for many years, he's the course coordinator. His lectures do go fast, so outside of class effort is needed to excel in this class. If you are looking for someone who is approachable and sympathetic, he is not your guy... Expect some harshness. Also don't expect much hints for exams or quizzes.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: I got 50s on both midterm but Scotts notes got me a 90 on the final. Only reason I passed is because of his notes. Generally a good prof who just gets down to

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Fast at teaching but you can quickly adapt to it. He can go off topic but can also get his point across. Overall not too hard of a course if you put in the effort to do good. Wouldn't recommend if you're a slow learner. Otherwise pretty good at teaching as he is straightforward

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Do not take Scotts class! Scott is an extremely hard marker and is easily insulted when he questioned. Also, you have to pass the final in order to pass the class! Try going into the final with an A-, having a bad test day and ending up with a D+. I would give Scott a 0 if I could!

Name: Scott Robison
Review: I just took this course twice with him and just barely passed. The final was out of 31 marks and worth 50% of our grade. He keeps saying he wants to help people pass, yet he made it more impossible my second time around. Incredibly rude to students. Scatterbrained. Disorganized. Never looks up so he never answers questions. Biggest ego ever.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Went into the final with a 94 studied hard for the final but didnt pass. Got given a D+ because of one test even tho thats physically not possible as the final is worth 40%. He makes a rule you have to pass the final to move on. WORST CLASS EVER

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Scott clearly enjoys the content he is teaching, so I never dreaded a lecture. Tests are difficult but in the end he is fair with the grading scheme. Don't ask stupid questions about course structure/grading as he can be a bit harsh. If you have valid questions about course material he does his best to help you (granted its in office hours).

Name: Scott Robison
Review: His lectures are very frustrating, he spends half the time off topic and in the time when he is doing examples he is very passive aggressive. He responds to questions in a rude way but passes them off as jokes. He makes up unnecessary rules and threatens to lower your grades if you even speak to him. The worst prof I've ever had

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Scott brings up the 50/50 pass fail rate of the class whenever possible. He says he wants to change it but keeps the format of the material taught disorganized and unclear. If you have questions, he makes it seem like an automatic F will be given if you even think about seeing him out of class. If you must take this class, find another option.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Disorganized, rude, and his lectures are useless. A complete waste of my mornings. He just does problems in his head, mumbles, writes the answer, and expects his students to just get it. A 50% passing rate is a reflection on you, Scott, not us.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Scott is a pretty good prof. He is funny and keeps you on your feet. He makes learning fun and interesting. The course itself is not incredibly easy, but Scott does make it pretty easy. Scott is a little scatter-brained and disorganized but overall a good intructor.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Honestly, the best prof I've had at u of c so far (second year). His homework is hard and so are his exams but if you really pay attention to him in class and actually do your best to understand your homework assignments it's not a hard class. As for approachability if you ask a dumb question be prepared for a dumb response.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Scott is the worst professor I have ever had. His examples given in class and in the given textbook are nothing like the problems he designs on quizzes and exams. He responds poorly to feedback, and is one of the most unapproachable people I have ever worked with in my life. Disorganized, rude, and ultimately sets his students up to fail.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Hes not a bad professor overall, but he is incredibly scatterbrained. His classes are hard to follow. He only does examples that look nothing like the questions asked in quizzes or tests. Basically nothing (4 quizzes and a final worth 50%) is for marks so its really easy to fail. Refuses to admit when hes wrong. Incredibly hard tests.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Mans will say that he is tryin to make the class better for students but just gets rid of a midterm and adds a 20% worth quiz (wtf is the difference its still a midterm)&keeps the 50% final. When ppl ask questions in the class that challenge the structure of the course his pride gets hurt. Fix the marking on the quizzes its either you get 1or0. BS

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Scott is very disorganized, shows tricks for problems but doesn't clearly outline which kind of problems to use them in so the tricks often get lost in translation. Read the textbook from the beginning of the semester and it hasn't cleared up any questions. Take this class with someone else.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: Scott doesnt respond well to valid criticisms and is heavily disorganized. The method of teaching is simply ineffective for a class like stats since it lacks order. He always brings up "real life skills" but lacks the capacity to teach those skills.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: So he is not a bad teacher and seems to know his content. But he is simply chaotic and has no order. You come in the class and you simply don't know what you're doing. He's rude on emails too. This course shouldn't be that hard as the content is easy. He tried to change things to prevent failure, but he simply fails incredibly as final is 50%.

Name: Scott Robison
Review: By far the worst prof I've had. Scott doesn't teach anything during the lecture, just shows how he would solve problems. He doesn't respond to questions well either.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: He was an okay prof. Talked lots, going off topic most often about politics. Notes were a little helpful but textbook was more useful than him. Doesn't post lectures online. Tutorials and assignments helped a lot. Final was not fair at all. Lectures were hard to get through.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Prof Schlenker is a nice and funny man, obviously likes politics. Thats what I got at most from that class, you can do without the lectures so far you study the textbook religiously and dont wait till the last minute to study for the finals because it is much tougher than the midterms. Other than that youll be fine.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: You skip class, you won't pass. You go to class, you probably still won't pass. Lecture notes are all written by hand, so there is no power points. The lectures don't really relate to the assignment/exams. The dates/timeline is largely unimportant, like actually, don't study the dates. If you have to take this class I'm sorry, so very sorry. GL

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: I honestly cannot comprehend how any of the comments for ECON325 are positive. He spends a lot of class time describing oil history, while it never appears on the midterm, assignment, or final. His mid-term/final review is essentially useless, and the math portion of the final is much, MUCH more difficult than the assignment. Good luck.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Fair midterms and final but doesn't post practice finals or solutions. Honestly thought Schlenker explained some concepts better than the textbook. If you go to class and tutorial you can do well as long as you can read graphs and do math. Found him pretty funny when he talked about his "dislike" for NDP and Trudeau policies.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Do not fall for his high rating like I did- he marked us on TWO things & final worth 50% which isn't rare for an Econ course. He doesn't post lecture notes online, probably because he knows that if he did then no one will come to class!!! You can't even absorb what he says because u are too busy jotting down all his notes..

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Class is easy, it's related to my major though so take that with a grain of salt. THIS PROFESSOR THOUGH WAS HORRENDOUS. Wastes class time by ranting about the liberals and NDP. All of which is just him yelling to the class about the government and how flawed our country is. His notes are on a projector and his handwriting is near impossible to read

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Hilarious, and rants about the ridiculous budget and ideas presented by the liberal and NDP government. Great guy and makes classes interesting

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Really enjoyed his lectures, always funny and insightful, if a little right wing for my taste. I strongly recommend taking classes with him, he's very clear and well spoken.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Hilarious lecturer, his notes are readable although he uses an overhead projector to write his notes which can be a little annoying. If you're a slow note taker, prepare to be copying down notes for the majority of the lectures, he does go on little political rants which can be an opportunity to catch up on note taking. Reading the textbook helps!

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: The funny capitalist. Funny cause he speaks his mind, even when not always politically correct. But on the real. high quality lectures, engaging and informative.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Spent most of the classes i actually attended listening to him rant. The guy uses an overhead projector and writes all his notes by hand throughout the lecture. His notes are very vague so save yourself time and just read the textbook and youll do fine in the class. Hes also not a very approachable guy, but the class overall isnt that difficult.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Schlenker is super passionate about politics, rather than economics. Spent most of the lecture ranting. Ended up not going to lectures after the first assignment. Your textbook is your best friend. Did not study from any of his notes, and still aced the assignments/midterm. Final is a little trickier than the midterm but still fairly easy.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: His rants are just as I expected from reading previous reviews here. Entertaining and great lecturer. His notes are good - sometimes a little vague. Textbook is a must IMO. Warning: SUPER EASY assignments and midterms but VERY HARD final. READ THE TEXTBOOK. His notes alone will not prepare you for the final. Overall, tough final but a fair course.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: The assignments and midterms are easy but does not prepare you for the final. Ron gives out a practice midterm but doesn't give out a practice final (why??). Instead, links us to exam bank where you pay for a 2007 practice exam, which many have said is not similar to his final. He doesn't explain concepts in lectures in depth enough for the final.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Rants. Alot. Very funny guy, good lecturer and kept you entertained on otherwise very boring content. He writes all his notes by hand. Posts nothing on D2L. Assignments are easy, midterm was easy, final was extremely difficult and not like midterm at all. Go to class and you should be fine!

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: He was a great prof when I showed up. Funny and taught the material thoroughly. Unfortunately he doesn't post ANYTHING on D2L and writes all of his notes on paper. I was at an A after the easy midterm and assignments, stopped going to class, and the final exam was VERY heavy on the near-end material. Go to class and you should be fine

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: Schlenker, what can I say? Well, he covers all the material that you will be tested on in class, so go to class. The textbook was helpful to re-explain confusing topics and help with the assignments. His lectures are always a joy to attend since he goes on so many interesting, hilarious tangents- that somehow relate to the course material.

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: He is gets very excited about economics and genuinely enjoys teaching, he tends to rant about stuff not related to the course material; but keeps the class interesting. The assignments and midterm is easy, but the final is worth 50% and is super hard compared to the rest of the material. Try to switch your prof if possible, but otherwise study hard

Name: Ronald Schlenker
Review: very funny guy, goes off topic a lot and constantly rants about his hate for Trudeau also very passionate about Econ. he doesn't put his notes on D2L since he uses an overhead and sometimes his notes are difficult to read. there was 1 midterm as well as 2 take home assignments and they were fairly easy, but the final was dreadful so

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Anita is not accommodating to different learning styles. She does not allow pictures of any kind in class, will dock you marks for being on your phone, and teaches off an overhead projector like it's the 90s again. You have to attend class as she doesn't post lecture notes/slides online but her strict class structure will make you not want to go.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Anita was one of the worst profs that I've had at the University of Calgary. She talks to her students like they're almost incompetent and when students ask questions, she gives an overly complicated non-answer that makes everyone more confused than before. Her lecture notes are practically useless, as well as going to class.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Doesn't get the credit that she deserves. If you go to class and do the examples and go through the practice questions or "self tests" that she gives you and re read her slides you will do more than fine. The people that i saw not doing well in the class only did the self tests the day before the quiz. Put in the time with practice you'l succeed.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Anita is really sweet and really cares about her student's success and is happy to help you if you're stuck. The way she teaches the content is a little confusing at times and not as comprehensive as the textbook. I'd honestly just bank on the textbook to teach you, but class is great for review and help if you need it.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Went to lectures for the first quiz and failed it, then stopped going and did way better on every test from teaching myself and watching youtube videos. The content is extremely straightforward, but her old school way of teaching is unclear, messy, and wierdly paced. She would focus on stuff that was really easy, but gloss over harder stuff.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: She makes this class so much harder than it really is. Slides are so vague it forces you to go to class. I found myself going to youtube to clear up everything she teaches. She also does the bare minimum and finishes early every class to tell stories..

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Anita is hands down the worst professor I have ever had the misfortune of taking a class with. Her lectures consist of her sitting on a table wearing a short skirt and passive aggressively asking people why they don't understand her terrible way of explaining things. She doesn't realize that not everyone is a chartered accountant like her.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Nice person but horrible teacher and even worse slide decks. Skips a lot of material, and in-class notes are very messy. If you want to do good you have to teach yourself A LOT. She really needs to reconsider her teaching style and make her slides better. Makes the course much more complicated than it should

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: She is one of the nicest profs I have had in 4 years, but she is not a great teacher. I barely went to class because I physically could not sit through lectures. Fell asleep almost every time. Basically taught the entire course to myself. Like I said, extremely nice and approachable, just difficult to learn.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: She's not the best professor but definitely not the worst i've had. The slides are pretty bad but she maybe does 1-2 examples in class per unit. The textbook has a lot of things you don't need to know while the slides aren't enough so it's a bit hard finding what is expected.. I found youtube to be my best resource

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: In my university career I have done many stupid things, but of those stupid things, going to Anita's lectures is ranked highest. Quite possibly the best way to waste your time and learn absolutely nothing. I would rather listen to someone scratch their nails on a chalkboard than listen to Anita talk about nonsense. Don't go to lecture

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: First quiz, went to every class and listened, failed it. Second quiz, didn't go to a single class and just read the textbook, doubled my grade (and passed). Think that's all you need to know

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Anita understands the course well but is a horrible teacher. She constantly does examples and just assumes the students are now able to successfully do so as well. Her slides are very unorganized and hard to follow (important concepts aren't noted, and her slides seem to barely cover the amount of information in the chapter. A horrible experience

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Anita is a terrible professor who has no idea how to teach. She knows course material well but cannot effectively convey concepts to students. She talks non-stop and her examples are terrible also talks about random stuff that doesn't matter. Overall terrible teacher and wish someone else taught the class.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Honestly, the people on here don't give Anita the credit she deserves. While yes, she can get confusing at times, she truly cares about her students and puts full effort into teaching the class. Her excitement and her engagement with the material is great, and she provides you with opportunities to improve. As well, the stuff she says means a lot.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Nightmare. Brutal. My god. Anita is a species of her own. She takes an easy, fun, and beneficial class and somehow makes it terrible. Don't go to class. Learn from textbook/youtube. Her marking keys are ridiculous. She is inconsistent. She marks based on how it's progressively going, some students will get certain marks and others wont. Avoid. Pls.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: The textbook will be your savior for this whole course!!! If you do the textbook questions you will be fine. Do not depend on only going to lectures for the material because she is slow and doesn't explain things too well.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: There is no surprise that Anita has one of the most reviews in Haskayne, yet one of the LOWEST reviews. I can't say anything that hasn't been said already about Anita. If you have her, you will do well if you know how to self-learn. Class isn't super hard, she makes it hard. (Final is easier than midterm, do not be discouraged) Good luck.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: One of the worst profs Ive ever had. She likes to talk about random things in the middle of lecture which wastes time. She hypes up the 2% bonus on the Final Exam like its this huge boost (it just means you can get 1 more question wrong). I did not have a choice because she was the only one teaching, but I do not recommend her to anyone.

Name: Anita Lakra
Review: Only prof who teaches 323 so you're basically screwed. She talks like an elementary school teacher and goes so slow. Stopped going to class and taught myself from the textbook. 4 quizzes, each worth 6 marks and each mark is worth 1% of your final grade. Midterm and final worth the same. She gives you extra 2% if you don't use your phone in class.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Thi is funny and people respect him but he made me feel scared to ask questions out of fear of being ridiculed and laughed at. This class is hard as it is and for someone with an anxiety disorder his classroom is kind of hell. He will tell the class that the answer is obvious and will say that your question or answer is dumb if he thinks it is.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: He is quite old school and marks extremely tough on exams. Having completed a Mathematics degree at another Uni, his class was the only one I failed. Retook the course and got A+, with someone else, that should sum up just how tough he marks

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Great and caring professor!!! Recommend him any day!!

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: This lectures are always thought provoking and engaging. What makes him stand out is that, unlike other professors, he doesnt use presentation slides but uses regular chalk and blackboard which makes following along much easier and you dont get lost as much.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Thi Dinh is an absolute legend. He explains everything so well, and he is extraordinarily hilarious. One of the few classes I really enjoyed attending. If you are going to study MATH211 and have the option to choose your prof, 100%, without a doubt, choose Dinh.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Lectures are a joy to attend. Thi is a great prof, all you need to do is pay attention to pass. The man is very funny and will call out dumb questions. Know the content if you sit in the first 5 rows because you will be picked on, but forced to pay attention and be engaged. Take every chance you get to have a class with him.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: This professor was amazing. Honestly the best I've ever had. His lectures were fantastic and made everything extremely clear. His method of teaching is kinda old-school, as he writes on a blackboard, but honestly, this isn't a bad thing at all. He's also a super funny guy. Don't sit in the front rows unless you wanna get picked on.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Super cool and funny prof

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: He's unclear about his expectations for his students. He fails to provide complete examples for the proofs he "does" in class. His teaching practices are old and outdated. Ultimately sets his students up for failure.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: What an absolute legend. He understands what it's like to be a student on a deep level and has a genuine love for teaching. He's brilliant, take classes with him if you get the chance.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: amazing amazing prof with great lectures. writes on black board with nothing online so attendance is mandatory. very funny and respected

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: IMPORTANT NOTES: (1) Review materials after each class and clear anything you don't understand right away. (2) Definition is the key for the final. (3) You might want to read Textbook for the Graph chapter. (4) Some questions might seem scary but it just looks in that way so don't panic.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Math 271 is more performance art than university course. Dr. Dinh is probably the best Math prof in the Math dept at the U of C. Memorize "the bible" and you'll do well in this class.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Amazing prof. One of the best profs I've ever had. Take his class

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Thi is a great prof! His lectures were entertaining and hilarious. The quizzes were reasonable, the assignments were challenging so you might have to use more resources than just the textbook. The midterm and final were fair, previous years practice was really helpful but focus on what you learn in your semester. Notes aren't posted so attend class

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Amazing instructor. The course is difficult, but he would often go very slow to make sure you understand all concepts thoroughly. Since he doesn't post lecture note, make sure not to miss any classes. Also, do A LOT of practice in the textbook (its free). Go to his office hours, its really helpful (sometimes he even extend the hours for students).

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: An absolute legend. Excellent presentation of material, gets you involved in lectures, hilarious, encourages you to think, and isn't afraid to call out the dumb questions. Every professor should take inspiration from Thi. Would take any class he teaches just for the joy of sitting in his lectures. Math273 is honors/pure math version of 271.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: Thi is one of the best professors I have had at UofC. His lectures are hilarious and he provides amazing examples. Course is just hard, but he does an excellent job at teaching the tough material. I would 110% recommend him as a professor.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: He is hilarious and always has really good lectures. Notes are not posted online so you'll have to come to class but the learning he promotes is also quite independent, so a lot of the learning in this class will be done on your own with practice.

Name: Thi Ngoc Dinh
Review: He's a great prof who tries to help as many people as he can but usually goes with the majority of the class. That is, if you don't ask questions, he won't know you're struggling and he will move on to the next topic. His lectures are easy to understand and very engaging, especially if you sit at the front! Be careful of getting called on however.

Name: Christian William Olbey
Review: In had Dr. Olbey for English 231 in 2001. Thats right, 19 years ago. It may have even been his first year with the department. I honestly still have all of the novels we used in his class and clearly recall the themes and ideas he exposed me to. What a long lasting impact he had on my thinking. Thank you, Dr. Olbey.

Name: Christian William Olbey
Review: He contradicts what he says he wants and what he grades on for essays. Olbey with say he wants creativity, but only talk about the same two things on all the books; in my case it was mainly gender (specifically how women are treated in a minority setting) and on occasion race. He was clear that all he wanted to see on an essay.

Name: Christian William Olbey
Review: Lectures were quite dry, but extremely easy to follow. He was also very clear what he expected from essays. There was a lot of reading, as well as his reading quiz questions were extremely specific. You need to pay a lot of attention to what you are reading (the novels) in order get good marks on the quizzes.

Name: Christian William Olbey
Review: Great prof, loves what he does. There are LOTS of readings and difficult essays in his class. But he adds bonus quizzes etc to help out. Very hard grader and attendance is mandatory.

Name: Christian William Olbey
Review: Best prof Ive ever had. Very intelligent and brilliant instructor. Knows his subject area throughly and knows how to deliver it.
