She provided extra office hours when exams were coming and also was always available to help after class hours.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: One of the best Prof. I ever had. He doesn't post his lecture notes, attending class is a good idea. Very knowledgable. His lectures are straight to point and very useful, all you need is his notes, you don't need the textbook. The Exam has no trick and straight forward. He makes good jokes too, very friendly and answers questions well.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Really good at explaining abstract ideas and concepts. Reasonable understanding guy. Very engaging teacher. However he is tough (but again reasonable) grader and you will have to work hard in his courses, but you will learn lots. Highly Recommend.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: This guy is a legend! Going to class isn't needed, especially if you're already good at calculus. His past papers and DGD problems are all you need to do well, and he genuinely wants everyone to pass. There are a lot of homework problems, but other than that, can't complain. Also, all midterm marks lower than the final mark get replaced.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: One of the best math professors at uOttawa. Lectures and notes are very clear and reflect what to do for assignments, midterms and finals. Midterm and finals were very straightforward. Highly reccomend taking his class. Easily one of, if not the best professor for math at uOttawa!

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: By far the best prof I have ever had. He and does lots of examples in class and notes are amazing. Assignments are straightforward. Midterm was super easy as well as the final. If you have the option to take one of his courses do. He is the G.O.A.T. of math

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Best prof I have ever had. I wish I was able to take all of my math classes with him. Has a lot of experience teaching and it it very clear in his lectures. The assignments perfectly prepare you for tests.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Go to school and listen the lecture, easily got A. Best teacher in Uottawa. The midterm and Final questions all from the class lecture.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Really interesting prof, easy tests. Never thought a history of math class could be fun, but he made it both fun and interesting.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: After being at university for 13 years I have never met a meaner prof than this man. He gives hard midterms , and even worse finals. He made me cry 17 times in one semester.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Steve Desjardins was a contract prof at Carleton for MATH1005 he was good at lecturing and his teaching style works. However, Prof Desjardins had been very unprofessional originally refusing to use a mic, swearing at students, and rolling his eyes at questions. He just had a terrible attitude all semester, avoid if possible.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Very nice man and excellent professor

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Best professor I've had at UOttawa.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Hands down the best professor I've had. Just finished my fourth course with him and am sad its over. Grades fairly, incredible lectures, straightfoward exams, and just fun to listen to.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Man, is very understanding of the material, and also understands very well what the class understands, and is able to communicate information very effectively and efficiently. This is a professor that understands the material so well, that it seems like its trivial for him to teach the material, Thank you for teaching me!

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: AMAZING PROF!!! TAKE THIS MAN

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Very easy going teacher

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: An excellent prof ! Lots of examples, easy to follow

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: Great guy! I had him for calculus 3 and he even helps me with ODE problems!

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: By far one of the best profs on campus. Tests were very easy to do well on, and assignments were there to help solidify the material. Shame he's not teaching any higher level math courses  though... I would have definitely been one of the first ones to sign up.

Name: Steve Desjardins
Review: His notes are amazing, midterms are fair, final exam was hard.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: He was super funny and interesting, and the lectures were fun at times. This is a class where you have to go 100% of the time and read ALL of the texts (in detail). The exams are online but they include even the most minor details from the textbook or lectures. If you want an A, you need to work HARD.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: His lectures are engaging however as mentioned before he IS a very lazy prof. All midterms online so you can work with friends etc (recommended) but they have nothing to do with what he teaches in class? Scared to put my hand up bc he often mocks students in front of the class. Interesting content so a shame he lacks effort/passion as an educator.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: Lectures are note heavy, he doesn't upload ANYTHING online. Lectures barely used in tests, which are usually focused on the texts and textbook, on the smallest details. Would NOT recommend, worst prof I had in first year.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: He is the worst professor I have had at U of O. He doesnt not care for his students, as his tests do not reflect what he teaches. The questions on the test are about random facts from the textbook, which shows that he is a lazy professor, as he does not make the questions himself. He does not care for his students, and I would AVOID at all costs!!

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: Prof Alvaros lectures are interesting, but that is the only positive thing I can say about his classes. The tests are all online and do not match what he teaches in class. Many of the questions are small facts that are buried in the textbook. He does not put the time in to help students, which shows that he is a selfish and careless professor.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: For all of you saying his midterms don't reflect the class material and are mainly from the textbook... get used to it in your upper year classes. Maybe that's why I wasn't so upset when I actually DID the readings and got an A- in the course. Teachers aren't going to just hand you material for you to memorize you have to work for it.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: good lecturer but lazy prof. His exams are computer generated so the questions come from random details in the text. Avoid him if you want an A

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: By far the worst prof I've had is far! What you are tested on on exams and tests are so random. His lectures are super interesting but who cares about an interesting prof if you can't get a good grade? WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: Out of my 10 first year profs ... he is by far the worst! He is funny and his lectures are interesting, but you are not graded on the lectures at all!!! Good luck remembering the smallest of details from the textbook !! You can write the exam from home, and even with friends from the class? No regulations ... u can use google when writing the exam

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: Just wrote his crm1300 final... the exam DID NOT reflect what we talked about in class! Everything is small details from the textbook, and not fundamental aspects of criminology.. absolutely terrible prof and teaching style!! Everything is online so you can google or work with friends , but that is not impartial and fair to ur actual knowledge!!!

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: I enjoy his classes, they are very fun! After that, it all goes down hill. His tests are not on what he talks about in class!! Very frustrating! His questions are based around minute details in the textbook... its a 500 page textbook. His grades discussions are marked on how to cite properly ... even though we have never talked about it in class??

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: He seems to be a nice guy, but he is not passionate about teaching. He gives you an entire textbook and then tests you on it. Do NOT be fooled, it is hard. His lectures are engaging, but you are not really tested on his lectures, and are tested on the textbook. His tests use odd diction, so it is easy to get questions wrong for no reason... AVOID

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: His lectures are very interesting, for he discusses pop culture very often. Although, on saying this, his class is very tough. His exams are multiple choice with only a minute per question. You must read the textbook because that is where all of his difficult questions come from. For a first year intro class he is very hard, but he is a fun prof.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: Very good prof, his lectures are engaging and interesting. Although you do learn a lot in his class, his exams are very very tough. Be prepared to study very hard for his exams.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: He doesnt post his notes and has lots of discussions not related to course material. His tests are online but you have 50 minutes to answer 50 questions and they are hard. 5 discussions online and the TA is a hard grader with no helpful feedback. I regret BIG time taking this class as an elective. I would NEVER reccomend this class to anyone.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: Prof is hilarious, makes references to pop culture to make the content relatable and relevant. Participation is encouraged and he will call on people randomly. midterm and final are online and theres a paper. slides are NOT posted online and no laptops so you gotta go to class and write them in a notebook. overall decent though

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: This class was my only class this semester I actually looked forward to/enjoyed going to. He is always updated on current events as well as pop culture, and speaks to a very 'hip' and current/modern audience. Midterms and exams are online and straight multiple choice, which I found to be nice as you have your notes in front of you.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: Very engaging prof as well as cares about his students. Your insight is valued and considered, and he is always trying to stay up to date in pop culture to make lectures relatable. He relies a lot on brightspace and all exams are done online but if you do not mind that I highly recommend him as a prof. Easily my favourite prof this semester

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: This teacher doesn't care about the students. His exams are online that consist of 50 multiple choice questions. You only have 1 minute to answer each question. Lots of readings and no study guideline to the exams. His classes are usually 2-3 hours and he doesn't allow breaks, would not take a class with him again.

Name: Sam Alvaro
Review: Prof Alvaro is very funny and makes sure to use lots of pop-culture references so we can better understand the subject matter - he even uses references SO current that the students don't even know about it yet. Make sure you attend every lecture since he doesn't post anything online and most discussion boards / projects have to do with the lectures

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Go to class. The lectures seem harder if you try to do them alone. He speaks fast, but he will repeat if asked. He gives a TON of problem sets DO EVERY SINGLE ONE. Exam questions are like the problem sets. This class is all about problem solving. Easy midterms, final was hard but he gives a lot of partial points. Second midterm and final open book.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: The class was suppose to be easy but he made it super difficult. Doesn't do examples in class only go over theory which weren't even on the midterm or final. He's such a disappointment for third year. Everything was so unfair, he only grades by a few things mt + exam no bonus, no bell curve. Stay away from this guy

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Ogilvie is an experienced and competent prof. I found he spoke a little too quickly sometimes but he had 2 office hours and is happy to explain things. His assignments are super helpful, if you just study those and past midterms you'll get an A. No lab and no textbook, which is a plus. Don't fall behind tho or else it's hard to catch up.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: I had Ogilvie for biopharm and while class is usually boring, his midterms and final were very fair. The midterms were all assignment questions and the final was also assignment questions as well as repeated midterm questions. So memorize the assignments and you'll be good to go.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Dr. Ogilvie was the best professor I have ever had at university. I loved all his courses he taught, especially biopharm. Tests are fair if you study. I would highly recommend this course to any science student - it was by far the most interesting class I've taken.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Ogilvie is by far the best prof I've had at this university so far. He inspired me to keep pursuing a career in pharmaceuticals. I highly recommend this prof for any science student. Courses have a lot of information, but he finds a way to break things down and explain it perfectly. A lot of memorization , but exams are very easy if you study.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Ogilvie is a really great professor. I had him for orgo 1 and bps2110 and he was a great lecturer for both. The classes he teaches tend to be very heavy in terms of information. His lectures and notes are incredibly thorough and as long as you attend class and make notes youll definitely do okay in the class. Amazing prof I loved him.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: He's a great prof and teaches really well. His first exam screwed me so hard it was so much harder than expected and I failed but I asked for a regrading in which he added 10% and made me pass. He's quick to answer any question you have and give you more info on anything

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: William Ogilvie is a respected prof throughout uOttawa because he is such a charismatic guy. To all my fellow students looking to take Drugs 101 as an easy elective; although the class material is very interesting and an A+ is definitely achievable, know that it is a LOT of work. 100+ slides per topic and lots of notes. Go to class, study everythin

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Bby, it's crunch time with this guy. He's nice and cracks a couple jokes but he is a difficult prof not going to lie. You MUST be at lectures or you'll miss the notes (he does NOT post them) which you have to hand write btw. It was the hardest course I've taken, just make sure you look at the corrected assignments for exam prep.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Really awesome prof, his midterms were fair but the final was random and hard. Retaking the class with a different prof this time.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Tests are very fair. His explanations are not always the best, but if you go to his office he tries his best to help

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Great guy, if you want in depth explanations rather than superficial patters spoken about in class, highly recommend going to see him

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Showing up to this class is essential cause he slides wont make sense otherwise. He is a great teacher and is really good at simplifying complex topics. He really cares. This course is especially easy and helpful if youre in health sciences or nursing cause it reviews a lot of the concepts learned in other classes but in simpler ways.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: I've had Ogilvie for CHM1321, BPS1101, and BPS2110. He has many pros and cons, but I feel that the pros outweigh cons. Pros: funny and teaches course in interesting matter, exams are FAIR or EASY (don't listen to anyone who says otherwise). Cons: messy handwriting & stinge when it comes to remarking. He's def one of the better sci profs at this uni

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Had him for orgo 1 and bps1101, not a bad prof. BPS1101 is alright, lots of memorization but his exams aren't bad.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: I came into Dr. Ogilvie's class with much excitement as I heard that Dr. Ogilvie is THE Prof. I'm not sure if he changed this year or not, but his grading scheme does not seem fair. He does not give you partial marks. He takes off marks per mistake. So a question with many parts to it out of 3 means 3 mistakes on the question will earn you a zero.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Such a good professor that makes a class with a heavy course load quite simple. Listen and pay attention to the lectures and the midterms and exam won't be too difficult.... Also listen because the content is so interesting and useful.

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Prof is good. Class isn't super easy. Lotsssss of information and lecture slides

Name: William Ogilvie
Review: Amazing class & amazing professor. Drugs 101 is an undergrad class you leave with so much applicable information to your daily life. Lectures are very heavy but as long as you go, take notes, really study, you will do well. Ogilvie is a must-take during an undergrad.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: She was an awesome Prof! The class itself was incredibly interesting but she made it a so much more interesting. I wish The class never ended. She was easy to talk to and understanding!

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: Not an easy class! The prof talks about her personal life more than class content, no technology allowed which makes it even more boring. I took this class as an easy A and I regretted it so so so much especially because the final was SO hard! It was all textbook-based, and the reading were heavy. I hated this class with a passion, would stay away!

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: SRS 1100 is said to be an easy A, not wrong. But the sacrifices you have to make to your life might not make this class not worth it. Prepare yourself for unstructured lectures, NO tech (which means no powerpoint) and endless classes of rambling, she doesn't stay on track at all and makes life unnecessarily difficult. Take this class at risk

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: Prof. Rabinovitch has a strict no electronic devices policy; no cell phones or laptops. Attendance is not mandatory, but the mid-term and final are heavily based on lecture material. Content in the textbook is often not referred to in class but can be found in some test questions. Long boring lectures. Food and snacks required to stay alert.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: I missed the first couple lectures and read that I wasn't allowed to use a phone in class during a 3 hour lecture. I thought it was going to be awful until I actually went to class. In fact, she's incredibly engaging and has a great sense of humor. She just tells interesting stories and anecdotes all class, and somehow you end up learning it all.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: DO NOT take this as a 3hr lecture. no powerpoints, no brightspace, old-fashioned listen to her talk and take notes, thats it. The class is easy but you have to actually go to the lectures b/c there's literally nothing else and it gets veryy boring veryy fast. ESPECIALLY in a 7-10 seriously avoid the 3hr lecture at all costs.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: This prof is horrible. You are paying so much money to be at this school and she acts like she has the right to scream at you for checking your phone. She is often in a grumpy mood and half the time she isn't even talking about the actual course just "I was the first woman in radio in Ottawa" like girl I don't care.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: I loved this class to death and I love this prof to death it was such a great class

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: She's a great prof you will love her. Her classes are generally interesting but get ready to read a whole lot more than any other class you're taking. You will get a good mark as long as you attend her classes and do all the readings. Not an easy A but an A is definitely possible.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: not a bird course. lots of readings (2 chapters per week plus 5-10 definitions) with a lot of unnecessary content. knowledgable prof but the 3 hour lectures are tiresome when you aren't allowed electronics. midterm is 40% and final is 60% and each question is a percent of your grade. lots of content so not a super easy course.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: Amazing prof. As long as you go to class and take good notes and do your readings (especially for the final), you'll do fine. The exams are multiple choice and easy. She's funny and the material is very interesting which makes the lectures quite enjoyable.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: Shelley's voice is very engaging in class. Her midterm is 40% and finals 60%. Finals are a bit tough therefore get ready. Technological devices are not allowed in her classes, neither does she post slides so you have to go to class in order to get notes

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: She seems to be unapproachable, however she is very kind and her lectures are interesting. She is funny and makes jokes which makes her lectures not feel so long. Midterms and quizzes are pretty easy, and you just need to show up to take good notes and you should be fine.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: I loved this course. Prof Rabinovitch gives interesting, if a little rambling, lectures and explains the material really well. The reading covers anything left out in class, so do that. Exams were super easy. Remember to bring a notebook, because she doesn't allow electronics!

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: I'm surprised people thought this class was difficult, I am by no means a straight A student but this class was so easy. There is only one midterm (40 M/C  40% of final grade) and the exam (60 M/C  60% of final) but as long as you attend you'll do fine (I never even opened the textbooks)

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: A very interesting person with lots of stories to tell. Teaches class content like she is telling a story, which made it very easy to remember. Absolutely no electronics are allowed, but there were never more than 15 important terms to remember from each course. Readings were not on the midterm much, but made up a good part of the final exam.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: EASYY CLASS! She is a no no for electronics. Take notes by hand. i liked the course material so i could sit for 3 hours without loosing conscious, but it could be boring for a lot of students. Tests and midterms are multiple choice, super easy do the reading and listen to her you'll get a good mark.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: Very interesting input, sadly there were too many people.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: Considering over 400 kids were paying 800 each for this course I would of hoped she could attend class in anything else but levi's jeans and collection of cereal box t shirts. She was often rude and grumpy. This course was interesting just did not like the prof personally.

Name: Shelley Rabinovitch
Review: She's an engaging lecturer which almost makes up for the fact on how strict she is about phones and how she doesn't use a power point. Key word being almost. You need to pay attention and take good notes.

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: He's very passionate about what he teaches. He brings a lot of personal research into his class which helps with understanding the material and concepts. For the tests, read the questions carefully, they're usually traps!

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Chapleau is one of my favourite professors I had first year. He gives really good lectures, and also posts podcasts for you to listen to after class (I still recommend going to class for a good grade). His multiple choice is specific, but if you put in the effort, getting an A is really easy!

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Amazing teacher, very passionate and really interesting. Tested on the small things he says during lecture. Pay attention in lectures, study mainly off your notes and you'll do great!

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: My favourite prof at uottawa by far. The man bell curves every single exam in order to give people a fair mark as he understands that markers can be tough. Hated the course so much but he made it very interesting. No textbook required. Second midterm very tough but final was the easiest. Good luck, try hard and you are guaranteed a good mark.

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: THE BEST PROF AT UOTTAWA HANDS DOWN! He is VERY clear on what he wants you to know! he wants you to understand the main concept and not necessarily the details. Make sure you listen to the podcasts at least once because literally everything he says is important. He gives good hints in class so pay attention. Put in the effort and you will get an A+

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Chapleau is a vey knowledgeable in the subject matter taught and reflects that very well. However I found sometimes he could go rambling on and I would lose the main idea he was trying to get across. Labs are free points that should be taken advantage of. On his midterms get ready to see lots of none of the above and they were very hard, covers all

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Chapleau is a great prof! He explains things very well during the lecture, shows videos, live demonstrations, and many examples to ensure his students understand the concepts. You do not need a textbook for this course, his midterms and exams are all based on what he says in class. He posts podcasts of every lecture, so if you miss a class, its ok!

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Lectures are interesting but you need to memorize absolutely everything to stand a chance at answering every question on the exams.

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Dr. Chapleau was my favourite prof this semester. He's clearly very passionate about biology which makes his lectures very interesting. His exams (specifically the multiple choice section) are difficult, so don't procrastinate studying. Make sure you study and memorize ALL of the examples he gives in class. Would definitely recommend!

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Very good lectures and podcasts for his lectures are posted on the bright space. Unfortunately, the ta's who mark all the midterms grade solely based on specific vocabulary words in your responses. So understanding the concepts is worth nothing without the specific terms. His multiple choice are also extremely specific and are based on things said.

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: such an AMAZING prof. Although the course is content heavy and sometimes super hard to stay awake in class, he taught so well. Even just going to class and listening without taking notes helps for midterms/exam. He is so extremely fair at marking and gives extra points. Go to class if you really want to do good. All his lectures are recorded as wel

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: His French accent can be a bit hard to understand but his lectures are very thorough :) if you just go to class and review your notes, its an easy A! (if you listen closely during his lectures he gives clues about what will be on the short/long answer part of tests) only hard thing are his multiple choice q's but he gives out bonus marks

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Really good prof, GO TO CLASS and write down EVERY exemple! he'll even tell u this at the beginning of classes cause a lot of his midterms is about what he says in class. He wants very specific answers for his long answer questions cause he looks for key words in ur answers, so without a certain word, u dont get a point! Have fun :)

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: He's a sweet guy! Professor Chapleau is very approachable and friendly. Make sure you pay attention to what he says during class because that's 10000% more important than what's on the slides.

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: A really great prof. Would recommend going to class and taking notes on his examples. He only tests you on what you learn in class and it is mainly concept based. Relistening to the lectures helps learn his examples as he posts the audio on Brightspace. Only issue is that the TAs aren't great markers but he gives out bonus marks to make up for it:)

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: This man is an absolute gem. His lectures are interesting and he is very intelligent in his field. His exams are mostly concept based and about what he says in class. Make sure you study mostly the examples given in class rather than the specifics.

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Chapleau is a good prof, the only problem is his midterms can get sneaky, especially with the multiple choice. He also has a lot of examples on the midterm that he explains in class, so you need to either go to the lectures or listen to his podcasts.

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: Chapleau is the best prof I had during first year.

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: get ready for "NONE OF THE ABOVE" multiple choices, most annoying stuff ever, but he's really nice that he records lectures in english and french and posts slides online, and will tell you exam content and structure a week in advance

Name: Francois Chapleau
Review: very cool professor i fell in love with fishes because of him would take again 10/10

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: she is the worst grader ever

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: The material is not hard, but she demands EXACT wording, which makes exams exponentially harder than they should be. Midterm average was 35% before the bellcurve. Often asks questions for material that was never taught. I dedicated more time to this class than my other four combined and STILL almost failed. Worst prof I've had by far.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: The class material is not that difficult, but she is a tough grader and words her test questions in a weird way which makes the tests harder than they should be... She also teaches like a high school teacher which I didn't't like, and makes you do weird group activities.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: Had her last year and ended up dropping the course because she expects you to know the material before coming into class. She seems to be the only prof who teaches this course too. The participation questions she would have on echo would be on things that were never learned in the lectures previously.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: Honestly, this was a pretty difficult course but not nearly as difficult as people make it out to be. Just take notes in class and study a couple days before the midterm. I didn't do a single one of the readings and it did not affect my grade. Her lectures were decent and she posted them as podcasts. Lots of online tests though, but they're easy.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: Teaching is fine, talks slow, posts videos of lectures  super helpful BUT exams have nothing to do with what you learn in class

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: I would not recommend her, she is a tough grader and it is difficult to meet her criteria. I know many people who dropped the course because of her and some who failed.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: Only prof that teaches BIO1140 so you don't really have another choice for a prof. Does not teach in her lectures and she expects you to know the material before class. Just get the course done with, it'll be your lowest mark even though its the course you spend the most time on.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: Lectures are mandatory but useless, you could study everything in the textbook and slides and still wouldn't be prepared for the mess of an exams or midterm that she has prepared. Incredibly tough grader and there are always surprises on her tests. Steer clear of this one...

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: Lectures and teaching method took some getting use to. She will give you the general gist of what you need to know in her lectures but reading is required if you want a cohesive and in-depth understanding of the material. Lots of small assignments that require weekly work (online quizzes & sapling). An older version of the textbook works.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: Still haunts me everyday...

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: I am a hard working student and dedicated MANY hours to this class over the semester. Unfortunately, the midterms and exam were much harder than expected. Most of the content is a review/build on grade 12 biology, however, the way she tests her students was unfair. No matter how much you study, be prepared to not end with the grade you hope for.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: THANK GOD SHE QUIT. SHE IS NO LONGER AT uOTTAWA. THIS IS THE BEST DAY EVER

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: It is the worst class I ever took in life. Wish there was another professor who taught BIO1140. You think you did good on your midterms and exams until you find out your mark.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: She's not a terrible person, but just a terrible prof. Tests seemed okay, but then her marking scheme is some next level answers that nobody would have thought of, which messes everyone's deserved grades. Do all the assignments and do well on the labs. I hope she never teaches this course again.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: Make sure you play Biolingo EVERY SINGLE DAY OF YOUR LIFE or else you won't get the 5% cus she completely screwed the entire class up by changing the syllabus halfway through the semester. Horrible prof.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: Don't write word for word what she wants? Expect low. Most difficult class I've experienced.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: One of the worst profs I've ever had. Had Chapleau last semester so I thought this class might be just as good. Nope. You think you're confident before the exam until you see the questions which makes no sense. Speaking of making no sense, her marking scheme is so confusing. Avoid her or your participation and lab marks are your saving grace.

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: The worst prof I have ever had at UOttawa. I found that I had to read the textbook all the time because her explanations were horrible. Every time I went to her lectures I felt like I absorbed nothing. She puts nothing on her slides which becomes a nightmare especially when studying all the specific pathways. Just horrible!

Name: Caroline Petit-Turcotte
Review: The readings and lectures might give you a false sense of confidence, but the marking scheme on the exams are nothing short of an enigma.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Strangelove... is strange. His research project instructions are ridiculous detailed that will freak you out. Yet, doing the project is fun but time-consuming and tedious. As long as you follow his instructions to tee, it is an easy A+ as he marks on effort. Attempts to be eccentric but is a nice, caring, and inspirational professor.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Dr. Strangelove put a lot of effort into his lectures. Contacting speakers ahead of time to organize engaging political events during class time. His final project what a little much in terms of guidelines, but if you follow them it is an easy A+ grade.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: He's an outstanding professor. He gets you to think deeply about the world. He's caring and motivating. I'm taking another class with him again because he's just that good. The assessments can be exhausting, but it's a good test of knowledge, assimilation, and creativity. Take a class with him, and you won't regret it.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Out of all the professors I've had in my 4 years of undergrad, Dr Strangelove is the most passionate about what he teaches. His lectures/classes are definitely not your typical boring university lecture. Show up to class, follow his instructions, and be creative with your work and you'll do well.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: I appreciate how much effort he put into planning the course. The course was more interesting and beneficial than I ever imagined it would be. Out of all the professors I've had, he's one of the few that understands mental health and is considerate to his students. He genuinely cares about the success of his students, just talk to him.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Definitely the kind of professor who wants you to leave feeling like you've learned something, regardless of what it is. Cares about every student and wants them to succeed. Heavily inspiring and despite his tangents, if you listen, they're more interesting than any lecture you'll get in another class.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: I had Strangelove for CMN 3133. It was a good class and he was pretty enjoyable. I didn't learn much in his class though. No midterms or finals. Just papers, assignments and online videos based on ethnographic research (in class speakers). I only attended mandatory classes (maybe 50%-75%) and still got a great mark.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: If you put in effort, follow instructions, be curious, and think deep thoughts you will be rewarded. Dr. Strangelove really cares about his students and works hard to teach more than just academic literature.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Had Stragelove for Political Economy of the Media and it was probably one of the best classes I've taken during my undergrad. He take a really unconventional approach to political economy and makes it really applicable to today's political and environmental climate. If you work hard and create something meaningful, you'll do well in this class.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Dr. S really tries to get students to explore what theyre interested in, rather than forcing the enture class to read the same textbook whether were interested or not, then test us on it! Learnt loads in his class. Get to know him, if he recognizes you, youll develop a good relationship with him :)

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Honestly, he's an easy A. But if you actually want to learn something, don't take his class. It's an absolute joke, and not worth the thousands of dollars it costs to go to university.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Just finished law school and Dr. S is still the worst professor I have had in 7 years of school.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Really passionate prof and gives entertaining lectures. His classes focus on a lot on ethnography. He tries really hard to be a good professor and be liked by his students, which I really respect. Taking a summer course with him was a great idea! Two video essays, a group outing to an art gallery and a final report.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Super dope class

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Just take this guy's class.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Honestly, strange love is great, especially for advertising. He's a weird dude but super funny and really cares about his students. Always brings snacks to class for us. Also, no exams, only video projects, which I absolutely loved!! Definitely recommend!

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Really fun class. A lot of course activities, but the professor gives awesome feedback on your drafts so that you can go back again, fix up and get an excellent grade. Everyday snack in class too.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Strangelove has really interesting lectures and I enjoyed his insights into the world of advertising. He's also pretty flexible with giving extensions for due dates. Definitely worth being in his class!

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Mister Strange is quite the gem. Take a class with him if you can! It's interesting, bizzare, and goes by quick.

Name: Michael Strangelove
Review: Dr. Strangelove is very motivating, helpful, and talented. You definitely have to be in attendance for every class, but he is a very understanding prof and I respect him a lot. No technology is allowed, but class is kept fun and interesting, so you won't care that you do not have your phone. I will definitely take him again.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Great prof. Explains everything on the slides and repeats himself constantly. Don't bother buying the book as everything he says is what you'll be tested on. Quizzes are so easy and as long as you memorize / briefly understand what was taught in class, you'll do well. Highly recommend taking PHI1102 with him.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Great prof. He gets straight to the point in his lectureshe makes the content clear and understandable which is really important when it comes to a subject like philosophy. Lectures aren't always exciting, but don't skip them! He posts powerpoints but those don't help if you don't go to class. Classes are short too, so don't come late!

Name: Mark Brown
Review: AWSOME proff!! Nice guy go to class tho or you wont pass

Name: Mark Brown
Review: he is a nice prof

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Usually I hate redundant teachers cuz they bore & annoy me but honestly I rly appreciated Mr. Brown repeating himself in different examples. He's very passionate about the subject, very clear when teaching. All pwr-points are online, 2 midterms worth 25%, 1 final worth 50%... There's a catch-up midterm if you missed 1 of the 2. No manual/book.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Conveys the material in a clear way making philosophy easier than expected. He doesn't have a textbook so the only way to get examples to practice with are from the notes and he only gives the answers in class. He tells you exactly the format of all the exams and reuses the examples he has in his notes. Wont let students leave class early.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Though not a tough grader he is a terrible professor, get ready to re-teach yourself a lot of material. The final exam is worth a ridiculous amount so it's almost as much about memorization as it is understanding. There is no textbook for this class but it probably would've been better if there was, his slides are very scattered.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Nice guy, always ended class early and was willing to answer questions. Attendance is not mandatory, but answers to exercises are only given in class. All slides were always posted. Two midterms, no tricky questions, some were taken straight from the examples. Follow along in class and do the practice questions and you'll do great.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: I am not great at philosophy but he does make it a manageable subject. 3 tests throughout the semester each worth a lot. He does post the slides online after class but it is very hard to learn if you're not there with him explaining it.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Pretty good teacher! My only advice would be to improve his examples in class using the projectors in some creative way instead of writing on the blackboard. Also rush a little less quickly; I like leaving early, but taking notes is fine too.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Tests are fair game but not to worry because he gives you everything you need to know. Gives lots of examples so practice that alot and you'll get an easy A. Finishes class 30 mins earlier. Doesn't allow students to talk and leave early during class which I appreciated. He is definitely the best philosophy prof you can get.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Honestly, he is a great prof, but the course will make you say "what?" a lot. However, he does present the material clearly, and he is a great lecturer. He also provides an outline of his exams. His exam's were very reasonable, just make sure you practice.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: While class is non-mandatory, you will find that attending will improve your understanding significantly as he provides clear and relevant examples. He demands respect from his students (i.e. not talking during lecture or leaving early) which I find refreshing (and should be expected in a University setting)! He's witty and extremely approachable!

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Actually made Philosophy interesting! GO TO CLASS because he goes over examples and answers in class that are usually used on the tests! Super easy to understand if you go to class. No textbook or readings!

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Great lectures with no textbook and a genuinely nice guy who wants his students to learn and do well! Would definitely take again!

Name: Mark Brown
Review: He was an easy prof, the best thing about him is that he always lets you leave half an hour early

Name: Mark Brown
Review: simply love him, very nice, always smile.  the lecture was fun.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: the only problem that I have with this class is that his handwriting is very difficult to recognize.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Such an easy professor. Sometimes the class feels slow but he will give you an easy A if you listen and do the work done in the lectures. Also his classes are only have the time of what is said on schedules. I was in a 3 hour class but it would never go past an hour and a half. Easy marks and short classes with little studying needed.

Name: Mark Brown
Review: Mark Brown was a great prof!  He gives all of the tools necessary to get a great grade.  He also takes a course that could be super duper boring and makes it interesting.  If you go to class and pay attention you will get an A easily because he goes over examples of his tests.  His expectations are very clear and I learned a lot in this course.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Je viens de terminé le cours avec M. Tassé et de toute évidence il est le meilleur professeur. J'ai adoré sons sens pratique et aussi son niveau de compréhension de la matière. Bravo et Merci

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Class always ends early, didn't teach much at all. Really chill guy but if you actually wanna learn something, not the best prof.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Took Finance with him and he is really the Best professor that I had. He is a professor that teach at University Level he make you think and he doesn't spend time going baby steps.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: He is for sure one of the best profs I've ever had at Telfer! The way he teaches is so engaging and there is no surprised on the exams. He did cancel the in class test but it did not affect us in any way as the final was also very straight forward and not hard at all! The assignment was also very straight forward and easy.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Très bon professeur. Very good teacher.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Our 30% group project was given to us in 5 bullet points without a rubric. Cancelled the one in class test and moved the weight to the final. Midterm was incredibly straightforward. No need to read the textbook, just make note of what he says in class. Very unstructured. Over half the content learned in class is not tested on. Ends classes early.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Hands down one of the best professors at Telfer. He grades exams very fairly and takes questions straight from the lectures. He is also very lenient on the exams, as in if your answer is logical then he will give u the mark as long as you can justify it. Ended with an A+ and so did many of my friends in the class. HIGHLY recommend him.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Prof. Tasse was very motivating and very helpful. His way of teaching is very helpful. You have to be prepare when you show up in class because it's university and the pace is fast.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: In class, Marc is less of a professor and more of a storyteller. He has experience is the finance field and shares his experiences, shows videos on some occasions, has a great sense of humour and clearly identifies the important content. However, he doesn't teach; he goes through slides at a quick pace. Tip: read and practise and you'll succeed.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Prof. Tasse is the most memorable professor that I ever had. This professor take you out of your comfort zone and make you think about what strategic management is really all about.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Marc is more interested in being your cool uncle than he is in teaching. Not a bad prof, but he struggles at laying the course out in a clear way making the course harder than the material should be. Make sure to attend class and take notes so you know what is actually important. There's tons of material and you're not going to be tested on it all.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Professor Tasse gave us a final exam which was very fair and very logic. His lectures were amazing and he was respected by students and also very inspirational.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Tassé is an exceptional in the way that he was able to explain Finance with so many exemples and rationality. Best professor in Telfer.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Professeur Tassé est un professeur exceptionnel et surtout un motivateur hors pair. À chaque session il motive les étudiants et est capable de nous sortir de notre zone de confort. Il explique les réalités du monde des affaires et nous indique ce que nous devrons faire pour nous démarquer dans carrière. Il est pour nous un motivateur et un mentor.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: This professor is simply amazing ... he teach in such a way that you are always motivated at the end of each class. He is respected by everyone in the class and he inspire and motivate so many of us.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Ce professeur est simplement le meilleur. Sa méthode d'enseignement est exceptionelle et il est un communicateur hors pair. Il motive les étudiant.e.s et il partage ses connaisances et expériences multiples.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Ce professeur est un excellent communicateur et est capable de faire comprendre des théories financières de façon simple et directe. Merci car vous m'avez fait aimer un cours qui n'est pas dans ma spécialisation.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Il passe à travers la matière assez rapidement et ne fait que parler pendant le reste du cours. Ses examens sont faciles pas de question piéger. Les DGD m'ont beaucoup aider a mieux comprendre la matière.

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: I was really impress by this professor motivational abilities this semester. He was able to make students realize that we had the abilities and the aptitudes to achieve our goals. He made us realize that we needed to have the right attitude and to control out anxiety.  I will always remember Prof Tassé

Name: Marc Tasse
Review: Prof Tassé was unique in his way of delivering the material and also to explain very difficult concepts. He is an inspiration for us and we are so grateful to had the chance tojave him as a professor.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: The prof is natural when it comes to presentation as you can tell from his 7-hour presentation(Since I believe no prof can keep talking for that long without drinking water, but he did it). But the DGDs are really awkward since it is TA who gives you the feedback instead of him. Even with the feedback, it is hard to improve in such a short time.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: He explains things clearly in class, but the materials covered in exams are broad - highly recommended to read the textbook extensively apart from his slides to score well. Take note of what the external speakers talk about as well as his in-class examples because they will come out on exams.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: All the comments on this course are real, the class has very strict grading standards and one mistake can cause huge deduction in your mark. I do not recommend taking this course when your other classes are busy enough, and you should lower your expectations even you put 100% effort in the class. TA is crucial since the evaluation is so subjective.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Prof Archibald really demonstrated his public speaking skills on Saturday's lecture. However, the DGDs were really tough and time-consuming. Generally, this course's original goal is to improve your public speaking skills, but the strict grading system and numerous restricts make the course impossible to follow. You'd better pray to have a good TA

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Prof Archibald is the best for ADM1300. His midterm and final was extremely easy and straightforward. The individual assignment is brutal, the TAs marked extremely harsh. He does not post the slides so do not skip. He loves teaching and it shows. It is my favourite class so far.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Nobody is born to be good at doing presentations, which is why we need more time and instructions. But the prof just gave us a super long lecture on Saturday and then left all the work to TAs. In my opinion, this is possibly the most meaningless and time-consuming class in a person's entire university life.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Absolutely terrible prof, if you're doing communications you're stuck with him but he is a nightmare to deal with. I was chasing him around just to get feedback, would routinel tell me to come in at x time and then wait an hour outside his office Also doesn't keep his promises The class itself only teaches you how to present like a robot.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Would take this professor again, but not the class. I'm a fourth year student, studied really hard for the first midterm and managed to get a C+ on it. It is a tough class if you're not good at memorizing. However, the prof is passionate, gives great lectures and is funny.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Gives good lectures, is funny. Midterm/exam theory-heaving (learning terms by heart).

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Archibald is a great prof who really cares about his students. He is the most passionate prof I have ever had. The DGD groups are made for you, but if you work together it should be okay! Participate in class if you can - get to know him as well.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Incredibly smart and he gives really great advice. Hes also really nice and super funny during the lecture!

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Mindtrust Leadership Development Program with a selection process to be admitted. It is obvious how much work Professor Archibald put into this course! It is extremely well structured and engaging. The 360-degree evaluation and coaching plan allow you to get an understanding of your strengths and weakness and how to polish your leadership skills.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: This class is a LOT of work, but weeks shorter than normal classes. Set aside one day a week dedicated only to the assigned work. Practice the presentations and proof read memos. Definitely dependent on TA but they are students too so they are very understanding. The Saturday lecture was a nightmare. Archibald himself was nice and passionate

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Class difficulty really depends on your TA and how good you are vs your classmates. It's a lot of work but it's not that hard. Just make sure you don't have any errors and practice at least 6hrs for each presentation. TA's are willing to answer all questions. If you put in 10hrs a week(memos & practice) and get over stage fright, you'll get min A-

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: I don't really have a whole lot of experience with him, other than seeing him in the introductory lecture, which was way too long btw, and in one of the DGD's where he offered pretty decent presentation feedback to some of the students. If you're taking business com., the TA is the person who you deal with the most. Mine was pretty nice :)

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Great teacher, clearly cares about his students and does all that he can to help us succeed. Brings in guest speakers to talk about real-world problems and situations. At one point he said that if he won the lottery he wasn't sure whether he would even quit teaching and I believe it.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: He was often unorganized as we were so far behind in our lectures. The lectures are not fully posted online so you need to show up to class.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Good prof, but you only see him three times throughout the course: during the opening Saturday lecture, one of your DGDs and during the final. Be wary during the final, he's been watching student presentations all day so he's going to look a little bored. Don't worry it's not because of you!

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: After working for a bank as a summer intern and having to present to the executives. All of the uOttawa grad at the company told me not to follow anything I learn in this class during my presentation to the company's executives. They all said the material taught was "cringe worthy" and no one talks or "presents" like that. It was very much true.

Name: Matthew Archibald
Review: Absolutely the best prof I've ever had. Sincerely cares about his students. He especially loves if you participate in the class. I saw him a year later and he still knew me by name. Every chance I get, I am going to take him as a prof. Take him if you get the chance

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Très bon professeur, il est drôle et donne de bons exemples pour s'assurer que les élèves se souviennent des concepts qu'ils enseignent. Les examens sont facile si vous révisez et assister au cours, car il donne quelques questions d'examen à l'avance.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Great prof at UOttawa! Highly recommend you take his class if youre taking an introduction Sociology class. If you show up to class and take proper notes youll do fine on the exams. No textbook needed for his class either opposed to other intro soc classes available.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Loved him! There were no readings at all, so all you have to do is go to class and take good notes. No assignments. As long as you provide the definitions/explanations exactly as he taught them to you, you'll get an A on the exams. As an Anglophone student in a French class, I really enjoyed the lectures and understood them well.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: I looked forward to his classes every week. He is passionate about what he is teaching, and fills his lectures with jokes and personal anecdotes that help you really remember the material. He was an excellent teacher all around, and I would absolutely love to take another class of his!

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Honestly, he was one of the best professor I have ever had !! And he's super funny

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: One of my favourite profs! He really cares about your success and gives you questions that will be on the midterms/final. His lectures are quite interesting as he gives good examples. You NEED to go to class to pass. He gives hints, examples and a bunch of information that is required to pass the exams. Overall 10/10 for me :)

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Only attended class for the midterms cause my friend gave me her notes from last year but i would recommend going to class. Pretty easy to get an A since he legit gives u 2 of the questions that will be on the exams beforehand so i reccommend going to the last class before the midterm to get those questions cause he only gives them out in class

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: An entertaining Francophone. He makes a lot of jokes, and they are actually funny. Had two midterms and an exam. He seems to be a really caring prof for sociology so I would definitely recommend him to all. Presentations are posted online so showing up for class isn't always mandatory. You learn a a lot.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Such a caring prof. He couldn't prep you for exams any better. Lots of memorizing but he gives you hints of what to memorize for exams. Make sure you show up to class or else you're gonna have a rough time. Overall, one of the best teachers out there. He's very funny and will answer any question you might have.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Prof. Larose is one of the most engaging professors I've encountered so far. He does everything he can to help his students succeed (he will literally explain most of the exam questions beforehand), and uses very interesting examples and explanations. I loved his class and highly recommend it!

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: his examples make concepts easier to understand and you dont really need the course pack, take home midterm and final were super easy and the group project portion really depends on your group but very easy regardless

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: The best prof I had in first year. There is not a textbook all from his lectures which you must attend as his slideshows do not make sense without what he says. His exams are super fair and come from the slideshows word for word, but your examples are from what he says in the lecture. Very interesting and super easy class.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Mr. Larose is a great prof, he's so funny and has a great sense of humour. There is not enough information in his lectures to do well in the class therefore, you must attend class and take notes. Listen to what he says and write it down. Beside that you will do well, his midterms are easy, he gives you two questions on each exam.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: An easy A for SOC1501 if you just show up and take good notes. The midterms and final exam closely reflect the course material and he even gives you 2 questions that will be on the test before each midterm and before the final. He also has one bonus question on each exam. Has a good sense of humour too. Would recommend if you want a grade-booster.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: I took sociology as an elective and heard only good things about Stephan. Glad to say everything I heard was right! He is super funny and easy to understand. He also gives questions that are going to be on the midterms and exams so that's super helpful. I HIGHLY recommend him as a prof!

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Si vous n'aimez pas les travaux d'équipes je vous conseil d'éviter son cours. Il y a un travail de recherche à faire, Des équipes de 2-5 personnes. Aucun examen, mais le travail de recherche (partie 1 et partie 2) et un examen final maison. Il met la majorité de ces notes sur Brightspace. Par contre, les notes sont incomplètes.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Larose was a really good time - super caring and fun! Didn't use a textbook - so no readings. Make sure to show up though cuz his slides make no sense without him explaining them. Also go the classes before the midterms cuz he shares one question from each category. Generally, not a really heavy class and you'll do well with minimum effort.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Dull but straightforward class. He's a decent lecturer. Usually ends class early.

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: I LOVED his class! Seriously so interesting, conveys the material so well in a way that everyone can understand. His examples were super interesting, and he was absolutely hilarious!! No textbook either! Exams are short & long answers but easy as long as you listen in class! Take a class with him, hes the best!

Name: Stephan Larose
Review: Funny guy. Tells you 2 questions that will be on his midterms and exams and the rest of the questions you can find online on coursehero and notebro. His slides aren't detailed enough to get by so go to his lectures

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Did not go over the syllabus on first day, Classes are not stimulating. Looks at you stupid when you ask questions. Blood lecture was boring. She was the worst.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Didn't even bother to go through the syllabus on the first day of class... Going to drop this course. She's so shady to students from her PHS3341 course last semester. Taking about how people failed and stuff, but refuse to admit that she marked the exam hard along with her bad teaching skills. Such disrespect towards other students.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Carnegie looks at you like you're stupid when you ask her a question. Exam was hard despite going to class. I've never done so bad in a course in my life (her part especially). Teach theory and expect you to apply it to situations. Multiple choice were tricky. Her teaching was no stimulating and loves to throw shade about students. Don't take bad.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Sweet prof, wants her students to do well. Hard course so reading the text as well as her slides is a good idea. Fair exams but can be confusing if you don't know the material in detail. Easier Anatomy prof than most.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: never went to a class. got an A+

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Midterms were easy, final was a lot more difficult. Very detail specific, and often diagrams/short answer were unexpected topics that were very briefly covered. Read the textbook.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Carnegie explains concepts clearly and has great slides to study off of. Make sure you know what's on the slides and read the textbook for some extra understanding. Try to find previous midterms since she recycles questions.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Her lectures are very useful so I would suggest sitting near the front. Really enjoyed the reproductive section (this is where she specialized). Overall was a good teacher I think that it's just the fact that the class is challenging. Study up.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Dr. Carnegie is an amazing prof! Would love to have her again. Record your lectures, she talks without breathing sometimes. Don't interrupt her class, she'll stop her entire lecture and stare you down. Love that lady! Would definitely recommend her for anatomy, she's brilliant.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Ugh I wish I never switched into this class. All her slides have so many blanks and the slides aren't that useful. You have to read the textbook to pass since the slides barely have useful information, and her final was SO HARD.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Very good lecturer even if the content is boring. Organized and made expectations clear for what to know for exams. Exams are mostly just multiple choice and a little fill in the blank so as long as you read the book you're fine. While going to class isn't mandatory she does explain more complicated topics very well. I still skip a lot and do well

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Her exams are SO hard for no reason. Just reading her powerpoints won't do, you need to legit memorize the textbook and google. Her lectures are really boring.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: It's clear that she knows the content and is very intelligent. She makes the content interesting, and also will answer emails fast and answers questions in class. She makes her expectations clear for the exams and the exams are fair, but try s study the content as a whole and worry less about very nit-picky details. I will take her again for sure!

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: She speaks extremely fast, but she is likely to answer questions, and she is friendly and experienced, I guess I am interested in ANP because of her.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Probably the best anatomy prof I have had at UOttawa so far. She talks fast but I do like her voice and also she really gets across how much details she wants you to know. Exams are fair, but don't try to cram these exams. You need time to study forsure

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Shes very good will take her again. If you have a Choice pick her. Its not easy but shes a very very solid person and prof. Highest respect. I enjoy her classes.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Dont take this class unless youre able to TEACH YOURSELF! She goes through slides very quickly so dont be surprised when you do a chapter per one class block. You will fail if you do not study from the textbook, which on the bright side the textbook is well written! I made the mistake of relying on her to actually teach anything, good luck.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: This professor cannot teach, she teaches as though she doesn't care for the students, she doesn't take the time for students to understand, her class is very dry.

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: This might just go for all anatomy profs, but she goes over content extremely fast and goes into details before you're even able to grasp the basics, so you end up relearning it all on your own. She's very passive aggressive when answering questions. Buy the textbook and use the online homework for practice. Midterms/exam aren't a joke - study hard

Name: Jackie Carnegie
Review: Good prof, rlly good at explaining info clearly. She goes through content quite fast so make sure to keep up. Used the textbook to clarify some points but other than that, the slides are sufficient. Also don't leave class early because she will call you out on it in front of everyone. Overall I enjoyed the class and I would definitely take it again

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Chris continues on all of the positive momentum he made in PSYC1001! Do all the readings, write the paper clearly and do the SONA studies/bonus assignment. The MEC screwed me over and had me write another section's midterm (even though the content was the same); Chris let me come in at my choice of time to rewrite his section's midterm, did great!

Name: Chris Motz
Review: A quirky prof but very passionate and dorky in the best way for a first year lecture course! Ensure to do all the readings and quiz yourself on the concepts in advance of multiple choice exams. Ensure to hand the paper in on time and make sure you're clear with the concepts he wants you to cover. Do all of the SONA studies and the extra credit!

Name: Chris Motz
Review: I didn't like him at first because I found him really annoying. His examples are always so long and seem pointless, but it really helps you remember them! He gives you so many resources and opportunities for bonus marks. If you study hard and read the book you will do really well. His study guides are super detailed and he has practice quizzes.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Teaches well but not the most understanding person (for ex. after a heavy snow storm he got mad at students who were significantly late or didn't show up to his midterm at 8:30 and said "If I can get here on time, so can you"... Not everyone has access to a car.) Content is straightforward and exams are graded heavily.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Chris is an excellent professor! He's extremely animated and makes 8:30am lectures very entertaining. Chris includes powerpoints and word documents for each lecture, as well as a mock midterm and mock final exam which is extremely helpful. Chris knows his stuff, and has a unique and fun way of teaching it.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: He makes learning not so fun topics fun. He also repeats the same information 3 different times in 3 different ways to makes sure you really get it.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Amaaaazing prof. knows his stuff and communicates it well. One midterm and one exam all multiple choice. Clear grading criteria and fair questions if you study. Must read all chapters since exams are about 50% textbook material that is not covered in the lectures. Lectures are fun. Great prof for sure I would recommend!

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Chris makes it super clear what you need to do in order to succeed in his class. Go to lectures because he sometimes plays videos and mentions things that aren't in the textbook. Read the textbook and study the lectures and this class will be a breeze. Chris is a real gem and his class made learning psychology fun.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: He's funny! A good prof to take a course with in the early morning :) I didn't particularly love his course, I found I couldn't retain much of what he taught. I felt like he was a bit all over the place. I did not use the textbook, though I probably should have. I got bored very easily. But he is passionate.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Very engaging prof with easy tests.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: If you have a chance to take a class with Motz take it because he is very good, caring and nice teacher.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Here is Carletons best Psychology professor. He is very knowledgeable in the field and is extremely hilarious to the point where you ribs hurt from laughing at the end of the lecture. The syllabus for the class is the best youll come across. Grab him while you can, before the class is full up.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Very caring prof but midterms and exams were fairly hard and I even did the reviews that were given

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Chris is the best prof I've ever had, he cares so much about his students and provides every opportunity to help them succeed. If you go to class and read the textbook, then you'll be set for the exams. 2 midterms @ 24%, final @ 48, SONA studies worth 4%. Do the easy bonus4% assignment he gives! If you're taking psych, he's the prof to do it with!

Name: Chris Motz
Review: At my fourth year, he's still the best prof I've ever had at Carleton. Truly cares about education.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Amazing prof. He is very detailed in his lectures and he makes it super interesting. Make sure to read the textbook because the midterms and exam contain lots of textbook material.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Incredibly charismatic and a pleasure to listen to. He very effectively explains the relevant concepts. I personally didn't read the textbook, but most people probably should. His practice tests and quizzes, as well as his study guides, are lifesavers, use them.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Motz is literally one of the best human beings I know. He cares so much about the material and the students. He wants you to do well and all you have to do is read the chapters and pay attention in lecture. He is so organized and the class is structured so well plus his jokes are amusingly lame. HE GIVES AMAZING STUDY GUIDES! FILL. THEM. OUT.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: AMAZING TEACHER!!! super nice, super funny and very good at making things clear. You will only get graded on tests which seems hard however he provides reviews, practice workshops and practice exams for everyone. As long as you study the material you'll pass without a doubt.

Name: Chris Motz
Review: Super caring guy who makes the learning easy to understand and memorable. You don't need to show up to class but you'll want to.

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Hands down the funniest and most passionate prof I've ever had

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: I've never been big on biology, but I'm so glad I took this class. Every class was both entertaining and incredibly interesting. I always looked forwards to lectures. His enthusiasm for the subject is apparent and infectious. If you think you might be even remotely interested, I highly recommend this class. Runtz is one of the best profs I've had.

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Can't say I'm the biggest fan of biology, and I was expecting to dread every single minute of taking the class as I needed a science course to graduate but I can honestly say that I don't think there was ever a dull moment in that class. Michael Runtz truly cares about what he teaches and spreads the enthusias throughout his lectures! Amazing prof!

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Take notes during the lecture and memorize them and you should be good (it is a lot of memorizing though but its do-able). You dont need the book!! Funny prof and most of the time the info is actually interesting.

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Such a passionate Prof! 35% midterm and 65% multiple choice final. The lectures are entertaining and he brings many real animals to class. The only downside is that the multiple choice exams have 5 options instead of 4. Overall great Prof!

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Prof Runtz is such an engaging lecturer. I'm happy he is doing this course even though he is on sabbatical. He's really entertaining and makes you enjoy the content. I typically am not a huge fan of "macro" biology (ecology, etc) but prof Runtz just gets you excited about nature. Amazing prof!

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Best teacher

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Runtz is the man! He's an amazing prof and you will for sure laugh during his lectures and even when you are writing his midterm/exam. Don't think this is a show up and pass course, there is a LOT to memorize in this course. I didn't find it too bad because I'm in Science, but if you aren't take good notes and memorize EVERYTHING! A++++++++++

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Mike is a fantastic guy and a amazing prof. He will tell you in the lecture what is important to remember. Quizzes and exams were very fair. Do the self-test as they are similar to the tests. Amazing lectures that made the content easy to remember. Be aware that there is a lot to remember in this course! A++++++++++++++++

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Take this class if you are ready to memorize a lot of names of plants and animals. I did not use the textbook that much, but it may be good to have if you cannot keep up during the lectures. He is very entertaining, passionate and vivid lecturer.

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Wow. Just Wow. I changed my major to psychology because I decided to become a clinical psychologist, and as a consequence, I required science electives. I took biol 1902 and 2903 because I thought the would be the "easiest" A+. Well, from initially having no interest in nature, I have developed a new hobby. Birdwatching. 10/10 would recommend A++++

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Professor Runtz was amazing! You really need to pay attention in the lectures because he tends to get a little side tract. He does not provide the sides he uses so you need to show up in order to get the content. Textbook is not mandatory. He is absolutely hilarious and is really good at explaining the content. I would highly recommend this course.

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Very hard class, the exam is extremely hard AND a lot to memorize.

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Don't get me wrong I love him I had him in 1902 and I decided to take 2903. He is so funny and I love his courses however I will warn people that it is not as easy as 1902 at all. The exam was extremely difficult (much harder then the midterm even). Course is interesting but I wouldn't recommend taking it as an "easy" elective (A LOT to memorize!)

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Mike is awesome and very passionate about what he teaches! I could not recommend him enough. This class is no joke though - i know many people take it as an elective because they believe it will be "easy" but it is A LOT of information and A LOT of memorization of topics you may have never encountered before. Very interesting but not a bird-course.

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Hes hilarious passionate, and will some times hint at material that will be on a quiz or exam. He was one of the reasons I switched my minor to biology! Im taking his second year class now. It is more memorization, but as long as youre in class and listen, youre good to go.

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: The guy is hilarious and teaches really well, what more could you want? Very enthusiastic and knowledgeable about his material. AND he takes great photos to go with the concepts covered in class! (you'll get the joke there if you take the course!)

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: Read the text, attend lecture, and you will get a good grade. Mike Runtz is passionate about nature, and his lectures and text book clearly define what you will be tested on. Miss class a lot? Read the text book! My only complaint is his jokes during his lectures - some border on inappropriate.

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: This is a tough class, but he ends class early every week, and if you go to class and pay attention, you will do fine. This mans humor and love for what he does more than makes up for the difficulty. Will give you clues as to what is in tests if you listen. Quizzes (best 4/5), mid term, paper, and final

Name: Michael Runtz
Review: This is the best class I've ever taken. I'm in legal studies but I'm debating changing my program because of him lol

Name: Wayne Horn
Review: Had him for the Fall 2019 Stat3503, amazing professor, great person. Respect his rules and you will be good. GO TO CLASS!!! Assignments are super helpful as well. His exams are fair if you want an A I suggest you do the problem sets.

Name: Wayne Horn
