Review: Dr. Penney does her best to teach 500+ students, who are mostly 1st years and not willing to put in the work that is necessary to get a good grade. The subject matter is tough, but she is always available for extra help and really tries her best to give you all the information on what to expect on the exams. You just have to earn your grade...

Name: Cindy Penney
Review: Dr. Penney is neither the best nor the worst prof I've ever had. Exams and labs were fair. Lecture wise, she basically just reads off the slides but go anyway for the learning catalytics questions. I've gotten A's on every exam and I've studied the night before; the material is very straightforward, much of it is high school review in my opinion.

Name: Cindy Penney
Review: Lectures slides are a mess. I could know the course forwards and backwards and I'd still struggle on her tests. Complexity of her tests exceeds her ability to teach the material. Difficult material is compounded by test questions that are specific and worded poorly with subtle differences in available answers

Name: Cindy Penney
Review: This class is NOT difficult and Dr Penney is no where near a bad professor. She explains everything that you need for the tests in lecture and doing the labs and quizzes help further prepare your for exams. There is a lot to memorize but that is a given in any science course.

Name: Cindy Penney
Review: Very dense & requires ++self-lead work, but this shouldn't come as a surprise. Any first year PHYL is difficult for many students; a lot of the concepts are new and (obviously) heavily science/chem based. The labs take A LOT of time, put 4 hrs each. Dr. Penney does her best to cover material, but you're solely responsible for your own learning.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: this man is one of Dals greatest profs. you will only know after you have a bunch of trash profs who make hard exams.. his tests are hard but he is an excellent lecturer that makes science interesting

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: really funny

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: amazing

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: He's a great prof. A comedian at heart and an all around wonderful man, but his exams are the work of the devil. If you don't know everything about everything in this course you will have a difficult time on the exams..

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: He is by far the best prof at Dalhousie. He is fair, practically tells you what will be on each test, you just have to go to class. This class is an easy A+ if you go to all classes (or at least get notes from someone who went). I don't understand people who do poorly in this class. He gives you everything you need to succeed. Bill's the best

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: He's a knowledgeable professor and helpful when contacted. I felt sad when he told us he'd retire. He has a good sense of humor. I loved attending his lectures. He's amazing really...I just want to say that he gave me the sense that he was not approachable. Otherwise he's amazing and great. I'll miss him. I wish him good luck and will remember him

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: Great lecturer. Classes go by quickly. Most of the material on exams is from the lectures, which is backed up by the readings, but its very important to go to class and take good notes. Seems like a nice guy and is obviously passionate and very knowledgable about the subject. Also an entertaining sense of humour.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: Explains things thoroughly but sometimes I do miss some things he says. Otherwise he's a really good lecturer and all kinds of funny stories and anecdotes to keep the mood light and interesting. Best of luck with your retirement! You will be missed!

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: Wish him the best in retirement

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: Thankfully, he is retiring this year. Few will miss his foul, condescending attitude towards students and faculty.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: Great sense of humour and a pleasure to listen to. He is very successful and full of knowledge.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: Sad to say its his last year, but he was one of my favourite professors and if I could i would take his course again. He has a really odd sense of humour, but his silly puns and jokes really keep you awake and focused.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: He's funny! A 75 minute lecture is almost impossible for me to stay awake through but I can with him. He makes dumb jokes but at least they keep you paying attention! Posts everything online, too, but it's good to take a couple extra notes.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: He is a great professor, he really knows his stuff.  sadly this has been his last year here at dalhousie.  This is a very hard class, and requires a lot of hard work. but the amount and level of work cannot be blamed on the prof. he does a very good job of explaining everything and always answers questions.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: So funny, his jokes are great especially if you like star-wars and classic rock

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: He is an awesome prof and absolutely hilarious. Knows the material really well and is a great teacher.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: So many thing wrong here, and not enough characters! He talks too fast, and quickly says names of certain essential terms leaving you no idea what he said. There are no written notes, and what he says contradicts the slides/books a lot. He frequently doesn't say things when he talks but then says he did. He tests from the MASSIVE book. Exams hard.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: Course material was interesting, but I found it very challenging. Unless you have a strong background in  microbiology or cell bio, I don't recommend taking transgenics. Lectures are entertaining, but I found exams extremely frustrating because each question is worth so much and you need to explain details of the most obscure processes/ genes.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: Dr. Pohjadak is an example of what every prof should be. He is knowledgeable, informative, funny and cares about his students. He admits to marking easily; just make sure you go to class as anything that comes out of his mouth could be on the exam! Great prof. One of my favourites.

Name: Bill Pohajdak
Review: This guy is a beauty. He makes the most boring things seem interesting and funny. The exams are stressful since they have few questions but are worth so much. Overall, the class is pretty easy and he admits to being an easy marker. This was my favourite Bio course so far at Dal because of the prof.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Generally an amazing prof. Explained everything effectively yet concisely. Nothing really mindblowing or mind-expanding from her course, but she was as engaging as she needed to be. Assignments and exams were fairly easy. Made plenty of notes and review materials available. Would recommend.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: best teacher ever

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Cyrus is great. She's (mostly) pretty funny, has great notes, and is great at explaining things. She also fixed my midterm grade after the TAs screwed it up. I would recommend her to anyone, even if they don't think economics is for them.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Great and thorough notes for each chapter. Although tries to make the material seem interesting, her monotone voice makes it almost impossible to stay interested.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Wonderful teacher who is humorous! Online Quizzes every week on brightspace

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: The lectures could be a little dry but her notes are amazing which makes tests and quizzes very easy.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Very engaging lectures from a smart, hard-working prof. ECON1101: Textbook wasn't terribly helpful, but you must purchase myeconlab, pearson's interactive online thingamabob. PRO TIP: after using the "study plan" function on myeconlab I got 100% on all my quizzes

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: if you are taking it as an elective, it won't be easy. Tips are useful, but it only make sure you pass. Good result is not guarantee if you study only her study guide. Also, there are writing assignment everyweek. For the assignment, you will have to go to the tutorial and read the literatures in order to get a high score.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Professor Cyrus is an amazing prof. Her notes are comprehensive and very helpful, and her upbeat teaching and attitude keep you active in lectures. She cares about your understanding and will take time to help you out. She makes econ seem very easy. That being said, if you like spending tuition to not show up to class, you might have a bad time.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: overall she is an alright teacher. learnt my lesson not going to class, made the class very difficult and stressful come exam periods. more than 70% of your grade comes from the midterm and the final. tricky course but manageable if you take the time to study and understand concepts.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: She was great!

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: I also had her for Micro and Macro and she's the best!

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Professor Cyrus is incredible! Her notes are beyond helpful, and it is obvious she really goes the extra mile to help her students understand the material. That being said, attending class is absolutely necessary. But it is fun!

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Cyrus is AMAZING. If you're going to take this course make sure to take it with her. Her lectures are very easy to follow along and she makes notes that will save your grade. She's also incredibly approachable, funny and really wants her students to do well. Highly recommend!

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Amazing professor. By far the best Economics prof at Dal. I always had friends with other profs asking for notes from Cyrus's class because they are comprehensive and easy to understand. She is very entertaining and makes Econ easy to understand. Attending her class makes this class so much easier!

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Very knowledgable prof who actually cares about you understanding the material.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Best prof at Dal

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Exceptional prof. She is hilarious and relates all the terms to real-word situations to make the concept easier to grasp. Would highly recommend any of her classes.

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: T. Cyrus is the best prof. She makes lectures so entertaining that I don't even find myself glancing at the time, I'm actually surprised when class is over. The midterms are made by all the econ profs but her questions are always straightforward. She's an excellent instructor. If you're first year commerce, definitely try to get into her class!

Name: Teresa Cyrus
Review: Best prof I've had yet!

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Honestly, taking this guys class was an experience. His classes are quite difficult but you will leave his classes a better person.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Very fast moving in lectures, impossible to follow, notes are scribbled everywhere, he is a very nice man and very funny, marks very tough

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Dr. Kember is the real deal. He knows the subject material intimately and is constantly drawing connections between DE and the real world. With that being said, the course is very difficult; in particular, some of the assignments seemed a bit excessive. If you buy in to his methods and do the practice problems you will be fine, but if not...

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Shows lots of DE and VEC applications (control system, circuitry, and fluid mechanics...) during the class which benefit for future learning. And class is not that hard

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Teaching style is very memorization and procedure based which throws off some students. He writes very illegibly and gives difficult assignments.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: An amazing professor to learn from who adamantly cares about making sure the message is conveyed. He goes off on tangents a lot and will take time to understand his way of teaching. Worth it at the end.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Unless you have super powers you will not have a good time in this class. This guy writes faster than you can jot down notes and speaks faster than you can perceive. Differential equations are already hard enough, but he makes it excruciatingly difficult by writings illegible chicken scratch. It's really hard to absorb anything during lecture.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: This Guy is the most eccentric and worst prof I've ever hard. I hardly ever grasp the material taught in class and revisiting his notes is like deciphering a hieroglyph. He constantly uses arrows, acronyms, and circles in a way that makes following his lecture next to impossible. His tests are difficult but reflect the homework problems.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: You will either learn it all inside out and backwards or learn nothing at all from his class.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: If you genuinely try, he will be one of the best teachers you will have; a lot of students complain because they don't put in much (great) effort but still expect good grades. He also has a good sense of humour and some interesting stories.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Toughest/most disorganized class I've ever had. DO NOT waste your semester with him, take it in the summer.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: He is the most smart guy ever who cannot be followed in lecture. I believe he is a good guy who is helpful on math, but he won't let you pass if you are not smart enough. Whatever, I dropped his class.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: His notes are impossible to follow. Jumps from topic to topic.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Dr. Kember is great, talk to him outside of the lecture and he answers any questions you have. He wants his students to succeed, but he wants to know that they're working for it. DE isn't easy but if you ask Dr. Kember for help he'll gladly give it to you.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Fun stories, but unfortunately tagged with the responsibility of teaching a difficult subject. Lots of his students fail to understand everything, but he won't put anything on the exam or midterm that you haven't seen before.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: He teaches those who want to learn and will never refuse to answer any dumb questions you may have for him. My advice is to study and look over your practice questions, if you fail- it's your fault. The final had one difficult question.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: Nice Prof for math. get prepared before class and you will learn a lot!

Name: Guy Kember
Review: With Guy Kember you get out what you put in.  Try hard, and show him you try, and he will work hard for you.  What he dislikes is when a student takes on the role of being just another number.  Show him you are an individual and he will help you, explain concepts, ect.  He's a good teacher, hard - but you will learn a lot.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: One of the most intelligent and interesting people I've ever met.However, he is useless as a teacher. His tests are impossible hard and share very little in common with practice questions.

Name: Guy Kember
Review: I love kembers random tangents and his stories. His is a bit hard to follow sometimes, but he is an interesting and extremely smart man. I loved going to his lectures just because i was so interested in who he was a person, and what he had to say.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Best prof of CS at dal

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Truly cares about your success

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Srini is a wonderful lecturer and person, but he gives far too much direction. A lot of hand holding on assignments with instructions describing exactly how to solve the problem, taking away the challenge and the learning experience. Group project at the end that should really be replaced with harder assignments. Try a more challenging prof.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Srini is the best professor at Dal. Period. I would take any course taught by him, no matter how difficult the course may be, he makes it so easy. I was lucky enough to get a seat in the course, because Srini's courses are houseful always and He extends the seats everytime.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Best professor I've had. Really wants you to succeed and gives you all the tools needed to get an A.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Srini really is a gem. I wouldn't hesitate to take a class with him again!!

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: best proff ever, if you come to class you are guaranteed to understand everything and get an A. I mean there is an award, "the Srini award for teaching excellence" named after him, that speaks for itself.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: He is the best professor ever. He really put a lot of efforts in class and he really care about how student feel and what student learned. He always keep tracks of every thing and respond email impossibly quick. He consist to mark every students's paper just to know how well everyone leared. I really can't say enough about Srini. Everyone loves him

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Best prof in the whole CS department, Possibly the best proff in Dalhousie

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: A little bit harder than the networking course... More things to memorize in general. Although attending classes is not 100% mandatory (depends on when he takes attendance), skipping classes will make it much harder to study on your own.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Easy exams if you attend every lecture. 5 Assignments and 1 Group project which is a little overwhelming if taking several courses... But easy A in general.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Simply awesome!

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: hes knows students by name

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: He's AMAZING. BEST prof.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Amazing professor, definitely my favourite in the program. Provided all the necessary information in printed out handbooks. Tests, labs and assignments were all reasonably challenging as well.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Follow his lecture, you can get a high grade.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Follow his lecture, you will get high grade.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: Hands down the best professor in computer science.

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: One of the best prof ever met. Lecture is well organized. A must-take if you want to enjoy the start of computer science at Dalhousie. Even brought small snacks for us occasionally(yes, for presentation. Cookie, Cookie Jars, Cookie Box- aggregation)

Name: Srinivas Sampalli
Review: I Have to find words to describe how awesome Srini is, You just needs to attend is class and do all the homework by your own and it guaranteed you will end up with A grades. Its not completely about the grade though , the concepts he teaches in the class , you will remember them for the rest of the life. very inspirational, extremely organized.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Duncan is so intelligent. You can't help but be intrigued by everything he says. He not only is incredibly smart but he's extremely kind. I went to his office hours skeptical because he is so sure his students will do well in the course but after discussing content with him, I was completely relaxed. He truly cares about his students.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: My favorite prof I have had so far

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Very passionate about the subject. Can tell he cares avout students and them doing well. Everyone should take one of his classes if they can

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Im not a fan of philosophy but i would definitely take this class again

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Best philosophy prof at Dal

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Professor MacIntosh was fantastic this semester. His exams were fair and he really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He's very enthusiastic, and it shows throuhgout every lecture which made me enjoy coming to class. After the first semester with Prof. Jeffers I was thinking of dropping it but I'm glad I didn't.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Dunc is honestly such a G. Absolutely HATED the X segment of the course and Dr. MacIntosh completely changed my perspective around and made me love philosophy. He makes everything very clear and prints notes for the class so you don't have to write your own. Take his class if you can!!

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Honestly, MacIntosh was an incredible professor, he was super funny and says things multiple times so that you completely understand the concepts. I would totally recommend taking this course even as an elective, as it is interesting and so long as you show up to class and listen you will do well.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: If you're in any way considering dropping out because you had a boring, low-energy prof (like I did with Professor Jeffers), then stick with it so you can get Professor MacIntosh. He explains things in a very easy to understand way, and tests are relatively easy as he makes sure to grind the information into your skull, in a funny, interesting way.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: I thought he was a great professor. He was funny and easy to understand. I'm really glad I got him!

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Truly amazing professor, changed my views of philosophy after almost dropping out after first semester with different (awful) prof. Every single lecture was top, I even shed tears at the end of his last lecture. Do yourself a favor and take any of his classes, such a pleasure!

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Prof was an inspiration after the previous semester when I almost dropped the course, I'm happy I didn't because I really like  Philosophy.  He has a natural way of delivering his lecture and the discussion segments after each lecture are very interesting. You won't be disappointed.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: One of the most  influential profs i've had. Saved my mark and view on philosophy after the X semester of the course. Inspiring, understanding and so wise. Delivers the material in an interesting, straightforward and humorous way which makes it easier to engage in the class and do well. Knew he would be an amazing prof from day one.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Really great prof - Interesting lectures, great sense of humour, super understanding about tests/grades/attendance.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: God he is the best prof at Dal, he'll even tell you himself. This class is made amazing by him as my last philosophy professor completely ruined my view on philosophy, but Macintosh revived it. If you can, def take a course by him. He's so funny, and he'll make sure your ideas are heard. This is one of those classes where anything said isn't wrong

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: This is the best prof I've had at Dal so far. Duncan is hilarious, cares about the students & takes time each class to individually ask every student if they have a question. He reviews the important stuff from the previous classs & clearly outlines what you need to know and the lectures are interesting. This class has saved my view on philosophy

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Best prof. Wastes no time, loves to engage with class, and truly knows what he's talking about.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: He's by far the best teacher I've ever had, and maybe the smartest man I've ever met. He is almost too accommodating, you never have to worry about losing a grade just because something is late, he'll always make arrangements for you.

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: Best professor of my entire university experience hands down

Name: Duncan MacIntosh
Review: While entertaining, I found that most of the material was spoon fed and very superficially covered. Additionally, some of his off color jokes were a bit off putting. Overall, great prof if you want to be entertained without having to think too much.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Expect amazing demonstrations, making you excited to attend class and help you visualize what's happening. The class is tough (with C being the median letter grade), with lots of studying to do and homework to solve. However, the prof is accessible outside of class during his office hours, and there is a great team of TAs in the resource center.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: One of the best profs of the first year. Kind, funny, and always ready with a cool demo of concepts. He teaches material well. The issue is with the course since it throws so much at you that you struggle to keep up. Do the assignments, pay attention, and you should do decent. Dahn is awesome!

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: I wouldn't say this course is easy, and it sure is a lot of work, but it's certainly not impossible to do well in it, if you do all the CAPA homework and use available resources. Jeff is one of the best lecturers I've ever seen, and his demonstrations were great, especially the ping pong cannon.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: His classes are very enjoyable and always interesting. He also gives you a lot of resource material to help you do well and is very encouraging. Would be an amazing class, but the homework is impossible, even when you know what you are doing and pay attention. Keep up with the homework even if it takes all your motivation to do it.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Jeff Dahn does awesome demonstrations in lectures. I always look forward to his lectures.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: The best prof in dal!

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Very bad prof. Doesnt respect students and always does the marking wrong. You will always find some grading mistakes in his exams. His exams are difficult and always contain mistakes. You have to bug him and repeatedly ask so that he upgrades your mark. Not open to questions.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Don't let Dahn's sometimes interesting demonstrations in lectures fool you into thinking he's a good prof. The material he covers in lectures is often never on exams and the assignment questions don't prepare you well enough for the tests and exam. The labs are also often tedious and boring.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: By far the best lecturer I have ever had, or ever will have. As someone who didn't take physics in high school, I was worried, however having Dr. Dahn for PHYC1190 was incredible. Engaging, incredibly knowledgeable & brilliant. Had sweet demonstrations almost every lecture. Tests were very difficult, however if you put your work in, you'll be fine.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Jeff Dahn is an amazing professor. His lectures are fascinating and there is always some type of incredible demonstration. He made me LOVE physics. However, this class is TOUGH. You need to be engaged from the beginning or you will not pass. Labs are mandatory to attend and if you do not attend lecture, you will fail! Tough, but AWESOME.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Alway does the marking wrong

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Dahn is fantastic. Does live experiments EVERY lecture and they're always relevant to the material. I wish he taught 1290. Got an A in the course, and learned a lot.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Great professor

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: The best prof forever!

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Great prof!

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: DAHN IS THE MAN!!!!! clearly the best prof dal has to offer,.  his class is hard and CAPA assignments suck a big one... But it won't matter because it'll help you in the long run. And he knows how hard and crappy the assignments are, he thrives on the suffering of students do to his assignments. all in all great course, great prof and great guy!

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Lectures are good. In class demonstrations are helpful and suit the class material perfectly. Assignments are difficult but not impossible.  Tests are not too difficult but they are frustrating because you learn a courses worth of material but only see a fourth or fifth of what you actually studied and learned in class.   Never purchased textbook.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: His lectures are fantastic, and he is more than happy to help you with any problems you have. Tests are hard, which is why doing the CAPAs is crucial.

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Gives awesome demonstration on concepts he teaches

Name: Jeff Dahn
Review: Dahn is a good lecturer. However teaching the material he tends to be all over the place. He gives great demonstrations during class. The assignments are essential. They take a lot of time however they are worth doing. The test questions all come from the assignments. If you can do the assignments you will do well on the tests.

Name: John Barger
Review: Best Prof at Dal!!!!!!!!!!!

Name: John Barger
Review: Good teacher, but not the best. Kids like him because he's "cool," but I never understood the hype. I took first year calculus with Surovell instead and don't regret it. The truefalse questions in Barger's linear algebra are the stuff of nightmares. Friendly, but also moody (watch out if you catch him on a bad day!) Shame he's retiring, though.

Name: John Barger
Review: such a gr8 prof

Name: John Barger
Review: Crystal clear when instructing. Definitely the best professor to take the class with since he writes the exams and will tell you an outline of what it will look like, which SERIOUSLY helps with studying. Exams are fair, but the assignments frequently cover content way above what you need to know.

Name: John Barger
Review: He's a great teacher.. he's funny ..  he knows how to relieve stress

Name: John Barger
Review: Barger is an amazing prof! He explains everything very well and he cares about everyone sitting in front of him! I'm so sad that he is not teaching math 1010 next semester!

Name: John Barger
Review: YOU ARE AMAZING BARGER. KEEP IT UP BRO!!

Name: John Barger
Review: Barger is the epitome of an awesome math professor. I found Calculus at DalHousie quite easy compared to the high school equivalent. Easier material, easier tests and an exam 1/4 the size of my highschool final. That being said I waited to do all my studying and 18 quizzes the night before his final, so my mark was not so great. From an A to a B-.

Name: John Barger
Review: Barger is a great teacher - he keeps the class interesting and I came away with a much greater appreciation for the subject than I went in with. I highly recommend him - and his words of wisdom are always great to hear!

Name: John Barger
Review: Great Prof, absolutely hilarious

Name: John Barger
Review: Unreal, favourite Prof by FAR!

Name: John Barger
Review: Hilarious Professor, every class was a blast. He cares for students

Name: John Barger
Review: Hilarious professor, really engaging in lectures. Helpful and clear. Makes calculus interesting.

Name: John Barger
Review: Awesome prof

Name: John Barger
Review: Amazing proff, never had a better class!

Name: John Barger
Review: Very very helpful prof. Really enjoyed his classes

Name: John Barger
Review: Awesome prof.

Name: John Barger
Review: I had Barger for MATH1000 and MATH1010. If your going to be taking first year calculus TAKE BARGER! All the other profs don't do anything with their classes. Even though its tough to do well and Barger can sometimes go through material really quickly he's the best option. Textbook was only good for homework practise questions.

Name: John Barger
Review: Barger's the best prof I've had in two years.  He's very clear and keeps his classes quiet but casual, fun and interesting at the same time. Take him if you can.

Name: John Barger
Review: GREAT Prof.  Take him if you can.

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: I took Introduction to Psychology as well as Human Neuropsychology with Marcia Ozier in the early 1990s. I never forgot her. She was my favourite professor. She was witty, informative and professional. I was shocked to read the bad ratings, as that wasnt my experience with her at all. I still think of her with fondness after all these years. :)

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: TERRIBLE!

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: She is a very fair teacher and a very nice woman. Just don't show up to her classes ready to chat with your friends the entire time. It annoys the rest of the 'listening' students as much as it bothers her!

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: Oh dear...any class taught by this woman is a disaster.  She had us all confused one day by saying that schizophrenia is like a disease, something that we catch in our brains.  Most confusing and WASTE of time

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: VERY rude to her students. if a prof wants respect and quiet from students they have to respect students AND be at least somewhat interesting. Dr. O does neither. She would interupt her class to point out someone leaving... in a 400 person class there are Bound to be ppl who leave. deal with it

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: A bit odd, but funny when she wants to be. PPTs and lectures have organization to them. Tests are straightforward and you'll do well if you read the book and know your stuff. She takes her job seriously though - DO NOT talk during her class and don't be rude. Hey, profs need respect too.

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: I think she was the worse teacher I had all year. She was rude and disrespectful to her students, and her voice put me to sleep. I used to like Psychology.

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: I enjoyed Dr.O's class, I found her lecturing interesting and stimulating.  The only issue that I had with her class was that some students, many in Section 2, did not treat her with respect.  Grow up!

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: Dr. Ozier is ignorant and confusing. I don't like going to lecture when she's teaching, and although I love psychology she ruins the experience. I can't believe my tuition is going to ignorant greedy people like her, who can't get a point across if her life depended on it.

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: Did she ever think that perhaps this student needed to leave for medical purposes... I know that sometimes I have to leave class to treat my hypoglycemia.. but perhaps she'd rather have me convulsing on the floor instead of interrupting her lecture for a few seconds

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: Dr. O is disrespectful to her students. The other day while Dr. O was lecturing a student left their seat and exited the auditorium. Dr. O then made a speech on how rude this was and that our class was the rudest she had ever taught. Did she ever think that perhaps this student needed to leave for m

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: Although I like the material she teaches and her method sometimes, Dr. Ozier is very judgemental and strict in response to student questions and actions. She has a terrible tendancy to forget what the question is while she answers it and instead answers a question which you did not ask.

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: I think she's a good prof. She doesn't tolerate talking in her class, don't test her. Tests are easy if you read the text and her notes. A very nice lady, if you don't ****her off.

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: Abnormal explains this woman to a tee, she is a werid bird. Besides being weird, I found her to be rude and disrespectful

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: Brutal brutal prof. I have never hated a prof so much as this one. I wanted to drop the class so badly becasue of her disrespect for the students and their opinion but I enjoyed the material too much. I highly suggest she ends her carreer in teaching and seek psychological help. Nuts!

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD.Dr.O should not be teaching.I can't believe I paid $ to be in a class taught by this disorganized, insulting, degrading, pompus women.  She humiliated students who asked Q's. Her tests are beyond disorganized and she obviously doesn't wrtite them herself. SHE BLOWS!

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: I loved this class, she asked exactly what was on her notes and in the text! I hardly even went to class and and got an A in this course, she follows the text exactly. It was just like being in high school again when you know exactly what the tests are going to ask!

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: Terrible teacher. If you've taken 2470, you'll be fine. If not, you're screwed. Extremely disorganized and confusing. Many test questions consist of the most trivial, poorly-worded questions and answers possible, often not related to the course/lecture at all. Unfortunately, she's on tenure w/ Dal

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: Really good class.  Just tests.

Name: Marcia Ozier
Review: I have spent many years in University, yet I have not come across a prof as bad as Dr. O. I do not underestand how she is still teaching. A high school kid could teach better than her.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Class deals with a lot of memorization as there are alot of pathways and a lot of proteins that have specific roles. He goes over the class material at a good pace, and is helpful. You need to understand eveyrthing or else the test will be hard as half of the final is fill in the blanks and T/F. Overall, exam is fair.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Dr. MacRae is a good professor for Cell Biology. Be prepared to do a lot of memorization, as he tends to ask very specific questions on his midterm and his final exam (i.e. you'd better know everything about everything he talks about, otherwise you'll end up with an unpleasant surprise).

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Amazing!

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Awesome prof. People may complain because he is hard but those people never went to class or didn't study enough. Great prof (even though he loves the Habs). Would definitely take another class from him if I could.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Dr.McRae probably one of the best profs at Dalhousie!

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: One of the best profs at Dalhousie.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Very nice, very friendly and very funny.  However, I slacked a little just because he seemed like a really nice guy and I ended up doing super bad on his exam.  You gotta know everything when you write his exams!!!

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Excellent lecturer, has a tendency to go off topic but never to a fault. At second year level the material was never terribly easy, but if you went to the classes and kept on top of the material the tests weren't as brutal as you would think. Overall, great prof.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Excellent prof.  Sure, the tests were sometimes tricky, but he was still an excellent prof who knew what he was talking about and made the subject clear.  Also very approachable and helpful, and classes were always interesting.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Super smart dude and teaches well but.......his tests suck (you get a -1 if you answer the mc question wrong.......so know your****).... he loves what he does too.....that makes him very approachable anytime

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: His class was soo informative that honestly, if you go to lecture and study your notes, you can easily do well on the infamous exam. He was an excellent prof.  He knows what to repeat and emphasize and he really makes you interested in the material.  He's amazing!

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Understands what students been to know, so he repeats these concepts several times. Hard to fall asleep while he speaks, he almost commands attention. Hands crowds very well and speaks with great knowledge and clarity.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Very clear, consise lectures. Made key concepts abundantly clear, and has a voice that's easy to listen to.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: An excellet professor- his lectures are clear, friendly and well-paced. And about the infamous exam- despite some questions being challenging, it is honestly not overly difficult. As long as you study the material well and don't cram the night before, you should do just fine.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Mr. Mac Rae is a SUPER nice guy. He is a very good professor in that he is clear in class and will repeat things if necessary. He is always willing to help.HOWEVER I MUST WARN YOU : HE IS HARD: DIFFICULT EXAMS. Even if you study VERY hard, you need to know the material INSIDE OUT BACK FRONT INVISIBLE everyway to do good. anyways, good luck! :)

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Great guy... funny and good prof. Lots of material though and exams were hard!

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Awesome prof!  Makes bio class interesting, hes great at lecturing if you want to take notes.  Study really really hard, know some tricks for solving mc exams and you should do fine on his midterm.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Great lecturer.  Very well organized.  Funny.  But as everyone else said, the exams are brutal.  You must know a TON of material to do well on the exams.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Good Prof, makes going to class fun. Covers alot of material but has it well organized. Tests are difficult but doable if you understand your material, you can't just memorize/recognize.

Name: Tom MacRae
Review: Great prof, one of the best in ways of teaching, but the midterm was very challenging, no matter how hard you study.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Course material isn't that bad, just a lot of hard work and pretty boring. Only way to get through it is to be organized. Tests are a literal sh*t show, you're never given enough time. Dr. Juckes is also kind of a jerk and called my friend a twit to her face. If you take his class, good luck and tell him his gold earring is gross from me.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: By far, he is the worst teacher I've ever had. Avoid this course if you can; otherwise, you will suffer mentally and physically, and your Grades will plummet. If you have to choose this course, please read the following low-rate comments and think twice. If you want to learn APA format, reading an APA book from DAL library is sufficient.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: hardest course i ever took your other classes will suffer from this class during my semseter 60% of students failed the class.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Put simply, this class is a lot of work with little to no reward. Each assignment takes the allotted week to complete. Juckes has little to no regard for other courses, they suffer as a result. He moves quickly through slides that are vague at best, and they are generally unhelpful for the assignments.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: A crazy amount of work. He has little regard for your other courses. To do well in this class other grades will suffer as you will have to sacrifice time that should be allocated for other classes to complete your weekly assignments. The grading structure is also poor with different people marking you for every assessment.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Hes rude and unaccomodating.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Seemingly arbitrary information a lot of the time

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Rude, condescending, and poor lecturer.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: This class is challenging and you have to be willing to put the time in to get a good grade. SCIE1111 significantly improved my writing skills. Make sure you buy Hofmann as you really do need it (he makes test questions based on certain chapters). Dr. Juckes may seem rude and scary in the beginning, but by the end of the course, I really liked him.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Just take something else to satisfy the writing credit.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Terrible. Very wordy lectures.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Interesting that he copyrighted public knowledge, though just showing the symbol certainly doesn't mean it's actually copyrighted. Regardless, I thought he was a solid prof. Interesting lectures, although vague, and it's obvious he's a smart guy. Of course, I only had him for three classes and one quiz, worth 0.75% of my total grade.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Lecture slides were extremely unclear  especially after taking a quiz followed by it. Most of the materials are not specific enough to apply on quizzes what more of midterms. Materials found on recent quiz was not even found on the slides.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: What you need to do to pass the course is just READ PAPERS and REMEMBER THEM.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Rude, and unreasonable. No matter how hard you work or how much energy you put into an assignment, your grade will never reflect your effort. By half-way through the course, I was struggling to pass.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: He is rude

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: I am a second-year Psychology now and I thank myself for taking this class during my first year. If you are a science student aiming for an honour degree, do consider to take this class and be sure to work really hard for it.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Most people only take this course to satisfy their Faculty of Science writing credit. If that is the only reason you are going to take this course, then don't do it. The grading criteria is the hardest I've encountered and the class averages are the worst that I've seen. By October, my only goal became just to pass the course.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Embodies all the worst qualities you would expect from a cartoonish villain professor. Poor class average, pop quizzes, confusing and poorly articulated feedback, strict marking scheme, strict late penalties, no mercy, and I  didn't learn anything I couldn't have seen on a 60 minute YouTube video on APA format and Scientific Style.

Name: Timothy Juckes
Review: Just an absolutely awful professor. All of the below comments about his arrogance is spot on. I will disagree with the comments that he is knowledgeable though as he is actually the opposite at least in this class. Avoid at all costs. You have been warned.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Just a very caring person overall. You can tell she really cares about her students. She is also very good at explaining tricky concepts in simpler terms to help students. Her midterm was very fair, nothing too difficult. Would definitely take a class with her again.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is one of the most amazing & best profs at Dal. She explains everything clearly and you can tell she really enjoys teaching. She really strives to make sure that all of her students succeed. Exams are not difficult whatsoever as long as you read her questions VERY carefully. Tons of resources to study off of, including test like mc questions.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is by far the best professor Ive ever had in any class. She can explain things in an engaging and fun way that is really easy to understand. She explained signal transduction in a 50 minute lecture better than my profs did during an entire semester of cellular neuroscience. The exams were not bad as long as you listen in class and study.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is a great lecturer and explains concepts in a way that is easy to understand. However, I found the amount of material covered on the final exam to be unmanagable. Definitely the hardest biology course I have taken.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Ungodly amount of information. Cumulative Exam with twice the amount of questions of any second or third year course ive taken. This is a mandatory course for Bio Majors, she needs to sift through whats of interest to future cell bio enthusiasts and what needs to be taught to satisfy the program. Exam is cumulative and 200 questions. Beware.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is an amazing lecturer. Her explanations are so clear and easy to understand unlike our textbook. Her tests are tricky but if you will just learn slides, itll be enough to get a good grade on midterms.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: By far the best prof I have ever had. So organized, caring, and actually feels like she wants you to do well. Tests are hard, but it's only because she wants you to really understand the information, and it's not at all because of her teaching abilities. She makes the lectures enjoyable, and makes it as easy to understand as she can. So awesome.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is an excellent teacher who really cares about her students. SHe puts lots of effort into her slides to make them well organized, easy to follow, and engaging. Her tests are a bit hard so be prepared to study for the midterm. I blame this on the difficult material more than her teaching ability, however. All in all, Mindy is awesome!!!

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: She made confusing things easy to understand and was always very organized. Her lectures were relaxing and interesting. Make sure to study absolutely everything for the midterm because the questions are very tricky unless you know exactly what you are talking about.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: my fave thing about mindy is her enthusiasm for cell bio!! she's very passionate about what she's teaching and really cares about students. however, even though she's incredibly sweet, her tests are intense!! very difficult, you really need to know concepts inside out and apply them way outside the box.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is an amazing prof, she genuinely cares about her students and the class is very organized! The class is very content heavy but the concepts are not difficult to grasp if you put the work in. The lab quiz is harder than you would expect.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is an amazing teacher for what I consider a very difficult class. She is really enthusiastic about what she teaches and goes slow to make sure students understand. The only thing keeping her from a 5/5 is her tests which I find incredibly difficult and very specific. Many questions are more applied and not gone over in class.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is such a lovely person! Her passion for cell bio really shows and makes it easy to pay attention during the lectures. She records all her lectures the night before in case you miss a class which is so helpful. Shes super kind and caring, definitely the best prof Ive had at dal so far!

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is by fav. my fav prof at Dal! She is so always so prepared and knows her stuff. Her midterm was extremely fair - study the lectures she posts.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Professor McCarville is very enthusiastic about cell biology. She genuinely cares about the subject and cares about making sure students learn the material. Her lectures are clear and easy to understand (lots of relatable analogies!) and she records every lecture at home as there's an extra study aid. Great professor!

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Best lecturer I've had and the recordings she posts online are super helpful for studying. She makes complicated concepts seem simple; her cell biology lectures for BIOL1010 were my favourite part of that class.

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy was a great prof! her lectures and recordings were gold, she was very engaging and excellently simplified complex concepts in a way thats easy to understand

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is a blessing!

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is easily one of the best instructors at dal! Kind, helpful, fair and really cares about her students!

Name: Mindy McCarville
Review: Mindy is great, she really cares and spends a lot of time reviewing concepts! She also records all her lectures ahead of time in case you can't make it to class (but it's better to go she emphasises things and shows videos in class). Watch out for tough tests and start studying early.  Great extra help

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Dr. Corke is amazing! She was helpful, kind and I learnt a great deal from her! As much as I don't like History I would absolutely take a class with Dr. Corke again.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: I really enjoyed Dr. Corke! Even with our course being split by 2 professors, her half of the term was great! Really down to earth and funny- never too serious. Incredibly passionate about politics and very well versed in the material. Would 100% take her class again.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Interesting professor, great at explaining the concepts of the course.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: One of the most thought-provoking profs I had at Dal. She makes students think critically about how history is done, what history is, and challenges students to question their preconceived notions about history. Having said that, she also has high expectations, so she's not for the squeamish and not an easy A.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Most classes are set up for debating, and tons of discussion.  DO THE READINGS! She's  not an easy marker. Has a hilariousopinionated no-bs attitude.   Has a lot to offer to people with an open mind to new philosophies and her post-modern philosophy will literally change the way you see history.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Dr. Corke is a phenomenal professor.  Her classes, however, are not run of the mill.  She is extremely approachable and it really matters to her that you care.  While her approach to history may seem unique, she is not looking for you to agree with her; rather, she enjoys engaging in respective debate on varying opinions.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Her "there's no truth" thing gets annoying, but in an endearing sort of way. Class is all about discussion and debate, and people get to know each other by how much they have to talk. She respects everyone as long as they can back up what they say, which earns her a lot of respect. She grades toughly but fairly. All around a fun class to take.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Too much historiography, tests were ridiculous.  She doesn't think facts exist.  The one and only course I have ever dropped.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Not easy, but rewarding. Took a couple of classes with her, which really challenged me to think outside of the cookie cutter education a lot of other professors fall under at dal. Encourages discussion - rather, demands discussion. Really kept me engaged. I can say one thing for sure: only 9 am class i ever woke up for consistently.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: I absolutely hate her, worst prof I've ever had. and I'm usually quite nice.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Worst professor ever. Tries to be edgy and ground-breaking: she ends up confusing half the class and alienating the rest. She's egotistical and thinks that (quote) "there is no such thing as history". She taught a second year survey course like a 4th year seminar. Terrible.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: A joke of a professor. Her lectures were ill planned. Her slides were full of typos and mistakes. She missed class one day simply because she forgot. Her assignments were juvenile and ill conceived. Attempted to dock marks on faulty technicalities. Took 40 days to mark an exam, and caused some students to miss scholarship deadlines.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Terrible prof. by far the worst I had in first year. She does not follow the course description and did not teach the actual history, but the historiography. assignments were pointless and juvenile

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: She started droning on about "no such thing as a fact" in the 2nd class it was clear that she was irritating. challenging students to come up with a factual statement, one said "an atomic bomb was dropped on Hiroshima", her response was that there were different time zones in the world. I'm here to learn about history, not debate semantics.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Not the most organized professor, but overall enjoyed her and her class. You MUST be interested in viewing history as a HISTORIOGRAPHY course. She was  knowledgeable and it was very interesting. She is also extremely sympathetic to her students and wants them to do well so she's very helpful, just try to get to know her on a personal level.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Acceptable answers to tests were devised after the fact and partially based on her opinion. The entire class failed one question because apparently the use of quotation marks changes the entire meaning. Several classes missed with no real make up info. The course outline was barely a suggestion.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: This was the first time this class was taught at Dal but I expected more thought to go into a course than what was put into History 1702. The marking scheme was constantly played with and too much weighting was given to silly and unrelated assignments; graphic depiction? DRAWING in a history course?!

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: Dr. Corke is nice and flexible with due-dates, but this course was not very well organized (supposed to be "History of the Americas," but mostly limited to her area of expertise in US history), the format of the exams was terrible (3 essays, usually on more obscure topics rather than the more important concepts) and assignments were juvenile.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: The worst ever. Why is it that the least capable profs are always the most demanding? Must have something to prove. Terrible lectures, unreasonable expectations, shallow knowledge of subject matter.  Horribly biased. avoid.

Name: Sarah-Jane Corke
Review: SJC... inconsistent, conspiracy theorist!!!

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Dr. Duffy's use of drawings to explain things instead of the usual slide, then monologue was quite challenging for me! If you are a linear learner like I am, then make sure to pay extra attention, his thoughts can be quite scrambled at times. The dissections were a nice touch, but if you prefer a structured class, then skip Dr. Duffy if you can.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: I really enjoyed Professor Duffys lectures. Great speaker with great clarity. Very thorough teachings with concern for students. Highly recommend him.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Very intelligent, some lectures are a bit boring but I find he shows great examples that keep your attention to the lecture. You can tell he knows his topics extremely well, answers students questions very well.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Dr. Duffy is a toss-up. On one hand, he is certainly VERY intelligent and respectable, however, for the class, I had with him I found his lectures to be dull and unenjoyable. His power points consisted of blank white slides with blurbs of text on them. And he often hand wrote some notes live during lecture that were barely legible at times.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Very well qualified, and makes you work very hard. Very smart and gives fascinating demonstrations.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: He really made the lectures interesting, he also interacts with the students and doesn't make super long over loaded slides. Very easy to pay attention to him, he makes good jokes too

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Dr. Duffy is very clearly interested in what he teaches. He takes concepts that most people might otherwise find boring and turn them into something that is really interesting. What you learn in class is pretty much all you need to know so if you take good notes you should be fine. He emphasizes what is important and his exam was not bad at all!

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Really cool prof, great at lectures and is interesting.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Dr. Duffy's lectures were fantastic. I think he has a way of making complicated information simple and really fun to learn.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Always came prepared with dissection displays and diagrams. Lectures were clear and concise and with many pictures to illustrate his points. His exam was very fair and is easy to do well on if you listen (he emphasizes what is important and what isn't) and try.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Kevin is a great prof, he does these amazing overhead notes he handwrites on the projector WHILE talking about them so you really can follow along well. Great marker and keeps it interesting and tells funny stories.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Literally the best teacher that I have had so far! He teaches in a way that any type of student can understand; whether it be through visual aids (such a dissecting an ear and diagrams) or through auditory aids (when he enthusiastically speaks, or shows us videos and we listen to Deadmau5)! All the student absolutely love him!BEST professor around.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Class was super interesting!

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: I LOVEEEE Dr. Duffy! He is BY FAR my favourite prof thus far! He explains things very well! He keeps the topics that he is going over very interesting! He even does live dissections! He is super easy to talk to and will answer anything that you have questions about! He is just fantastic!

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: He is awesome!! I am in my third year and taking a first year class. He has me hooked. He is so interested in what he is teaching, and it makes everyone else interested as well! Ill take more of his classes for sure. Make sure you go to class though, he draws a lot of pictures off the slide that explain LOTS!

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: He was the co-ordinator for the lab part of the class. The structure of the labs were bad with nothing explained and if you went to discuss the marks with him he will probably tear you apart. I would say he is one of the best teaching professors but definitely the worst co-ordinator. I would recommend taking the   corresponding class (PSYO 2000)

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: One of my favourite profs. Passionate about what he teaches and makes class interesting

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: such a fantastic prof! he made the topic interesting (which was pretty hard to do) and made it so easy to understand. he's really passionate about what he teaches, which makes the class way more entertaining. also, he's really cute and he played deadmau5 before class all the time :)

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Has to be the best professor I've had at Dalhousie thus far, and it's my second year already. Incredible person.

Name: Kevin Duffy
Review: Amazing professor!!

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: He was okay. He wasn't the most interesting lecturer and he's got a pretty uncomfortable way of speaking, but he teaches the concepts fairly well.   Unfortunately, he doesn't wash his hands after he pees, so ultimately, I cannot recommend taking a course with Denis.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: This class should be taken by all students at dalhousie. Bonnie and Denis were both helpful and knowledgeable.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Denis is a very good professor for providing you the hands out and material to make you successful. Denis however has one flaw that's pretty big and that's his voice is extremely monotone. If you can get past this he's a great professor with a lot of knowledge in what he's teaching and if you show up you will pass his class.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Interesting and useful course

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Course material was mostly review in my case as somebody who has been programming for a few years, but the class was well maintained. Clearly written slides, and handout copies given at the beginning of each class. Plenty of opportunity to test your skills in the labs or on your own time. Handwriting on the chalkboard can be hard to read at times.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Very good course

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Attendance was not technically mandatory, however he refused to post notes and handouts online to entice students to come to class. He is very soft spoken, and will put you to sleep unless you have your coffee first. Denis was not helpful when approached directly. I would recommend taking Prof. Bonnie MacKay's 1100 class instead

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: His worksheets are very helpful

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: I only took one lecture with him, and he put me to sleep in a few minuets.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Ok, so this is very boring class when he teaches, he is monotone and says "OK" as every third word.  You can make a game out of counting them when you get bored every class.  THE BOOK IS NOT USED ONCE SO DONT BUY IT even though he tells you its required and you'll use it a lot.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Great prof! Really holds your hand the entire time (prints handouts for the entire class!) Great clarity and great voice to  listen to! Made intro to CS a lot less overwhelming than I thought it'd be!

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Excellent Prof! The best I have had at Dal.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Danger Danger Danger

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Excellent Prof!

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Great professor! I was SO lucky to have him as my prof! He had small quizzes every week on Monday to make sure you know your stuff and never all behind.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Best teacher so far - helpful

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: He is the best prof in Dal computer science in department. He is a prof who has your best interest at heart and is so happy when achieve something. Do a course with this guy

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Excellent Prof! Would recommend his class to anyone interested in comp sci.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Overall an excellent professor. The worksheets he provided for each lecture, he went over in great detail. He is willing to help students with any material they having difficulty with in the course. The TAs that help him with this course were also very excellent and helpful. I higly recommend this professor to any student.

Name: Denis Riordan
Review: Amazing Prof.  Gave us worksheets every class summarizing everything that awas in the lecture.  Cares very much about class.  Faverate prof of the year, if you get a chance to take one of his courses you will love it.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Participation isn't marked on attendance, you actually have to contribute to discussion. its a seminar course so lots of readings, but all interesting. Very easy to participate in discussion, loves current events.  No tests strictly assignments, but gives amazing feedback when you meet with him or email him. definitely an understanding guy.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Todd is awesome and really knows his stuff. His classes aren't really an 'easy A' as some have put it but if you put the work in, do the readings, and take the assignments seriously you should do well. Todd is great for discussing assignments, he makes himself available and really gives good feedback.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Excellent teacher! Really funny and makes things interesting even if you're not necessarily interested in the subject.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Took a bunch of classes with Todd, was really interesting and kept me coming back. funny and taught a lot about what I call fringe history. Really interesting stuff

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Excellent prof! Lots of readings and discussion, but done in a really effective way. Makes topic really interesting and easy to follow. Good marker and LOTS of feedback, expect a while before you get your assignment back, but at the same time very lenient with deadlines! Great professor!

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Todd is a really cool prof and the material is interesting. He seemed a little disorganized this year however (no where near enough course readers, really long waits to get back assignments).

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Haters and their haterade need to move aside, this guy's pretty much the best History prof I've ever had. No textbooks, tends to rely on course readers with primary and secondary sources. Extremely intelligent and very knowledgeable.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Unconventional but EXCELLENT. Lectures and tutorials are never boring.Heavy course in terms of detailed lectures and reading material, but his execution style makes it interesting. Exams are hard, they test to make sure you know the readings, so they can be tricky.Essays and writing material are unique and thought provoking, yet demands creativity.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Expects memorization of readings for exams (gives you a direct quote and asks which author said it...impossible) - but a very cool, engaging Prof.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Not enough brains to get a headache.  This guy expects you to spew the readings back at him verbatim.  Doesn't want you to think because then he may have to.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Todd is awesome! He's really cool, very friendly, and always willing to help. He makes a boring subject interesting! I would take more classes from him. He also has this wonderful habit of extending due dates for essays! Don't bother with the textbook, unless you want to be able to use it as sources for essays, but the course readers are needed.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: I was dreading this class because I thought it'd be boring, but McCallum made it so much fun. He really does everything to make his classes come alive. Amazing

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Easy A? I don't think so - be prepared to work in McCallum's classes...but overall he's a great prof.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Seems pointless to add another post in praise of McCallum but nevertheless...Best prof I've had at dal.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: Easily the best prof. in the History department.  Awesome and interesting classes.  HIST3292 rocked my world.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: A jerk outside of class?! WRONG. Very helpful, passionate teacher who KNOWS his stuff. He puts extreme amount of effort into his classes and makes them both interesting and stimulating. He is the best history prof at DAL.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: He taught the class so that it was interesting, but outside of class, he's a jerk. If you want an easy A, definitely take this class. It's absolutely no work.

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: AMAZING professor. By far the most animated, interesting and engaging professor I've had at Dalhousie. He puts everything he has into his lectures, and it shows! Creative assignments and teaching methods, and he clearly has a passion for what he teaches, which makes all the difference. He rocks, plain and simple!

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: A great leader with excellent communication skills, and his positive energy is contagious. He sees the big picture. His classes are both innovative and challenging. I highly recommend!

Name: Todd McCallum
Review: By far the funniest, most interesting and best history professor at Dal.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: He put "3rd grade mistake" on one of my papers as well. Made us go to class on a day when there wasn't supposed to be class.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: I accidently used an apostrophe in a word instead of ending it with an es and he circled it and called it a 'thrid grade mistake, he also told my friend in the same class to 'learn how to wirte before he came back into his classroom'

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: The feedback for the major paper was not helpful. Places a lot of emphasis on attendance. Held the final lecture on a day that was supposed to be a makeup day for other classes so some people would not have been able to attend; told the class he didn't care when this was pointed out. Knowledgeable about his topic though.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Hanlon is so intelligent and obviously very passionate about this history. Sometimes lectures are a little boring, but he's really funny. Make sure to copy down what he's saying rather than what's on the slides, because sometimes the wording is hard to understand. If you're a good writer and you keep up with the textbook, it's a pretty easy course

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Clearly knows his stuff and enjoys his job, really funny, an absolute must if you enjoy European history, pretty easy class

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: A kind man, and an awesome prof. He gives great feedback on papers, but if you really want to get ahead, go to his office hours (SUPER helpful). Loved how he incorporates his own personal stories and photos into lectures from time to time. All in all, wonderful person, one of my favourite profs.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Awesome prof; really helped me with my writing and my ability to research for topics to write essays on. Office hours are great for ensuring that he knows who you are; this shows him that you care about your work. Marks fairly and gives great VERBAL feedback - OPEN DOOR POLICY!!! Just care and try and you'll do just fine - he is a fair marker.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: hanlon was aight, he has a test that is worth 10% and its all memorization so its easy to get 100%. His lectures are pretty boring but he can be funny. I wrote all my essays a night before and got a  b+, c+ and a B but I'm an alright writer. I knew nothing before the exam but managed to pass because 50% were definitions and the other 50% was essay

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Dr. Hanlon was my best professor all semester. He was approachable outside the class every time I had a question. His office hours - almost all the time - are key. Furthermore, just go to class,if you do he will respect you. He helped me with my writing,which started at a B- and improved to a solid A. The guy cares, but you have to work to succeed.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Open door policy. Gives good feedback. Cares and wants you to do well IF YOU TRY. Won't care if you don't. A real gem and I loved every minute of his classes.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Hanlon does a great job at helping students. He has one rule ... go to class. If you do, he will help you and respect you. At the beginning of the year, I was barely a C student, I got several great marks in his classes. He has an OPEN DOOR POLICY! Take advantage of it. Lastly, the man cares about your education, but he wants you to work for it.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Very broad topic but Hanlon nails the key, important themes. For the love of god go to class - he will respect you if you have good attendance, if not will not show sympathy. Little feedback on papers, but gave a list of terms for the final so studying was simple. Approachable in his office hours and will give research advice for papers.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: He is not an easy professor by any stretch, but he's incredibly knowledgeable and respected in his field. He does notice who puts in the work though, and will treat people based upon this pretty fairly. He's great if he sees that you've done the work, if you do not or skip class often, do not expect any help or sympathy from him.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: He's incredibly knowledgeable about his topic and field, a very research and publishing oriented professor. He's can be quite nice if you put in the effort in his class, especially with attendance and doing the reading assignments, but he'll be incredibly dismissive towards those who do not. He gives credit where credit is due in terms of effort.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: He can be slightly intimidating at first but if you go to see him during office hours he is really helpful. One of the best profs I've had so far! As long as you go to class and do the readings you will do well. For the final exam he gave a list of key terms which made studying a lot easier.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Knows his stuff and is always willing to answer questions, but be prepared!  He will expect you to know the reading - and pay attention to footnotes, he'll expect you to know who wrote the reading, when it was written, and using what kind of sources. He's intimidating but if you show interest he's super helpful, and he doesn't care about due dates.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: His class is so hard for international students!

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Upon receiving my essays back, I noticed the lack of good feedback which deterred my interest for the course. He knows his stuff but... come on really? Those comments were not helpful.

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: Very helpful and accomodating if you demonstrate that you are willing to work.  Class is definitely fast paced. It would be beneficial to put a class outline on BLS. Found his class extremely interesting and visual which helped bring the topic to life.  Would gladly take another class of his.  Fortunately I have fast typing skills.  :-)

Name: Gregory Hanlon
Review: tough marker but if you really want your A and put the effort in you will receive it

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Best STATS prof at the U of M. He goes through problems 2 or 3 times with different examples and always does questions in class that will relate to the exam. He is slightly boring during lectures tho, and I found myself dosing off quite often. Make sure to sit beside someone who is listening so they can wake you when he moves on. All in all, 10/10

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: He is a great prof, sometimes funny, very accessible. He gives extra office hours if students need help. Lecture notes, practice assignments, practice exams are posted and highly recommend to do them. Best to practice the assignments, read slides before going to tutorials.

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: he is the best prof i have ever had for any class so DEFINITELY take a class with him if you can

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: HONESTLY AN EASY A CLASS. IF YOU TOOK STATS 1000 YOU WILL ACE STATS2000. I STUDIED 2 DAYS BEFORE THE FINAL AND STILL DID WELL. MAKE SURE TO DO THE PRACTICE FINALS AND MIDTERMS THEY ARE EXACTLY HOW THE MIDTERMS AND EXAMS WILL BE LIKE

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: a stats god. hands down the best stats prof at u of m i jumped at the chance to take 2000 with him after having him for 1000. the courses are easy on their own but he makes lectures interesting and engaging to attend since they are mandatory

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Absolutely one of the best. I've never enjoyed a class like his. Makes difficult subject easy to understand. For other courses I just wanted to stay at home and wonder if I really need education because they're that bad. But Andrew's class, I'd be upset if I didn't come.

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: For a guy that knew that no one in the room cared about that class, he did all he could to make it enjoyable for everyone. Fair exams and a gem of a guy. I cannot recommend him enough.

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Super helpful, genuinely invested in his students (even when they aren't invested in his class), definitely a solid prof. Explains things super well with an abundance of examples in his notes. Textbook optional.

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Best prof at u of m

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Such a good prof, explains everything very well. If you go to the lectures and pay attention its an easy A. Labs aren't really helpful unless you have questions, but it depends on your TA. Multiple choice midterm and half the exam as well. DO the practice tests and you will be fine.

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Easily could be top prof at the U of M overall. Made the course ridiculously easy, quizzes and exams were extremely fair, no trick questions, everything on them was taught multiple times in his lectures because he creates the exams so he knows what you need to know. 100% would take future course with Morris

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Makes stats easy, go to class and pay attention and you will have no problems. Midterm and final are fair and not too hard. 100% recommend this prof if you want to get a good mark with minimal effort.

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: I almost never leave prof reviewsbut Professor Morris is truly an incredible one, if you have the chance please take his course

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Probably one of the best profs I've had so far. Very clear, straight to the point, with the occasional joke. Conducts very fast paced lectures, but thoroughly explains everything. Very quick to email you back if you have questions. If you don't go to class you will fall behind very quickly. Do not push this class to the side or you will do badly.

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Andrew Morris is an amazing prof!! His lectures were clear and sometimes fun, and his use of dry humour lightened up the class. Im so glad he was my prof.

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: You can tell how much he cares about his students actually understanding the material. He is not just trying to get through the material, he really wants us to learn. He knows that the material can be dry, and tries to make up for it with sometimes funny jokes.

Name: Andrew Morris
Review: Andrew is a great prof. He is really good at what he does and explains ideas very clearly. Really funny in class.

Name: Andrew Morris
