Review: An amazing women, She is funny, and sweet however doesn't let you get away with easy marks, you need to Put in effort to get your grade, but it's a reasonable amount for the course. She makes class fun and has been the only prof I was excited to get up and go listen to in the morning. Reading is mandatory but she is available to help you out.

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: MY FAVOURITE. Dr. Jackson is an amazing teacher and the course is really fair, honestly do your work and you'll be good. Not an easy A but not insane either. Her class is the one I never want to miss, she makes the subject extra fun. Her lectures also are really helpful, you need to go to class to get the info on the slides but its also in the text

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: Dr Jackson you are amazing!!! I am so happy I took this course with you! You are so kind to your students and we adore you! Please teach this class forever because youre simply the best prof in psych and on campus. Thank you for all that you do for us!!

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: Dr. Jackson is a decent lecturer and her exams aren't too bad, but she barely teaches any of the content. Going to class is honestly a waste of time (coming from someone who went to every class) as much of the exam is on content not found in her lectures. Read and summarize the textbook and that's really all you should study from.

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: I loved Dr. Jackson! She made me realize further that I was SO interested in Psychology because of her engaging lectures. She really makes sure you understand the concept of the material, all while adding in something funny along the way. My favorite professor so far.

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: Jill Jackson is an amazing lecturer, cares about her students, and knows how to make class more interesting. She is a fair marker, is always accessible for help, and is super funny. A lot of reading is required, and class is pretty much mandatory as there's usually a participation assignment. Totally recommend her for any psychology course possible

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: Jackson is a great lecturer compared to most of my professors. She makes the information fun, loves what she does, and is a fair marker. The only minor negatives are that she holds random participation marks in class and talks too much about her personal life.

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: Dr. Jill Jackson is the first prof I've had that not only makes you pay attention in class and makes you understand whats being presented. She know whats talking about and makes sure you know it to. She very open to helping you. Great person.

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: she's fine at teaching but she literally teaches 1/10th of the chapter in class and you're expected to read the rest from the textbook yourself.. might as well skip class and memorize the textbook. the exam being 50% wasn't great either, but if u read the book u can get a 90 and the bonus marks offered help too

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: love, love, love this prof. She was clear, she gave amazing examples of the material in her lectures. She has a funny side and keeps you interested. If you don't get the opportunity to have her for your intro psych classes you are missing out ! shes the bomb dot com

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: (Major class): An amazing professor and person in general. Interesting lectures that won't have you falling asleep, and not completing an entire chapter in one day like other courses (*cough *cough bio). The group projects are a bit annoying, but it's not too difficult to do well. The "midterms" are all online and you can used notes.

Name: Jill Jackson
Review: Dr. Jackson is very likable and sweet.  She doesn't cover everything in her lectures (a lot of reading is expected), however it's still important to show up to her lectures as there are a few things she may say that aren't in the textbook that will most likely be in the exam. Buy the textbook - you won't regret it. Just read it and you'll be fine.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Her tests were hard to ace despite hard work. Many of her questions were taken from students and thus not worded well/inconsistent in delivery style. Lots of ambiguous questions made it hard to know what she wanted even if you knew the content well. I found that this was an easy 80 but VERY challenging 90+ course (for you perfectionists out there)

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: She's way better this semester than last semester. You can tell she is way more confident and comfortable with the material. She is extremely fair-grader and one of the few profs who take time to look at the written answer questions rather than letting the GAs do it for her. Overall, I enjoyed her class and would take her again if I had the chance.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Was enthusiastic at first ( since physio 1 was great with a different prof). until I wrote the midterms, the content of the M/C is not difficult but the way they are worded with many of the options being very similar (some questions having 6 options) makes it so difficult with such little time. the M/C was worth about 80% of the grade. terrible.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: You can study and think you know everything and somehow still do bad. Every question on the tests are a trick question. As well, she talks fast in the lectures and makes simple concepts really confusing. The slides are just pictures and you have to type everything she says. You have tons of dumb assignments that are graded hard for no reason.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Dr. Poling is very nice, but she is not very knowledgeable (she's not THAT bad though). Exams are not hard but the wording is. My biggest complaint is her using students-written questions in the exams, so you'll have different wording styles (and some are not very consistent). Most of the questions would be answered as "you can argue either ways".

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Dr. Poling is not knowledgeable. Her lectures are unorganized, was unable to answer questions, constantly contradicted herself, and used student-made questions on exams (which were low quality/incorrect). The material itself was not hard, but she made exams unreasonably difficult because things were taught wrong or her MC questions were ambiguous.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Dr. Poling is amazing. I have taken many courses with her and have even gone to her for help for other courses. She is always willing to meet and help you with anything you need, including personal problems. If you think the grading on your assignments or exams was unfair, she will reason with you and change your grade accordingly. GREAT prof!

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: She is a nice enough person.... unfortunately she does not know what she is talking about. She consistently was unable to answer in-class questions and resorted to saying, "you could argue either way". Even for MC questions from previous exams she would discover mistakes and say there were multiple right answers (too bad you answer on a scantron).

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Dr. Poling is my favourite! She's like the nicest prof I've ever known. You absolutely can't miss any of her lectures though because the exam is exactly about what is taught in class. But she is super open to students' questions and loves to teach. I wish she could teach my next human phys class.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: she covers the most useful topics which is good but her grading criteria makes the class a pain in the ass. Also some of the questions on the final were horrible.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: She takes questions from student assignments & puts them on the midterms. This makes them unnecessarily difficult due to the different writing styles. She does practice questions in class which usually have more than one correct answer, but will not give marks if present on the midterms. Material is easy & interesting but tests makes it unenjoyable

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: She is the worst prof I've ever had! The midterms are on very little material which sounds easy but NO! The multiple choice is so hard, she doesn't know the answer to it. Viewing an exam will make you mad, her answers are incorrect and when proven wrong (even with textbook evidence) doesn't do anything about it. She acts nice in class, don't trust!

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: She is so unprofessional and just awful! If you see this name drop it immediately! This is my lowest mark and is bringing down my average! She has no clue what she's talking about, and makes up her own multiple choice which often has two answers and is impossible! Would never take any course with this prof again! Don't even know how she has a job!

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Very bad at explaining in the lectures. Exam marks are graded tough and most exam questions are confusing. Very heavy on inclass participation, also incorporates online parts which are a waste of time. This is not my first physiology class and I understood the material but still received my worst physiology grade. would not recommend this prof.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Beware of her multiple choice. Her test questions are more challenging than they need to be. She isn't good at explaining the material well either, and it's almost as if she speaks too fast and says too many words. Not a bad person, just horrible prof.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Not THAT bad, but not the greatest. Doesn't use the textbook at all, so make sure you attend all the lectures and write down everything she says. Test material is directly from what she teaches & from Peerwise questions. Tests are frustrating -- questions aren't well thought out and have more than one right answer or none at all.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Overall a good professor! Engaging, kind, and hilarious! Make sure you go to class and write down EVERYTHING she says (I recommend recording lectures). There is a fair amount of opportunity to boost your grade but beware of her multiple choice (make sure you know the material well enough to answer the questions w/o looking at the confusing options.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: Dr. Poling is an excellent professor & more over a good TEACHER which is so rare to find in profs. She is really nice and willing to accomodate and help students. Don't get me wrong you will need to WORK in her classes and attend lectures and labs to get a good grade. Her tests are fair, if not a little tricky at times. Overall, highly recommended.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: she contradicts herself in the lecture. tells us not to read the textbook. went to every lecture plus read the textbook. Very unfair. she does not know what she is talking about. Very unfair in marking. Makes you write peer wise questions, that you spend hours creating, then still gives you a low mark for them. don't like her.

Name: Kirsten Poling
Review: I say Get Ready to Read but even that will not help you.  Her questions come out of no where.  She is super unhelpful and confusing.  I will never take another class with her and recommend that you do the same.  I think it is funny that she is a "Learning Specialist" and does not know how to teach.  She obviously has no good qualities to be a prof

Name: Jang Singh
Review: His marking scheme for participation was highly unprofessional. You will see kids who barely attend class get a higher grade than you and when this was addressed he told me other students' grades were none of my business. When I addressed his procedures for grading participation, he could not give me a clear answer. Inconsiderate towards me.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: He marked us for participation (%12) in class just randomly which is not fair at all! He could tell us come to all presentations and by asking questions from your peers you can get your participation mark or come prepared to discuss case studies, but he only did it once in entire semester!

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Mid-term & Exam Requirement: Read Book to Pass (Fair Marking) Review: Will not Provide 12% Participation-Must interact in each class to earn it. Group Project & Presentation: Liberal Mrking Gives respect to students, but will make you work hard for it. Book reading is must otherwise you are at risk. He is a Good person but TAKE AT YOUR OWN RISK.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Makes you work for your grade. Fair.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Dr. Singh is a nice guy, but he would rather have endless discussions than teach what is on the exams. Only 5 short (long) answer questions on the midterm. Midterm and exam together are worth 62% so watch out. Lectures are basically useless, you're better off just reading the textbook cover to cover.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Useful course

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Good prof, teaches well but hard to get a really good grade as it is all essay based. He marks hard but balances and controls mark with group project and 12% participation option. I attended every class and spoke here and there and got 6/12. He does like to chat with students and is a nice guy, but just annoying to deal with when regarding grades..

Name: Jang Singh
Review: A really fair grader, no extra mark if you don't do well in his classa generous instructor for  presentations. He is really interested in chatting with students ,however his exams were harder than I expected

Name: Jang Singh
Review: He marks thoroughly and fairly.  No m.c questions, all essays.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Most of your class time spent with Dr. Singh is used to generate discussion. Is this bad, well it depends. If you enjoy the professor trying to incite arguments between peers then this professor is for you. If you want to go and learn something then not so much. Otherwise he marks with a scythe and culls your average. Avoid if possible.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Well informed professor .  You must work for a good grade.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: No free marks. Interesting course.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Straight forward course but if you are a slacker prepare to get a low grade

Name: Jang Singh
Review: He knows his stuff.  If you make an effort you will gat a good grade.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: No surprises.   Good lectures.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Very helpful when approached-enjoyed class.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: He is a fair professor.  Don't expect a free ride.  You must know your stuff to do well in his classes.

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Stimulating topics covered

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Great course but don't expect a good grade for goofing off

Name: Jang Singh
Review: Group project can completely ruin your grade. Gives pointless marks for participation in his class. Quizzes are pretty easy if you study for them, although they may be on a very obscure part of the chapter. Very bad at answering emails in a timely manner.

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: Very caring and professional teacher.  He asks great questions and is very supportive.  He is an awesome role model and a teacher with a lot of integrity.

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: I had a great time in his class! He was fun to watch. I hated the assignment it was on access and was complicated.

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: I Loved Him!!!

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: Prof Boulos is a good prof, although not usually clear in what he expects of his students.

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: tought final

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: Amazing prof, the stuff that he has to teach is really boring and I feel bad for him at times since the class becomes very loud which gets annoying. He is very clear on the concepts and hes always available for questions even after the class is done. He ends class early only if he is ahead not if people are talking. One of the best profs for sure!

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: don't know what you are talking about ... he is awesome, that's why students from other sections are showing up to our section ... Boulos is clear!

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: he just gives up, if people are not listening he stops classs and just ends early. I pay way to much for class to get cancelled

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: Great prof. he explained every thing in class that u need to know for the exams. The assignment do take some thinking though. Awsome lectures.

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: just awesome ... more like him would be great!

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: Seriously all i can say is read his ratings above... i mean he is just that good... and a funny guy.... wicked prof... should give him a raise! haha

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: One of, if not the best proffesor at this University.  The only one so far that I have understood prefectly.  His teaching and examples keep you interested in the course, unlike other profs who go on and on and don't even stop to explain anything.  Tests are easy if you study for them.  I only wish I he taught more Computer Science courses.

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: honestly, one of the best profs i've ever had at the U of W. VERY EASY proffesor, and very interesting class, although the class was 8:30 in the morning. Very thorough and expects every one to do well.  If you're looking for an easy A, take this class. Assignments/Midterms/Finals, very easy. Good sense of humor too!

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: Arguably the best teacher I've ever had.  The course is a ton of fun.  It was at 8:30 in the morning, but you keep awake in that class for sure.  Full of brain teasers and stuff.  It's not necessarily easy.  I reccomend EVERYONE to take it.

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: Boulus was an awesome teacher! He made his class interesting every single day.  Exams were fair, and assignments were decent.  Check this guy out,he is easily one of our school's best profs.

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: No Comments

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: Interesting prof, not bad looking either ;)

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: he makes his course very interesting so u don't sleep in his class and use alot of examples and give the material enough time ... i wish all teachers just like him :(

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: extremely smart man.  very helpful when you approach him AND EVEN IF YOU DONT!  teaches what he thinks you should know, not the mumbo jumbo like some profs.  if you attend the labs, your mark will reflect it.  overall, AMAZING PROF

Name: Pierre Boulos
Review: Pretty good prof but the TA's in the class are not cool. They mark hard.

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Val is the greatest professor Ive ever had. She is incredibly caring and is always willing to meet with you, even if you just need somewhere to cry! Im so happy shes my academic advisor and I would LOVE to take more classes with her!

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Best professor ever! She makes chemistry the class everyone looks forward to, even if its at 8:30 in the morning. Testing is always fair, the exams are a little more challenging, but very doable if you go to class.

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: The best professor I've ever had, hands down. Very approachable, easy to understand, and cares deeply about her students. Very funny and brightens your day.

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: By far my favorite professor. She cares so much about her students and is always willing to go out of her way to make sure you understand the material. Lectures are amazing and tutorials are even better for helping understand the material.

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Caring and amazing

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Val (or Dr. Reeves, depending on what you prefer) is the perfect first-year prof. She is easy to approach and talk to, she loves to laugh in her class while teaching, and she does everything she can to make your life easier, offering plenty of chances for extra credit and bonus marks.

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Easily the most kind-hearted, genuine, and passionate professor I have ever come in contact with. Chemistry is such a touch and scary subject to lots of people (myself included), but she some how finds spectacular ways for you to fall in love with it. Val is also SO easy to talk to! In all, I am so happy to have experienced her teachings myself.

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Val is an absolute gem. I looked forward to going to her class even though it was at 8:30am. She is always willing to meet with students outside of class and it extremely helpful. Would love to take more classes with her.

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: super nice

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Wouldn't change a think about her. She'll make 100% sure everyone passes unless they failed all their midterms and exam.

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Class is at 8:30, probably ditched more of this class than any other else, but I love every single second of it

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Awesome!

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: The most caring, amazing professors I have ever had at any university. She is always there to help with schoolwork, or just life!

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Val is an angel and will help anyone who is willing to try!

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Great prof, lol

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Val was my favourite prof that I had all year. She is so kind and caring, she really wants you to pass! As long as you go to class, do the extra practice questions, and go to her office hours if you need help, its definitely an easy A!

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Love her! Favourite prof so far!

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Val is such a caring and fun prof! Truly cares about each student and I am still mind blown how she remembers everyone's name- even from previous years! Definatly recommend taking her courses. If you make an effort, you will do well.

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: As a computer science student, this course was the best one I have taken so far. We need more profs like her!

Name: Valerie Reeves
Review: Val is an amazing professor. She genuinely wants her students to succeed and takes the time to help when you asked. The material is tough (or so I found it, but if you are a Chem whiz you'll get an A+)! As long as you make an effort you will succeed in her course. Val is caring and approachable and will go the extra mile to make sure you learn!

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Very nice course and lectures. Explains hard topics well and with humour. The tests are easy but the final was a little bit hard. Assignments are are little bit more challenging and hard to understand. Don't buy the textbook

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Really nice prof. His content can be difficult to learn but he does a great job teaching. Is a harder marker.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Solid lecturer, you can actually understand him, and he's fairly funny which is rare at UNB. Takes attendance, but the classes are worth going too

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Mandatory attendance, even though the material is so easy. I studied 30 minutes for both midterms and got 85 on both. Assignments and labs aren't very difficult, I've never spent more than 1-2 hours doing them. I did get a 20% on one lab though because the virtual machine running 2007 software didn't save my code before I submitted it.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Doesnt explain anything in class, so labs and assignments are hell, but the midterms and final are relatively easy compared to it.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: He explains nothing in class but requires us to do everything in lab&assignment&test.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: He doesn't explain stuff very good and also the tests are much harder than the assignments.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: You are not truly ready for the greatness that is Rick. Hands down the funniest prof at the university. He puts a huge emphasis on understanding the material as opposed to memorization (so try hards hate his class) and will help you work your way to the answer instead of giving it to you.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Gives good real-world context and meaning to topics but does have a tendency to go a little off topic. Tests are difficult, attendance is VERY important and be sure to really understand material rather than memorization. It is a good idea to ask many questions and visit office hours. Overall a very caring solid professor.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Overall, pretty good. Gives good notes. Tests and exams are kind of hard, but questions are always fair. Make sure you go to class or you probably won't pass. Assignments and Labs aren't usually super hard but do take a while sometimes. Would definitely recommend.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Quizzes were out of 5 and weighted for a large portion of your mark and questions were ambiguous

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: +You HAVE to attend class. He's reasonable IF you miss it for a good reason. (420 is not a good reason) +Hard marker, but FAIR. He will NOT give you a question that hasn't been taught. +Easy to get a hold of; Office is usually open. +Friendly, and willing to help if you're willing to put effort in. He will NOT give you the answer.  9/10

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: He is funny and nice. Class wasn't hard, but you needed to be there...

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Had Rick for CS1073 and CS1083. He's not great at explaining stuff. He's a really nice guy though, but unless you already have a pretty good understanding of Java, I would not recommend him.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Attendance is mandatory. He goes off-topic alot in the middle of explaining something.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: He doesn't possess the knowledge to teach the course. He doesn't upgrade himself. Teaches wrong concept, will reduce marks for uploading a zip file instead of .tar file, If you get stuck on some issue while doing project or assignment he won't help as he himself doesn't know but expect us to solve the error. He is the only guy who I ever heard saying that read Wikipedia and write the answer. Avoid the course its awful, Plus I feel he I racist

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: He reads off the slides, doesn't do examples in class and gives assignments without teaching the material first so the students are left in the dark. The lectures are long and sometimes he goes over the allotted time period. He is willing to help if you ask for it and he is enthusiastic about the subject.

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Very helpful, easy to talk to

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: Think twice before taking ! It is not easy to score in his subjects. He is very friendly but you are expected to do things independently . Attendance is crucial !!!

Name: Rick Wightman
Review: You pretty much need to attend every lecture, even if you already know the course material

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: She treats you a bit like your still in high school, with mandatory checked attendance to every class she does (all grade levels), but she genuinely cares about your success, she teaches well and her tests are very balanced to the course content. She's a good prof.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Her lectures had nothing to do with the assignments. The assignments, on average, took 8 hours to complete. Also, her advice for when struggling with labs and assignments is to "look back at your notes."

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: She will ruin your life, get ready to put in double the work for this course and receive half the grade. Do not take her course, if you try to contact her via email she doesnt respond, if you go try to talk to her about the email, she then says email me, played a game of cat and mouse with her the whole term. Also 5 absences and you get a D.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: DO NOT TAKE HER COURSE! She is a horrible professor, terrible attendance policy (miss 5 labs or lectures or tutuorials and you get a D, doesnt care if its a valid excuse), talks to us like we are children, emailed her serveral times during the course, she didnt reply once, the class average on the midterm was 51%. Shes the reason I switched majors.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: She is an amazing prof! Explains stuff easily for anyone to understand and if you have a question she will do her best to explain it so you understand.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Natalie Webber is the type of first-year prof where you'll go in, do the work, and leave. She scarcely answers emails, patronizes students, and can seem sassy at times. But outside of class she is one who is easy to approach, talk to, and ask questions. Just a warning, though, CS1073 has a VERY high fail rate, but that is due to the course, not her

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Awesome professor and is great with explaining everything during her lectures. Only CS1073 prof that hands out practice questions/examples that are VERY helpful for midterm and especially the exam. Do all of them 2 or 3 times.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Wonderful professor, very easy to understand and gives a ton of examples and hand outs for practice which is very useful on tests. I would recommend her to anybody new to programming.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: She is not very familiar with the concepts she teaches.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Nathalie is a very good and caring professor. That said, she will expect you to show up to all of your classes and for you to put a lot of work towards the course. She is a tough Grader but will usually give you good feedback and is easily approachable. If you put a lot of effort into what you do, you will love this teacher!

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: She marks very hard on easy concepts. I emailed her about my team members contributions and she sent the email to my team. Doesn't answer any questions in emails and is very hard on people that miss class even for good reason. I asked to meet with her and she wouldn't answer.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: A very good choice if you are unfamiliar to programming. Natalie explains VERY thoroughly and goes over important topics multiple times. If you are new to programming you will have lots of opportunities to clearly learn new ideas and apply them. If you have experience programming you may be bored as many topics are covered a few times. Great notes!

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Only CS prof with mandatory tutorials

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: I found that she talked to us like we were small children. Her lectures were unbelievably boring, I found it almost impossible for me to pay attention in class, and plus the fact that class is mandatory made it even worse. This prof is why I decided to switch my major.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Natalie is a knowledgeable, but dull professor. Her slides, lectures, and examples are all so boring. She makes it easy for first time programmers, maybe too easy. I can't imagine anyone putting effort into CS1073 and failing. Her insistence on mandatory attendance and tutorials is a pain. She can't lecture to save her life.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Very organized, a little too repetitive but more practice is always better. Will get angry and maybe even throw you out if you are a minute late. Lots of help available outside class. Final was easy/fair, be sure to practice GUI button examples. Textbook unnecessary, assignments require math skills and research, practice practice practice.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Respected Professor @ UNB. She's intelligent, and willing to answer questions. Easily accessible outside of class time (usually in her office or the CSA lounge). Participate & try assignments on your own? She'll bend over backwards to help you. Heads the CSA and is very active in Student Life. Very pleasant to meet.  DON'T SKIP CLASS.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Natalie is easily my favorite professor in CS. Everything she teaches is clear and she knows the subject area well. She is super patient with students who don't have previous programming experience and explains things well. She is also involved in every event you will go to and is by far one of the most approachable prof's.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Natalie could probably teach java to a five year old or a particularly smart monkey. A great choice if you have no prior experience with programming; class might be a little slow if you do, but is still super helpful for solidifying your basics. Genuinely a very friendly and involved prof who is easy to approach and easy to get in contact with.

Name: Natalie Webber
Review: Once again, Natalie impresses with her introduction of new and potentially-difficult topics in a clear and concise way. She's easy to talk to, happy to help students who need it, and patient when students ask old questions after they've fallen behind. For most students, though, she is just a great teacher.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: If you take him for arts 1000, better know what his idea of things are and then just puke it all out in the essay. otherwise, its almost certain you will get a very horrible grade. most of us in his class got C - B+ for the essays. incredibly tough grader. makes me wanna drop philosophy instead. other phil profs dont grade as hard.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: very good prof, he understands the material very well, is always kind and his office is always open for students. The wording on the online quizzes can be a little confusing but he is always willing to be corrected. I have never taken a PHIL class before, but if you attend class regularly and make a little effort, you will get an easy A.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: Very quiet, lacks empathy, and does not explain concepts well.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: Ahmad is willing to go the extra mile outside of the classroom to help out his students. He is NOT a prof that simply puts in minimal effort to scrape by.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: I would say avoid if you can. Literally the most boring class I have ever been to. He's confusing , and gets annoyed with students not answering his questions and when you do ,your answer is almost always wrong. His exam was the exactly the same way, all opinion but only HIS opinion. I just wish I knew what his opinion actually was! Horrible class!

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: I wouldn't take another class with him again. He wasn't a bad prof but his lectures are very boring, he's difficult to understand and his tests are pretty hard. He cares about his students but isn't easy to learn from at all.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: He doesn't want to make it difficult at all. He's always ready to answer questions and very kind. He's a little confusing sometimes because, it seems like, that there are too many thoughts going on at the same time in his head. He has a very unique and entertaining sense of humour.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: Extremely long and boring class, the worst class experience I ever had. No ppt and used and projector, what a joke...

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: Rahamanian is generally a nice guy and is friendly to his class, however that is not what you need is a professor. He is utterly terrible at trying to convay any topic, the examples he uses are very vague and sometimes un-helpful, and any imput from students that is different to his own opinion are dissmissed.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: Oh my god avoid if possible. Literally the most boring class I have ever been to. He's super contradicting, and gets mad when people won't answer his questions in his class. But if you do, your answer is almost always wrong, even though its all open to interpretation. His exam was the exactly the same way, all opinion but only HIS opinion.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: Got more out of the textbook than the lectures. Classes were never engaging (I went to almost every one) so it was difficult to absorb information. There is one quiz per chapter and personally, I ended up just reading the chapter and then doing the quiz. It still did not guarantee that my mark would be 100%, but I definitely learned the material.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: WORST, and it was a mandatory course

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: WORST CLASS EVER. I need it for my degree and this prof is terrible. He looks for near impossible answers. Gives bare minimum marks for everything. His tests are essay questions where you basically need to memorize the book. I'm a very good student and find this HARD

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: really hard to stay interested, marking can be a bit confusing, not knowing where you lost marks

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: Speaks very, very quietly. Important to take notes because the textbook at times can be unclear/he will test on things we have talked about in class. The exam has 5 questions - he gave us all of the questions (practically word for word)before the exam, so if you go to class and take notes, you will have no problem in this course.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: I love this guy!! He's so sweet and nice. A bit quirky and absentminded in a good way. The midterms were super easy. Pretty much read the book and add some personal opinion and you're golden. He sometimes wanders off topic to other unrelated philosophical problems but overall great guy. Unfortunately, the course was still a bit dry.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: If you want a good grade, stay away from him! I can not concentrate in his class. I went to class regularly and almost fail at last.There is another section, they have only multiple choices in test, but for him, we have a lot of essay questions, and he gave most of student half marks of each questions. Seriously, dont take his class

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: honestly can't figure out what he's trying to say... I look all of the terms up online.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: Prof is very, very quiet. Lets personal views on politics and capitalism slip into lectures (2203 is Business Ethics). Mostly pleasant in dealings with him. Lost 20% of my essay grade with little explanation, and 25% on a mid-term question for being "too hard" on the essay's author. Wouldn't take another course with him -- turned me off of PHIL.

Name: Ahmad Rahamanian
Review: Great prof, super helpful. Wants you to do well.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Had high hopes for him after reading the reviews on here. Worst prof Ive ever had. If we asked questions he would get mad. Explains everything super super fast and you dont have time to understand anything. I heard he changed this term (Fall 2019) than other terms so idk

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Mo is great. It is clear he genuinely cares about student success. BUT can be tough when necessary. He is strict on his personal rules and that's totally fine. TA marking is questionable, but when Mo marks he is generous with points. He wants to do everything he can to ensure your success.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: I had a miserable experience with this professor. Tests were brutally long and extremely hard. He had a ta mark all the assignments and the ta was insanely hard. Marks were taken off for the dumbest things.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Mo is an awesome teacher. He is always willing to give extra help and give you resources to help you succeed. He's extremely smart. He's helped me with multiple math courses that he doesn't even teach. He gives you a final mark that you deserve.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Although he was harder than some and went extremely fast, he was a great prof. He cares about his students and that they succeed. He knows everyone's name (that he teaches). He is very willing to sit with you and help you out if you need it, even as far as doing hard questions on the assignments with you. Overall I would take him again.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: a misunderstood genius ?!

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Took this course as it was manditory. Hallirous man, extremely smart. If only he could understand the difficulty some students have with math, expects students to understand immediately. Does not give partial points, may be because of student graders. He could be a very effective prof, if only he could understand math isn't everybody's strong suit.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: awesome on so many levels !!!!

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Introduces new topics and expects you to grasp them like its 2+2. Very difficult prof. Studied for HOURS and got a 50% on midterm. Might work for some but he was not the right prof for me. Had to take the "W" and withdraw.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: It has been a privilege to study under Dr. Hamdan. While he may come off as being a little cold during the first few weeks of the semester, do keep in mind that he does wish to see you succeed. If you apply yourself, complete all required work, and maintain a perfect attendance (or at least notify him when you're going to be absent), you will pass.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: he is just amazing ... attended classes but didn't really study hard and i got A- ... if i actually studied i would have had an A+ in a blink of an eye. Awesome prof!!

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Best math prof ever, it's a gift to even be in the same room!

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: What an amazing man! It was a privilege to have been able to take two classes with Dr. Hamdan. He is an absolute gem and my favourite professor at UNBSJ. Knows his material, is always willing to help and has some of the best math jokes ever! Work hard, pay attention in class and you will learn so much. Midterms and finals are very fair aswell!

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: This individual is the least mediocre man on this planet. Super helpful, nice and an overall good time. Also has best math jokes on the campus!

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: intelligent prof, passionate about his work, great storyteller and he is fair.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: THE BEST MATH PROF AT UNB. Period. Amazing man. He is very smart and knows his stuff, though he does make you write a lot of notes (most test questions are from the notes though). He is clear when he explains and expects you to understand the "why". You must show up to class (takes attendance) and participate. Tests are fair, as is the final exam.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: He is a very smart professor, but difficult to understand and a very hard maker. No part marks. He also moves very fast through the material, so have some calc background.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Genius and down to earth. He is fair and will give you credit for partly solved problems. Attendance is key to pass the class.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Most humorous professor ever. Hamdan is a hoot. Highly recommended.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Mohammad Hamdan
Review: Go to his class and do the assignments. Rest is easy.

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: Prof Cashions classes will be a self assessment on whether you should go to medical school or not. His classes are very hard and require you study every day for atleast 2-3 hours. However they are not as challenging as medical school.  If you can't deal with his classes, maybe you should be looking for a different profession

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: Dr. Cashion is rude, not at all helpful, he plays favorites, and he would stab anyone in the back given the chance.  A friend of mine asked for a referral for med school, Dr. Cashion said yes.  My friend had a bad feeling about it, so opened it and Dr. Cashion gave him a TERRIBLE referral.  Textbooks are useless in his class.  Terrible person/prof.

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: Great Prof. Hard but very fair, don't miss class b/c you will fail. Textbook readings are a waste of time...just recopy the sheets he gives you and you'll ace this course

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: In the first class, you'll be warned that this is not a course for lazy people and take heed. I've taken all of Prof Cashions courses offered and he's one of the best prof's at UNB IMO. Only way to get an A+ is to attend all classes, rewrite your notes immediately after class, and study every day.

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: Rumours about having to attend his parties to get a good grade are totally false; I never attended any. There is a lot of material and you can't afford to miss a single class. I recommend recording his lessons and rewriting them immediatley after class.

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: Great Prof

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: I've taken three courses taught by Cashion because I think he is an amazing teacher! His classes are a lot of work but they are totally worth it!

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: Excellent professor - I strongly recommend his classes to anyone who is interested in post graduate or professional  studies.  The expectations are high but they will provide rewards for your future education.

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: There's A LOT of material, you have to work hard, and yes, he is a hardass, but this is by far the class from which I have learned the most. He really gets down to the why and how of biochemistry. Don't let the crazy handouts scare you-they make sense once he explains them. He can seem unapproachable but he is usually happy to answer questions.

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: not as good as advertised

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: cashon is the man, if he was your uncle he would be the crazy old uncle. Dont cross him tho, he could kick your ass if he needed to. And if you know about the lotion in the exam, well, then you know . . .

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: this prof was ridiculous.  expected way to much of a second year student.  Def played favorites.  After discussing my final exam with him which was worth 100% and questioning him on it.  He proceeded to tell me i was stupid and shouldnt be in univeristy.  I later graduated on the deans list.  That will show him.  Horrible, try to avoid taking

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: If you are a dumbass, or even if you THINK there is a SLIGHT chance that you may be a dumbass, a Cashion class is not the spot for you. You have to work for the A+, but it is very possible to get.

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: I learned  so much, I thought my head would explode. That aside, this man is an amazing teacher. Never was there a concept I never understood. And as for the favoritism, I never talked ot the man personaly one on one before, I just payed attention everyday in class and took notes whenever he explained somthing, and I got an A+. Amazing teacher

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: material isnt that bad but there is way too much of it. the class material is more than someone can reasonably know in a single term.  immuno final, studied 45 hours to cover the material once well and the final was mostly on take home assignments which he gave out like 3 per class, at least. dont even think about missing a class, you will be MIA

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: Great at teaching material...classes very interesting.. however grading is unfair and questionable. So sucking up is needed. will get good grade if he likes  you enough.

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: The final will have you ripping the hair out of your head, but if you studied and understand it, you should be fine. His handout every lecture are crazy, but once he explains them, you'll understand it all. He explains it good, but I always took noted on what he was saying to make sure I understood handout, and I got an A+... does kinda play favs

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: just as terrible the second time around

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: All I heard about his classes was that you had to study tons and he expects a lot!! It's true, and the studying helps. Exam is hard, but once you get through with the course you actually feel like you learned something for once!!! Plus first class that i never fell asleep in

Name: Peter Cashion
Review: Awful teacher, if you can even call me that. Don't take his class if you can help it.

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Best prof I've ever had. He doesn't post anything online so be sure to go to class, but he explains things so well. Makes everything seem so simple!

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Most definitely the most engaging, caring prof I have ever had. I highly recommend him!

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Super sad that he wont be teaching next semester. He's the type of prof that goes out of his way for you. He's always up for a chat, he's a very funny and warm person. It'll be easy if you come to class and BE in class (actually listen). Textbooks are where the homework is but you should find ways...

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: An outstanding teacher - he keeps your attention and makes the class interesting. He has coach-like abilities and gives you motivation to do well.

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: He's the best!  Awesome teacher who really cares about his students and has an amazing talent for explaining Math in a way that even us non-Math people understand!  If you attend class and his tutorials....you'll have no problem!  Love him!!!

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: This guy is a teacher, not a professor. He doesn't just give you the tools to find the help you need, he actually helps you. He explains things simply and clearly and makes it interesting. He wants you to succeed.

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: totally love him!

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Excellent professor, very approachable and keeps attention. Very enthusiastic and amiable

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: The best math teacher I have ever had...wish i could have my future classes with him! Thank you!

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: One of the best prof's I've ever had. Really cared about his students and kept class interesting (yes, math was interesting!).

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Mr T is the best! I didn't like math what so ever before his class, he made it so that if you didn't get it the first time he'd go out of his way to make you understand it. Great times and I wish he was still here to teach Calc 1003!

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Best teacher I have ever had, I recommend him for everybody even if math does not interest you. He loves the subject and knows what he is talking about.

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: This is an amazing prof he always is available to help one of his students when they really need him. If you have a chance to take one of his classes do it you will never forget the class.

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: It's been more than 4 years since I've taken his class, but I still look back on it with great memories. He made if fun, easy to understand, and made me love calculus more than I already did. If you can take his class, do it!

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Fantastic Prof! He's quite funny, great at explaining concepts and very approachable. The class is pretty easy too.

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Great professor!!!!! He is so engaging and so easily understood. He offers so much of his own time to help students. Best prof so far!

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: this is the best prof you can have, super easy to understand and offers a ton of extra help if you need it

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: EXCELLENT Prof, he made everything as clear and easy as it can be. Not to mention he has a very engaging personality.

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Awesome prof.  One of best teachers I have ever had.  A little relaxed atmosphere which can be distracting.  Very helpful and easy to approach.  Would highly recommend.  Lots of assignments to do.  Would recommend doing them ahead of class if u can.  Don't fall behind.

Name: Darrell Wayne Tomilson
Review: Awesome prof!! If you have the chance take his classes. He explains everything crystal clear and wants you to succeed. He is very approachable and always makes class enjoyable! He loves when you ask questions in class and gives you a lot of encouragement!

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: Good teacher, lots of expectations, makes the course more difficult, provides good feedback, but does not gives scores which should be given according to which is deserved. makes to feel that did a great mistake by choosing this university.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: this class was really interesting - the simulation was awesome and I learned a lot

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: this class is going to be different.  She knows her stuff and the computer game is going tobe great

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: Totally cool class!!!  Very very very hard marker but always smiles and talks to you after class.  Experiements were fun

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: this is a class where you learn.  the research project is fun but a lot of work.  the exams are hard but if you go to class you should be able to ace the essays

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: This class was really good.  We did projects even though it was summer school.  They were fun.  I think I want a Marketing job now I like it so much.  I am taking Buyer Behavior now and I know it is going to be hard but I like her

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: Oh my, please explain to me why UNBSJ has a good business program when we have incompetent fools running the Faculty of Business?

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: She is really into this class and its contagious.  Great class and she cares a lot about us

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: Wonder where she gets her grades from? Mine didn't closely resemble my work and people who turned in pretty much the same things did better. Be sure you get on her good side or expect the worst.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: very easy to understand. Gives lots of examples. Must come to class to pass the written portion of the tests and exam.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: are you nuts - all we did all semester is look at models and tolls and stuff to use when we gets out

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: Easy to get good grade. If you want to have fun, take this class. If you want to learn something that can be used in the real world, take another. This course is another example of why we can't get jobs either.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: cool class. makes you think before you buy.  she likes the class as muich as the students. lots and lots and lots of examples

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: this was a great experience.  I am actually using things I learned in my job.  I had fun

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: this was fun class.  hard tests but good teacher and help us out with understanding

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: This school is going nowhere fast and she is the speedy racer at its front. It is easy to see why few english speakers want to go here. Fortunately, I speak mandarin which makes it easy to understand my class mates.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: Bad news all around. Few positions, other than campus ones, and no hope of better. I want my $ back which will be easier to get than good pizza around here.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: My classmates are right. This prof is freekin useless. Bad teacher, does not anzwer our questions and cannot make a decision that she will stick to. Tells one person one thing and others something else. Bad news.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: Need a clone of her to do everything around here. She is unavailable most of the time and unresponsive to students. Acts nice in person but cannot get anything done that needs to be done.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Shelley Rinehart
Review: this is a great class - lotsof hard work but we are learning a lot.  I can't beleive theother ratings

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: I have taken 7 classes with Professor Littlejohn. He is the best teacher Ive had in my 33 years on this planet and is quite possibly the most brilliant human Ive ever met. He has opened my mind, helped shape my character and Im forever grateful for his teachings.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: A few years ago, I liked his teaching style more, but he's kind of outgrown me. He always goes past the time the class is supposed to end, which is not fun.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Interesting lectures, gets your mind enlightened. Was great being his student.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Absolutely love Professor Littlejohn's class. Inspiring professor. He is passionate about his classes. I would highly recommend him and will take another class of his. He is one of my favorite professors. He wants you to pass and if you need help he will help you.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: While he may be a bit eccentric, he's incredibly passionate about the material. His lectures are always interesting, and he makes philosophy easy to understand. He might think a bit too highly of himself, but he's a great prof. He's 200% better if you like classic rock, as well.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Awesome

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Murray Littlejohn is one of the funniest profs I've had. He is my favourite prof I've had in my 2 years at UNBSJ. He's a real gem and I actually look forward to the classes I have with him!

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Murray seemed to spend infinitely more time fabricating stories apparently intended to convince students of his grandeur than actually teaching. His lectures were sometimes enjoyable, but almost always off-topic.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Overall good teacher. Can be confrontational with student at times. For example, if two students are speaking, he has at times interrupted the conversation, and has gone as far as to accuse students in front of class of things that are not the case (paranoid, agitated and angered by anyone speaking who is not him). Raises grades on tests.. AWESOME.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: He gets off subject then speeds through the rest of the lecture to finish it. But everything is in the book he goes over. Hard to get in touch with him.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: His lectures are the most interesting part of my day. I think mr lil john is a great prof!

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. He's ALWAYS late by 10-15 minutes and is a complete tool. Lectures are inconsistent and hardly ever relate to the syllabus. Hes rude and has HUGE ego, acts like he invented air. I spent 700$, to listen to him boast himself and talk about politicians. Literally take ANY OTHER course except his, huge waste of my tuition. frig

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Eccentric Prof you will love him or hate him. Do not use electronics in his class or talk he will lose his mind. Classes are entertaining but he is very opinionated, however he welcomes others opinions provided they do not try to take over the class. Tests are easy.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Interesting class, don't take if you're going for straight A's. Easy to get a C, but you have to go to class.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Very Intelligent Prof, one of the few left who actually can "teach". If you're a student who just memorizes the textbook, may not be your "thing". If you're a student with an open mind,can relate to "real life" experiences and would like to become a better Human being... MLJ can teach you. Don't just "listen" to what he says, "Hear" him.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Friendly and funny. A truly dedicated professor with an authentic and genuine interest in truth and humanity. Absolutely no regrets about this prof.

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Extremely intelligent professor, wide area of expertise.  Sometimes he forgets his students aren't so well-read as him.  Quite engaging discussions in many classes (depending on the rest of your class).  He is strict about his intellectual property and electronic use in class.  Overall a good teacher

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Based off of his lecture and half the time he spent filling us in on what we learned in the previous class so we never learned anything new. The mid-term is worth 40% and the final is worth 60% of our final grade and he stopped doing power points so we had nothing to study for the final exam. Worst part is i didn't learned a thing = waste of $. FML

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: Awful professor...

School: University of New Brunswick - Saint John
Name: Murray Littlejohn
Review: He knows Nothing about his course

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: I dont understand this mans job. He seems completely in the clouds and does not do a good job of explaining concepts or answering questions. His office hours were not helpful at all.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: A bit hard to talk to I find, but he is very willing to help during labs and will explain things so they are easy to understand.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Big bad Benton was the second spiciest man on campus (next to Branimir) and always was guzzling a cold sodie pop or apple juice during labs. 10/10 would take labs with Brucie again.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Know everything before you enter the lab. Figure out every formula you're about to use, especially before the lab final. Write simple conclusions about sources of error in calculations that demonstrate you really understand the experiment. Know your rotational physics.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Makes inappropriate comments. Offensive. Felt uncomfortable. Undermined my studies/degree.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Can't lecture at all but great in labs. Homework daily.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: For those not ready and willing to do class preparation, such as designated readings before class, you will struggle. Lectures are very example/practice based, covering little theory. This is where you need to do a lot of studying to learn the concepts being discussed before the class. Overall hard marker, but not impossible to do well.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Very spicy lad, would definitely take his class again. Great prof, doesnt bamboozle you at all, and holds the heckin world record for juice guzzling.  Also i didnt have any friends until i met Bruce's "Old friend equations", now i never feel alone.  Great lad, very saucy, 10/10. Keep pluggin and chuggin good ol' Brucy.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: God awful,  re-explains subjects in class a completely new way! Literally bombed 3 midterms

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Can't teach.  Absolutely useless teacher, almost no point to go to class Assignment don't correlate with stuff taught in class. If possible avoid, If you cannot good luck!

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: So bad

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Truly, he is a nice person, but as a prof he was horrible. He clearly knows the material, but he can't teach whatsoever. Expect to teach yourself the course, and recognize when you need help and find it! The textbook will help some, make sure you use it. Making smart friends never hurts either...

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Nice guy, always there to help if u need it but it can be confusing when he explains something and he's  the toughest grader I have ever had.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Doesn't explain anything very well. Smart guy but thinks everyone else is as smart as he is

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Absolute worst professor I have ever had! If you can switch professors DO IT!! I failed Even though I passes everything.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Benton is a nice guy if you talk to him outside of class and is willing to help. Unfortunately, he is not great at teaching. He often boggles down topics with jargon and notation. Watch out for terribly worded questions on his midterms. Just remember: the class that fails together, scales together.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Try and avoid his classes if possible, regret otherwise!!

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Not an effective communicator. We do not know what is expected from us students. Class average is in the 40's. Evidently he is doing something wrong.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Benton is a nice guy. However, he isn't a great prof- the slides are rarely complete online, and he doesn't really explain the concepts you're supposed to know for the exam. Apparently the course is mega-scaled, but so far the averages for the midterms have been 50%.

Name: J. Bruce Benton
Review: Bruce is a great prof who is very willing to help and provide clarification where necessary when asked. Ridiculing him in class isn't gonna help you learn faster.  Physics is a subject that requires analysis, logic and many hours of practice. If you think you bluff yourself through it like Linear Algebra, save yourself time and change majors.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: Calc 2 is typically a class that people struggle with. I originally had a D when i took it for the first time, however, after taking it with Dr. Purdy, i got a B-. She truly cares about how her students to and is willing to help you find the resources you need for extra help.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: She made it very easy to understand and follow along for an online course. Provided lots of notes/homework questions and was also very organized.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: frankly speaking, this is a very easy course for math students.I take it as elective course, and never thought a B- back in the end. I think she treat different students differently, some just finish homework at her office but others who obbey the ruoes and feel ot easy doesn't get good feed back. by the way she is not a smart instructer.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: She is sweet and helpful. She simplifies the math and makes the class easy. Great professor. Take her if you can.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: This professor is a must if you are a bit shaky on your math skills. I learned so much from her, and she made learning math a pleasure! Love her lecture style, and she is ALWAYS or (her math help people )available to help. I totally recommend her. Her tests are not always the same as her homework questions.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: She is a wonderful professor, she gives a lot of optional homework but it really helps pass her class. She does amazing lectures, she goes over almost every question with the class. Her tests are the same types of questions that you do in class. Honestly, I defiantly recommend her for math courses!

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: I really enjoyed her class. She did not give out homework to mark, but she would give us some questions we could work on. Very easy to understand and her tests are really easy. They are exactly like questions she does in class. She also posts her notes from the lecture in D2L if you missed class. You dont need to go to class, but i recommend going

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: test review, homework and practices are nothing similar with the quiz she gives out. she just solves the exercises and not explain in a very detailed way. It is not fair that most of the class fails in the quiz and she doesn't really do anything to help us out.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: Took lin alg 1503 online with purdy as the proff and the online lecture format is awesome! Great clear and thorough explanations. Easily the easiest A+ I've received at UNB so far and definitely reccomend.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: Nightmare

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: She was really friendly and nice and easy to talk to. Also a good and fair grader.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: I found the notes for the online course to be confusing, but she goes out of her way to offer help. Tutoring sessions, offering to attend lectures, hell texting for help is even offered. Will review tests with you to make sure your'e on the same page. Really seems to care. No textbook so that rating shoudln't count.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: SHE IS AWSOMEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: She's a great prof! Gives great real life examples and makes class fun. Highly recommend any class with her!

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: She is very easy to follow and good at explaining the questions.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: Caroline Purdy does an amazing job at making difficult math concepts easy to understand.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: Pretty funny. Explains concepts well. Class was very helpful, although you could just read the textbook the night before a test and understand easily. DO THE HOMEWORK.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: Incredible. Perfect for those of you with difficulty in math.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: Probably the best prof to integrate you into University from High School. Very clear, very fair and always there to help you out. She runs the math help centre at UNB and she's always there day and night. midterm and final were fair, you have to study.. don't think of getting a good grade without putting in the effort with this prof.

Name: Caroline Purdy
Review: If you have to choose between Rangipour and her, please! Choose her! She is one of the best prof, and makes everything really clearly to understand, plus makes the class interesting! One of the best Math prof that UNB has!

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: I took this course as an arts elective and I'm glad I did. The most difficult part of this class was waking up at 8:30. The midterm was pretty easy and the Final had the exact same format. Dr. Ahern was very entertaining and will usually pick on anyone who has not prepared very well for class.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Took his class out of interest. Honestly thought I was going to fail my first course ever. He was a great help and answered all of my questions and made sure I understood the material. This class ended up being my highest grade for the term. Professor Ahern is now now one of my favourite professors at UNB.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Dr. Ahern has been my favourite professor at UNB so far. He is sometimes abrasive and has dry humour, but it seems to work for him. He is tough on his students and likes to call on them or tease them if they answer questions unclearly. This course is endlessly interesting and generally useful in real life. WHOLEHEARTEDLY RECOMMEND THIS COURSE.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: One of my favourite professors I've taken at UNB. Class at 8:30 wasn't a joy, but he can usually keep you awake. Very funny and intelligent, he has a strong grasp on the material. Can't imagine anyone regretting taking his courses, he's a beauty.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Dr. Ahern is the single best professor I had in my *many* years of studying philosophy. He is a kind man, a hard marker, has a wicked sense of humor and takes zero crap. Being late breaks his flow, and he does not like that (i was late a lot) but you can still get by. I was also chronic for being absent and I regret it now, class was always a joy.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Go to class on time or he will call you out and make you feel awkward. He is not afraid to call you out for anything. Phone off or you will get a dirty look. Decent guy and quite funny at times. Sometimes a little bit full of himself which can lead to him shushing you out if he does not agree with you statement. Gets sidetracked very easily.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: What an amazing professor. He is so passionate about the material and has a genuine interest in the very questions he gets us to ask. But if you are looking for an easy class, this is not the prof you want to take! if you want to actually work, hes amazing!

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Great, as always. The material is not easy, but Dr. Ahern is good at unpacking the more difficult concepts and presenting.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Ahern is a phenomenal prof! I have taken two courses with him to date, both of which have been a fantastic learning experience. The subject matter is not easy, but lectures and resulting discussion are hugely helpful in clarifying things. He's always willing to help because he's genuinely concerned when it come to student progress. Reccomended!

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: He's the best.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Top notch prof; always a pleasure taking his classes. He never disappoints. I don't get the people who hate that he singles out late people; get to class on time, and he'll leave you alone. If you want to show up late, don't show up. I find it hilarious when he makes fun of people for coming in late.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: He was absolutely passionate about the class, and it was the most fun course I've had in my three years here.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Took his course as an engineer doing one of my comp electives. Wonderful experience. Wish my engineering profs had half the passion for their work as this guy does.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Favourite professor so far! Not a class that you can slack in, and once you get used to his teaching style his classes are extremely engaging. One thing he seems to enjoy is insulting students in a comical way, so make sure to do your research so you don't end up being that student!

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Great guy, great prof. People who are constantly late deserve to be roasted, and he's top notch at it. Anyone who has a problem with him is dead wrong, and didn't take the time to speak with him outside of class. Take any course you can with him--you'll actually learn something.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Absolute inspiration,  I hope this guy teaches for a long long time!

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Took 2 courses w/ him (hard subjects). To succeed: don't be late, hand in on time, do readings, work on writing good material (no coasting), ask questions. Outside of class: great guy, funny, considerate. Cares about his students. Phil maj/minors should take at least one course of his.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Amusing and interesting prof. You won't fall asleep in class or dread going to it.

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Classes were really interesting and helpful. He was pretty intimidating at first,  but he's awesome. Don't come into class late or he'll pick on you all class. I really enjoyed him as a prof, best i've had so far!

Name: Daniel Ahern
Review: Thus far the greatest Prof of my university experiance. He was helpfull and funny.

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: Dr. Kennedy is an amazing professor. He is easy to talk to, and will help you out when needed. Very passionate about history and he cares a lot for his students.

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: Really good lectures, he makes them super interesting and seems very interested and knowledgeable with the material. Very approachable and always open to meeting with students. Gives helpful feedback on papers and assignments. Usually takes attendance but its not a big part of the grade.

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: Dr. Kennedy was my supervisor in the MA program, I definitely learned more from him than any other prof I have ever had in university (including law school where I went after). One of the nicest, most considerate, people I know, almost to a fault and an incredible and engaging lecturer at that. I consider myself lucky to have been taught by him.

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: Dr. Kennedy is one of the best History profs I've ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and follows feedback. He is always willing to set up meetings or talk after class regarding any questions or helping ensure that his students succeed. He has a real interest in what he teaches. I would take all of his courses if I could!

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: He is a great prof . Really well organized. Marks fairly. He cares about student progress. Very genuine and kind .He makes you love history. Hope he doesn't retire soon!!

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: Awesome guy.   Just do the readings and you'll do fine

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: Knows what hes talking about and makes the lectures very interesting, despite the material. Tells you exactly what needs to be improved upon and is very easy to talk to. Just do the readings and it should be an easy ride.

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: One of the best lecturers at this university. Great classes and he seems very interested in his topic. Knows his stuff and makes the classes very interesting. Will definitely take many classes with him

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: I only took one class with him, but he is the advisor for History so I've spoken with him a lot about my history minor. He is super clear with what he expects from students and his assignments and tests reflect what is taught in class.

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: Fantastic lecturer! I did not major in History but Dr. Kennedy's classes made me seriously consider doing so! I would have loved to have taken more of his classes.

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: He is the reason I took History at UNB. I took 4 classes from him and I wish I could have taken more! Sign up right now before his classes fill up - because they will. But he's such a nice guy he'll probably get the lecture switched to a bigger room to accommodate everyone.

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: Travel Study - so lectures were different from class rooms, but I loved them. Nothing like sitting in front of a historic place and hearing all about why the building behind you is so important. He knew is stuff very well and just as important, was great at giving the information to his students. Looking forward to more classes with him!

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: By far one of the best lecturers and professors at UNB. I highly recommend taking any of his courses.

Name: Sean Kennedy
Review: If you don't take a course with Dr. Kennedy then I pity you. His courses have been the best experience by far at UNB. Take every class you can with him. They are detailed, crystal clear, and above all, he is the most understanding and helpful individual I have ever met. Thank you Dr. Kennedy.
